1f41f324-d052-4377-ad1b-964446c1fa4a: At 10th level, you can summon a battle companion. This ability functions as summon monster IV with a duration of 1 minute, but can only summon demons. This ability can summon only one creature, regardless of the list used. For every 2 levels beyond 10th, the level of the summon monster {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} increases by 1 (to a maximum of summon monster IX at 20th level).
45001515-93a7-4ac1-b94f-6c53a63a6ce6:
"The Lady of Graves", "Mother of Souls", "Gray Lady", Pharasma is the goddess of birth, death, and prophecy. She shepherds Golarion's recently departed souls to their final reward. Upon death, souls migrate via the River of Souls to Pharasma's Boneyard in the Outer Sphere, which sits atop an impossibly tall spire that pierces the Astral Plane. She is among the most ancient deities in the multiverse, but keeps her knowledge of the fate of all souls closely guarded.
Domains: Death, Healing, Ice Subdomain, Knowledge, Repose, Water.
Favored Weapon: Dagger
e5d46340-ec25-492d-b1c9-7953ed20a70b: 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} + 1 round for every 5 by which you beat the {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g}.
6d4d83ed-589a-426c-8fcc-7d3fa7fe1573: 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} for each {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} bomb {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}, can {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}save{/g} each round
070f76da-1254-45cf-9090-6650133705d3: A 1st level beast tamer can use his performance to inspire ferocity in his summoned and pet allies (including himself), bolstering them against fear and improving their combat abilities. To be affected, an ally must be able to perceive the bard's performance. An affected ally receives a +1 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against charm and fear effects and a +1 competence bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} and weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}. At 5th level, and every six bard levels thereafter, this bonus increases by +1, to a maximum of +4 at 17th level.
00dd0446-f7a1-4e86-9282-596ea04909e2: A 1st level sensei can use his performance to inspire courage in his allies (including himself), bolstering them against fear and improving their combat abilities. To be affected, an ally must be able to perceive the sensei's performance. An affected ally receives a +1 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against charm and fear effects and a +1 competence bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} and weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}. At 5th level, and every six sensei levels thereafter, this bonus increases by +1, to a maximum of +4 at 17th level.
38de5631-6889-463e-8b0a-6aa7fa5ba836: A 1st-level bard can use his performance to inspire courage in his allies (including himself), bolstering them against fear and improving their combat abilities. To be affected, an ally must be able to perceive the bard's performance. An affected ally receives a +1 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against charm and fear effects and a +1 competence bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} and weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}. At 5th level, and every six bard levels thereafter, this bonus increases by +1, to a maximum of +4 at 17th level.
7c4a3706-c2bf-43fd-aa66-e34350ffeccf: A 1st-level incense synthesizer can use his ability to create incense fog in a 15-foot area around him to aid his allies (including himself), improving their combat abilities. An affected ally receives a +1 alchemical {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} and weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}.
de989166-5c9e-40d6-b4f4-69d6256616cc: A Hellknight signifer gains proficiency with heavy armor.
52f91910-0387-4c4a-9dcd-2bdd0f777134: A Hellknight who successfully uses the {g|Encyclopedia:Persuasion}Persuasion{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill{/g} to cause a creature within 10 feet to become shaken can instead cause that creature to become frightened.
d4e1d5db-6878-45b9-a842-65c4409dfcdf:
A barbarian can call upon inner reserves of strength and ferocity, granting her additional combat prowess. At 1st level, a barbarian can rage for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} per day equal to 4 + her {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} modifier. For each level after 1st she possesses, the barbarian can rage for 2 additional rounds per day. Temporary increases to Constitution, such as that gained from bear's endurance, do not increase the total number of rounds that a barbarian can rage per day. A barbarian can enter a rage as a {g|Encyclopedia:Free_Action}free action{/g}. The total number of rounds of rage per day is renewed after resting for 8 hours, although these hours need not be consecutive.
While in a rage, a barbarian gains a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g} rolls, melee {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}, thrown weapon damage rolls, and Will {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g}. In addition, she takes a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}Armor Class{/g}. She also gains 2 temporary {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}Hit Die{/g}. These temporary hit points are lost first when a character takes damage, disappear when the rage ends, and are not replenished if the barbarian enters a rage again within 1 minute of her previous rage. While in a rage, a barbarian cannot cast {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}.
A barbarian can end her rage as a free {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}action{/g}, and is fatigued for 1 minute after a rage ends. A barbarian can't enter a new rage while fatigued or exhausted, but can otherwise enter a rage multiple times per day. If a barbarian falls {g|Encyclopedia:Injury_Death}unconscious{/g}, her rage immediately ends.
398d085c-d71f-4368-a22d-edf20732562e: A barbarian is proficient with all simple and {g|Encyclopedia:Weapon_Proficiency}martial weapons{/g}, light armor, medium armor, and shields (except tower shields).
49d758ad-3b8f-42cc-8ed1-9aae8a6060aa: A barbarian's land {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} is faster than the norm for her {g|Encyclopedia:Race}race{/g} by +10 feet. This benefit applies only when she is wearing no armor, light armor, or medium armor, and not carrying a heavy load. Apply this {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} before modifying the barbarian's speed because of any load carried or armor worn. This bonus stacks with any other bonuses to the barbarian's land speed.
4fa2e4ce-5a0c-4f58-b0ce-81ff5db5226d: A bard adds half his {g|Encyclopedia:Class_Level}class level{/g} (minimum 1) to all Knowledge and Lore {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g} and may make all Knowledge and Lore skill {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g} untrained.
886a7d80-869d-4c48-951f-807c1e8804aa: A bard is proficient with all {g|Encyclopedia:Weapon_Proficiency}simple weapons{/g}, plus the longsword, rapier, shortsword and shortbow. Bards are also proficient with light armor and shields (except tower shields). A bard can cast bard {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} while wearing light armor and using a shield without incurring the normal {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Fail_Chance}arcane spell failure chance{/g}. Like any other arcane spellcaster, a bard wearing medium or heavy armor incurs a chance of arcane spell failure. A multiclass bard still incurs the normal arcane spell failure chance for arcane spells received from other classes.
aad59597-c63c-4413-bb72-e6e774d5a288: A bard of 12th level or higher can use his performance to create an effect equivalent to a mass {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}cure{/g} serious wounds, using the bard's level as the {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}. In addition, this performance removes the fatigued, sickened, and shaken condition from all those affected. Using this ability requires 4 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} of continuous performance.
5ab608ae-5b03-42be-a0bf-26a1466a56d9: A bard of 14th level or higher can use his performance to cause fear in his enemies. To be affected, an enemy must be able to hear the bard perform and be within 30 feet. Each enemy within range receives a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} 10 + 1/2 the bard's level + the bard's {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier) to negate the effect. If the save succeeds, the creature is immune to this ability for 24 hours. If the save fails, the target becomes frightened and flees for as long as the target can hear the bard's performance.
3af0616e-5ced-4f0d-bd52-d5d7e3484931: A bard of 15th level or higher can inspire tremendous heroism in all allies within 30 feet. Inspired creatures gain a +4 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} and a +4 dodge bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}. The effect lasts for as long as the targets are able to witness the performance.
bf51ad61-ccab-4f37-a225-86fc27c6dd7b: A bard of 20th level can use his performance to cause one enemy to die from joy or sorrow. To be affected, the target must be able to see and hear the bard perform for 1 full {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} and be within 30 feet. The target receives a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} 10 + 1/2 the bard's level + the bard's {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Cha{/g} modifier) to negate the effect. If a creature's saving throw succeeds, the target is staggered for {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} rounds, and the bard cannot use deadly performance on that creature again for 24 hours. If a creature's saving throw fails, it dies.
538ecf3e-224a-4390-8cac-12f0e51f2b18: A bard of 3rd level or higher can use his performance to help allies succeed at a task. They must be within 30 feet and able to see and hear the bard. They get a +2 competence {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on all {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g} as long as they continue to hear the bard's performance. This bonus increases by +1 for every four levels the bard has attained beyond 3rd (+3 at 7th, +4 at 11th, +5 at 15th, and +6 at 19th).
85259150-f18e-471e-9b2b-21e0f89757da: A bard of 8th level or higher can use his performance to foster a sense of growing dread in his enemies, causing them to become shaken. To be affected, an enemy must be within 30 feet and able to see and hear the bard's performance. The effect persists for as long as the enemy is within 30 feet and the bard continues the performance.
6595a6dc-0f2b-40af-a3ea-cc08296f1987: A bard of 9th level or higher can use his performance to inspire greatness in all allies within 30 feet, granting extra fighting capability. A creature inspired with greatness gains 2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}Hit Dice{/g} (d10s), the commensurate number of temporary {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} (apply the target's {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} modifier, if any, to these bonus Hit Dice), a +2 competence bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g}, and a +1 competence bonus on Fortitude {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g}.
a682077e-db9a-43a9-9aaf-cf9f37f7edd2: A battle singer's songs are powerful enough to {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} enemies with the sheer power of their vocal cords.
c8a8ad3a-672a-47ce-b49a-67b12461b225: A beast rider is proficient with light and medium armor, and with shields (with the exception of tower shields).
5aa02c12-ac34-4bd7-a43b-8e0e2171e30f: A beast tamer can channel stored {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} energy into summoning spells that she hasn't prepared ahead of time. She can spend a prepared spell in order to cast any summon nature's ally spell of the same level or lower.
0015e9cd-cb6d-4272-9d3d-0498f270d839: A blight druid may not bond with an animal companion, but may select from the Death and Destruction domains in addition to those normally available.
65ca5e3b-26f5-4e15-8d84-043169b8c8a6: A bloodrager's land {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} is faster than is normal for his {g|Encyclopedia:Race}race{/g} by 10 feet. This benefit applies only when he is wearing no armor, light armor, or medium armor, and not carrying a heavy load. Apply this {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} before modifying the bloodrager's speed due to any armor worn or load carried. This bonus stacks with any other bonuses to the bloodrager's land speed.
86215e0f-2014-4bfa-a71c-2a4958ae3c3f: A bonded object can be used once per day to restore any one sorcerer {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}.
1d0b388c-68ae-4afd-958d-8efd832f69dc: A bonded object can be used once per day to restore any one {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} slot.
d31cb5ad-6b57-433a-bb92-8872873e8286: A bonded object can be used once per day to restore any one {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} that the ecclesitheurge had prepared for that day.
99810ac3-7564-4770-9d0f-068f96e69926: A bonded object can be used once per day to restore any one {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} that the shaman had prepared for this day.
c086ea95-fd31-4297-bd58-f2f0f122bf66: A bonded object can be used once per day to restore any one {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} that the wizard had prepared for this day.
c434026f-fad7-4142-adab-57116220a253: A brilliant energy weapon ignores nonliving matter. Armor and shield {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonuses{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} (including any enhancement bonuses to that armor) do not count against it because the weapon passes through armor. ({g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g}, deflection, dodge, natural armor, and other such bonuses still apply.) A brilliant energy weapon cannot harm undead, constructs, or objects.
3be3b57a-9e22-4c5f-a877-03d0b8f1d8fc: A cavalier who belongs to this order has pledged himself to a sovereign; be it a king, queen, or even the local warlord. Cavaliers of this order are stalwart and dedicated to their cause, willing to go any length to ensure the safety of their lord and his domain.
12ca7dc6-2e49-48a6-92be-1e62e478d8bf: A cavalier who belongs to this order serves only himself, working to further his own aims and increase his own prestige. Cavaliers of this order tend to be selfish and concerned only with personal goals and objectives.
0cff07a9-830f-4dca-98f9-09c51d427892: A character can avoid even magical and unusual attacks with great agility. If a character makes a successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex saving throw{/g} against an attack that normally deals half {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} on a successful save, he instead takes no damage. A {g|Encyclopedia:Helpless}helpless{/g} character does not gain the benefit of evasion.
0b851f73-e399-4e4e-8280-e1cd8c469084:
A character can study an opponent he can see as a {g|Encyclopedia:Move_Action}move action{/g}. The character then gains a +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} against it. The {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}save{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DCs{/g} of character class abilities against that opponent increase by 1.
If a character deals sneak attack damage to a target, he studies that target, allowing him to apply his studied target bonuses against that target (including to the normal weapon damage roll).
At 5th, 10th, 15th, and 20th levels, the bonuses on weapon attack rolls, damage rolls and to character save DCs against a studied target increase by 1.
At 7th level, a character can study an opponent as a move or {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}.
d4fd2e92-7676-4c48-9d7d-7c78d2203c24: A character can, as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, denote one target within his line of sight as his quarry. He receives a +2 insight {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} made against his quarry, and all {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical{/g} threats are automatically confirmed. A character can have no more than one quarry at a time.
c2d010bc-e585-4527-b574-4047b5bc4b9c: A character must choose one Hellknight order to join at 1st level. The choice of order determines what disciplines the character gains later access to. If a character takes a level in the armiger class, they must choose an order as well, but they don't gain any benefits from it until they gain levels in the Hellknight or Hellknight signifer class.
6db74ed5-c647-4222-b0b0-d47910abe6c6: A character that selects this talent gains a bonus combat {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}. You can take this talent multiple times, each time selecting a different feat.
747f675a-2768-4051-ad1b-2098f827deac: A character that selects this talent gains a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}. These feats must be taken from the following list: Bull Rush, Greater Bull Rush, Improved Blind Fight, Blind Fight, Greater Blind Fight.
bfa0bb3b-41f9-4f5b-8a1f-0c0bffeb3c89: A character that selects this talent gains a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}. These feats must be taken from the following list: Deflect Arrows, Lightning Reflexes, Improved Lightning Reflexes, Dodge, Combat Mobility.
04e0f202-8a17-4e53-b0b4-ea771af64752: A character that selects this talent gains a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}. These feats must be taken from the following list: Great Fortitude, Improved Great Fortitude, Endurance, Trip, Greater Trip
4ae707a0-eaef-40ca-b1ce-20308632afa7: A character that selects this talent gains a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}. These feats must be taken from the following list: Iron Will, Improved Iron Will, Persuasive, Dazzling Display, Dreadful Carnage.
d2df43df-0312-413a-b40a-b6da13d955e4: A character who selects this talent gains Blinding {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}Critical{/g} as a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}, even if she doesn't meet the prerequisites.
7d8c1cc4-02fc-4826-80fd-0fb572fc6694: A character with this ability can sneak attack opponents with such precision that the blows weaken and hamper them. An opponent {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damaged{/g} by one of her sneak attacks also takes 2 points of {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:AbilityDamage}damage{/g}.
63b6b136-741b-4f23-8d30-46eb4245d3f5: A character with this talent has a cast-iron stomach or has trained themselves to withstand poisons, especially ingested ones. They gain a +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on all {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g} against poisons as well as a +4 bonus on saves against all {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} and effects that cause the character to be nauseated or sickened.
54362960-4c3b-49c8-8e19-172f407db045:
A child of the manticore can grow spikes from her body and throw them. At 1st level, a child of the manticore can throw spikes from her body as a natural throwing {g|Encyclopedia:RangedAttack}ranged attack{/g}, which replaces her claw {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}. This ability otherwise functions as the shifter claws class feature and benefits from all shifter claws improvements as well as shifter's fury.
At will, a child of the manticore in her natural form can gain two spike attacks as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g} to use as a weapon. The spikes can be used as a primary {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural attack{/g}, dealing {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}piercing damage{/g} (1d3 if she is {g|Encyclopedia:Size}Small{/g}). As the child of the manticore gains levels, the power of her spikes increases. At 3rd level, her spikes bypass {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} N/cold iron, N/magic, and N/silver. At 7th level, her spike {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} increases to 1d6 (1d4 if Small). At 11th level, her spike damage increases to 1d8 (1d6 if Small). At 13th level, her spike damage increases to 1d10 (1d8 if Small). At 17th level, the damage die does not increase, but the {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical{/g} multiplier becomes ×3. Finally, at 19th level, the spikes bypass DR N/adamantine and N/-.
63c929ed-589f-4877-a67d-e9a6197f83e3:
A child of the manticore can grow spikes from her body and throw them. At 1st level, a child of the manticore can throw spikes from her body as a natural throwing {g|Encyclopedia:RangedAttack}ranged attack{/g}, which replaces her claw {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}. This ability otherwise functions as the shifter claws class feature and benefits from all shifter claws improvements as well as shifter's fury.
At will, a child of the manticore in her natural form can gain two spike attacks as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g} to use as a weapon. The spikes can be used as a primary {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural attack{/g}, dealing {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}piercing damage{/g} (1d3 if she is {g|Encyclopedia:Size}Small{/g}). As the child of the manticore gains levels, the power of her spikes increases. At 3rd level, her spikes bypass {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} N/cold iron, N/magic, and N/silver. At 7th level, her spike {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} increases to 1d6 (1d4 if Small). At 11th level, her spike damage increases to 1d8 (1d6 if Small). At 13th level, her spike damage increases to 1d10 (1d8 if Small). At 17th level, the damage die does not increase, but the {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical{/g} multiplier becomes ×3. Finally, at 19th level, the spikes bypass DR N/adamantine and N/-.
ea816737-619a-446f-82fc-5e4eb962f579:
A child of the manticore can take on the aspect of the manticore as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}. While in this form, she gains a +2 inherent {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to her {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} scores. She can maintain this form for a number of minutes per day equal to 3 + her shifter level. The duration does not need to be consecutive, but it must be spent in 1-minute increments.
At 5th level, when making her first {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} in each {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}, the child of the manticore throws two spikes instead of one ({g|Encyclopedia:Dice}roll{/g} the weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} dice for the spike attack twice and add the results together before adding bonuses from Strength, weapon abilities (such as flaming), precision-based damage, and other damage bonuses).
At 10th level, the inherent bonus to Strength and Dexterity increases to +4.
At 15th level, the inherent bonus to Strength and Dexterity increases to +6.
At 20th level, when making her first attack in each round, the child of the manticore throws four spikes instead of one (roll the weapon damage dice for the spike attack four times and add the results together before adding bonuses from Strength, weapon abilities (such as flaming), precision-based damage, and other damage bonuses). Her inherent bonus to Strength and Dexterity also increases to +8. Additionally, she now can use her manticore aspect and manticore shape at will.
This alters and replaces all improvements to shifter aspect.
49d388dc-0491-4722-b1f4-bb502ed8098e: A cognatogen that gives the alchemist a +4 alchemical {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} and a +2 natural armor bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}. The alchemist takes a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} as long as the cognatogen persists, and takes 2 points of {g|Encyclopedia:AbilityDamage}ability damage{/g} to Constitution when the cognatogen ends.
263842a8-8d89-4199-be53-d4beaa41a797: A cognatogen that gives the alchemist a +4 alchemical {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} and a +2 natural armor bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}. The alchemist takes a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} as long as the cognatogen persists, and takes 2 points of {g|Encyclopedia:AbilityDamage}ability damage{/g} to Strength when the cognatogen ends.
478ade58-bca8-425c-9ba1-0c482ed71b3f: A cognatogen that gives the alchemist a +4 alchemical {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} and a +2 natural armor bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}. The alchemist takes a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} as long as the cognatogen persists, and takes 2 points of {g|Encyclopedia:AbilityDamage}ability damage{/g} to Dexterity when the cognatogen ends.
9eb69e34-eca8-479a-ba97-4cb81bde5994:
A colluding scoundrel is adept at redirecting a foe's hostility toward another creature, creating openings for her own {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g}. A number of times per day equal to her hunter level, as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}, she can target one foe within 30 feet and designate one willing ally adjacent to that foe as a scapegoat. For the following minute, the target takes a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on attacks against any creature other than the designated scapegoat, and the target has a 10% {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Fail_Chance}spell failure chance{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} that don't target the scapegoat or include the scapegoat in their area of effect. The penalty increases to –4 at 8th level and –6 at 15th level.
The colluding scoundrel can designate her animal companion as a scapegoat without it counting against her daily uses of this ability.
1cfe303e-f233-465c-9f7a-f5d05983c93f: A composer of sonorous laments for the dead and elaborate requiems for those lost yet long remembered, dirge bards master musical tools and tropes that must appeal to the ears and hearts of both the living and the dead.
06877007-8f0d-4f0d-ae75-f662b480270a: A creature that takes a direct hit from a tanglefoot bomb must {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}save{/g} against the bomb's {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} or be entangled and glued to the floor as if it had failed its save against a tanglefoot bag. Creatures in the splash area that fail their saves are entangled but not glued to the floor; those who make this save are not entangled at all.
a58e3c92-114a-4615-b0ab-9d822ed9230a: A creature with this ability gains two additional claw {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g}, which it can only use against an enemy it grapples. A creature must start its turn with a grappled enemy in order to use {g|Encyclopedia:Rake}rake{/g}.
de2e069c-cc5d-4c4d-91e2-103d11e35681: A crossblooded bloodline combines the powers of two distinct heritages. In most cases, sorcerers with this bloodline are the offspring of two sorcerers from different ancestries, but occasionally a crossblooded sorcerer arises from the conjunction of other powers. A draconic sorcerer who is also the culmination of a great destiny, an abyssal sorcerer from a family that dealt with devils, and an arcane sorcerer raised from birth by fey are all possible sources for crossblooded bloodlines.
46dee21f-a12a-4876-8c24-b31c61766744: A crossblooded sorcerer gains an additional bloodline as a secondary bloodline. She receives only the {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} class {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill{/g} and bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} from this bloodline.
c2ee342a-5658-401c-8a00-4d9f25fdfb68: A crossblooded sorcerer has one fewer {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} known at each level than regular sorcerer.
b47975ce-364b-4208-ad15-8afdcbc8aa27:
A crusader gains a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} at 1st level, then again at 5th level and every five levels thereafter (to a maximum of five at 20th level). These bonus feats must be chosen from the following list: Heavy Armor Proficiency, Shield Bash, {g|Encyclopedia:Weapon_Proficiency}Martial Weapon{/g} Proficiency, Saving Shield, Shield Focus, Tower Shield Proficiency, and Weapon Focus.
At 10th level, a crusader may also choose from the following feats: Greater Weapon Focus, Improved {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}Critical{/g}, and Weapon Specialization.
At 20th level, a crusader may also choose Greater Weapon Specialization. A crusader need not meet the normal class- or level-based prerequisites for these bonus feats.
94ef297c-3681-4c73-933e-1106c370d427: A cult leader gains a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Stealth}Stealth checks{/g}.
0e0d0c7b-a5df-48d1-b63f-b614005e8a81: A daredevil gains a competence {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Mobility}Mobility checks{/g} equal to half its {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}Hit Dice{/g}.
ee5191d4-5475-4986-9ca5-a6ea87374a44:
A dark elementalist uses the souls of others to protect herself from the dangers of burn. She can't choose to accept burn if doing so would raise her total number of points of burn above 3. However, a number of times per day equal to her {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier, as a {g|Encyclopedia:Full_Round_Action}full-round action{/g} she can gather up the souls of dead creatures with {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}HD{/g} sum equal to or higher than her {g|Encyclopedia:Character_Level}character level{/g}. When she does, some of her existing burn is unloaded into the departing souls, racking it with unspeakable torment, but reducing her current burn total by 1 point.
A dark elementalist gains {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} bonuses from elemental overflow based on how many times that day she has successfully used soul power to rack souls, rather than based on her current burn total. For instance, a 9th-level dark elementalist who had used soul power three or more times during the course of the day would add a +3 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on attack rolls and a +6 bonus on damage rolls. A dark elementalist does not gain {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} bonuses to physical {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability scores{/g} or a chance to ignore {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hits{/g} and sneak attacks from elemental overflow.
This ability alters burn and elemental overflow and replaces internal buffer.
5d218c4e-8f9f-404a-841f-5fb410084fdb:
A dark elementalist's base {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g} bonus from the kineticist class is equal to 2 + 1/2 her kineticist level, and her base Reflex and Fortitude save bonuses are equal to 1/3 her kineticist level. She gains all Knowledge and Lore skills as class {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g}.
A dark elementalist uses her {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier instead of her {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} modifier to determine her {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} with wild talents, the {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DCs{/g} of Constitution-based wild talents, the durations of wild talents with Constitution-based durations, her {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Concentration}concentration checks{/g} for wild talents, and any other Constitution-based effects of all her wild talents.
This alters the kineticist's class skills and base saving throws and the key {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability score{/g} of wild talents.
9cbceb5c-64b3-4fed-8049-f63243f1367b:
A defender of the true world gains a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} against fey.
A defender of the true world can channel stored {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} energy into summoning spells that she hasn't prepared ahead of time, but she cannot use summon nature's ally to summon fey creatures. She can "lose" a prepared spell of 7th or lower level in order to cast any summon nature's ally spell of the same level or lower. She can "lose" a prepared spell of 8th level to cast summon elder earth elemental or "lose" a prepared spell of 9th level to cast summon elder worm.
0787cfe8-d75c-49a6-82f1-d4b78e1a5bf3:
A deity, also known as a god or goddess, is a being or force of incredible power capable of granting its power to mortal beings through divine magic. A deity is strongly associated with a specific {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}alignment{/g}, several domains, and a plane.
Each deity also limits the choice of your starting alignment and the choices for certain classes. Deity choice cannot be changed later.
eb38bac7-4db8-4f38-a849-017e1538da32: A demonbane priest chooses only one domain from his deity's list of domains rather than the normal two domains. In all other respects, this works like and replaces the standard cleric domain ability.
32c52193-a976-4375-af70-88af2464e6dc: A demonbane priest is proficient with heavy armor in addition to all standard cleric proficiencies.
ff2668d1-498a-455d-8386-8e685acb0faa: A demonslayer adds the following {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} to his spell list: 1st — protection from evil; 2nd — protection from evil, communal.
434ba4aa-f220-4caa-a12b-a1af37f8f5b1: A disciple of the pike gains a +1 dodge {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} against creatures larger than he is. This bonus increases by 1 if the creature is two {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} categories larger. At 6th level, the bonus increases to +3 against a creature three size categories larger, and at 12th level, the bonus increases to +4 against creatures four size categories larger.
27c48b13-1613-4df4-9806-d88378f62225:
A divine caster's deity influences their {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}alignment{/g}, what magic they can perform, their values, and how others see them. The character chooses domains (in quantity depending on their class) from among those belonging to their deity. A character can select an alignment domain (Chaos, Evil, Good, or Law) only if their own alignment matches that domain.
Each domain grants a number of domain powers, dependent upon the level of the divine caster.
Clerics also gain a number of bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}. A cleric gains one domain spell slot for each level of cleric spell they can cast, from 1st on up. Each day, a cleric can prepare one of the spells from their two domains in that slot. If a domain spell is not on the cleric spell list, a cleric can prepare it only in a domain spell slot. Domain spells cannot be used to cast spells spontaneously.
6c148cef-bf09-4d94-8e53-7c5fa1ebd27c: A divine guardian gains a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} at 7th level, and additional bonus feats at 10th and 13th level. These bonus feats must be chosen from the following list: Combat Reflexes, Diehard, Dodge, Endurance, Great Fortitude, Improved Great Fortitude, Iron Will, Improved Iron Will, Lightning Reflexes, Improved Lightning Reflexes, Missile Shield, Shield Focus, Toughness, or Tower Shield Proficiency.
060bff78-16f5-4439-a5c0-5a57c19821e8:
A divine herbalist combines alchemy, acupuncture, and divine magic to {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g} wounds by touch. She can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 1 + her {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier. With one use of this ability, she uses positive energy to heal the target of {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} for every 2 oracle levels she has. Using this ability is a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} unless the oracle targets herself, in which case it is a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}. This ability counts as a paladin's lay on hands ability for the purposes of {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}, and effects that work with that class feature when it is used for healing purposes. Unlike lay on hands, this ability cannot be used to harm undead.
This ability replaces the revelation gained at 1st level.
8bf7fe4f-c065-4ccb-a394-a587f3b5891e:
A divine herbalist has mastered countless alchemical techniques that supplement her divine powers and greatly aid her when she heals the sick and wounded. She gains a competence {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Lore_Nature}Lore (nature) checks{/g} equal to 1/2 her oracle level (minimum 1), and uses her {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier in place of her {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier when attempting Lore (nature) {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g}.
This ability replaces the additional class {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g} the oracle gains from her mystery.
aab09052-2ea2-4026-adef-a5a50631ef7f: A divine hound gains the inquisitor's judgment ability. Additionally, he shares all the bonuses gained from judgment with his animal companion.
985276ef-14d3-4652-ae8c-c9eea3bd2638: A dragon disciple adds his level to his sorcerer levels when determining the powers gained from his bloodline. If the dragon disciple does not have levels of sorcerer, he instead gains bloodline powers of the draconic bloodline, using his dragon disciple level as his sorcerer level to determine the bonuses gained. He must choose a dragon type upon gaining his first level in this class and that type must be the same as his sorcerer type. This ability does not grant bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} to a sorcerer unless he possesses spell slots of an appropriate level. Such bonus spells are automatically granted if the sorcerer gains spell slots of the spell's level.
ae687b36-a024-41c4-aef6-83ab082bdf6c: A dragon is a reptilelike creature, usually winged, with magical or unusual abilities.
8e002bda-34a5-411d-a784-7e68533f622f: A dragonblood shifter can temporarily imbue her body with draconic majesty as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}. When activating this ability, the dragonblood shifter must select one of the chromatic or metallic dragon types. Her draconic aspect abilities grant resistances and deal a type of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} based on the chosen dragon type. While shifted into this form, she gains the {g|Encyclopedia:Scent}scent{/g} ability and {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}energy resistance{/g} 5 against the energy type that corresponds to her selected dragon type; also, whenever she prevents damage with either the resistance or the immunity provided by her draconic aspect ability, she {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heals{/g} a number of {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} equal to the amount of damage prevented. She can maintain this form for a number of minutes per day equal to 3 + her shifter level. The duration does not need to be consecutive, but it must be spent in 1-minute increments. The dragonblood shifter can select a different dragon type every time she uses this ability, but she must end her current draconic aspect and activate this ability again in order to change her chosen dragon type. Evil dragonblood shifters can only choose from chromatic dragons, good dragonblood shifters can only choose from metallic dragons, and neutral dragonblood shifters can choose any dragon type.
6ad9ea12-fe15-4beb-a4ce-5a3f8940ea82:
A dragonblood shifter can temporarily imbue her body with draconic majesty as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}. When activating this ability, the dragonblood shifter must select one of the chromatic or metallic dragon types. Her draconic aspect abilities grant resistances and deal a type of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} based on the chosen dragon type. While shifted into this form, she gains the {g|Encyclopedia:Scent}scent{/g} ability and {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}energy resistance{/g} 5 against the energy type that corresponds to her selected dragon type; also, whenever she prevents damage with either the resistance or the immunity provided by her draconic aspect ability, she {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heals{/g} a number of {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} equal to the amount of damage prevented. She can maintain this form for a number of minutes per day equal to 3 + her shifter level. The duration does not need to be consecutive, but it must be spent in 1-minute increments. The dragonblood shifter can select a different dragon type every time she uses this ability, but she must end her current draconic aspect and activate this ability again in order to change her chosen dragon type. Evil dragonblood shifters can only choose from chromatic dragons, good dragonblood shifters can only choose from metallic dragons, and neutral dragonblood shifters can choose any dragon type.
At 5th level, the energy resistance granted by the dragonblood shifter's draconic aspect increases to 10. At 10th level, the energy resistance granted by the dragonblood shifter's draconic aspect increases to 15, and she gains a breath weapon of her energy type that deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of damage per shifter level within a 30-foot cone. A target can attempt a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} 10 + half the dragonblood shifter's shifter level + her {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} modifier) to reduce the damage by half. The dragonblood shifter can use her breath weapon a number of times per day equal to half her shifter level + her {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier.
At 15th level, the energy resistance granted by the dragonblood shifter's draconic aspect increases to 20.
At 20th level, the dragonblood shifter becomes immune to the energy type that corresponds to her selected dragon type while in her draconic aspect and gains {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g} equal to 10 + her shifter level.
c17ddf0a-8d25-4382-a09a-a3c4e624164b:
A druid can call upon nature's strength, granting her additional combat prowess. At 1st level, a druid can rampage for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} per day equal to 4 + her {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} modifier. For each level after 1st she possesses, the druid can rampage for 2 additional rounds per day.
While rampaging, a druid gains a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} made with {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural weapons{/g}. In addition, she takes a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}Armor Class{/g}. These bonuses are increased by 1 at 6th level and every 5 levels after.
8f7573fc-82a4-4769-85ef-997c1de8182c: A druid can channel stored {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} energy into summoning spells that she hasn't prepared ahead of time. She can "lose" a prepared spell in order to cast any summon nature's ally spell of the same level or lower.
1a30b5fd-f2bf-466a-9b42-d8544c151827: A druid can form a tight bond to an animal to gain an animal companion who can wear barding and advance along with the druid. Alternatively, they can form a bond with a domain to get {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} and abilities it provides.
3fae1977-8d9b-43ef-89f6-bed5f51eef44: A druid gains a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Lore_Nature}Lore (nature) checks{/g}.
228b1da7-964c-4de8-97cf-89b3bd91a077: A druid gains the ability to transform into an animal, gaining its {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} and abilities, thus becoming deadly in melee combat. As a druid advances, they learn to turn into more and more powerful beasts.
068e28c4-f056-415e-858c-26281086223e: A druid who changes to a prohibited {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}alignment{/g} loses all {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} and druid abilities (including her animal companion, but not including weapon, armor, and shield proficiencies). She cannot thereafter gain levels as a druid until she returns to a permitted alignment.
eded7fca-7c9e-4969-8019-4750bfc0e887:
A duelist gains the ability to strike precisely with a light or {g|Encyclopedia:Light_Weapon}one-handed{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}piercing{/g} weapon, adding her duelist level to her {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage roll{/g}.
To make a precise strike, a duelist cannot have a weapon in her other hand or use a shield. A duelist's precise strike only works against creatures with discernible anatomies. Any creature that is immune to {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hits{/g} is also immune to a precise strike, and any item or ability that protects a creature from critical hits also protects a creature from a precise strike.
0958858b-0310-46ed-ba42-b6fe4c946a43: A faith hunter chooses a single {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}alignment{/g} that opposes her own along either the law/chaos axis or the good/evil axis. Creatures of this alignment are her sworn enemies.
14c79729-17b0-427e-b0f4-2c6a6f597086: A familiar is a magical pet that enhances the character's {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g} and senses. A centipede's master gains a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will saves{/g} and a +2 bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Perception}Perception checks{/g}.
9d0741fa-dac1-436e-84be-2d2d8c56ce40: A familiar is a magical pet that enhances the character's {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g} and senses. A chicken's master gains +3 {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} and a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Perception}Perception checks{/g}.
5e74af6a-e168-4e97-848d-94b3f3c60101: A familiar is a magical pet that enhances the character's {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g} and senses. A dog's master gains a +3 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Lore_Nature}Lore (nature) checks{/g} and a +2 bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Perception}Perception checks{/g}.
e0d3f9bd-9443-4129-b1df-d28346b5532e: A familiar is a magical pet that enhances the character's {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g} and senses. A duck's master gains a +3 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Knowledge_World}Knowledge (world){/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g} and a +2 bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Perception}Perception checks{/g}.
95259a6c-0479-44e0-9adb-2fabcb2b8c20: A familiar is a magical pet that enhances the character's {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g} and senses. A hare's master gains a +4 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g} and a +2 bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Perception}Perception checks{/g}.
e3cfaf97-5ccb-4a19-803d-9db749fb5fb1: A familiar is a magical pet that enhances the character's {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g} and senses. A jerboa's master gains a +3 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Athletics}Athletics checks{/g} and a +2 bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Perception}Perception checks{/g}.
dd085d09-db50-4c9b-8d1f-45e7c696b1e6: A familiar is a magical pet that enhances the character's {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g} and senses. A lizard's master gains a +1 natural armor {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} and a +2 bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Perception}Perception checks{/g}.
8aa65f08-b16a-4619-9618-386fba7add0f: A familiar is a magical pet that enhances the character's {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g} and senses. A monkey's master gains a +3 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Mobility}Mobility checks{/g} and a +2 bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Perception}Perception checks{/g}.
0b1aded0-8c18-4b1f-9f28-7067a13e8775: A familiar is a magical pet that enhances the character's {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g} and senses. A rabbit's master gains a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex saves{/g} and a +2 bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Perception}Perception checks{/g}.
9c7cc788-dbe4-4967-9ea8-c9479a49dac6: A familiar is a magical pet that enhances the character's {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g} and senses. A rat's master gains a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude saves{/g} and a +2 bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Perception}Perception checks{/g}.
8e2bf9db-540f-4b71-8046-286705de60f5: A familiar is a magical pet that enhances the character's {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g} and senses. A raven's master gains a +3 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Persuasion}Persuasion checks{/g} and a +2 bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Perception}Perception checks{/g}.
1fa15586-b406-413e-953f-f211e695ccee: A familiar is a magical pet that enhances the character's {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g} and senses. A tarantula's master gains a +3 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Athletics}Athletics checks{/g} and a +2 bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Perception}Perception checks{/g}.
2e320393-7b0d-4670-89fb-fcb87078e024: A familiar is a magical pet that enhances the character's {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g} and senses. A viper's master gains a +3 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Persuasion}Persuasion checks{/g} and a +2 bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Perception}Perception checks{/g}.
8f6285d8-911f-4395-b60a-17e167d0d838: A familiar is a magical pet that enhances the charaсter's {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g} and senses. A cat's master gains a +3 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Stealth}Stealth checks{/g} and a +2 bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Perception}Perception checks{/g}.
12d5efc2-2e36-4a3b-b927-2517deb80c2c:
A fearsome leader can help his allies throw off effects of enemy fear with his own display.
Each time you use Dazzling Display, you also try to dispel all fear effects on your allies in the same radius, using your cavalier level as {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}.
Starting at 9th level, your allies also gain the benefit of the good hope {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to your {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g}, but no more than once per combat.
193a9b18-858b-4f45-9b1a-dec6bfefa4ec: A feral champion must take the Animal blessing and does not gain a second blessing.
d79de903-7dcb-411c-98c9-6e967f02cccb: A fey is a creature with {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}supernatural abilities{/g} and connections to nature or to some other force or place. Fey are usually human-shaped.
c5a4bede-e965-45fc-8f9d-b17e062cb636:
A feyform shifter can take on a First World aspect and assume fey traits as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}. While in this form, she gains {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} 1/cold iron. Her body outline becomes indistinct; she is treated as though she has {g|Encyclopedia:Concealment}concealment{/g} (20% miss chance). She can maintain this form for a number of minutes per day equal to 3 + her shifter level. The duration does not need to be consecutive, but it must be spent in 1-minute increments.
At 5th level, the feyform shifter's DR increases to 2/cold iron, and she grows a pair of butterfly-like wings that grant her immunity to ground-based effects.
At 10th level, the feyform shifter's DR increases to 5/cold iron, and she gains a +4 inherent {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against mind-affecting effects.
At 15th level, the feyform shifter's DR increases to 7/cold iron, and her bonus on saving throws against mind-affecting effects increases to +6.
At 20th level, the feyform shifter's DR increases to 10/cold iron. She becomes resistant to movement-impairing effects (as per the freedom of movement {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}) and gains {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g} equal to 10 + her {g|Encyclopedia:Class_Level}class level{/g}.
This alters and replaces all improvements to shifter aspect.
c4eac042-aafb-4bad-a684-103e39cbc23d:
A fiendflesh shifter's claws are infused with rage at her creators from the evil Outer Planes. At 1st level, a fiendflesh shifter's claws overcome the {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g} of any evil outsiders. This ability otherwise functions as the shifter claws class feature.
This alters shifter claws.
bf9fe445-3df3-49c9-9c80-6342ef0ea511: A fighter can choose a group of weapons and gain {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonuses{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} and chance to hit while wielding them. As a fighter advances, they can choose additional weapon groups, or gain new unique powers.
8fa6d6eb-6d6c-4ee9-aec9-7ad29177a0d9: A fighter is proficient with all simple and {g|Encyclopedia:Weapon_Proficiency}martial weapons{/g} and with all armor (heavy, light, and medium) and shields (including tower shields).
ac8b5c4b-23f4-4105-abf6-54e4b0e3ae2b: A flame dancer studies the movements of fire, adding its grace to his repertoire. He seeks truth in fire's burning essence, and uses his performance to unleash the power of fire against those who dare oppose him.
c33b63a4-7ffc-491a-9cba-ddc219a1fc15: A flaming burst weapon functions as a flaming weapon that also explodes with flame upon striking a successful {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g}. The fire does not harm the wielder. In addition to the extra {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g} from the flaming ability, a flaming burst weapon deals an extra 1d10 points of fire {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} on a successful critical hit. If the weapon's critical multiplier is ×3, add an extra 2d10 points of fire damage instead, and if the multiplier is ×4, add an extra 3d10 points of fire damage.
11ff69ee-8d00-40b3-b4a7-d09c0be63c50: A freebooter is a natural leader, a pirate who works well with a variety of people and in a variety of roles. Her specialized combat tactics help organize and direct a crew, and freebooters' talents are in high demand. Most freebooters work as independent agents. A freebooter signs on with a crew when she feels the urge to travel, and often moves to a new ship when her contract ends.
efdd1d54-babd-4713-99bc-1084891d3233: A gendarme trains to be a mounted terror, almost to the exclusion of all other abilities. He gains bonus combat or mounted combat {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g} at 1st level, 3rd level, and then every three levels thereafter.
929114c1-8f2f-4845-bfc4-207f4bf99d15: A geokineticist adds {g|Encyclopedia:Athletics}Athletics{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Knowledge_World}Knowledge (world){/g} to her list of class {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g}.
4a298adf-92e9-471b-90ee-f5fe4c94b53b: A good cleric (or a neutral cleric of a good deity) can channel stored {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} energy into {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}healing{/g} spells that she did not prepare ahead of time. The cleric can "lose" any prepared spell that is not an {g|Encyclopedia:Cantrips_Orisons}orison{/g} or domain spell in order to cast any cure spell of the same spell level (a cure spell is any spell with "cure" in its name).
74b34ee6-e821-4d3e-a41b-6beafa64c80c:
A good cleric (or a neutral cleric who worships a good deity) channels positive energy and can choose to deal {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} to undead creatures or to {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g} living creatures.
Channeling energy causes a burst that either heals all living creatures or damages all undead creatures in a 30-foot radius centered on the cleric. The amount of damage dealt or healed is equal to {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of damage plus 1d6 points of damage for every two cleric levels beyond 1st (2d6 at 3rd, 3d6 at 5th, and so on). Creatures that take damage from channeled energy receive a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g} to halve the damage. The {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of this save is equal to 10 + 1/2 the cleric's level + the cleric's {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier. Creatures healed by channel energy cannot exceed their maximum {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit point{/g} total—all excess healing is lost. A cleric may channel energy a number of times per day equal to 3 + her Charisma modifier. This is a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} that does not provoke an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attack of opportunity{/g}. A cleric can choose whether or not to include herself in this effect.
A good cleric (or a neutral cleric of a good deity) can also channel stored {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} energy into healing spells that she did not prepare ahead of time. The cleric can "lose" any prepared spell that is not an {g|Encyclopedia:Cantrips_Orisons}orison{/g} or domain spell in order to cast any cure spell of the same spell level or lower (a cure spell is any spell with "cure" in its name).
fc8ad163-bb71-427d-aa80-35e25d60a4c5:
A good warpriest (or a neutral warpriest of a good deity) can channel stored {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} energy into {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}healing{/g} spells that he did not prepare ahead of time. The warpriest can expend any prepared spell that isn't an {g|Encyclopedia:Cantrips_Orisons}orison{/g} to cast any cure spell of the same spell level or lower. A cure spell is any spell with "cure" in its name.
An evil warpriest (or a neutral warpriest of an evil deity) can't convert spells to cure spells, but can convert them to inflict spells. An inflict spell is any spell with "inflict" in its name.
A warpriest that is neither good nor evil and whose deity is neither good nor evil chooses whether he can convert spells into either cure spells or inflict spells. Once this choice is made, it cannot be changed. This choice also determines whether the warpriest channels positive or negative energy (see Channel Energy ability description).
c9d5f6e8-0fad-4df1-8c23-273c05c5232c: A grand cognatogen that gives the alchemist a +8 alchemical {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g}, a +6 alchemical bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g}, a +4 alchemical bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g}, and a +6 natural armor bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}. The alchemist takes a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} as long as the cognatogen persists, and takes 2 points of {g|Encyclopedia:AbilityDamage}ability damage{/g} to Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution when the cognatogen ends.

f8ea4ee2-f09c-47dd-8998-9a6f5be5ac1a: A hagbound must select one of the following patrons: Deception, Winter, Shadow, Strength.
2a1affb8-2d5d-4d77-a2e7-be5a45c06584: A hagbound's hands grow into a pair of hideous claws that deal {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} for a {g|Encyclopedia:Size}Medium{/g} hagbound (1d3 for a Small creature).
3a0fbf5f-1a5e-45f7-818a-79e50bcc8075: A herald caller can channel stored {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} energy into summoning spells that she hasn't prepared ahead of time. She can lose a prepared spell in order to cast any summon monster spell of the same level.
2164bb09-5f02-4de0-ac36-87d010274805: A herald caller depends on summoned allies to overcome her foes, which affords her little experience with the martial pursuits typical of other clerics and a narrower spiritual focus. A herald caller can choose only one domain from her deity's list of domains, rather than the normal two domains, and she doesn't gain proficiency with medium armor or shields.
56f0de07-bc13-4ec8-bbb2-b199e704e072: A hex channeler is a witch who devotes herself to either life — {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}healing{/g} the wounded and destroying the undead — or death, slaying the living and aiding undead.
020bfa5a-2947-44b4-b6cf-c92c290983fa: A hexcrafter magus adds all {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} of 6th level or lower that have the curse descriptor to his spellbook.
6a5b9336-0e54-4151-a19f-5470944245a0: A hexcrafter magus has uncovered the secret of using his arcane pool to recreate witch hexes. These magi can hex friend and foe, curse those they strike, and expand their {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} selection to include many curses and harmful spells.
5dcf6faf-c269-4a34-b560-bc6f4a9886c7: A hexcrafter may select any witch hex in place of a magus arcana. At 12th level, the hexcrafter may select a hex or major hex in place of a magus arcana. At 18th level, a hexcrafter can select a hex, major hex, or grand hex in place of a magus arcana.
cf46f987-e97d-49d4-a35f-afc56d1086fc: A holy weapon is imbued with holy power. This power makes the weapon good-aligned and thus bypasses the corresponding {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g}. It deals an extra {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} against all creatures of evil {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}alignment{/g}.
175b54ed-9270-44f6-964a-03b287173c8f: A humanoid usually has two arms, two legs, and one head, or a human-like torso, arms, and a head. Humanoids have few or no supernatural or {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}extraordinary abilities{/g}, but most can speak and usually have well-developed societies.
c0707f85-1bfd-48a1-bb59-4d11bcb53a34: A hunter gains a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Lore_Nature}Lore (nature) checks{/g}.
164d4634-f371-4bde-b8c9-a4ac5a39095f: A hunter is proficient with all simple and {g|Encyclopedia:Weapon_Proficiency}martial weapons{/g} and with light armor, medium armor, and shields (except tower shields).
b4e7bd38-5209-4a21-aa92-a0df641c79b7: A hydrokineticist adds {g|Encyclopedia:Lore_Nature}Lore (nature){/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Athletics}Athletics{/g} to her list of class {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g}.
2bb8b8f9-6316-425b-b766-9acb981fe6f7: A hydrokineticist can select either cold blast or water blast as her simple blast. She gains one of them when she first selects water, and must select water again with expanded element to gain the other.
dd14835d-d988-4cfd-aa39-881570a44d02: A incense synthesizer learns a number of alchemical tricks, called incenses, which grant ally powers or weaken foes. At 3rd level, a incense synthesizer learns one incense. At 6th, 9th, 12th, 15th and 18th level, the incense synthesizer learns new incense. A incense synthesizer cannot select a incense more than once unless noted otherwise.
5d7d770e-d0fb-4565-8bdc-d42ed4e9098d: A kinetic knight dons armor and wields a blade of elemental energy. Kinetic knights are rare in the Inner Sea region, but not unknown; many realize their elemental powers while training for battle.
d6f57421-5afd-412b-811c-d9ae87bda63d: A kineticist can briefly, but significantly empower their blasts by adding several infusions. This inflicts burn, which lowers their {g|Encyclopedia:HP}health{/g} until the next time they {g|Encyclopedia:Rest}rest{/g}. Special abilities can help a kineticist mitigate or completely prevent burn.
67748a71-e3bd-4ba3-8446-64cbd1119901: A kineticist can use wild talents — magical abilities similar to {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} but drawn from the kineticist's innate psychic talent and usable at will. Wild talents are typically {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}spell-like abilities{/g} (though some are supernatural abilities), and take a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} to use unless otherwise noted. Every wild talent has an effective spell level. A kineticist can always select 1st-level wild talents, but she can select a wild talent of a higher level only if her kineticist level is at least double the wild talent's effective spell level. Kinetic blast and defense wild talents are always considered to have an effective spell level equal to 1/2 the kineticist's {g|Encyclopedia:Class_Level}class level{/g} (to a maximum effective spell level of 9th at kineticist level 18th). Unless otherwise noted, the {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} for a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g} against a wild talent is equal to 10 + the wild talent's effective spell level + the kineticist's {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} modifier. The kineticist uses her Constitution modifier on all {g|Encyclopedia:Concentration}concentration{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g} for wild talents. In addition to the wild talents she gains from her other class features, at 2nd level and every 2 levels thereafter, a kineticist selects a new utility wild talent from the list of options available to her. A kineticist can select only universal wild talents or those that match her element.
ef390161-350f-4963-8b89-e8412f9cf681: A knife master focuses her ability to deal sneak attack {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} with daggers and similar weapons to such a degree that she can deal more sneak attack damage with those weapons at the expense of sneak attacks with other weapons. When she makes a sneak attack with a dagger, kukri, punching dagger, starknife, or sai, she uses d8s to {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}roll{/g} sneak attack damage instead of d6s. For sneak attacks with all other weapons, she uses d4s instead of d6s.
fb4b14e4-7d02-4a22-9593-48e57cb4495b: A lone strider is a recluse who gained her oracular powers from isolation in a deep desert, on a mountain peak, or in another secluded location. A connection to untraveled places gives the lone strider powers to evade her enemies.
aa3b4306-ab57-4df7-aedd-e5258d3313f9: A lone strider must choose a mystery that adds {g|Encyclopedia:Lore_Nature}Lore (nature){/g} to his list of class {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g}.
7d100be5-9e1a-41c1-b76e-04299b06ce4f: A loremaster can get a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to one {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g} as a secret.
08743d54-25d2-471a-bf75-33fe09aa2171: A loremaster can get a rogue's talents as a secret. He need not meet the prerequisites of the talent.
989b5179-ddb2-4f13-b98c-87c4b2902a4f: A loremaster can get any combat {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} as a secret. He need not meet the prerequisites of the feat.
3cd569aa-af9c-4f55-98b3-8abc393a2a6f: A loremaster can get any wizard {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} as a secret. He need not meet the prerequisites of the feat.
4f598bcf-3dfe-495b-8855-879b2bbbcda7: A loremaster can learn a {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} from another class's spell list, adding it to the list of spells one of his current spellcasting classes can cast.
75f43f22-a9fe-4b3d-9823-a129345d4091: A magus is proficient with all simple and {g|Encyclopedia:Weapon_Proficiency}martial weapons{/g}. A magus is also proficient with light armor. He can cast magus {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} while wearing light armor without incurring the normal {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Fail_Chance}arcane spell failure chance{/g}. Like any other arcane spellcaster, a magus wearing medium armor, heavy armor, or a shield incurs a chance of arcane spell failure. A multiclass magus still incurs the normal arcane spell failure chance for arcane spells received from other classes.
fa23d814-07ef-47c9-a9af-b70cf1d5b068: A mercenary undertaking his task with cold, professional detachment, the assassin is equally adept at espionage, bounty hunting, and terrorism. At his core, an assassin is an artisan, and his medium is death. Trained in a variety of killing techniques, assassins are among the most feared classes.
af1e6760-027b-4f23-a3a6-9a10572bf240: A metamorph adds {g|Encyclopedia:Stealth}Stealth{/g} to her list of class {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g}.
a13b5ca3-9d29-4823-b30a-7be32eef12c1:
A metamorph gains the ability to transform herself into another form. The effect lasts for 1 hour per metamorph's alchemist level, or until she changes back. Changing form (to another form or back) is a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} that doesn't provoke {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attacks of opportunity{/g}. The metamorph is fatigued for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} each time she changes shape.
A metamorph can use this ability twice per day at 4th level and an additional time per day every 2 alchemist levels thereafter, for a total of ten times at 20th level.
This ability functions as beast shape I at 4th level, as beast shape II at 9th level, as beast shape III at 11th level, as beast shape IV or dragonkind I at 13th level, and as dragonkind II at 15th level.
This ability replaces alchemy (which also includes bombs, extracts, and mutagen) and Throw Anything.
a459fc2d-ee5b-4dc7-96a8-3b9a03e3223e: A mixed-blood rager can use his strange heritage to invoke powers of different bloodlines. Once per day, he can choose a bloodline: until the next time he chooses a bloodline, he gains all the advantages of the chosen bloodline.
3f5daa22-f474-4786-9a40-62b0e6313d4d: A monk can set up vibrations within the body of another creature that can thereafter be fatal if the monk so desires. You make {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g} and if it succeeds the target must make a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude saving throw{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} 10 + 1/2 the monk's level + the monk's {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wis{/g} modifier) or die. Using this ability is a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} that costs 4 ki points.
bcecd700-2f8e-4454-a4f2-fb2f2da537c3: A monk gains immunity to poisons of all kinds.
1a95e329-eb46-480f-918f-e57860891ae0: A monk gains {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g} equal to his current monk level + 10. In order to affect the monk with a {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, a spellcaster must get a result on a {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d20{/g} + caster level) that equals or exceeds the monk's spell resistance.
89aa6812-52e2-43df-9146-534c9e2d0290: A monk with this ki power can spend 1 point from his ki pool as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} to gain temporary, intuitive insight into the immediate future during his next {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}. The monk's next single attack roll (if it is made before the end of the next {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}) gains a +20 insight {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g}. Additionally, he is not affected by the miss chance that applies to attackers trying to strike a {g|Encyclopedia:Concealment}concealed{/g} target.
e1f0ba36-b4e4-4954-b4ee-053d431d3d73: A monk with this ki power can spend 1 point from his ki pool as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} to grant himself a tough skin. The effect grants a +2 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to the monk's existing natural armor bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}. This enhancement bonus increases by 1 for every three {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster levels{/g} above 3rd, to a maximum of +5 at 12th level.
b2bf64f3-bbef-46c1-9fe6-05c694dfadd9: A monk with this ki power can spend 1 point from his ki pool as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g} to grant himself a sudden burst of {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g}. This increases the monk's base land speed by 30 feet for 1 minute.
b5411249-fd54-4354-aa7d-5be5d01cc3e0: A monk with this ki power can spend 2 points from his ki pool as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} to blast his enemies with a searing beam of fire. The monk may fire one ray, plus one additional ray for every four levels beyond 3rd (to a maximum of three rays at 11th level). Each ray requires a ranged {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g} to hit and deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}4d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g}.
f9e00067-cac1-4d21-bc87-bd0e80956930:
A monk with this ki power can spend 2 points from his ki pool as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} to dispel temporary negative levels or one permanent negative level.
Restoration {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}cures{/g} all temporary {g|Encyclopedia:AbilityDamage}ability damage{/g}, and it restores all points permanently drained from a single {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability score{/g}. It also eliminates any fatigue or exhaustion suffered by the target.
db488d85-81c4-4349-9356-e8858f2bb36e: A monk with this ki power can spend 2 points from his ki pool as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} to infect the subject with a horrible poison by making a successful melee {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g}. This poison deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d3{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:AbilityDamage}damage{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} for 6 rounds.
184a1390-13e9-41ce-8824-013023e44ded: A monk with this ki power can spend 2 points from his ki pool as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} to spit a stream of venom at a target using a ranged {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g}. If the venom hits, it causes blindness for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. The target must also make a successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g} or be poisoned by black adder venom; the save {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} in successive rounds of the poison is equal to the ability's save DC.
2b3b4834-a43c-4dfc-a5a5-89762f2119d7: A monk with this ki power can spend 3 points from his ki pool as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} to unleash a sudden blast of sonic energy that strikes his opponent. The target takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}sonic damage{/g} per level (maximum 20d6) and is stunned for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}; a successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g} reduces the {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} by half and negates the stun.
da7a6b4c-8e63-4b32-8fee-092c54ff0916: A monk with this ki power can spend 3 points from his ki pool as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g} to create a shredding flurry of ice slivers, which blast from his hand in a line. The line deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}cold damage{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum 15d6).
577abad3-a110-4ea4-a97e-2d929226b17a: A mutagen that gives the alchemist a +4 alchemical {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} and a +2 natural armor bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}. The alchemist takes a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} as long as the mutagen persists.
f182a722-4070-4aca-a8cf-2b9e678836ac: A mutagen that gives the alchemist a +4 alchemical {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} and a +2 natural armor bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}. The alchemist takes a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} as long as the mutagen persists.
0bb5c17a-ff16-4466-8145-60a636dd8428: A mutagen that gives the alchemist a +4 alchemical {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} and a +2 natural armor bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}. The alchemist takes a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} as long as the mutagen persists.
6f5646a1-6058-4c8d-9887-66f6aabbd4fa: A mystic theurge can prepare and cast {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} from one of his spellcasting classes using the available slots from any of his other spellcasting classes. Spells prepared or cast in this way take up a slot one level higher than they originally occupied. This ability cannot be used to cast a spell at a lower level if that spell exists on both spell lists. At 1st level, a mystic theurge can prepare 1st-level spells from one of his spellcasting classes using the 2nd-level slots of the other spellcasting class. Every two levels thereafter, the level of spells that can be cast in this way increases by one, to a maximum of 5th-level spells at 9th level (these spells would take up 6th-level spell slots). The components of these spells do not change, but they otherwise follow the rules for the spellcasting class used to cast the spell.
8c0fe875-1131-47f6-a18f-0f8d72874ece: A nature mage loses access to arcanist's {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} list, and instead uses druid's spell list. His spells are still considered arcane spells, and use his {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier to determine the {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of the spells and number of additional spells per day.
e1be297e-d76f-4b8a-a679-36ee18587c41:
A nine-tailed heir chooses a sorcerer's bloodline as usual, but she will not learn any additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} derived from her bloodline.
At 7th level, and every six levels thereafter, a nine-tailed heir receives one bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}, chosen from a list specific to each bloodline. The nine-tailed heir must meet the prerequisites for these bonus feats.
11cbcc04-fb1d-4f86-8f71-67dc4ecce42c: A number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to the magus's {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} bonus
b3e5e24f-08ab-44e9-80fe-a5d85fd53da3: A number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to the magus's {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} bonus
4883f23e-dcd2-49c8-8543-03e8184db827: A number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to the number of dice of the ecclesitheurge's channel energy.
e9109598-f4f4-42bd-8987-1e17cefa4119:
A paladin can add the axiomatic property to a weapon enhanced with her divine weapon bond, but this consumes 2 points of enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} granted to this weapon.
An axiomatic weapon is infused with lawful power. It makes the weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}lawful-aligned{/g} and thus overcomes the corresponding {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g}. It deals an extra {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} against chaotic creatures.
4a0f7cae-a65c-4571-a1d4-572e339a2fac:
A paladin can add the brilliant energy property to a weapon enhanced with her divine weapon bond, but this consumes 4 points of enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} granted to this weapon.
A brilliant energy weapon ignores nonliving matter. Armor and shield bonuses to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} (including any enhancement bonuses to that armor) do not count against it because the weapon passes through armor. ({g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g}, deflection, dodge, natural armor, and other such bonuses still apply.) A brilliant energy weapon cannot harm undead, constructs, or objects.
01d576af-cf69-48eb-99c0-5b6ec40d26b3:
A paladin can add the disruption property to a weapon enhanced with her divine weapon bond, but this consumes 2 points of enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} granted to this weapon.
A disruption weapon is the bane of all undead. Any undead creature struck in combat must succeed on a {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} 14 {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g} or be destroyed. A disruption weapon must be a {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}bludgeoning{/g} melee weapon.
668a2d0c-f069-4726-b636-cd9b49ef08e7: A paladin can add the flaming burst property to a weapon enhanced with her divine weapon bond, but this consumes 2 points of enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} granted to this weapon. A flaming burst weapon functions as a flaming weapon that also explodes with flame upon striking a successful {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g}. The fire does not harm the wielder. In addition to the extra {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g} from the flaming ability, a flaming burst weapon deals an extra 1d10 points of fire {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} on a successful critical hit. If the weapon's critical multiplier is ×3, add an extra 2d10 points of fire damage instead, and if the multiplier is ×4, add an extra 3d10 points of fire damage.
f76d496c-d2f0-4e9a-b2fa-635475b4d4a8:
A paladin can add the flaming property to a weapon enhanced with her divine weapon bond, but this consumes 1 point of enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} granted to this weapon.
A flaming weapon is sheathed in fire that deals an extra {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g} on a successful hit. The fire does not harm the wielder.
dbf2d336-ba41-4976-b713-e551fbb8232c:
A paladin can add the holy property to a weapon enhanced with her divine weapon bond, but this consumes 2 points of enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} granted to this weapon.
A holy weapon is imbued with holy power.
