This power makes the weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}good-aligned{/g} and thus overcomes the corresponding {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g}. It deals an extra {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} against all creatures of evil alignment.
ffb26f99-5193-4513-add8-fbcb190ffead:
A paladin can add the keen property to a weapon enhanced with her divine weapon bond, but this consumes 1 point of enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} granted to this weapon.
The keen property doubles the threat range of a weapon. This benefit doesn't stack with any other effects that expand the threat range of a weapon (such as the keen edge {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} or the Improved {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}Critical{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}).
7c423f98-5758-408d-ae90-464e2b3de1ac:
A paladin can add the speed property to a weapon enhanced with her divine weapon bond, but this consumes 3 points of enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} granted to this weapon.
When making a full {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}, the wielder of a speed weapon may make one extra attack with it. The attack uses the wielder's full {g|Encyclopedia:BAB}base attack bonus{/g}, plus any modifiers appropriate to the situation. (This benefit is not cumulative with similar effects, such as a haste {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}.)
b7dbedb6-7332-4a3f-b88a-5d85eff5a235:
A paladin can call out to the powers of good to aid her in her struggle against evil. As a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}, the paladin chooses one target within sight to smite. If this target is evil, the paladin adds her {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} bonus (if any) to her {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} and adds her paladin level to all {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} made against the target of her smite, smite evil attacks automatically bypass any {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} the creature might possess.
In addition, while smite evil is in effect, the paladin gains a deflection {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} equal to her Charisma bonus (if any) to her {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} against attacks made by the target of the smite. If the paladin targets a creature that is not evil, the smite is wasted with no effect. The smite evil lasts until the target dies or the paladin selects a new target.
af1e37c3-78e9-41b3-82a5-9db4d1c778e1: A paladin can {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g} her wounds as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}. With one use of this ability, a paladin can heal {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} of damage for every two paladin levels she possesses.
40e7a1fc-9ba9-4884-a462-d11bc1f5e79c:
A paladin can {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g} the wounds of others by touch. With one use of this ability, a paladin can heal {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} of damage for every two paladin levels she possesses. Using this ability is a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}.
Alternatively, a paladin can use this healing power to deal {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} to undead creatures, dealing 1d6 points of damage for every two levels the paladin possesses. Using lay on hands in this way requires a successful melee {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g} and doesn't provoke an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attack of opportunity{/g}. Undead do not receive a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g} against this damage.
74529612-f72c-427d-ab16-56ba4a2455b7: A paladin who ceases to be lawful good loses all paladin {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} and class features. She cannot thereafter gain levels as a paladin until she changes the {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}alignment{/g} back.
b991a953-03e2-4c4f-bd0b-e06bacfb4e1c: A phantasmal mage loses the ability to increase {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} of the next {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} using her arcane reservoir but instead gains a number of powerful metamagic abilities at 5th, 11th, and 17th levels.
f3eb616b-fa37-45fe-b565-d71b0ca6dce5:
A primal druid adds enlarge person to her list of class {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}.
She can also channel stored spell energy to cast this spell without preparing it—she can lose a prepared spell of 1st level or higher to cast enlarge person.
At 8th level, if a primal druid casts enlarge person on himself, he gains +4 {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} instead of the usual bonuses.
At 16th level, if a primal druid casts enlarge person on himself, he increases by two size categories and gains +6 size bonus to Strength and Constitution instead of the usual bonuses.
c7968161-c8f7-476d-8479-925364e59559: A proclaimer cannot be evil or worship an evil deity, and he must choose {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}cure{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} for his spontaneous casting.
a0c3462a-ca38-4ecc-9ff2-3ada43b3d91b: A proclaimer rushes into Abyss-twisted wastes with nothing but his weapon in his hand and his faith in his heart, shouting his deity's name to the skies. Most proclaimers don't survive their first day in a hostile environment, but those who do become the stuff of legend, bolstering the spirits of crusaders near and far.
e4ea32c2-6e16-4d50-9584-14d9e4e776bb: A psychokineticist uses his {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier instead of his {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} modifier to determine his {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} with wild talents, the {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DCs{/g} of Constitution-based wild talents, the durations of wild talents with Constitution-based durations, his {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Concentration}concentration checks{/g} for wild talents, and other Constitution-based effects of all his wild talents.
9a5f7712-0fb8-40d1-9501-d7390766e7cb: A psychokineticist's elemental energy sends strange elemental humors and planar echoes through his brain instead of reshaping his body with matter from his element. Instead of gaining {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonuses{/g} to physical {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability scores{/g} from elemental overflow, he gains alchemical bonuses to his mental ability scores in equal amounts (a +2 alchemical bonus to two mental ability scores at 6th level if he has at least 3 points of burn; a +4 alchemical bonus to one mental ability score and a +2 alchemical bonus to the other two at 11th level if he has at least 5 points of burn; and a +6 alchemical bonus to one mental ability score, a +4 alchemical bonus to another, and a +2 alchemical bonus to the last at 16th level if he has at least 7 points of burn). A psychokineticist doesn't gain a chance to negate {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hits{/g} and sneak attacks based on his burn. Otherwise, his elemental overflow works just like a normal kineticist's.
f7ed0378-6e21-4f3c-a924-38c8b155b14a:
A psychokineticist's mind strains when he overtaxes himself. He takes a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on Will {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g}, and Wisdom-based {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g} for each point of burn he has accepted, rather than taking nonlethal {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} from burn. He can accept an amount of burn equal to his Wisdom modifier (rather than 3 + his Wisdom modifier). Otherwise, his burn works just like a normal kineticist's.
This ability alters burn.
28f39ab8-da3c-46d7-8d62-548e882dc0df: A pyrokineticist adds {g|Encyclopedia:Lore_Nature}Lore (nature){/g} to her list of class {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g}.
0f545b4a-6f21-43dd-a8b7-146911a7fdcb:
A rageshaper can deliver blows that demolish his foes. This functions as the shifter claws class ability, except his {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural weapons{/g} are treated as slam {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g}. Additionally, the rageshaper's terrible slam deals increased {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} to constructs. At 1st level, terrible slam deals 5 additional points damage to constructs. This increases to 10 points at 5th level, 15 points at 10th level, and 20 points at 15th level.
At will, a rageshaper in his natural form can gain two slam attacks as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g} to use as a weapon. The slam can be used as a primary natural attack, dealing {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}bludgeoning damage{/g} (1d3 if he is {g|Encyclopedia:Size}Small{/g}). As the rageshaper gains levels, the power of his slams increases. At 3rd level, his slams bypass {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} N/cold iron, N/magic, and N/silver. At 7th level, his slam damage increases to 1d6 (1d4 if Small). At 11th level, his slam damage increases to 1d8 (1d6 if Small). At 13th level, his slam damage increases to 1d10 (1d8 if Small). At 17th level, the damage die does not increase, but the {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical{/g} multiplier becomes ×3. Finally, at 19th level, the slams bypass DR N/adamantine and N/-.
43af4005-1590-4b3d-b91d-517532edcc56:
A rageshaper can deliver blows that demolish his foes. This functions as the shifter claws class ability, except his {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural weapons{/g} are treated as slam {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g}. Additionally, the rageshaper's terrible slam deals increased {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} to constructs. At 1st level, terrible slam deals 5 additional points damage to constructs. This increases to 10 points at 5th level, 15 points at 10th level, and 20 points at 15th level.
At will, a rageshaper in his natural form can gain two slam attacks as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g} to use as a weapon. The slam can be used as a primary natural attack, dealing {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}bludgeoning damage{/g} (1d3 if he is {g|Encyclopedia:Size}Small{/g}). As the rageshaper gains levels, the power of his slams increases. At 3rd level, his slams bypass {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} N/cold iron, N/magic, and N/silver. At 7th level, his slam damage increases to 1d6 (1d4 if Small). At 11th level, his slam damage increases to 1d8 (1d6 if Small). At 13th level, his slam damage increases to 1d10 (1d8 if Small). At 17th level, the damage die does not increase, but the {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical{/g} multiplier becomes ×3. Finally, at 19th level, the slams bypass DR N/adamantine and N/-.
d516ea34-0002-475c-8868-e930f63cb9bd:
A rageshaper can enter a state of intense fury, transforming into a living engine of destruction. This ability functions as the barbarian's rage class feature, except entering this state of fury requires a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}. The rageshaper can maintain this form for 1 minute.
The rageshaper gains all benefits of a barbarian's rage and grows one {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} category larger.
The rageshaper can use devastating form a number of times per day equal to his shifter level (the Limitless Rage mythic ability removes this restriction).
Once per use of devastating form, a rageshaper can use the ground slam ability.
Ground Slam: Once per use of devastating form, a rageshaper can slam the ground, dealing {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}bludgeoning damage{/g} per shifter level + an additional 1d6 bludgeoning {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} for every enemy hit by this ability to all enemies within 20 feet of him and knocking them prone. A successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} 10 + half the rageshaper's shifter level + the rageshaper's {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} modifier) halves the damage and negates being knocked prone.
When the rageshaper ends his devastating form ability, he is fatigued for 5 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g}. The rageshaper cannot enter devastating form again while fatigued or exhausted. If the rageshaper falls {g|Encyclopedia:Injury_Death}unconscious{/g}, his devastating form ends immediately.
At 10th level, the rageshaper can grow up to a maximum of two size categories larger with devastating form; his rage is now treated as greater rage, as the barbarian ability of the same name; and the damage die of his ground slam ability increases to d8.
At 20th level, the rageshaper gains a +4 racial {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to his {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability score{/g} and the {g|Encyclopedia:Improved_NaturalAttack}improved natural attack{/g} ability with his slam {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} in devastating form; his rage is now treated as mighty rage, as the barbarian ability of the same name; and the damage die of his ground slam ability increases to d10.
This replaces wild shape, shifter aspect, and all improvements to shifter aspect.
2678ab44-2715-4b0a-85fa-624e2f04126c: A ranger forms a bond with his companions. This bond allows him to spend a {g|Encyclopedia:Move_Action}move action{/g} to grant half his favored enemy bonus against a single target of the appropriate type to all allies within 30 feet who can see or hear him. This bonus lasts for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to the ranger's {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier (minimum 1). This bonus does not stack with any favored enemy bonuses possessed by his allies; they use whichever bonus is higher.
41c77a73-5e57-4bb0-bf58-364427f53b6c: A ranger is proficient with all simple and {g|Encyclopedia:Weapon_Proficiency}martial weapons{/g} and with light armor, medium armor, and shields (except tower shields).
383209d4-2fb1-4b55-8d19-649c533c88c3: A ranger of 12th level or higher can, as a {g|Encyclopedia:Move_Action}move action{/g}, use the {g|Encyclopedia:Stealth}Stealth{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill{/g} to hide in any of his favored terrains, even in combat.
3a91f722-9060-46bc-aa83-b7391448b8c1: A ranger of 17th level or higher can use the Camouflage in any terrain.
910ad4ee-9167-49ff-8bdf-81ab9fdd4ea0: A ranger of 20th level becomes a master hunter. He can, as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, make a single {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} against a favored enemy at his full attack bonus. If the attack hits, the target takes {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} normally and must make a successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g} or die. The {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of this save is equal to 10 + 1/2 the ranger's level + the ranger's {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier. A ranger can use this ability once per day against each of his favorite enemy types. He can't use it against the same creature more than once in a 24-hour period.
2f727b71-6ba1-4498-ac22-a18fe34b0209: A rogue adds 1/2 her level on {g|Encyclopedia:Perception}Perception checks{/g}.
85909d69-5e09-4edb-8640-74b915fa079d: A rogue who selects this talent gains Dirty Trick as a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}, even if she does not meet the prerequisites.
4b64e03b-95cf-4ed8-8ecc-0e0d4f99c803: A rogue with this talent adds {g|Encyclopedia:Knowledge_Arcana}Knowledge (arcana){/g} to her list of class {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g}.
f88cd3e3-b9c6-4573-bd66-a1b02bb505c8: A rogue with this talent adds {g|Encyclopedia:Lore_Nature}Lore (nature){/g} to her list of class {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g}.
3e85cece-37b0-4f41-8163-e0836d9a5864: A rogue with this talent can make a {g|Encyclopedia:Trickery}Trickery check{/g} in place of a {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}combat maneuver{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} when attempting to disarm an opponent.
f879d4d2-2db7-4156-93ea-a5da0ab0b7dc: A rogue with this talent does not provoke {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attacks of opportunity{/g} when standing up from prone.
983db6a8-e9ec-4016-ba10-7de99d77c8ab: A rogue with this talent gains a familiar as the familiar option of the wizard's arcane bond class feature.
5fa5fb4e-fe42-4e60-b079-97dbb9d2bda1: A rogue with this talent gains a favored terrain, as the ranger class feature of the same name, but the {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} does not increase with her level.
bfd31433-b960-4e42-9429-2e59fe02eb22: A rogue with this talent gains immunity to difficult terrain.
a2b0adb5-01b0-4aa5-9cb7-ecb6b2ab61dd: A rogue with this talent gains {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against mind-affecting conditions equal to her {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} modifier.
9d7eaa79-c8be-4bea-971c-f3d8ebfcec53: A scroll savant adds half his {g|Encyclopedia:Class_Level}class level{/g} (minimum 1) as a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Use_Magic_Device}Use Magic Device checks{/g}. He will always take 10 on Use Magic Device {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g} to cast a {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} from a scroll if 10 on a {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}roll{/g} is enough for a successful {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill check{/g}.
ef644c51-1926-450b-8ba0-bef661699774: A sensei of 3rd level or higher can use his performance to help allies succeed at a task. They must be within 30 feet and able to see and hear the sensei. They get a +2 competence {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on all {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g} as long as they continue to hear the sensei's performance. This bonus increases by +1 for every four levels the sensei has attained beyond 3rd (+3 at 7th, +4 at 11th, +5 at 15th, and +6 at 19th).
19d3ccbd-14dd-40f7-a928-494e1930ff64: A sensei of 9th level or higher can use his performance to inspire greatness in all allies within 30 feet, granting extra fighting capability. A creature inspired with greatness gains 2 bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}Hit Dice{/g} (d10s), the commensurate number of temporary {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} (apply the target's {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} modifier, if any, to these bonus Hit Dice), a +2 competence bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g}, and a +1 competence bonus on Fortitude {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g}.
422d8f59-0587-48b3-b4a8-1c30834108c0:
A sensei's advice is identical to bardic performance, allowing him to inspire courage at 1st level, inspire competence at 3rd level, and inspire greatness at 9th level, as a bard of the sensei's level, usable a total number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} per day equal to his level + his {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier (minimum 1).
Starting a bardic performance is a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, but it can be maintained each round as a {g|Encyclopedia:Free_Action}free action{/g}. Changing a bardic performance from one effect to another requires the sensei to stop the previous performance and start a new one as a standard {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}action{/g}. A bardic performance cannot be disrupted, but it ends immediately if the sensei is killed, paralyzed, stunned, knocked {g|Encyclopedia:Injury_Death}unconscious{/g}, or otherwise prevented from taking a free action to maintain it each round. A sensei cannot have more than one bardic performance in effect at one time.
b2d634eb-ce5e-4be2-9e1f-3fe5c14af796: A shadow shaman gains {g|Encyclopedia:Stealth}Stealth{/g} as a class {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill{/g}.
22820709-9b35-460e-afd8-06d1c867247b:
A shaman can cause a creature within 30 feet to fall into a deep, magical sleep, as per the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} sleep. The creature receives a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g} to negate the effect. If the save fails, the creature falls asleep for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to the shaman's level.
This hex can affect a creature of any {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}HD{/g}. This hex ends immediately if the creature takes {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}. Whether or not the save is successful, a creature cannot be the target of this hex again for 1 day.
0e37f8f5-2ed6-4e86-a0e8-8d9600f02ef9: A shaman can chant as a {g|Encyclopedia:Move_Action}move action{/g}. Any creature that is within 30 feet that is under the effects of the shaman's evil eye, fortune, fury, or misfortune hex has that effect's duration extended by 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}.
205b1dcc-2ca2-432a-a568-ec66a3f89bf2:
A shaman forms a mystical bond with the spirits of the world. She forms a lasting bond with a single spirit, which grants a number of abilities and defines many of her other class features.
At 1st level, a shaman gains the spirit ability granted by her chosen spirit. She adds the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} granted by that spirit to the list of spells that she can cast using spirit magic. She also adds the hexes possessed by that spirit to the list of hexes that she can use with the hex and wandering hex class features.
At 8th level, the shaman gains the abilities listed in the greater version of her selected spirit. At 16th level, the shaman gains the abilities listed for the true version of her selected spirit.
73168f7f-a83f-40f1-b1fd-20b9bfafeb38: A shaman incites a creature within 30 feet into a primal fury. The target receives a +2 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} and a +2 resistance bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against fear for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to the shaman's {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier. At 8th and 16th levels, these bonuses increase by 1. Once a creature has benefited from the fury hex, it cannot benefit from it again for 24 hours.
9dc28a63-b0bc-40ac-a590-449a6360c33d:
A shaman learns a number of magical tricks, called hexes, which grant her powers or weaken foes. At 2nd level, a shaman learns one hex. At 4th, 8th, 10th, 12th, 16th, 18th, and 20th level, the shaman learns new hexes. A shaman can select from any of the hexes available to her chosen spirit. A shaman cannot select a hex more than once unless noted otherwise.
Using a hex is a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} that doesn't provoke an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attack of opportunity{/g} unless otherwise noted. The {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} to resist a hex is equal to 10 + 1/2 the shaman's level + the shaman's {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier.
4cb25b75-2685-4608-afac-cb10850b652a: A shaman surrounds herself with the spirit of battle. Allies within 30 feet of the shaman (including the shaman) receive a +1 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} and weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}. At 8th level and 16th level, these bonuses increase by 1. The shaman can use this ability for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} per day equal to 3 + her {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier. These rounds do not need to be consecutive.
22476804-3905-4df5-b44a-f7319a609d65: A shaman touches a willing creature (including herself) and grants a bone ward. The warded creature becomes encircled by a group of flying bones that grant it a +2 deflection {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to the shaman's level. At 8th level, the ward increases to +3 and lasts for 1 minute. At 16th level, the bonus increases to +4 and lasts for 1 hour. A creature affected by this hex cannot be affected by it again for 24 hours.
4aa00812-c245-4fa3-a701-36d50f6ae017: A shaman who selects the battle spirit gains scars from every wound she takes, and the grit of battle always seems to cling on her body. When she calls upon one of this spirit's abilities, she grows in stature — becoming taller and more muscular, with a grimace of rage stretching across her face.
3a6e7e82-5147-4ecc-b777-e3689ace11d3: A shaman who selects the bones spirit is cadaverously thin, with sunken eye sockets and dead eyes that stare off into the distance. Her body has a faint smell of the grave. When she calls upon one of this spirit's abilities, a ghostly wind whips her hair and clothes about, and the unpleasant stench becomes more prominent.
143d2674-6094-4eb6-9d6e-60e2d92bf7eb: A shaman who selects the flame spirit has a radiant light behind her eyes and the faint smell of smoke about her. When she calls upon one of this spirit's abilities, a hungry spectral flame dances around her body.
1f2d7ae6-04dd-4b44-8e1e-841e2fe4dcff: A shaman who selects the life spirit appears more vibrant than most mortals. Her skin seems to glow, and her teeth are a pearly white. When she calls upon one of this spirit's abilities, her eyes and hair shimmer in the light.
da4f055b-951f-4408-8ab6-2f0e8d58d580: A shaman who selects the nature spirit takes on an appearance that reflects the aspect of the natural world she has the closest connection to. A nature shaman from the forest has a green tinge to her skin and hair, with eyes of sparkling emerald and the scent of green leaves and flowers about her. A nature shaman from the tundra is typically alabaster pale, with platinum hair and crystal blue eyes, and her skin always seems strangely cold.
db17d741-6882-4974-9eb8-6be08ae813fe: A shaman who selects the waves spirit has a fluid grace that exhibits itself whenever she moves. When she calls upon one of this spirit's abilities, floating orbs dance about her, sublimating between icy crystals, misty vapors, and globules of water.
fdf9dba9-65af-4f33-a37d-83302f463c64: A shaman who selects the wind spirit appears windswept, and her movements seem lithe and carefree.
ca4e142b-71e1-4493-ac72-64e5059c5599:
A shieldbearer treats shields as sacred weapons (instead of his god's favored weapon), though the shieldbearer can still designate additional weapons as sacred weapons by selecting them with the Weapon Focus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}. The shieldbearer's sacred weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} applies only to {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} made with shields.
The shieldbearer does not gain the ability to enhance sacred weapons until 7th level.
For every 3 warpriest levels beyond 7th, this {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} increases by 1 (to a maximum of +5 at 19th level).
9a551414-e9b1-4183-8ada-292f3ccf24cb: A skald adds 1/2 his {g|Encyclopedia:Class_Level}class level{/g} (minimum 1) on all Knowledge and Lore {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g}.
c355642c-5310-4abd-9109-3598faa4361e: A skald gets a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} equal to 1/2 his {g|Encyclopedia:Class_Level}class level{/g} (minimum +1) on {g|Encyclopedia:Knowledge_World}Knowledge (world){/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g}.
065820c1-2cf8-4c5e-9bd2-15b51ec57e5b: A skald is proficient with all simple and {g|Encyclopedia:Weapon_Proficiency}martial weapons{/g}, light and medium armor, and shields (except tower shields). A skald can cast skald {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} while wearing light or medium armor and even using a shield without incurring the normal {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Fail_Chance}arcane spell failure chance{/g}. This does not affect the arcane spell failure chance for arcane spells received from other classes. Like other arcane spellcasters, a skald wearing heavy armor incurs a chance of arcane spell failure if the spell in question has somatic components.
9a4a4ec7-b1dc-4f7e-82de-ab9d3caa1fbb:
A skald is trained to use music, oration, and similar performances to inspire his allies to feats of strength and ferocity. At 1st level, a skald can use this ability for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} per day equal to 3 + his {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier. For each level thereafter, he can use raging song for 2 additional rounds per day.
Starting a raging song is a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, but it can be maintained each round as a {g|Encyclopedia:Free_Action}free action{/g}. A raging song cannot be disrupted, but it ends immediately if the skald is killed, paralyzed, stunned, knocked {g|Encyclopedia:Injury_Death}unconscious{/g}, or otherwise prevented from taking a free {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}action{/g} each round to maintain it. A raging song counts as the bard's bardic performance {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}special ability{/g} for any effect that affects bardic performances. A skald may learn bard masterpieces.
If a raging song affects allies, when the skald begins a raging song and at the start of each ally's turn in which they can hear the raging song, the skald's allies must decide whether to accept or refuse its effects. This is not an action. If accepted, the raging song's effects last for that ally's turn or until the song ends, whichever comes first.
At 7th level, a skald can start a raging song as a {g|Encyclopedia:Move_Action}move action{/g} instead of a standard action. At 13th level, a skald can start a raging song as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g} instead.
ee1cc170-0e4e-4f13-8276-077f21b704be: A slayer can use the {g|Encyclopedia:Stealth}Stealth{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill{/g} to hide in any of his favored terrains, even if the terrain doesn't grant cover or {g|Encyclopedia:Concealment}concealment{/g}.
2bac4ea6-a23a-494d-974f-0f499e8972c4: A slayer is proficient with all simple and {g|Encyclopedia:Weapon_Proficiency}martial weapons{/g}, as well as with light armor, medium armor, and shields (except tower shields).
e50385b6-d5c5-4b87-8af4-571c35d38fd0: A sohei gains a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}rolls{/g} equal to 1/2 his monk level. At 20th level, a sohei's initiative roll is automatically a natural 20.
5dfe1f96-aeae-4c4f-b852-b026f400d4cf: A sohei gains {g|Encyclopedia:Lore_Nature}Lore (nature){/g} as a class {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill{/g}.
c83945fb-c6d9-48fe-8575-bd09783ebc71: A sohei is proficient with all simple and {g|Encyclopedia:Weapon_Proficiency}martial weapons{/g} and with light armor, instead of a monk's usual weapon and armor proficiencies.
2fd9c250-1958-4b42-88b1-0eb3aa8892fc: A sohei may select mounted combat {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g} as bonus feats.
06cf884a-c226-4c82-8bb5-cf3e49cdb90f: A sohei's {g|Encyclopedia:UnarmedAttack}unarmed{/g} strike {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} does not increase at 4th level and above.
347e8ea0-50ea-4753-9c57-fe193db08660:
A spawn slayer specializes in fighting against larger, single targets. At 5th, 10th, 15th, and 20th levels, the {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonuses{/g} on weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} against a studied target increase by 1, as do the {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DCs{/g} of slayer abilities against a studied target. At 5th level, if the target is Large or larger, these bonuses increase by an additional 1. At 10th level, if the target is Huge or larger, the bonuses increase by an additional 2. At 15th level, if the target is Gargantuan or larger, the bonuses increase by an additional 3. At 20th level, if the target is Colossal in {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g}, the bonuses increase by an additional 4. He does not gain the ability to study an opponent as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g} at 7th level.
This alters studied target.
1ed375d7-288d-48b3-adda-aa8de18ba7b4: A stalwart defender is proficient with all simple and {g|Encyclopedia:Weapon_Proficiency}martial weapons{/g} and with all armor (heavy, light, and medium) and shields (including tower shields).
3c77e273-90c2-4e27-8540-374a846d5559: A stalwart defender receives a dodge {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} that starts at +1 on the 1st level. It improves to +2 at 4th level, to +3 at 7th level, and reaches the maximum of +4 at 10th level.
3e2d3997-81f4-44c2-847a-9f310d993515: A steelblood gains proficiency in heavy armor. A steelblood can cast bloodrager {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} while wearing heavy armor without incurring an {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Fail_Chance}arcane spell failure chance{/g}.
e179d03f-64fd-49e2-af98-9dc77cba39e0: A stonelord is a devoted sentinel of dwarven enclaves, drawing the power of the earth and ancient stone to protect her people.
8943683f-cd87-4052-8d82-480f6a4443f4: A stygian slayer crawls out of the darkest shadows to strike fear into the hearts of civilized folk. He's a merciless killer who can control a sliver of magic, allowing him to arrive unseen, commit murder, and depart without detection.
e5884a11-0f57-4ceb-925b-1c084c9bddda: A stygian slayer is proficient with all simple and {g|Encyclopedia:Weapon_Proficiency}martial weapons{/g}, as well as with light armor, but not with medium armor, heavy armor, or any kind of shields (including tower shields).
38e5be20-200f-43a5-ac22-ff314d64889b:
A sword saint is proficient in {g|Encyclopedia:Weapon_Proficiency}simple weapons{/g} and in a single martial or exotic melee weapon of his choice. A sword saint is not proficient with armor or shields and suffers normal {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Fail_Chance}arcane spell failure chance{/g} when casting magus {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} while armored.
At 1st level, a sword saint gains Weapon Focus with his chosen weapon as a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}.
ccf8db54-dd79-4ae2-a336-cf6157f84190: A sword saint spends his life focusing his training and meditation into a rapturous perfection of the use of a single weapon, which is usually but not always a sword, channeling his arcane might through it in a dizzying and deadly dance beyond the abilities of even the greatest of mundane warriors.
fee62663-503d-45f6-9203-82c8784b5db3:
A sylvan trickster can select a witch hex in place of a rogue talent. At 10th level, the sylvan trickster can select a hex or major hex in place of a rogue talent. At 18th level, a sylvan trickster can select a hex, major hex, or grand hex in place of a rogue talent. She cannot select any hex more than once.
This alters rogue talents.
8c314bbb-e416-4fb3-b865-243689b006e9: A thundercaller gains a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} equal to 1/2 her level on {g|Encyclopedia:Lore_Nature}Lore (nature){/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g}.
fbc16c9f-f3dd-4cb8-82af-bb471738ae70: A vivisectionist studies bodies to better understand their function. Unlike a chirurgeon, a vivisectionist's goals are not related to healing, but rather to experimentation and knowledge that most people would consider evil.
a51be8f8-45aa-40b1-930b-f1bf2214d8e1: A warpriest is proficient with all simple and {g|Encyclopedia:Weapon_Proficiency}martial weapons{/g}, as well as the favored weapon of his deity, and with all armor (heavy, light, and medium) and shields (except tower shields).
7ddc7188-6767-47c4-b5fb-85b0318417dc:
A warpriest's deity influences his {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}alignment{/g}, what magic he can perform, his values, and how others see him. Each warpriest can select two blessings from among those granted by his deity (each deity grants the blessings tied to its domains).
Each blessing grants a minor power at 1st level and a major power at 10th level. A warpriest can call upon the power of his blessings a number of times per day (in any combination) equal to 3 + 1/2 his warpriest level (to a maximum of 13 times per day at 20th level). Each time he calls upon any one of his blessings, it counts against his daily limit. The {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}save{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} for these blessings is equal to 10 + 1/2 the warpriest's level + the warpriest's {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier.
70f6e5f7-d73d-449e-8133-eb0b92218d33: A white mage is an arcanist touched by a divine power and gifted with the ability to heal others.
8c3d3565-77b7-4af5-aa32-ad89889d2761: A wild effigy still takes on the shapes of natural animals, but rather than transforming her body into flesh and muscle, she transforms into constructed effigies of her chosen aspects.
e4efdd48-40c2-41a5-95f8-8b3f7336c1a4:
A wild effigy's animal aspects are made out of carved, living rock. When a wild effigy is shifted into one of her minor or major aspects, she gains {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} N/- where N is equal to her shifter level.
This replaces track.
214157fc-63e9-4a0f-b1de-586656ce1356: A witch can cackle madly as a {g|Encyclopedia:Move_Action}move action{/g}. Any creature that is within 30 feet that is under the effects of an evil eye hex, fortune hex, protective luck, or misfortune hex caused by the witch has the duration of that hex extended by 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}.
324920fb-9eb3-4fcc-9c9c-54472871820e:
A witch can cause a creature within 30 feet to fall into a deep, magical sleep, as per the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} sleep. The creature receives a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g} to negate the effect. If the save fails, the creature falls asleep for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to the witch's level.
This hex can affect a creature of any {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}HD{/g}. This hex ends immediately if the creature takes {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}. Whether or not the save is successful, a creature cannot be the target of this hex again for 1 day.
52fc1be2-9e3c-4e01-8e6d-d7f108f846f5: A witch of the veil gains {g|Encyclopedia:Stealth}Stealth{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Trickery}Trickery{/g} as class {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g}.
4dc2ce79-874b-41ed-a6d1-b4d6cb67a784:
A wizard can choose to specialize in one {g|Encyclopedia:Magic_School}school of magic{/g}, gaining additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} and powers based on that school. This choice must be made at 1st level, and once made, it cannot be changed. A wizard that does not select a school receives the universalist school instead.
Each arcane school gives the wizard a number of school powers. In addition, specialist wizards receive an additional spell slot of each spell level he can cast, from 1st on up. Each day, a wizard can prepare a spell from his specialty school in that slot. This spell must be in the wizard's spellbook. A wizard can select a spell modified by a metamagic {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} to prepare in his school slot, but it uses up a higher-level spell slot. Wizards with the universalist school do not receive a school slot.
c17d559c-4cdd-44e3-b46f-7748896db308: A wizard that chooses to specialize in one {g|Encyclopedia:Magic_School}school of magic{/g} must select two other schools as his opposition schools, representing knowledge sacrificed in one area of arcane lore to gain mastery in another. A wizard who prepares {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} from his opposition schools must use two spell slots of that level to prepare the spell.
f6157a1e-cacf-42b0-8532-a1bb47761cae: A wrecker's {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural attacks{/g} ignore an inanimate object's {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g}. At 9th level, a wrecker's natural {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} count as if they were adamantine for the purpose of overcoming a construct's {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} reduction.
7734bc92-3aa2-484f-9a2b-2f3037cae15d:
A zen archer's bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g} must be taken from the following list:
Combat Reflexes, Deflect Arrows, Dodge, Point-Blank Shot, Precise Shot, and Rapid Shot.
At 6th level, the following feats are added to the list:
Improved Precise Shot, Manyshot and Mobility.
At 10th level, the following feats are added to the list:
Improved {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}Critical{/g} and Clustered Shot.
A monk need not have any of the prerequisites normally required for these feats to select them.
ebe86fd4-504b-4f96-95b4-27db86631996:
A {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} is an ability a character has mastered. Feats often allow characters to circumvent rules or restrictions.
Characters gain one feat at the 1st level and every two levels thereafter. Humans receive a bonus feat at 1st level.
f7639f48-7923-48e6-9dbc-b0c4b464ef5d: A {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spelleater{/g}'s blood empowers him to slowly recover from his wounds. At 2nd level, while bloodraging a spelleater gains {g|Encyclopedia:Fast_Healing}fast healing{/g} 1. At 7th level and every 3 levels thereafter, this increases by 1 (to a maximum of fast healing 6 at 19th level).
5287e003-6066-483c-84e8-6829476c8622:
Abadar, the god of cities, law, merchants, and wealth, also called "The God of Walls and Ditches" in the eastern Dragon Empires, is known to be a patient deity. Maintaining a strong neutral stance in his actions, he sets forth to expand civilization and order among the peoples of Golarion.
Domains: Earth, Law, Nobility, Protection, Travel.
Favored Weapon: Light Crossbow
8914b255-fc01-4c7c-ad83-fecadcbc50d6: Ability doubles the threat range of a weapon. This benefit doesn't stack with any other effects that expand the threat range of a weapon.
648cfc20-7134-4df0-851c-356f4ebd804f: Abjurations are protective {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}. They create physical or magical barriers, negate magical or physical abilities, harm trespassers, or even banish the subject of the spell to another plane of existence.
fca90626-7ca3-4159-9936-bb6ab7e7faa8: Add all summon nature's ally {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} to your spell list. You must still select these spells using your allotment of spells known. Animals within 30 feet of you receive a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on all {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} equal to your {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier.
8e09ae1c-3453-4bee-b4ad-20acb4c97034: Additional class skill from the Abyssal bloodline.
0ed93c38-19ed-49cd-a8f5-c98bd0ace73b: Additional class skill from the arcane bloodline.
52837b5d-3edb-443e-9505-90a4dcdec951: Additional class skill from the celestial bloodline.
f7ff30a7-2421-4bf4-ad75-eda19edcc0b6: Additional class skill from the draconic bloodline.
ade590a0-bfbf-4dc4-a7c3-a4fa9a47578a: Additional class skill from the elemental bloodline.
1403abd1-f40b-4292-9ed2-de880e70c323: Additional class skill from the fey bloodline.
de0f48d4-7f0d-44f2-bcbe-03df3befdc40: Additional class skill from the infernal bloodline.
7873d555-74e3-4290-aafb-670210e28d62: Additional class skill from the serpentine bloodline.
f0519888-3304-4cbf-9f43-22e1cb3d7b20: Additional class skill from the undead bloodline.
5d8e7181-8597-4d11-8d9c-846a8065c4a9: After 10th level, a character can choose one of the advanced rogue talents in place of a rogue talent.
42d87e5c-1da7-4cb1-8e8b-468c9dd3a252: After resting, an arcanist chooses a limited number of {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} to cast this day. They can cast the chosen spells in any combinations — the same one many times, or different ones, one time each.
174ea3c8-a769-4b28-958a-628588a55dba: After the battle, you can dismiss area infusion effect at will. You must be out of combat and within a 100-foot range of the infusion's effect. Dismissing a infusion is a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} that does not provoke {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attacks of opportunity{/g}.
da3fc98f-788a-4ad7-bd59-7201b22134c2: Alchemist is an unusual class that employs a vast arsenal of handmade potions, extracts, elixirs, and even bombs. Bombs are a ranged, area of effect weapon — the alchemist's main weapon. They learn a lot of arcane {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}, but instead of casting them normally, an alchemist prepares them as extracts.
3969749c-e59d-42ff-b5cb-78d9bb78f6c6: Alchemists are proficient with all {g|Encyclopedia:Weapon_Proficiency}simple weapons{/g} and bombs. They are also proficient with light armor, but not with shields.
412b492b-1973-488c-8be8-44e95383f515: Alchemists are scientists who wield magic, but instead of casting {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}, prepare them as a special kind of potions — extracts. Most extracts provide some kind of empowerment. After some advancement, an alchemist can gain the ability to share their extracts with their allies.
85bfcc89-0352-4490-bfdd-206a81c529fe: All alchemists gain the Throw Anything {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} as a bonus feat at 1st level. An alchemist adds his {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier to {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} done with splash weapons, including the splash damage if any.
adcb4858-d4f0-4ab9-ba22-e97f26380cb0:
All of the fighter's allies are treated as if they had the same teamwork {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g} as the fighter for the purpose of determining whether the fighter receives a bonus from his teamwork feats. His allies do not receive any bonuses from these feats unless they actually have the feats themselves. The allies' positioning and actions must still meet the prerequisites listed in the teamwork feat for the fighter to receive the listed bonus.
Teamwork feats include Allied Spellcaster, Back to Back, Coordinated Defense, Coordinated Maneuvers, Outflank, Precise Strike, Seize the Moment, Shake It Off, Shield Wall, Shielded Caster and Tandem Trip.
791acba5-95ad-42b6-8b60-7853c7330b31:
All shifter aspects have a minor form and a major form. The minor form grants the shifter some of the animal's physical traits, while the major aspect is the form she takes on when she uses wild shape to transform into an animal completely. The list of abilities gained with the major aspect include those gained from the wild shape class feature, but the benefits gained from any resulting changes to {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} are not listed here.
This ability lasts for 1 hour (the Master Shapeshifter mythic ability makes this duration permanent). Using major form is a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} that does not cause {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attacks of opportunity{/g}. The shifter can use major form a number of times per day equal to her shifter level + her {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier.
6d2e7cea-03ac-4a08-a3cf-8262cc7d03b7: All {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} made by an animal companion are treated as magic weapons for the purpose of overcoming {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g}. An animal companion gains a +1 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on attack rolls and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} and +1 resistance bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g}. These bonuses increase by 1 for every 3 {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}HD{/g} the animal companion has.
a5e5f9ac-0663-4e6e-b259-b09abdef9e6e: All {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} that deal {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}energy damage{/g} that you cast will deal acid {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} instead. This also changes the spell's type to an acid spell.
41b08433-e253-4f05-ac2c-094bf97b9bad: All {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} that deal {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}energy damage{/g} that you cast will deal cold {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} instead. This also changes the spell's type to a cold spell.
6d47d9fc-38d4-4389-b0fb-8bb4c5090564: All {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} that deal {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}energy damage{/g} that you cast will deal electricity {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} instead. This also changes the spell's type to an electricity spell.
41ab6ffc-4efa-4faa-9957-2869aadff47a: All {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} that deal {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}energy damage{/g} that you cast will deal fire {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} instead. This also changes the spell's type to a fire spell.
509bd20d-1f54-43bc-adb7-3ac8f535098a: Already targeted by this hex today
ea8b75d3-c854-43b5-9cbb-b63a1500608f: Already targeted by this hex today
c0d0b5ed-74ed-4d86-99d3-85537923d847: Also known as a divine assassin, god's blade, or wrath-bringer, a deliverer is a weapon chosen by a god to punish those who have committed an affront to that deity. Evil deities are more likely to use assassins than deliverers, but some good deities use deliverers to deal with problems of a subtler nature than a cleric, inquisitor, paladin, or warpriest can typically handle.
d1c24197-725d-411d-ac78-f8fbeacc0d8a: Although most consider it to be the weakest and most feral of the chromatic dragons, the white dragon makes up for its lack of cunning with sheer ferocity.
7c1d0d00-694a-41be-a918-da6920015480: Although the gods work through many agents, perhaps none are more mysterious than oracles. These divine vessels are granted power without their choice, selected by providence to wield powers that even they do not fully understand. Unlike clerics, who draw their magic through devotion to a deity, oracles garner strength and power from many sources, namely those patron deities who support their ideals. Instead of worshiping a single source, oracles tend to venerate all of the gods that share their beliefs. While some see the powers of the oracle as a gift, others view them as a curse, changing the life of the chosen in unforeseen ways.
1e0afa31-17b5-4417-b0ff-8560ea330d6e: Among mystical leaders are those who speak for the spirits of the land, who bear the knowledge of the ancients, and whose voices ring like thunder, calling the sky's wrath down upon their enemies.
c52f6fd2-2455-4caa-8571-0629d47a0488: An aberration has a bizarre anatomy, strange abilities, an alien mindset, or any combination of the three.
7882810b-efac-4444-b521-1ee4a770b66b: An aerokineticist adds {g|Encyclopedia:Lore_Nature}Lore (nature){/g} to her list of class {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g}.
717513b8-5711-4a9f-a523-24cca2a82793:
An affected ally receives a +2 alchemical {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against fear effects.
You can gain Rallying Incense up to 3 times. Its effects stack.
6d0407db-016f-4d9a-b338-199f8f8860da:
An affected ally receives a +2 alchemical {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against mind-affecting effects.
You can gain Clarifying Incense up to 3 times. Its effects stack.
455c1bbf-cbd4-45f1-b654-8ec70f0dfd59:
An affected ally receives a +2 alchemical {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against poisons.
You can gain Neutralizing Incense up to 3 times. Its effects stack.
52dba4af-211b-499f-8961-6c4bb7ef7689:
An affected ally receives additional a +1 alchemical {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} and weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}.
You can gain Improved Incense up to 2 times. Its effects stack.
7d48345f-88ce-44e9-a820-d91d197c7952: An affected ally receives {g|Encyclopedia:Concealment}concealment{/g} (20% miss chance).
7304d567-6995-4e09-9067-21e615ee54e0:
An affected enemy receives a -2 alchemical {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against mind-affecting effects.
You can gain Unsettling Fog up to 3 times. Its effects stack.
330d909b-21c6-4346-b0cc-72feb2a7e296:
An affected enemy receives a -2 alchemical {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against poisons.
You can gain Toxic Incense up to 3 times. Its effects stack.
5d426313-2717-4d14-91dd-39a83651d2d4: An aggressor's first {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} in every {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}, if it hits, makes the enemy bleed for {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} each round. The aggressor also gains a +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on attack and damage rolls against the target. This bonus increases at 5th level and every 5 levels thereafter.
cdd34265-aa12-4e0c-90a2-9eaee77c801d: An alchemist who studies anatomy and uses this knowledge to {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g} is a chirurgeon.
a61b974a-0664-418f-a814-adf8a69cfddd: An alchemist with this discovery can quickly create enough bombs to throw more than one in a single {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. The alchemist can prepare and throw additional bombs as a {g|Encyclopedia:Full_Round_Action}full-round action{/g} if his {g|Encyclopedia:BAB}base attack bonus{/g} is high enough to grant him additional {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g}. This functions just like a full-attack with a ranged weapon.
fc26e63f-4b52-4a4f-a705-e53be8ecbbe3: An anarchic weapon is infused with the power of chaos. It makes the weapon chaotically aligned and thus bypasses the corresponding {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g}. It deals an extra {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} against all creatures of lawful {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}alignment{/g}.
15db4535-5b2d-4e0c-99fa-8eb88003f756: An angelfire apostle is less concerned with the traditional divine magic that many religious adherents receive. The angelfire apostle receives one fewer {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} slot at each spell level. When an angelfire apostle gets no spells per day at a spell level, he can cast domain spells of that level normally, but can only cast nondomain spells of that level if he gets them as bonus spells.
7c74a14a-2ede-4836-a37e-ffb735edf0b7: An animal companion gains a +4 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on Will {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g} against Enchantment {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} and effects.
918b8e2f-25a9-46e1-a5a8-17e30a810d7a: An animal is a living, nonhuman creature, usually a vertebrate with no magical abilities and no innate capacity for language or culture.
da23d1e1-c7af-4cc5-8eb2-12187edaa275: An arcane rider can use dimensional ride as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g} now. After teleporting, the arcane rider and his mount companion gain the effect of the haste {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to the arcane rider's {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} bonus.
02feeeee-996b-439b-b51f-ca2206edf3be: An arcane rider gains an opportunity to spend 1 point from his arcane pool and a {g|Encyclopedia:Move_Action}move action{/g} to transfer himself and his mount companion from his current location to any other spot within a 30-foot range.
e874d6b6-d4e7-479b-a8c2-7f12df528c31: An arcane rider may select mounted combat {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g} as bonus feats.
ac4ebe17-5dc6-469b-85ff-6f825dca49a2: An arcane rider's abilities that spend arcane pool also apply to his mount companion.
3e53551e-c6cd-480b-a6ac-df61812b718e: An arcane trickster can use {g|Encyclopedia:Trickery}Trickery{/g} at a range of 30 feet. Working at a distance increases the normal {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill check{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} by 5.
78f4c9c6-43c3-4092-ad90-152ab5fef648:
An arcanist has an innate pool of magical energy that she can draw upon to fuel her arcanist exploits and enhance her {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}. The arcanist's arcane reservoir can hold a maximum amount of magical energy equal to 3 + the arcanist's level. Each day, when preparing spells, the arcanist's arcane reservoir fills with raw magical energy, gaining a number of points equal to 3 + half her arcanist level. Any points she had from the previous day are lost. She can also regain these points through the consume spells class feature and some arcanist exploits. The arcane reservoir can never hold more points than the maximum amount noted above; points gained in excess of this total are lost.
Points from the arcanist reservoir are used to fuel many of the arcanist's powers. In addition, the arcanist can expend 1 point from her arcane reservoir as a {g|Encyclopedia:Free_Action}free action{/g} whenever she casts an arcanist spell. If she does, she can choose to increase the {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} by 1 or increase the spell's {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} by 1. She can expend no more than 1 point from her reservoir on a given spell in this way.
ae85ce47-35b8-4e70-9163-b04e2863e4b8: An arcanist possesses an innate reservoir of arcane energy they can use for magical abilities and empowering their {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}. Arcane reservoir points can be replenished by resting, or by sacrificing a prepared spell.
22d20709-e165-40d1-9122-8f403874cea1:
An armiger gains 1 additional {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill{/g} rank at each level.
In addition, the armiger treats {g|Encyclopedia:Knowledge_World}Knowledge (world){/g} as class skill.
This alters the fighter's class skills and skill points per level, and replaces the fighter's bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g} gained at 1st and 10th levels.
c7def1d0-a0be-49a2-8ff6-86d4c6e5c1b0:
An armored battlemage cannot spend points from his arcane pool to enhance weapons. Instead, he can expend 1 point from his arcane pool as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g} to grant armor he is wearing a +1 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} for 1 minute. For every 4 magus levels he has beyond 1st, the armor gains another +1 enhancement bonus, to a maximum of +5 at 17th level. These bonuses stack with existing armor enhancement bonuses to a maximum of +5.
Multiple uses of this ability do not stack.
At 5th level, these bonuses can be used to add any of the following armor special abilities: balanced, bitter, fortification (heavy, light, or medium), ghost touch, invulnerability, {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g} (13, 15, 17, or 19), or {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} storing.
Adding these {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}special abilities{/g} consumes an amount of bonus equal to the ability's base price modifier. In addition, the armored battlemage can grant his armor the {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}energy resistance{/g} special ability at the cost of a +3 bonus or the improved energy resistance special ability at the cost of a +5 bonus. These special abilities are added to any the armor already has, but duplicates do not stack. If the armor is not magical, at least a +1 enhancement bonus must be added before any other special abilities can be added. These bonuses and special abilities are decided when the arcane pool point is spent and cannot be changed until the next time the armored battlemage uses this ability. These bonuses do not function if the armor is worn by anyone other than the magus.
1ae7f1c4-45ce-42f6-a95a-84d3cdfa3c75: An armored battlemage gains this ability at 1st level instead of 7th. When wearing medium armor, the armored battlemage gains a +4 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Concentration}concentration checks{/g}. This stacks with the bonus from the Combat Casting {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}.
e71286e7-6154-4ff3-b485-793ffda53547: An armored battlemage gains this ability at 7th level instead of 13th.
7fc793c7-7cd8-4c9c-b471-fa3378124c13: An armored hulk gains a +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}combat maneuver{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g} and to {g|Encyclopedia:CMD}CMD{/g}, and on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex saves{/g} against trample {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g}. She also gains a +1 bonus to her {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} against charge attacks and on attack and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} against charging creatures.
651e936c-05ef-424b-8106-27b0127c0307:
An assassin can make a special {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} with a melee weapon against a target that doesn't know about the assassin. The attack has the additional effect of possibly either paralyzing or killing the target (assassin's choice). Death attack is a {g|Encyclopedia:Full_Round_Action}full-round action{/g}. The death attack fails if the target detects the assassin or recognizes the assassin as an enemy. If the victim of such a death attack fails a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} 10 + the assassin's {g|Encyclopedia:Class_Level}class level{/g} + the assassin's {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Int{/g} modifier) against the kill effect, they die. If the saving throw fails against the paralysis effect, the victim is rendered {g|Encyclopedia:Helpless}helpless{/g} and unable to act for {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} plus 1 round per level of the assassin. If the victim's saving throw succeeds, the attack is just a normal attack.
At 10th level, the death attack becomes a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}.
4ef32677-82ef-460a-a141-b71de3ca1d83: An axiomatic weapon is infused with lawful power. It makes the weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}law-aligned{/g} and thus bypasses the corresponding {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g}. It deals an extra {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} against chaotic creatures.
3f99830e-616e-4e0b-826f-83b37163b3ae: An ecclesitheurge is proficient with the club, dagger, heavy crossbow, light crossbow, quarterstaff, and the favored weapon of his deity, but he's not proficient with any type of armor or shield.
84f97a67-901c-4472-b888-e2e4e43ccb63: An eldritch font gains one additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} slot for each level of arcanist spell she can cast. However, the number of spells of each level that she can prepare reduces by 1. If this reduces her spells prepared for a level to 0, she still gains spell slots of that level, which can be used to cast spells using metamagic {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g}.
20c998c2-059b-4b40-ae3c-648d2f4b64eb: An eldritch knight adds his level to any levels of fighter he might have for the purpose of meeting the prerequisites for {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g} (if he has no fighter levels, treat his eldritch knight levels as levels of fighter). He also adds his level to any levels in an arcane {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spellcasting{/g} class for the purpose of meeting the prerequisites for feats.
b626fd28-b92e-4766-a1c8-f5a18a3fb891: An espionage expert gets a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} equal to 1/2 her level on {g|Encyclopedia:Perception}Perception checks{/g}.
130bd771-567c-40e0-ae17-62069df2a530: An espionage expert gets a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} equal to 1/2 her level on {g|Encyclopedia:Persuasion}Persuasion{/g} (when used to bluff) and {g|Encyclopedia:Stealth}Stealth checks{/g}.
d07ea8bc-5d2f-4003-868f-ebea4d6a9863: An espionage expert of 20th level becomes an espionage master. She can, as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, make a single {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} against a favored enemy at her full attack bonus. If the attack hits, the target takes {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} normally and must make a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g} or die. The {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of this save is equal to 10 + 1/2 the espionage expert's level + the espionage expert's {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier. An espionage expert can use this ability five times per day, but not against the same creature more than once in a 24-hour period.
68d45080-0fc5-47df-9f7e-34765937fdcc: An evil cleric (or a neutral cleric of an evil deity) can channel stored {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} energy into wounding spells that she did not prepare ahead of time. The cleric can "lose" any prepared spell that is not an {g|Encyclopedia:Cantrips_Orisons}orison{/g} or domain spell in order to cast any inflict spell of the same spell level (an inflict spell is any spell with "inflict" in its name).
a81614e6-7754-423f-9a87-32589564009d:
An evil cleric (or a neutral cleric who worships an evil deity) channels negative energy and can choose to deal {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} to living creatures or to {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g} undead creatures.
Channeling energy causes a burst that either heals all undead creatures or damages all living creatures in a 30-foot radius centered on the cleric. The amount of damage dealt or healed is equal to {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of damage plus 1d6 points of damage for every two cleric levels beyond 1st (2d6 at 3rd, 3d6 at 5th, and so on). Creatures that take damage from channeled energy receive a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g} to halve the damage. The {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of this save is equal to 10 + 1/2 the cleric's level + the cleric's {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier. Creatures healed by channel energy cannot exceed their maximum {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit point{/g} total—all excess healing is lost. A cleric may channel energy a number of times per day equal to 3 + her Charisma modifier. This is a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} that does not provoke an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attack of opportunity{/g}. A cleric can choose whether or not to include herself in this effect.
An evil cleric (or a neutral cleric of an evil deity) can also channel stored {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} energy into wounding spells that she did not prepare ahead of time. The cleric can "lose" any prepared spell that is not an {g|Encyclopedia:Cantrips_Orisons}orison{/g} or domain spell in order to cast any inflict spell of the same spell level (an inflict spell is any spell with "inflict" in its name).
d1d3c76e-e136-41e6-a0a5-b9bcfcdf4c1a: An imitator can imitate a martial class style, which allows him to enter fighter, barbarian, rogue, or monk stance for 1 minute a number of times per day equal to his {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier + half his slayer level.
e7b340ec-1640-4293-98eb-8257b661cb4f: An inquisitor is proficient with all {g|Encyclopedia:Weapon_Proficiency}simple weapons{/g}, plus the longbow, shortbow, and the favored weapon of her deity. She is also proficient with light armor, medium armor, and shields (except tower shields).
56dc0b64-d582-4ea4-8a9b-ee2b47264849: An instinctual warrior adds his {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} bonus (if any) to his {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g}.
bf230926-9e3e-46b1-9f77-f2d4fd8cae4d:
An instinctual warrior can call upon inner reserves of strength and ferocity, granting her additional combat prowess. At 1st level, an instinctual warrior can rage for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} per day equal to 4 + her {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier. For each level after 1st she possesses, the barbarian can rage for 2 additional rounds per day. Temporary increases to Wisdom do not increase the total number of rounds that an instinctual warrior can rage per day. An instinctual warrior can enter a rage as a {g|Encyclopedia:Free_Action}free action{/g}. The total number of rounds of rage per day is renewed after resting for 8 hours, although these hours need not be consecutive.
While in a rage, an instinctual warrior gains a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} and Wisdom. In addition, she gains 2 temporary {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}Hit Die{/g}. These temporary hit points are lost first when a character takes {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}, disappear when the rage ends, and are not replenished if the barbarian enters a rage again within 1 minute of her previous rage. While in a rage, an instinctual warrior cannot cast {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}.
An instinctual warrior can end her rage as a free {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}action{/g}, and is fatigued for 1 minute after a rage ends. An instinctual warrior can't enter a new rage while fatigued or exhausted, but can otherwise enter a rage multiple times per day. If an instinctual warrior falls {g|Encyclopedia:Injury_Death}unconscious{/g}, her rage immediately ends.
095cbb1a-47ef-437b-b4ea-982fee32a25d:
An instinctual warrior can take Improved Unarmed Strike as a bonus rage power. The {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} dealt by a Medium instinctual warrior's {g|Encyclopedia:UnarmedAttack}unarmed{/g} strike increases with level: {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} at levels 1–3, 1d8 at levels 4–7, 1d10 at levels 8–11, 2d6 at levels 12–15, 2d8 at levels 16–19, and 2d10 at level 20.
If the instinctual warrior is Small, his unarmed strike damage increases as follows: 1d4 at levels 1–3, 1d6 at levels 4–7, 1d8 at levels 8–11, 1d10 at levels 12–15, 2d6 at levels 16–19, and 2d8 at level 20.
If the instinctual warrior is Large, his unarmed strike damage increases as follows: 1d8 at levels 1–3, 2d6 at levels 4–7, 2d8 at levels 8–11, 3d6 at levels 12–15, 3d8 at levels 16–19, and 4d8 at level 20.
b77c5b47-fba6-45ef-b894-8bdd42d63289: An instinctual warrior gains {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g} equal to his current barbarian level + 10. In order to affect the instinctual warrior with a {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, a spellcaster must get a result on a {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d20{/g} + caster level) that equals or exceeds the instinctual warrior 's spell resistance.
4819ebf4-4e66-418b-b20a-b9fa53fe2aec: An instinctual warrior is proficient with all simple and {g|Encyclopedia:Weapon_Proficiency}martial weapons{/g} and shields (except tower shields).
6bfc3a77-671a-4298-a9f8-f58b7ff88bf0: An opponent that is dealt sneak attack {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} by a character with this ability is affected by a targeted dispel magic affecting one of the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} effects active on the target. The {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} for this ability is equal to the character's level.
5c878921-d5d1-4b2f-b813-dcc814eb5a27: An oracle can {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g} her wounds as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}. With one use of this ability, an oracle can heal {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} of damage for every two oracle levels she possesses.
999b8b9e-47b4-4b16-aefd-e76887261455: An oracle can {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g} the wounds of others by touch. With one use of this ability, an oracle can heal {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} of damage for every two oracle levels she possesses. Using this ability is a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}.
7bd8e612-62f6-433a-a24a-820cc0e014fd: An oracle with the ancestor mystery adds all Knowledge and Lore {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g} to her list of class skills.
030dc7ed-d557-4062-86a4-adb821a193b5: An oracle with the battle mystery adds {g|Encyclopedia:Persuasion}Persuasion{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Knowledge_World}Knowledge (world){/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Perception}Perception{/g} to her list of class {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g}.
0f68cd2e-7ff2-47a4-b9d6-94f4a7ac5ace: An oracle with the bones mystery adds {g|Encyclopedia:Persuasion}Persuasion{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Stealth}Stealth{/g} to her list of class {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g}.
0715db03-f890-41e3-8b6a-2825829735f4: An oracle with the flame mystery adds {g|Encyclopedia:Mobility}Mobility{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Athletics}Athletics{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Persuasion}Persuasion{/g} to her list of class {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g}.
db7596b9-770d-4f7d-bbfa-4f75e5199ce6: An oracle with the life mystery adds {g|Encyclopedia:Lore_Nature}Lore (nature){/g} to her list of class {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g}.
0af0a2ca-d6e1-409e-8b44-1ca0515daf08: An oracle with the nature mystery adds {g|Encyclopedia:Athletics}Athletics{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Lore_Nature}Lore (nature){/g} to her list of class {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g}.
45e81847-d119-420b-8435-76dedeb19417: An oracle with the stone mystery adds {g|Encyclopedia:Athletics}Athletics{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Persuasion}Persuasion{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Lore_Nature}Lore (nature){/g} to her list of class {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g}.
3b808a2f-c1b2-47c4-ab2e-004af6ce4646: An oracle with the waves mystery adds {g|Encyclopedia:Mobility}Mobility{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Lore_Nature}Lore (nature){/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Athletics}Athletics{/g} to her list of class {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g}.
271427fc-90f5-487c-aa5c-3b67e211d77d: An oracle with the wind mystery adds {g|Encyclopedia:Mobility}Mobility{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Stealth}Stealth{/g} to her list of class {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g}.
46b96b2f-24da-40d6-bf84-be662e9ff01b: An order of the lion cavalier adds {g|Encyclopedia:Knowledge_World}Knowledge (world){/g} to his list of class {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g}.
40b7c447-f6e9-4934-a448-04f4f0978992: An order of the shroud cavalier adds {g|Encyclopedia:Lore_Religion}Lore (religion){/g} to his list of class {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g}.
d0423859-9222-4966-9e3a-32eaf3d2d5eb: An order of the star cavalier adds {g|Encyclopedia:Lore_Religion}Lore (religion){/g} to his list of class {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g}.
1d629ff5-6d06-45db-8a40-03e52ca524f9: An order of the sword cavalier adds {g|Encyclopedia:Lore_Religion}Lore (religion){/g} to his list of class {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g}.
3cb1cc2b-f242-4203-aba4-c0c0654d0d4d: An outsider is at least partially composed of the essence (but not necessarily the material) of some plane other than the Material Plane. Some creatures start out as some other type and become outsiders when they attain a higher (or lower) state of spiritual existence.
a4c6df68-e656-4c0f-a2b9-a157c6118a4a: An overwhelming soul uses her {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier instead of her {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} modifier to determine her {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} with wild talents, the {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DCs{/g} of Constitution based wild talents, the duration of wild talents with a Constitution-based duration, her {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Concentration}concentration checks{/g} for wild talents, and the other Constitution based effects of all her wild talents.
22d45f6d-cec3-417a-aaaa-5531f4601fd5:
An overwhelming soul's mind is strong enough to protect her body from the stress of channeling the elements. However, in exchange, she is unable to push her limits quite as far as other kineticists.
She can't choose to accept burn, though she can use wild talents with a burn cost if she can reduce that cost to 0 points with abilities such as gather power and infusion specialization. At 6th level, once per day, she can reduce the total burn cost of any wild talent by 1.
She can use this ability an additional time per day at 10th level and every 4 levels thereafter.
2b0b4ece-4749-445f-b27f-b669230b405c: An swordlord can add his {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} bonus (if any) to {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} made with a dueling sword instead of his {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} bonus. This {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on damage rolls applies whether the swordlord is wielding a dueling sword {g|Encyclopedia:Light_Weapon}one-handed{/g} or two-handed. An swordlord cannot use this ability if he is wielding a shield or using an off-hand weapon (including armor spikes, {g|Encyclopedia:UnarmedAttack}unarmed{/g} strikes, or {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural weapons{/g}).
3c26c408-1af7-44a5-890d-6bb77176ce6d: An unholy weapon is imbued with unholy power. This power makes the weapon evil-aligned and thus bypasses the corresponding {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g}. It deals an extra {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} against all creatures of good {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}alignment{/g}.
e3499924-04df-427e-aba6-f3cbad1e3e19: An unlettered arcanist does not keep a {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spellbook{/g}. Instead, she gains a familiar in which she stores her spells as a witch does, though she does not gain a witch's patron. Treat her arcanist level as her witch level for determining the abilities and benefits granted by the familiar. Anything that would allow an unlettered arcanist to add spells to her spellbook allows her to add spells to her familiar instead.
9f9d2e7f-45f0-498a-8140-2b69beae5c21: An unlettered arcanist follows a different arcane tradition. She uses the witch {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} list instead of the wizard/sorcerer spell list.
b8182f19-13ae-4ca3-97a6-3596b56392d6: An unsworn shaman never binds herself to one specific spirit, always making new deals as she deems necessary for the circumstances that she finds herself in. While this weakens the powers she can access from any one spirit, it gives her access to a broader overall range of abilities.
3d393407-82b2-4157-be5e-8cd77945637c: Angelfire apostles are only proficient with light armor.
d5674434-9fdc-4e5d-999b-0552fb9e2f97: Angelfire apostles use the powers of good to avoid violence when possible and cleanse both maladies and evil creatures with blinding flames.
25f70658-3c07-4ab0-877f-13e8a608b4e0: Animal companions receive {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonuses{/g} to their natural armor.
02d5f566-4b43-477b-81c3-a1180baf6e58: Animal companions receive {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonuses{/g} to their {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g}.
20530651-0d00-44ca-a75a-ba8340389dbc: Any potion that the alchemist drinks functions at a {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} equal to his {g|Encyclopedia:Class_Level}class level{/g}.
ae461d9f-eed0-4f13-bd28-152699889776: Any potion that the alchemist drinks functions at twice its normal duration, as if affected by the Extend Spell metamagic {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}.
2dd77d5e-4113-4965-b181-43d56687e5ba: Any potion that the cauldron witch drinks functions at twice its normal duration, as if affected by the Extend Spell metamagic {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}.
8ddcad55-ed16-4c66-bbac-9dfff4b94737: Any undead creatures and evil outsiders who enter the area of incense fog must succeed at a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g} or become alchemically nauseated and alchemically sickened for {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g}. If the save succeeds, the opponent is only alchemically sickened for 1d4 rounds. The {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of this save is equal to 10 + half the alchemist's level + the alchemist's {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier.
aeaa8d6b-cf2c-4c6b-a37b-0e86c102023a: Any undead creatures and evil outsiders who enter the area of incense fog must succeed at a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g} or become alchemically sickened for {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g}. The {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of this save is equal to 10 + half the alchemist's level + the alchemist's {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier.
6dd81832-86d9-469c-9b29-8406f32f2ef9: Arcanists are proficient with all {g|Encyclopedia:Weapon_Proficiency}simple weapons{/g}. They are not proficient with any type of armor or shield. Armor interferes with an arcanist's gestures, which can cause her {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} with somatic components to fail.
d450dbdd-d4aa-499b-b1a4-c2f0e8c7e046: Arcanists are specialists of arcane magic. They apply a wide array of {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} that make them useful in a lot of different situations. After resting they choose a limited amount of spells they can use that day. Arcanists are capable of making their spells more powerful.
e576cb90-ea36-46f2-806d-851dc533efda: Arcanists can cast number of {g|Encyclopedia:Cantrips_Orisons}cantrips{/g}, or 0-level {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}. These spells are cast like any other spell, but they do not consume spell slots.
87f926dc-b824-4f9b-a1b7-36dc70aebaa6: Arcanists learn exploits that let them duplicate simple {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} or effects of {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g} by expending points of the arcane reservoir.
9da31dc4-daaa-4811-aec9-545cb6c6d9dc: Arcanists with an affinity for elemental forces sometimes focus on one and display its power in everything they do.
230ed353-9737-43ef-8214-166024370f45:
