bd8024f2-ad60-4e37-b074-0dafa6cbaa60: At 12th level, your {g|Encyclopedia:Reach}reach{/g} increases by 5 feet during bloodrage.
2f6e8570-24e1-4a2f-8358-b28b3579251e: At 12th level, {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} of your elemental strikes increases to {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d6{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} with your elemental descriptor increases by 2.
ddd6d353-db12-4059-a6a3-5c8bd5e971a5: At 13th level, a bard can start a bardic performance as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}.
d5631aa5-fa1a-4503-896d-f0a0c4110ad3: At 13th level, a flamewarden adds flamestrike, volcanic storm, and summon large fire elemental to his ranger {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} list as 4th-level spells.
546467d0-3073-4cef-a030-70fe8e1e57aa: At 13th level, a magus gains proficiency with heavy armor. A magus can cast magus {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} while wearing heavy armor without incurring the normal {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Fail_Chance}arcane spell failure chance{/g}. Like any other arcane spellcaster, a magus using a shield incurs a chance of arcane spell failure.
a966dce1-9b3c-4ce9-abf8-8de1d48ae0b1: At 13th level, a quarterstaff master can use his quarterstaff to make his first {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} during a flurry of blows make a free disarm attempt, which does not provoke {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attack of opportunity{/g}.
cbc1eeff-e6d0-408d-8ec3-832df4ba6b92: At 13th level, a sensei can start a bardic performance as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}.
e5d114d4-9551-42d4-b663-a492738a1520: At 13th level, a skald can start a raging song as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g} instead of a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}.
a5b44813-c7f5-4079-a0c0-441a2adcc601: At 13th level, a slayer can once per day increase his movement {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} by 30 ft, and his movement doesn't provoke {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attacks of opportunity{/g}. At 17th level, he can do this twice per day.
c0063b1f-b1c6-49f5-a429-148f64a6c0fe: At 13th level, an eldritch font can use her eldritch surge ability to force a creature to {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}reroll{/g} a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g} against one {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} or arcanist exploit and take the lower value. The eldritch font must declare the use of this ability before the result of that creature's saving throw is revealed. If the spell or arcanist exploit affects more than one target, only one target is affected by this ability.
fbab8ff3-d643-4f98-acbd-dee8c9a7154b: At 13th level, her claw {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} increases to {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d10{/g} (1d8 if {g|Encyclopedia:Size}Small{/g}).
7f63e6b7-b7c1-42a6-bce8-2d2ae370c70c: At 13th level, her spike {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} increases to {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d10{/g} (1d8 if {g|Encyclopedia:Size}Small{/g}).
434948ca-8696-4393-a11f-c454d8a68d9a: At 13th level, his slam {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} increases to {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d10{/g} (1d8 if {g|Encyclopedia:Size}Small{/g}).
9762167c-419a-4e88-a2a6-f434e477a65e: At 13th level, inspire tranquility also grants {g|Encyclopedia:Blindsense}blindsense{/g} with a 10-foot range.
c99cef32-13f7-4c1d-8ac3-eb0aaf4ffb98: At 13th level, when a sword saint is attacking a {g|Encyclopedia:Flat_Footed}flat-footed{/g} opponent, he adds his {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier on {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} with his chosen weapon (minimum 0).
88d47d8d-cd03-49b2-b64e-8906afbadf65: At 13th level, while using a tower shield, a tower shield specialist cannot be {g|Encyclopedia:Flanking}flanked{/g}.
22afddac-4092-457d-acd4-1633c98c7e95: At 13th level, while wearing light armor or no armor, a {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} dancer's insight {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} increases to +4.
4d044a3d-f6fe-464d-9440-9f096d432c07: At 14th level inspire ferocity makes all {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural attacks{/g} by affected allies count as if they were adamantine.
713df8d9-e4a6-44fb-ad53-98ffe52ee47d: At 14th level inspire ferocity makes all {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural attacks{/g} by affected allies count as if they were adamantine.
e6ab3889-7d99-4f5b-82e4-bd3864c96b3a: At 14th level, a bloodrager gains a +4 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on Will {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}resist Enchantment spells{/g} while bloodraging. This bonus stacks with all other modifiers, including the morale bonus on Will saves he also receives during his bloodrage.
b4608503-b872-4c19-b47a-c41fec888a21: At 14th level, a divine hunter's ranged weapons are treated as {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}good-aligned{/g} for the purposes of overcoming {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g}. Any {g|Encyclopedia:RangedAttack}ranged attacks{/g} made by an ally within 10 feet of her are likewise treated as good-aligned for the purposes of overcoming {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} reduction. This ability functions only while the divine hunter is conscious.
c7f3c976-8bc4-46b9-8271-3f64fda548a4:
At 14th level, a dragonblood shifter's ties to her draconic abilities grow stronger. Her {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g} against sleep and paralysis effects increases to +4. Her wild shape ability now functions as the dragonkind II {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}.
You become a {g|Encyclopedia:Size}large{/g} dragon-like creature. You gain a +6 polymorph bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g}, a +4 polymorph bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g}, a +6 natural armor bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}, immunity to difficult terrain, a breath weapon, {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g} 5/magic, and resistance to one element. Your movement {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} is increased by 10 feet. You also gain one bite ({g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d6{/g}), two claws (1d6), two secondary wing {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} (1d6) (secondary attacks do not benefit from shifter claws), and one tail slap attack (1d8). Your breath weapon and resistance depend on the type of your dragon prototype. You can only use the breath weapon once per 1d4 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g}. All breath weapons deal 8d8 points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} and allow a Reflex save for half damage.
This ability lasts for 1 hour (the Master Shapeshifter mythic ability makes this duration permanent). Using dragon shape is a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} that does not cause {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attacks of opportunity{/g}. The dragonblood shifter can use dragon shape a number of times per day equal to her shifter level + her {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier.
This replaces greater chimeric aspect.
42614f6a-4971-461a-92e2-a6809ed55081:
At 14th level, a feyform shifter gains a third aspect. When she uses her shifter aspect ability to take on her fey aspect, she can choose two aspects and assume the minor form of each aspect, alongside her fey aspect.
This modifies greater chimeric aspect.
9e371559-061f-4b1c-af39-c43720962438:
At 14th level, a fiendflesh shifter's chimeric fiend ability grants her additional bonuses as noted below.
Daemon: A +4 inherent {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to her {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} score and immunity to disease.
Demon: A +4 inherent bonus to her {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} score and increases the {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} die of all {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural attacks{/g} by one category.
Devil: A +4 inherent bonus to her {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} score and immunity to blindness.
This replaces greater chimeric aspect.
47e49900-550b-4f1c-9aa3-c04a6f08ae48:
At 14th level, a paladin's weapons are treated as {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}good-aligned{/g} for the purposes of overcoming {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g}. Any {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} made against an enemy within 10 feet of her is treated as good-aligned for the purposes of overcoming {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} reduction.
This ability functions only while the paladin is conscious, not if she is {g|Encyclopedia:Injury_Death}unconscious{/g} or dead.
271de5de-d650-4d51-880a-8fc4ef2e0d15: At 14th level, a preservationist adds summon nature's ally VII to his formula book as a 5th-level extract.
6d090303-0493-4dd4-9376-6ee792b902a2: At 14th level, a skald can temporarily revive dead allies to continue fighting, with the same limitations as raise dead. The skald brings all allies within 50 feet back to life. The revived allies are alive but staggered. Each {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}, the skald may expend another 1 round of raging song to keep them alive for another round. The allies automatically die if the skald ends this performance or is interrupted.
86a15553-c043-4651-974c-b5d4be6ba457: At 14th level, a tactical leader can grant his judgment benefits to a single other ally within 30 feet who can see and hear the tactical leader as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}. These benefits last for 1 minute. A tactical leader can use this ability a number of times per day equal to his {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier (minimum 1).
1f66e503-3cd7-4611-9071-91a82f8da652: At 14th level, a warrior of the holy light can unleash a 30-foot burst of pure, white light as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}. evil creatures within this burst take ({g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} for every two paladin levels) points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} and are blinded for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. Evil dragons, evil outsiders, and evil undead are blinded for 1d4 rounds on a failed {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}save{/g}. A Reflex save halves this damage and negates the blindness. The {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of this save is equal to 10 + 1/2 the warrior of the holy light's level + the warrior of the holy light's {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier. good creatures within this burst are healed 1d6 points of damage per two paladin levels and receive a +2 sacred {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability checks{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g}, saving throws, and {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g} for 1 round. A warrior of the holy light can use this ability once per day at 14th level plus one additional time per day at 17th and 20th levels.
b6ca9dea-c859-4c45-9ca0-dde2482da927: At 14th level, the cavalier's banner becomes a rallying call to his allies. All allies within 60 feet receive a +2 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against charm and compulsion {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} and effects.
92ef2707-3f20-46ec-a290-a04c81f729a5: At 14th level, the drovier can choose to grant her allies the benefits of the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} aspect of the wolf rather than an animal aspect.
e3e641f4-32fd-42ba-9c24-1bfdabfb191c: At 14th level, the effects of a mutagen last for 1 hour per level.
f83136c8-ffd8-41cd-accc-54ffec104f08: At 14th level, the inquisitor learns to take advantage of any opportunity that presents itself. Whenever the inquisitor scores a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g}, she ignores any {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g} the target might have. In addition, if the target has {g|Encyclopedia:Regeneration}regeneration{/g}, the creature loses regeneration on the {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} following the critical hit and can die normally during that round. Creatures whose regeneration always functions are immune to this ability.
ed65a903-5967-4359-967a-37ba6613b3ac: At 14th level, the magus gains the ability to seamlessly cast {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} and make {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attacks{/g}. Whenever he uses the spell combat ability, his {g|Encyclopedia:Concentration}concentration check{/g} bonus from Improved Spell Combat increases to +4.
cd89421c-3ebb-4d43-81d6-a3534183cd7a: At 14th level, when a shifter uses her shifter aspect ability to take on a minor form, she can choose up to three aspects and assume the minor form of each aspect.
12b1bc26-073d-48e9-a647-d85bc16ce553: At 14th level, whenever a thundercaller uses her Storm Call ability, the amount of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} dealt by bolts of lightning increases to {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}5d6{/g} (or 5d10 when outdoors in stormy weather).
9f66cb22-f3f6-4520-9520-3d18a6256304: At 14th level, whenever her war beast succeeds at a bull rush, overrun, or trip {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}combat maneuver{/g} against an opponent threatened by the mad dog, a mad dog can take an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attack of opportunity{/g} against that opponent.
262bbfef-c372-4bb8-a4c1-c7269ffed511: At 14th level, while in any of her favored terrains, a forester can use the {g|Encyclopedia:Stealth}Stealth{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill{/g} even while being observed.
bc1e2604-ccd7-42fd-b3a2-9f4c148b397e: At 15th level, a dragonheir scion can grow leathery dragon wings from her back. She can dismiss the wings as a {g|Encyclopedia:Free_Action}free action{/g}.
25b60000-20e8-4261-b1f6-b62519d79a98: At 15th level, a hunter as a standard can shoot an ammunition 3 times per day, which marks all enemies in a 10-foot area as prey. Against such creatures the animal companion gets a +3 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}, and its attacks bypass {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} N/cold iron, N/mithral, N/adamantine, and hardness. Whenever the animal companion kills a marked enemy, all its attacks' {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical{/g} range increases by 1 until the end of combat. Multiple applications of this effect stack.
20df536a-7967-461c-9dd9-5ed511fc7846: At 15th level, a paladin's mount gains {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g} equal to the paladin's level + 11.
0fe09789-6871-4484-a6f3-96527fb67a22: At 15th level, a scaled fist can spend 3 points from her ki pool to make a breath weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}. This breath weapon deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}acid damage{/g} per monk level in a 30-foot cone. Those caught in the area of the breath can attempt a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} = 10 + 1/2 the scaled fist's monk level + her {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier) to halve the normal {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}.
5267626e-2708-48f8-be70-bf15914fb983: At 15th level, a scaled fist can spend 3 points from her ki pool to make a breath weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}. This breath weapon deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}acid damage{/g} per monk level in a 60-foot line. Those caught in the area of the breath can attempt a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} = 10 + 1/2 the scaled fist's monk level + her {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier) to halve the normal {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}.
fb0ee29e-7ed5-4b83-871c-3fd980139c55: At 15th level, a scaled fist can spend 3 points from her ki pool to make a breath weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}. This breath weapon deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}cold damage{/g} per monk level in a 30-foot cone. Those caught in the area of the breath can attempt a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} = 10 + 1/2 the scaled fist's monk level + her {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier) to halve the normal {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}.
8209b617-db33-46a4-ae59-3e44a350bb56: At 15th level, a scaled fist can spend 3 points from her ki pool to make a breath weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}. This breath weapon deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}electricity damage{/g} per monk level in a 60-foot line. Those caught in the area of the breath can attempt a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} = 10 + 1/2 the scaled fist's monk level + her {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier) to halve the normal {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}.
453bc5c3-b12c-43c1-987b-88675d848fcb: At 15th level, a scaled fist can spend 3 points from her ki pool to make a breath weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}. This breath weapon deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g} per monk level in a 30-foot cone. Those caught in the area of the breath can attempt a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} = 10 + 1/2 the scaled fist's monk level + her {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier) to halve the normal {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}.
8f236bd7-b5fc-4cfd-beda-77c1a14e7a94: At 15th level, a scaled fist can spend 3 points from her ki pool to make a breath weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}. This breath weapon deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g} per monk level in a 60-foot line. Those caught in the area of the breath can attempt a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} = 10 + 1/2 the scaled fist's monk level + her {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier) to halve the normal {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}.
ee024181-499a-4b82-9603-9485f6313665: At 15th level, an order of the lion cavalier can protect those around him. Allies that are adjacent to the cavalier receive a +3 shield {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to their {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}.
4e6806b8-0ba5-4d84-914f-c2a16e97573a: At 15th level, pick one {g|Encyclopedia:Magic_School}school of magic{/g}. The {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} for any {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} you cast from that school increases by +2. This {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} stacks with the bonus granted by Spell Focus.
771b6869-a864-43d2-91f0-b17e44d25b94: At 15th level, the cavalier can make a knight's challenge once per day. This functions like a normal challenge, but the cavalier adds his {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} bonus on all {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} made against the target of his challenge. In addition, he receives a +4 circumstance {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on attack rolls made to confirm {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hits{/g} against the target of his knight's challenge.
babffa3a-eb38-47e8-b5a7-19503af66f83: At 15th level, the cavalier can take retribution on those who dare to strike an agent of his faith. Whenever an enemy makes a successful {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g} against the cavalier or an adjacent ally devoted to the same faith as the cavalier, the enemy provokes an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attack of opportunity{/g} from the cavalier. The cavalier receives a +2 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on the {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} of opportunity. If the attack made by the enemy was a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g}, the cavalier may treat the enemy as the target of his challenge for the attack of opportunity. The cavalier can use this ability once per {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}.
f510068c-503b-499e-9b11-e18f1ac89a74: At 15th level, the cavalier can take revenge on undead that dare strike him or those he seeks to protect. Whenever an undead creature that is the subject of his challenge hits the cavalier or an adjacent ally with a {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g}, the creature provokes an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attack of opportunity{/g} from the cavalier. The cavalier gains a +2 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} of opportunity provoked as a result of this ability. If an undead subject of the cavalier's challenge threatens a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g} against the cavalier, the cavalier gains a deflection bonus equal to his {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier against the confirmation {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}roll{/g}. This bonus functions as a {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}supernatural ability{/g}.
bebdf9bd-5b75-45a6-97a5-219ab45aea96: At 15th level, the cavalier can, as a {g|Encyclopedia:Free_Action}free action{/g}, declare a moment of triumph. For 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}, the cavalier receives a competence {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} equal to his {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier on all {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability checks{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g}. This bonus is also added to his {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}. In addition, any critical threats he makes are automatically confirmed. The cavalier can use this ability once per day.
a90dbedf-8377-479a-a455-87d0c5e0268a: At 15th level, when the cavalier hits the target of his challenge with a {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g}, and that target is at least Large {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g}, he gains a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} equal to half his cavalier level. This damage is multiplied on a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g}.
e145a31b-87c2-4c06-b0e7-a90055d53f82: At 15th level, when using Power Attack with a {g|Encyclopedia:Light_Weapon}two-handed{/g} melee weapon, the bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} from Power Attack is doubled (+100%) instead of increased by half (+50%).
231d346b-2463-4a76-b380-5d0ef3eb76b3: At 15th level, whenever you cast a summoning {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} that conjures more than one creature, add one to the total number of creatures summoned.
7c01a042-6440-4c90-ba88-fa1e81a15607: At 15th level, you are no longer fatigued at the end of your rage.
0c2eefd6-5c30-4d82-9518-45ec49430b43: At 15th level, you become immune to grapple, entangle, slow, and difficult terrain.
1e3a9bc7-ac8e-4854-bbeb-a039efba8f6d: At 15th level, you can become incorporeal for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} per sorcerer level. While in this form, you gain the incorporeal subtype. You take no {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} from non-magic weapons. You also take only half damage from any source not dealing ghost, holy, divine, or {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}force damage{/g}. You can use this ability once per day.
da6c9896-1d02-4b33-833e-dbd1a5c1b229: At 15th level, you gain +30 feet to your base {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g}.
504e64a8-94b3-4d65-8067-2ffac9f35f25: At 15th level, you gain immunity to {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}combat maneuvers{/g}.
d521a3ee-e402-4407-a231-a6b712afe7ad: At 15th level, you gain the burrow ability. While burrowing, you have a +8 dodge {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to your {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} and total {g|Encyclopedia:Concealment}concealment{/g}, but you can't take any {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}actions{/g} except moving. You may use burrow as often as desired.
5eb2c553-8f99-41b6-9438-51bb8338dfa9: At 15th level, you gain {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g} against evil {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} and spells cast by evil creatures equal to 11 + your sorcerer level.
948f52b0-6d0d-4c9c-9bd5-66d65ff2d910: At 15th level, you get a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d20{/g} + caster level) made to overcome a creature's {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g}. This bonus stacks with the one from the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}Spell{/g} Penetration and Greater Spell Penetration {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g}.
d8794f2e-a431-42d5-bfd5-77453d699290:
At 15th level, you may summon a host of insects. This power acts as creeping doom, but the swarms' poison inflicts {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Con{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} and any creature other than you sharing a space with a swarm is entangled. You may use this ability once per day.
Creeping Doom: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} summons to your side 4 spider swarms. The summoned swarms appear where you designate and act according to their {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} results. They {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} your opponents to the best of their ability.
The swarms have 60 {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} each and deal {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}4d6{/g} points of damage with their swarm attack plus poison and distraction. The {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}save{/g} to resist their poison and distraction effects is equal to the save {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of this spell. Creatures caught in multiple swarms only take damage and make saves once.
Distraction: A creature with this ability can nauseate the creatures that it damages. Any living creature that takes damage from a creature with the distraction ability is nauseated for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}; a Fortitude save negates the effect.
Poison: Swarm — injury; Fortitude save; frequency: 1/round for 6 rounds; effect: 1d4 Con; cure: 1 save.
7b768354-7a70-42f2-ab25-c961b60e1419:
At 16th level, a kineticist becomes more adept at creating composite blasts. She reduces the burn cost of all composite blasts by 1 point.
This can't reduce the cost of a composite blast below 0 points.
f14ad35b-d016-4419-97e0-826bb8de103b: At 16th level, a stormwalker gains {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Immunity}immunity{/g} to electricity.
939c7f13-a452-4096-8c67-5800b10c6b1d: At 16th level, enemy creatures of the animal or plant types who come in a 15-foot area around you have to make a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will saving throw{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} 10 + half your bloodrager level + {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier) or become fascinated. This ability is active even while you are not bloodraging.
d0c8920d-7e17-4912-8449-8c3fb1e3bcdf: At 16th level, if a flamewarden dies, his body explodes in a conflagration in a 20-foot spread. Each hostile creature in the area takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}10d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g} unless it succeeds at a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} = 10 + half the ranger's level + his {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} modifier) for half {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}. The flames don't harm the flamewarden's allies, who instead are {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}healed{/g} 5d6 points of damage, and any poisons they are currently suffering are neutralized.
035fa29b-6482-4af3-a1e5-46a95ed3d3ab: At 16th level, ki strike allows the sohei's {g|Encyclopedia:UnarmedAttack}unarmed attacks{/g} and any {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} with weapons for which he has weapon training to be treated as adamantine weapons for the purpose of overcoming {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g} and bypassing hardness.
fbeb7cc1-c523-4823-9094-3afaf4b7f253: At 16th level, once per bloodrage, you can turn into a Hydra as a {g|Encyclopedia:Free_Action}free action{/g}. You gain a +4 {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g}, a +2 size bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g}, a +4 natural armor bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}, immunity to trip, and five bite {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d8{/g}). The poison from serpentine fangs applies to bite attacks in hydra form.
4233a831-6cec-44c8-a645-c47b55ec3fbb: At 16th level, once per day when entering a bloodrage you can take an elemental form as elemental body IV.
b90314ad-3933-4f90-8721-39d42019cdd4: At 16th level, once per day you can choose to become incorporeal. You take only half {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} from magic corporeal sources, and you take no damage from non-magic weapons and objects.
7b5eb256-59a4-4cae-994b-4a8e386b3b61: At 16th level, the monk's {g|Encyclopedia:UnarmedAttack}unarmed attacks{/g} are treated as adamantine weapons for the purpose of overcoming {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g} and bypassing hardness.
bf2be577-411e-4144-a438-dd451e888772: At 16th level, the nimbus of light grants the warrior of the holy light and her allies protection from {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hits{/g}. There is a 25% chance that critical hits made against the warrior of the holy light and her allies in the area are instead treated as normal hits. This does not stack with other abilities that grant similar protection (such as light fortification).
66ad854c-a266-4ed6-8bf3-ba77ee267ca8: At 16th level, when entering a bloodrage you can choose one of the following {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} and apply its effects to yourself: beast shape IV, dragonkind I, or transformation. This is in addition to arcane bloodrage and greater arcane bloodrage, and otherwise works as those abilities.
8702dfea-af11-4d7c-9f06-8a194929142f: At 16th level, when entering a bloodrage you can choose to exude an aura of fire. The aura is a 5-foot burst centered on you, and deals ({g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d6{/g} + your {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} modifier) points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g} to creatures that end their turns within it.
a9854822-4f7a-4840-9c18-0081a2639a0b: At 16th level, when entering a bloodrage, you can choose to take the form of your chosen dragon type (as dragonkind II).
37364d78-99c8-4c85-a39e-24e4dbe188ee: At 16th level, when you charge the {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} you make at the end of the charge deals additional {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g} equal {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} per four bloodrager levels you have.
bcffd31a-ea7b-47d5-a442-caca6d163cb4: At 16th level, whenever an enemy within {g|Encyclopedia:Reach}reach{/g} of the magus successfully casts a {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} defensively, that enemy provokes an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attack of opportunity{/g} from the magus after the spell is complete.
6b9a414f-168e-4497-857e-b457f75dee61: At 16th level, whenever an inquisitor uses her judgment ability, she selects three different judgments, instead of just two. This only consumes one use of her judgment ability. As a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}, the inquisitor can change one of these judgments to another type.
8f923a66-a35f-4dd3-b2a5-e74070fcde25: At 16th level, while using a tower shield, the tower shield specialist gains evasion, as the rogue class ability. If he makes a successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex saving throw{/g} against an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} that normally deals half {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} on a successful save, he instead takes no damage.
156d8f47-828d-4313-9597-0182e57cf2c0:
At 16th level, you can maximize your next {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} as though using the Maximize Spell {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}. Maximizing costs 3 daily usages of metamagic mastery.
Maximize Spell: All variable, numeric effects of a spell modified by this feat are maximized. {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Saving throws{/g} and opposed {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}rolls{/g} are not affected, nor are spells without random variables.
9acb16c9-5d25-455c-b72a-4a1f3a38a6fa: At 16th level, you gain a +4 deflection {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} and a +4 resistance bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} made or effects created by evil creatures.
81146a0d-ce09-411a-843f-707f731c46a6: At 17th level, a bloodrager no longer becomes fatigued at the end of his bloodrage.
489326c2-97bc-483f-824d-66fcac141bc3:
At 17th level, a paladin gains {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} 5/evil and immunity to compulsion {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}spell-like abilities{/g}. Each ally within 10 feet of her gains a +4 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against compulsion effects.
This ability functions only while the paladin is conscious, not if she is {g|Encyclopedia:Injury_Death}unconscious{/g} or dead.
e58754b1-dbf7-43bd-8b63-4874addcc0e4: At 17th level, an urban hunter and her animal companion can each attempt an Intimidate {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} to demoralize a foe as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}.
0a0217ac-071a-48ee-8d60-48be04f62d71:
At 17th level, the hunter's animal companion are respected or even feared by other animals.
The hunter and her companion can attempt to demoralize all animals in a 30-foot radius as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}, as if using dazzling display.
f2290e8c-ca52-41ef-9c3c-a0b307c6e141: At 17th level, the phantasmal mage can spend 3 points from her arcane reservoir as a {g|Encyclopedia:Free_Action}free action{/g} to make the next arcanist Illusion {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} she casts in 2 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} Maximized or 4 points to make it Quickened, as per using the corresponding metamagic {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}.
59b8760c-c828-4d38-9924-e20a9e46a688: At 17th level, the {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} die does not increase, but the {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical{/g} multiplier becomes ×3.
12bcf862-75a0-4693-86ca-dfed5a7db079: At 17th level, the {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} die does not increase, but the {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical{/g} multiplier becomes ×3.
5211a367-2f89-4678-97a5-59e79de38a4f: At 17th level, the {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} die does not increase, but the {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical{/g} multiplier becomes ×3.
87a7723d-d7fe-4a49-b5d8-cb35015bbcca: At 18 level, a preservationist adds summon nature's ally IX to his formula book as a 6th-level extract.
6c562947-842e-42b2-a1b7-6829eff470db: At 18th level inspire ferocity grants all affected allies the effect of the greater magic fang {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}.
bb1b0de5-32a6-475b-91b7-5468218b8d7c: At 18th level inspire ferocity grants all affected allies the effect of the greater magic fang {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}.
8c813a9f-0955-4bc5-bcac-225465c97890: At 19th level, a fighter gains {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g} 5/— whenever he is wearing armor or using a shield.
2192c326-8cfc-4c7a-b21c-4fad85a79e9d: At 19th level, a kineticist chooses one type of metakinesis, such as empower or quicken. She reduces the burn cost of that metakinesis by 1 point (to a minimum of 0 points).
17a59bb9-7a01-4241-a6cc-fa3480c2a20f: At 19th level, a sword saint's {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}roll{/g} is automatically a natural 20.
61018ac4-45ba-4075-b3de-070826087a84: At 19th level, as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, a two-handed fighter may make a single {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g} with a {g|Encyclopedia:Light_Weapon}two-handed{/g} weapon at a –5 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g}. If the {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} hits, it is treated as a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical{/g} threat. Special weapon abilities that activate only on a critical hit do not activate if this critical hit is confirmed.
9f395791-f9c9-4d45-92d0-33aeb80dac31: At 19th level, the character's ability to hunt his quarry improves. He can now select a quarry as a {g|Encyclopedia:Free_Action}free action{/g} and his insight {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} his quarry increases to +4.
828305c4-0de4-4763-85bf-8d4f207f42e5: At 19th level, the claws bypass {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} N/adamantine and N/-.
3bd03d47-2193-425c-bf84-bdf8eb2265ef: At 19th level, the magus gains access to an expanded {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} list. He learns 6 spells of any levels from 1st to 6th from the wizard's spell list and places them into his spellbook as magus spells of their wizard level.
82533b82-a8c6-4ced-ae9d-5151210bb423: At 19th level, the slams bypass {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} N/adamantine and N/-.
6247f318-3e51-453e-bc34-434cd8bb22a9: At 19th level, the spikes bypass {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} N/adamantine and N/-.
66b3b157-bcab-45b4-83c3-fca4864e4495: At 19th level, when a demonslayer chooses an evil outsider as his quarry, he can forgo the normal +4 {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} bonus and instead treat his weapon as if it had the holy weapon special ability while attacking his quarry.
ad7df776-478e-4f19-a72e-7a36baf6243c: At 19th level, when a stormwalker uses flash step, he can make two {g|Encyclopedia:RangedAttack}ranged attacks{/g} after his movement. Both of these {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} are made at his highest {g|Encyclopedia:BAB}base attack bonus{/g}.
4357d5dd-de0a-4c2c-8833-4a3a3b38c133: At 1st level a sohei gains a horse as a mount. A sohei may spend 1 point from his ki pool to grant his mount temporary {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} equal to twice his level for 1 hour per level.
499c0bbf-3a01-4cdb-aa6d-5a97ef53b30a:
At 1st level a spirit hunter can, as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}, grant a +1 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} for 1 minute to any weapon she is holding. For every four levels beyond 1st, the weapon gains another +1 enhancement bonus, to a maximum of +5 at 17th level. These bonuses can be added to the weapon, stacking with existing weapon enhancement to a maximum of +5. Effects of multiple uses of this ability do not stack.
At 1st level, the bonus can be used to add ghost touch special ability to the weapon.
At 5th level, these bonuses can be used to add any of the following weapon special abilities: flaming, frost, keen, shock, or speed.
Adding these properties consumes an amount of bonus equal to the property's base price modifier. These special abilities are added to any the weapon already has, but duplicates do not stack. If the weapon is not magical, at least a +1 enhancement bonus must be added before any other special abilities can be added. These bonuses and special abilities are decided when the ability is used and cannot be changed until the next time the spirit hunter uses this ability. These bonuses do not function if the weapon is wielded by anyone other than the spirit hunter.
A spirit hunter can only enhance one weapon at a time with this ability. If she uses this ability again, the first use immediately ends.
This ability can be used a number of times per day equal to half the spirit hunter level plus her {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier.
d1316fab-d71f-46f9-be1d-7a302b7b7b91: At 1st level and every 4 levels thereafter, the exploiter wizard gains a single arcanist exploit. An exploiter wizard exploit cannot be selected more than once. Once an exploiter wizard exploit has been selected, it cannot be changed. Most exploiter wizard exploits require the exploiter wizard to expend points from her arcane reservoir to function. Unless otherwise noted, the {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} for an exploiter wizard exploit is equal to 10 + half the wizard's level + the wizard's {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier.
ab46a559-2b67-4d67-a299-227335610b69: At 1st level and every two levels after, student of war gains one skill as a class {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill{/g}.
effaa25f-8944-4562-a626-6fa692facf5a: At 1st level and every two levels higher than 1st (3rd, 5th, 7th, and 9th), the loremaster chooses one secret from the following list. He can't choose the same secret twice.
ee1de182-21b2-4231-b095-9fbddf1eb66e: At 1st level you gain a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:CMB}CMB{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:CMD}CMD{/g}. This bonus increases by +1 at 5th and 9th level.
d30098a1-1e33-4bff-9172-7f54b20089f7: At 1st level you gain an aura which you can use 3 times per day. It lasts 1 minute and grants all allies in a 30-foot radius a +1 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} against chaotic enemies. This bonus increases by +1 at 5th and 9th level.
9cc97808-a988-4339-a2a7-f10ab4a74569:
At 1st level, 2nd level, and every 4 levels thereafter, a monk can select a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}. These feats must be taken from the following list: Combat Reflexes, Dodge, Crane Style, Blind Fight, Improved {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}Initiative{/g}, Deflect Arrows.
At 6th level, the following feats are added to the list: Improved Trip, Improved Disarm
At 10th level, the following feats are added to the list: Improved {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}Critical{/g}, Improved Blind Fight.
A monk need not have any of the prerequisites normally required for these feats to select them.
28802c85-48a5-427e-9016-e66730f50ed7:
At 1st level, 2nd level, and every 4 levels thereafter, a scaled fist can select a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}. These feats must be taken from the following list: Combat Reflexes, Dodge, Crane Style, Blind Fight, Improved {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}Initiative{/g}, Dragon Style, Intimidating Prowess.
At 6th level, the following feats are added to the list: Improved Trip, Improved Disarm, Dazzling Display, Dragon Ferocity.
At 10th level, the following feats are added to the list: Improved {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}Critical{/g}, Dragon Roar.
A scaled fist need not have any of the prerequisites normally required for these feats to select them.
85c82b3b-61e3-441b-a275-6048b5cb2e9a:
At 1st level, 3rd level, and every four levels thereafter (7th, 11th, and so on), an oracle uncovers a new secret about her mystery that grants her powers and abilities. The oracle must select a revelation from the list of revelations available to her mystery. If a revelation is chosen at a later level, the oracle gains all of the abilities and bonuses granted by that revelation based on her current level. Unless otherwise noted, activating the power of a revelation is a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}.
Unless otherwise noted, the {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}save{/g} against these revelations is equal to 10 + 1/2 the oracle's level + the oracle's {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier.
c9e003ed-1fc0-4306-a6d9-4e18445c48be: At 1st level, a battle scion's bearing radiates command and presence, allowing her to tower over her opponents in social situations. The battle scion gets a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} equal to 1/2 her {g|Encyclopedia:Character_Level}character level{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Persuasion}Persuasion checks{/g} made to intimidate. However, her bardic knowledge ability applies to only {g|Encyclopedia:Knowledge_World}Knowledge (world){/g}.
48cdc9b7-71cd-45d0-96fb-dc0d6cb33410: At 1st level, a blood kineticist can use her abilities to wrack a target within 30 feet, harming the target by manipulating its blood from the inside. The target takes half the normal {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} of the blood kineticist's blast, and can attempt a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g} to reduce that amount to 1/4 normal damage, but the damage is untyped and ignores {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g}. This is a 1st-level form infusion that costs 0 points of burn and can be used with water and blood blasts.
c7ca0afa-0683-4181-8d91-0ab5b3d7d631: At 1st level, a blood kineticist can use her abilities to wrack a target within 30 feet, harming the target by manipulating its blood from the inside. The target takes half the normal {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} of the blood kineticist's blast, and can attempt a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g} to reduce that amount to 1/4 normal damage, but the damage is untyped and ignores {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g}. This is a 1st-level form infusion that costs 0 points of burn and can be used with water and blood blasts.
9ebad2a4-4281-41f4-8520-5aefb55bbcd2:
At 1st level, a cauldron witch gains the ability to make an arcane mixture — a special substance that enhances her allies' abilities. Each arcane mixture gives a +2 alchemical {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to one of the abilities for a number of minutes equal to her witch level. She can use this ability a number of times equal to 3 plus her {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier.
At 11th level, the bonus increases to +4.
aca4033f-ce3c-4d6b-9ca5-b6ee7b9dd3d5: At 1st level, a cavalier must pledge himself to a specific order. The order grants the cavalier a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonuses{/g}, class {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}special abilities{/g}.
0bcaa198-9090-4c08-a844-44174025cdd7: At 1st level, a cavalier receives a teamwork {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} as a bonus feat. He must meet the prerequisites for this feat. As a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, the cavalier can grant his teamwork feat to all allies within 30 feet who can see and hear him. Allies retain the use of this bonus feat for 3 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} plus 1 round for every two levels the cavalier possesses. Allies do not need to meet the prerequisites of these bonus feats. The cavalier can use this ability once per day at 1st level, plus one additional time per day at 5th level and for every 5 levels thereafter.
2ff87cf1-13a8-450f-b0bb-a5e64a371249:
At 1st level, a champion of the faith must select one of the following as his chosen {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}alignment{/g}: chaos, evil, good, or law. This choice must be one of the alignments shared by the champion of the faith and his deity. Additionally, a champion of the faith gets the blessing corresponding to his chosen alignment, even if it's not on his deity's list of domains.
His chosen alignment's opposite is referred to as his opposed alignment. Good and evil oppose one another, just as law and chaos oppose one another.
09264d44-fe44-44c8-9859-2433bfb636dd: At 1st level, a demonslayer must choose favored enemy (evil outsider). At 5th level and every time he advances his favored enemy bonus, the demonslayer must advance his bonus against evil outsiders. In addition to the normal benefits of favored enemy, a demonslayer gains a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} equal to half his favored enemy bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}spell-like abilities{/g}, and supernatural abilities of evil outsiders.
e69e1995-b43e-4489-9f0a-93bed9543366:
At 1st level, a druid forms a bond with nature. This bond can take one of two forms. The first is a close tie to the natural world, granting the druid one of the following cleric domains: Air, Animal, Earth, Fire, Plant, Water, or Weather. When determining the powers and bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} granted by this domain, the druid's effective cleric level is equal to her druid level. A druid that selects this option also receives additional domain spell slots, just like a cleric. She must prepare the spell from her domain in this slot and this spell cannot be used to cast a spell spontaneously.
The second option is to form a close bond with an animal companion. Unlike normal animals of its kind, an animal companion's {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}Hit Dice{/g}, abilities, {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g} advance as the druid advances in level. If a character receives an animal companion from more than one source, her effective druid levels stack for the purposes of determining the statistics and abilities of the companion. Most animal companions increase in {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} when their druid reaches 4th or 7th level, depending on the companion.
d0e26ec1-843b-483a-b58d-8df19996abc5:
At 1st level, a feyspeaker allows the strange idylls of the fey to guide her magic. The feyspeaker uses her {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} score instead of her {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} score as her key {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spellcasting{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability score{/g} (to determine her spell {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DCs{/g}, bonus spells per day, {g|Encyclopedia:Concentration}concentration checks{/g}, and so on).
At 4th, 6th, 8th, 10th, 12th, 14th, 16th, and 18th levels, a feyspeaker adds one Enchantment or Illusion spell from the sorcerer/wizard spell list to her druid spell list as a spell of 1 level higher (for instance, at 4th level, she could add color spray as a 2nd-level druid spell). In order to select a spell, she must be of a level high enough (including the increased spell level) to cast it. Once selected, the spell cannot be changed.
bd1d6ab3-642c-4220-8297-9aa5e658f325:
At 1st level, a fiendflesh shifter can temporarily transform her body into an amalgam of otherworldly evil creatures as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}. While in this form, the fiendflesh shifter gains a gore {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} that deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} (1d4 points of damage if the fiendflesh shifter is Small) and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} 1/good. She can maintain this form for a number of minutes per day equal to 3 + her shifter level. The duration does not need to be consecutive, but it must be spent in 1-minute increments.
At 5th level, the fiendflesh shifter's DR increases to 2/good, and she also grows a pair of bat-like wings when in her fiendish aspect, granting her immunity to ground-based effects.
At 10th level, the fiendflesh shifter's DR increases to 5/good, and the electricity and fire {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resistance{/g} provided by her fiendish resilience ability doubles while she is in her fiendish aspect.
At 15th level, the fiendflesh shifter's DR increases to 7/good, and she gains a +4 inherent {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on Reflex {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g}.
At 20th level, the fiendflesh shifter's DR increases to 10/good. She also gains {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Immunity}immunity{/g} to electricity and fire and {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g} equal to 15 + her shifter level.
This replaces wild shape, shifter aspect, and all improvements to shifter aspect.
cb8795de-4052-4e20-9cb3-995a292dc984:
At 1st level, a hellknight selects a creature type from the ranger favored enemies list. He gets a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} against them.
At 5th level and 9th level this bonus increases by additional +2.
If the hellknight chooses humanoids or outsiders as a favored enemy, he must also choose an associated subtype, as indicated on the table below. If a specific creature falls into more than one category of favored enemy, the ranger's bonuses do not stack; he simply uses whichever bonus is higher.
949c393a-ab3b-4c88-9300-78561d63a73a: At 1st level, a kinetic knight gains the kinetic blade form infusion, and it costs 0 points of burn instead of 1 point. She can't use her kinetic blast without the kinetic blade form infusion or an infusion that lists kinetic blade as a prerequisite.
aab6f2cd-d2fc-4357-8e4f-adf80c7fb733: At 1st level, a kineticist can overexert herself to channel more power than normal, pushing past the limit of what is safe for her body by accepting burn. Some of her wild talents allow her to accept burn in exchange for a greater effect, while others require her to accept a certain amount of burn to use that talent at all. For each point of burn she accepts, a kineticist takes (1 per {g|Encyclopedia:Character_Level}character level{/g}) points of nonlethal {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}. This damage can't be healed by any means other than getting a full night's {g|Encyclopedia:Rest}rest{/g}, which removes all burn and associated nonlethal damage. Nonlethal damage from burn can't be reduced or redirected, and a kineticist incapable of taking nonlethal damage can't accept burn. A kineticist can accept only 1 point of burn per {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. This limit rises to 2 points of burn at 6th level, and rises by 1 additional point every 3 levels thereafter. A kineticist can't choose to accept burn if it would put her total number of points of burn higher than (3 + her {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} modifier), though she can be forced to accept more burn from a source outside her control. A kineticist who has accepted burn never benefits from abilities that allow her to ignore or alter the effects she receives from nonlethal damage.
987eb4f4-ffd5-47b2-9dff-b41aeb1b0c64: At 1st level, a kineticist chooses one primary element on which to focus. This element determines how she accesses the raw power of the Ethereal Plane, and grants her access to specific wild talents and additional class {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g}. She gains her selected element's basic utility wild talent (basic aerokinesis, etc.) as a bonus wild talent.
b53aaf8d-a392-489f-9d80-eadd5c91147f:
At 1st level, a kineticist gains a kinetic blast wild talent of her choice. This kinetic blast must be a simple blast that matches her element.
As a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, the kineticist can unleash a kinetic blast at a single target in close range. She must have at least one hand free to aim the blast. All {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} from a kinetic blast is treated as magic for the purpose of bypassing {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g}. Kinetic blasts count as a type of weapon for the purpose of {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g} such as Weapon Focus. The kineticist is never considered to be wielding or gripping the kinetic blast, and she can't use Vital Strike feats with kinetic blasts. Even the weakest kinetic blast involves a sizable mass of elemental matter or energy, so kinetic blasts always deal full damage to swarms of any {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} (though only area blasts deal extra damage to swarms).
Each simple blast is either a physical blast or an energy blast.
Physical blasts are {g|Encyclopedia:RangedAttack}ranged attacks{/g} that deal an amount of damage equal to {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g}+1 + the kineticist's {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} modifier, increasing by 1d6+1 for every 2 kineticist levels beyond 1st. {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}Spell resistance{/g} doesn't apply against physical blasts.
Energy blasts are ranged {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attacks{/g} that deal an amount of damage equal to 1d6 + 1/2 the kineticist's Constitution modifier, increasing by 1d6 for every 2 kineticist levels beyond 1st.
Composite blasts combine elements to form a new blast. When a kineticist gains a new element through expanded element, she gains access to all composite blasts for which she qualifies.
Most composite blasts are either physical or energy blasts, like simple blasts.
Physical composite blasts deal an amount of damage equal to 2d6+2 + the kineticist's Constitution modifier, increasing by 2d6+2 for every 2 kineticist levels beyond 1st.
Energy composite blasts deal an amount of damage equal to 2d6 + 1/2 the kineticist's Constitution modifier, increasing by 2d6 for every 2 kineticist levels beyond 1st.
65752301-45a1-4254-b852-d1e2271ca7a8:
At 1st level, a kineticist gains an infusion wild talent from the list of options available based on her elemental focus. She gains additional infusions at 3rd, 5th, 9th, 11th, 13th, 17th, and 19th levels. By using infusions along with her kinetic blasts, a kineticist can alter her kinetic blasts to suit her needs. Infusions come in two types, each of which changes a kinetic blast differently: a substance infusion causes an additional effect, while a form infusion causes the kinetic blast to manifest in a different way. Each infusion can alter only certain kinds of kinetic blasts, which are listed in its Associated Blasts entry. Each time the kineticist uses one of her kinetic blast wild talents, she can apply up to one associated form infusion and up to one associated substance infusion.
Some infusions change the {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}action{/g} required to activate a kinetic blast or entirely transform the kinetic blast's normal effects.
The burn cost listed in each infusion's Burn entry is added to the burn cost of the kinetic blast the infusion modifies.
The {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} for a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}save{/g} against an infusion is based on the associated kinetic blast's effective {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} level, not the level of the infusion. The DCs for form infusions are calculated using the kineticist's {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} modifier instead of her {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} modifier. When a kineticist modifies a kinetic blast with a form infusion and a substance infusion that both require saving throws, each target first attempts a saving throw against the form infusion. If a target succeeds and a successful save negates the infusion's effects, the entire kinetic blast is negated; otherwise, the target then attempts a saving throw against the substance infusion. If a kineticist's form and substance infusions both alter the kinetic blast's {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}, apply the substance infusion's alteration first.
870a7d8e-0e87-4e1a-adda-5884ab2192ac: At 1st level, a ley line guardian is adept at channeling energy from ley lines to enhance her own {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}. As a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}, she can increase her effective {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} for the next spell she casts in that {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} by {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g}–1 levels. After performing a conduit surge, the ley line guardian must succeed at a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} = 10 + level of spell cast + number of additional caster levels granted) or become staggered for a number of minutes equal to the level of the spell cast. At 8th level, the caster level increase becomes 1d4. She can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + her {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier.
54fb5d27-2c49-462a-b183-c9df32445929: At 1st level, a mad dog gains the service of an animal companion, using the barbarian's level as her effective druid level.
642e0bdc-6f90-4811-846f-030d77920b3f:
At 1st level, a magus can expend 1 point from his arcane pool as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g} to grant any weapon he is holding a +1 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} for 1 minute. For every four levels beyond 1st, the weapon gains another +1 enhancement bonus, to a maximum of +5 at 17th level. These bonuses can be added to the weapon, stacking with existing weapon enhancement to a maximum of +5. Multiple uses of this ability do not stack with themselves.
At 5th level, these bonuses can be used to add any of the following weapon properties: flaming, flaming burst, frost, icy burst, keen, shock, shocking burst, or speed.
Adding these properties consumes an amount of bonus equal to the property's base price modifier. These properties are added to any the weapon already has, but duplicates do not stack. If the weapon is not magical, at least a +1 enhancement bonus must be added before any other properties can be added. These bonuses and properties are decided when the arcane pool point is spent and cannot be changed until the next time the magus uses this ability. These bonuses do not function if the weapon is wielded by anyone other than the magus.
A magus can only enhance one weapon in this way at one time. If he uses this ability again, the first use immediately ends.
0f2ffcc4-5d8e-47f8-8bdd-85c532bb0cdd: At 1st level, a magus learns to cast {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} and wield his weapons at the same time. This functions much like two-weapon fighting, but the off-hand weapon is a spell that is being cast. To use this ability, the magus must have one hand free, while wielding a light or {g|Encyclopedia:Light_Weapon}one-handed{/g} melee weapon in the other hand. As a {g|Encyclopedia:Full_Round_Action}full-round action{/g}, he can make all of his {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} with his melee weapon at a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} and can also cast any spell from the magus spell list with a {g|Encyclopedia:Casting_Time}casting time{/g} of 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} (any attack roll made as part of this spell also takes this penalty).
b96f6717-2b8b-486d-a6b5-b43ef99f1647:
At 1st level, a monk can make a flurry of blows as a full {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}. When making a flurry of blows, the monk can make one additional attack at his highest {g|Encyclopedia:BAB}base attack bonus{/g}. This additional attack stacks with the bonus attacks from haste and other similar effects. When using this ability, the monk can make these attacks with any combination of his {g|Encyclopedia:UnarmedAttack}unarmed{/g} strikes and weapons that have the monk special weapon quality. He takes no {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} for using multiple weapons when making a flurry of blows, but he does not gain any additional attacks beyond what's already granted by the flurry for doing so. (He can still gain additional attacks from a high base attack bonus, from this ability, and from haste and similar effects).
At 11th level, a monk can make an additional attack at his highest base attack bonus whenever he makes a flurry of blows. This stacks with the first attack from this ability and additional attacks from haste and similar effects.
1a676736-29ad-420e-949d-c3dc4f6c9a5e:
At 1st level, a monk gains Improved Unarmed Strike as a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}. The {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} dealt by a Medium monk's {g|Encyclopedia:UnarmedAttack}unarmed{/g} strike increases with level: {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} at levels 1–3, 1d8 at levels 4–7, 1d10 at levels 8–11, 2d6 at levels 12–15, 2d8 at levels 16–19, and 2d10 at level 20.
If the monk is Small, his unarmed strike damage increases as follows: 1d4 at levels 1–3, 1d6 at levels 4–7, 1d8 at levels 8–11, 1d10 at levels 12–15, 2d6 at levels 16–19, and 2d8 at level 20.
If the monk is Large, his unarmed strike damage increases as follows: 1d8 at levels 1–3, 2d6 at levels 4–7, 2d8 at levels 8–11, 3d6 at levels 12–15, 3d8 at levels 16–19, and 4d8 at level 20.
50035259-35a2-40d2-8731-124bae79220e: At 1st level, a possessed shaman selects two {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g}. The possessed shaman treats these skills as if she had a number of ranks in them equal to her shaman level, and uses her {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier in place of the ability modifier the skills would normally use. These ranks do not stack with her other skill ranks (only the higher number of ranks applies).
b3ff9df4-966a-4b4e-b8ff-651083c45d3e:
At 1st level, a quarterstaff master can make a flurry of blows as a full {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}. When making a flurry of blows, the monk can make one additional attack at his highest {g|Encyclopedia:BAB}base attack bonus{/g}. This additional attack stacks with the bonus attacks from haste and other similar effects. When using this ability, the quarterstaff master can make these attacks only with quarterstaves.
At 11th level, a quarterstaff master can make an additional attack at his highest base attack bonus whenever he makes a flurry of blows. This stacks with the first attack from this ability and additional attacks from haste and similar effects.
fba9fd38-6840-408f-bd2e-e017a04284f4:
At 1st level, a ranger selects a creature type from the ranger favored enemies list. He gets a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} against them.
At 5th level and every five levels thereafter (10th, 15th, and 20th level), the ranger may select an additional favored enemy. In addition, at each such interval, the bonus against any one favored enemy (including the one just selected, if so desired) increases by +2.
If the ranger chooses humanoids or outsiders as a favored enemy, he must also choose an associated subtype, as indicated on the table below. If a specific creature falls into more than one category of favored enemy, the ranger's bonuses do not stack; he simply uses whichever bonus is higher.
f7e1d5b6-0c70-4b48-87fd-525e0264a1d4:
At 1st level, a ranger selects a creature type from the ranger favored enemies list. He gets a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} against them.
At 5th level and every five levels thereafter (10th, 15th, and 20th level), the ranger may select an additional favored enemy. In addition, at each such interval, the bonus against any one favored enemy (including the one just selected, if so desired) increases by +2.
If the ranger chooses humanoids or outsiders as a favored enemy, he must also choose an associated subtype, as indicated on the table below. If a specific creature falls into more than one category of favored enemy, the ranger's bonuses do not stack; he simply uses whichever bonus is higher.
Demons of Magic are the group of demons who prefer to use {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} in battle. Some of the Demons of Magic are dretch, oolioddroo, and succubus.
d4f7c52c-ad4e-466a-b9b4-92d10a283a8a:
At 1st level, a ranger selects a creature type from the ranger favored enemies list. He gets a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} against them.
At 5th level and every five levels thereafter (10th, 15th, and 20th level), the ranger may select an additional favored enemy. In addition, at each such interval, the bonus against any one favored enemy (including the one just selected, if so desired) increases by +2.
If the ranger chooses humanoids or outsiders as a favored enemy, he must also choose an associated subtype, as indicated on the table below. If a specific creature falls into more than one category of favored enemy, the ranger's bonuses do not stack; he simply uses whichever bonus is higher.
Demons of Slaughter is a group of demons who use martial weapons and have a lot of attacks or special attack effects, such as sneak attack. Some of the Demons of Slaughter are babau, cambion, and incubus.
353994ce-14cb-431b-8c1a-3f475e752b70:
At 1st level, a ranger selects a creature type from the ranger favored enemies list. He gets a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} against them.
At 5th level and every five levels thereafter (10th, 15th, and 20th level), the ranger may select an additional favored enemy. In addition, at each such interval, the bonus against any one favored enemy (including the one just selected, if so desired) increases by +2.
If the ranger chooses humanoids or outsiders as a favored enemy, he must also choose an associated subtype, as indicated on the table below. If a specific creature falls into more than one category of favored enemy, the ranger's bonuses do not stack; he simply uses whichever bonus is higher.
Demons of Strength is a group of demons who use martial weapons and powerful attacks. Some of the Demons of Strength are balor, nalfeshnee, and vavakia.
c92200ae-aef7-4fbf-a604-22e6137a2a5f: At 1st level, a rogue gains Weapon Finesse as a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}. In addition, starting at 3rd level, she can select any one type of weapon that can be used with Weapon Finesse (such as rapiers or daggers). Once this choice is made, it cannot be changed. Whenever she makes a successful {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g} with the selected weapon, she adds her {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} modifier instead of her {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} modifier to the {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage roll{/g}. If any effect would prevent the rogue from adding her Strength modifier to the damage roll, she does not add her Dexterity modifier. The rogue can select a second weapon at 11th level and a third at 19th level.
ae8a9089-186e-4ce1-9392-cc334acf04b8: At 1st level, a sanctified slayer gains the slayer's studied target class feature. She uses her inquisitor level as her effective slayer level to determine the effects of studied target.
8c80b9f8-b995-4f7f-93ba-b0dff1249ced: At 1st level, a shaman forms a close bond with a spirit animal tied to her chosen spirit. This animal is her conduit to the spirit world, guiding her along the path to enlightenment. The animal also aids a shaman by granting her a {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}special ability{/g}. A shaman must commune with her spirit animal each day to prepare her {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}.
a33706ab-9710-49e0-b566-b450920969db:
At 1st level, a shifter gains her first aspect — a category of animal to which her body and soul have become supernaturally attuned. She can shift into her aspect's minor form for a number of minutes per day equal to 3 + her shifter level. The duration does not need to be consecutive, but it must be spent in 1-minute increments. Shifting into a minor form is a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}, while ending the effect is a {g|Encyclopedia:Free_Action}free action{/g}. Until a shifter reaches 9th level and gains the chimeric aspect class feature, she can assume only one minor form at a time. Shifting to a new aspect (or aspects, in the case of chimeric aspects or greater chimeric aspects) ends all minor forms currently manifested.
As the shifter gains levels, she gains more aspects; she gains her second aspect at 5th level, a third aspect at 10th level, and a fourth at 15th level.
cd422f78-a5b7-420d-bf7a-e4fa62f76594: At 1st level, a sorcerer gains a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}. At each such opportunity, she can choose a metamagic feat, spell focus feat, or any other {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spellcaster{/g} feat. The sorcerer must still meet all prerequisites for a bonus feat, including {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} minimums.
bcc47e8d-9063-42e9-8fea-7cc81bb39f26:
At 1st level, a stalwart defender can enter a defensive stance, a position of readiness and trance-like determination. A stalwart defender can maintain this stance for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} per day equal to 4 + his {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} modifier. At each level after 1st, he can maintain the stance for 2 additional rounds per day. Temporary increases to Constitution, such as those gained from the defensive stance and {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} like bear's endurance, do not increase the total number of rounds that the stalwart defender can maintain a defensive stance per day. The stalwart defender can enter a defensive stance as a {g|Encyclopedia:Free_Action}free action{/g}. The total number of rounds of defensive stance per day is renewed after resting for 8 hours, although these hours do not need to be consecutive. While in a defensive stance, a stalwart defender gains a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g} rolls, melee {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}, thrown weapon damage rolls, and Will {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g}. In addition, he gains a +2 dodge bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}Armor Class{/g} and 2 temporary {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}Hit Die{/g}. While in a defensive stance, a stalwart defender cannot willingly move from his current position through any means.
The stalwart defender can end his defensive stance as a free {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}action{/g}; after ending the stance, he is fatigued for a number of rounds equal to 2 times the number of rounds spent in the stance. A stalwart defender cannot enter a new defensive stance while fatigued or exhausted but can otherwise enter a stance multiple times during a single encounter or combat. If a stalwart defender falls {g|Encyclopedia:Injury_Death}unconscious{/g}, his defensive stance immediately ends, placing him in peril of death. A defensive stance requires a level of emotional calm, and it may not be maintained by a character in a rage (such as from the rage class feature or the rage spell).
2cd8d6bd-de39-4e09-8cb7-b1467b1ff0d3: At 1st level, a steelblood gains a +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}combat maneuver{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g}, to {g|Encyclopedia:CMD}CMD{/g} against overrun combat maneuvers. He also gains a +1 bonus to his {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} against charge {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} and on attack and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} against charging creatures.
a504b704-b4a8-4e52-a7fe-2e5722d93132: At 1st level, a tranquil whisperer can use his performance to inspire tranquility in his allies (including himself), bolstering their defenses. To be affected, an ally must be able to perceive the bard's performance. An affected ally receives a +1 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} and suppresses the effects of all kinds of rage. At 5th level, and every six bard levels thereafter, this bonus increases by +1, to a maximum of +4 at 17th level.
5d718954-71cf-4304-b1c7-63324eb4bfbe: At 1st level, a white mage can expend 1 point from her arcane reservoir to use one of her {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} slots to cast a {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}cure{/g} spell (any spell with "cure" in its name) from the cleric spell list as if it were on her spell list and prepared. The spell must be of a level the arcanist can cast. At 10th level, the white mage can expend 5 points from her arcane reservoir and a spell slot of at least 5th level to cast breath of life.
0a70a684-275f-45a7-b251-399474c4ad2b:
At 1st level, a winter witch's mastery of the cold becomes so great that any {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} with cold descriptor she casts has its {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} increased by 1. Additionally, all spells with fire descriptor she casts have their saving throw DC decreased by 1.
At 5th and 10th level this {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} are increased by 1, up to a maximum of 3.
50e7fee7-f2b1-47db-b105-85aea77f3ab8:
At 1st level, a witch forms a close bond with a familiar, a creature that teaches her magic and helps to guide her along her path. Familiars also aid a witch by granting her {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill{/g} bonuses, additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}, and help with some types of magic.
A witch must commune with her familiar each day to prepare her spells. Familiars store all of the spells that a witch knows, and a witch cannot prepare a spell that is not stored by her familiar. A witch's familiar begins play storing all of the 0-level witch spells plus three 1st level spells of the witch's choice. The witch also selects a number of additional 1st-level spells equal to her {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier to store in her familiar. At each new witch level, she adds two new spells of any spell level or levels that she can cast (based on her new witch level) to her familiar. A witch can also add additional spells to her familiar through a special ritual.
5179b421-32ae-4d6b-9e78-49dbd88e7683: At 1st level, a {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} dancer gains the ability to expend 1 point from his arcane pool as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g} to gain a +10 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to his movement rate and a +2 dodge bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} against {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attacks of opportunity{/g} for 1 minute. For every four levels beyond 1st, the spell dancer gains another +10 enhancement bonus to movement and +2 to AC against {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} of opportunity. At 5th level, once per spell dance as a swift {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}action{/g}, the spell dancer may use blur or haste on himself as a swift action. These abilities last for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. At 9th level, the spell dancer may instead take a swift action to use dimension door as a {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}spell-like ability{/g} once during a spelldance. At 13th level, the spell dancer may instead choose to take a swift action to gain freedom of movement for {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} rounds.
5ef2f5aa-39fb-441e-9022-6a540cac23a4: At 1st level, affected allies gain a +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} and a +1 bonus on Will {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g}, but also take a –1 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}. While under the effects of inspired rage, allies other than the skald cannot use any ability that requires patience or {g|Encyclopedia:Concentration}concentration{/g}. At 4th level and every 4 levels thereafter, the song's bonuses on Will saves increase by 1; the penalty to AC doesn't change. At 8th and 16th levels, the song's bonuses to {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} and damage increase by 1. (Unlike the barbarian's rage ability, those affected are not fatigued after the song ends.)
8ae1b803-ebf2-454b-8dd0-756cf24de4cb: At 1st level, affected allies gain a +2 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} and a +1 morale bonus on Will {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g}, but they also take a –1 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}. At 4th level and every 4 skald levels thereafter, the song's bonus on Will saves increases by 1; the penalty to AC doesn't change. At 8th and 16th levels, the song's bonuses to Intelligence and Charisma increase by 2. (Unlike the barbarian's rage ability, those affected are not fatigued after the song ends.)
f5580f6c-d911-4749-9dbb-cc88084ae1b2:
At 1st level, an alchemist discovers how to create a mutagen that he can imbibe in order to heighten his physical prowess at the cost of his personality.
It's a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} to drink a mutagen. Upon being imbibed, the mutagen causes the alchemist to grow bulkier and more bestial, granting him a +2 natural armor {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} and a +4 alchemical bonus to the selected {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability score{/g} for 10 minutes per alchemist level. In addition, while the mutagen is in effect, the alchemist takes a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to one of his mental ability scores. If the mutagen enhances his {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g}, it applies a penalty to his {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g}.
