If it enhances his {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g}, it applies a penalty to his {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g}. If it enhances his {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g}, it applies a penalty to his {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g}.
bf9c1e4a-5753-4705-9617-1a54ac291dfc: At 1st level, an arcane trickster selects an arcane {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spellcasting{/g} class she belonged to before adding the prestige class. When a new arcane trickster level is gained, the character gains new spells per day and new spells known as if she had also gained a level in that spellcasting class.
aed909f2-8a29-45ef-89e9-90a57d8fa21d: At 1st level, an arcanist can expend an available arcanist {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} slot as a {g|Encyclopedia:Move_Action}move action{/g}, making it unavailable for the rest of the day, just as if she had used it to cast a spell. She can use this ability a number of times per day equal to her {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier (minimum 1). Doing this adds a number of points to her arcane reservoir equal to the level of the spell slot consumed. She cannot consume {g|Encyclopedia:Cantrips_Orisons}cantrips{/g} (0 level spells) in this way. Points gained in excess of the reservoir's maximum are lost.
1d1ea5e4-083b-40ac-962f-391fbbe7c917: At 1st level, an eldritch knight may choose a bonus combat {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}. This is in addition to the feats that a character of any class normally gets from advancing levels. The character must still meet any prerequisites for these bonus feats. An eldritch knight gains an additional combat feat at 5th and 9th level.
9d58b4bd-3302-4923-8a1c-3aaa370e1eb2: At 1st level, an elemental rampager gains a claw {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} that deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} (for {g|Encyclopedia:Size}medium{/g} creature). At 9th level, the damage of his claw increases to 1d8, and at at 15th level, it increases to 1d10.
7b053d66-d2d5-4fe2-a872-613abc26fdf6:
At 1st level, an elemental specialist selects one element. He gains the ability to convert elemental {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} into his chosen element.
At 15th level, his spells of the chosen element also deal half of the damage as untyped damage.
20d5396b-55be-4ffa-a3b0-48d8c4857b60:
At 1st level, an elemental witch selects one type of energy. She gains the ability to use this energy to create a ray of destruction, dealing {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}energy damage{/g} plus an additional 1d6 {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} for every 3 witch levels as a ranged {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g}.
At 11th level, she selects one more energy type.
cd22765b-abbe-4315-bdeb-981b963725c5: At 1st level, an executioner's studied target bonuses and the {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DCs{/g} of the {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against his slayer abilities increase by 1 against humanoid opponents, but decrease by 1 against non-humanoid targets.
71ffe019-238d-4d33-8fc1-14bad9d88146: At 1st level, an overwhelming mage gains a +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on all {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g} made to overcome a target's {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g}. This bonus increases by +1 for every 6 levels thereafter.
cab775a6-edbe-4f11-88fa-d958cfabfac8: At 1st level, and at every even level thereafter, a fighter gains a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} in addition to those gained from normal advancement (meaning that the fighter gains a feat at every level). These bonus feats must be selected from those listed as Combat Feats, sometimes also called "fighter bonus feats."
eb71d1c5-c890-4c44-8790-2fb8c3621e55: At 1st level, and at every level thereafter, a Hellknight signifer gains new {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} per day as if he had also gained a level in a spellcasting class he belonged to before adding the prestige class. He does not, however, gain any other benefit a character of that class would have gained, except for additional spells per day, spells known, and an increased effective level of spellcasting. If a character had more than one spellcasting class before becoming a Hellknight signifer, he must decide to which class he adds the new level for purposes of determining spells per day.
c74b996e-86ce-4035-8a99-00911efda428: At 1st level, any potion that the cauldron witch drinks works as if it was made by a caster of the witch's level.
6bb0589d-2693-4f32-8b7e-f64f833e8b2c: At 1st level, as a {g|Encyclopedia:Move_Action}move action{/g} you can create an illusory double of yourself. This double functions as a single mirror image, and lasts for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to your warpriest level, or until the illusory duplicate is dispelled or destroyed. You can have no more than one double at a time. The double created by this ability doesn't stack with the additional images from the mirror image {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}. This ability doesn't stack with the additional {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} from the mirror image spell.
288f9d82-9181-4ca7-8c64-4171e5b97605:
At 1st level, as a {g|Encyclopedia:Move_Action}move action{/g} you can create an illusory double of yourself. This double functions as a single mirror image, and lasts for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to your warpriest level, or until the illusory duplicate is dispelled or destroyed. You can have no more than one double at a time. The double created by this ability doesn't stack with the additional images from the mirror image {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}. This ability doesn't stack with the additional {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} from the mirror image spell.
At 10th level, as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g} you can become invisible for 1 round (as greater invisibility).
efc3d971-62bd-47cd-9d4a-80dc1b570de5: At 1st level, as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g} up to three times a day you can infuse your {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} with hellfire. When you do, your {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attacks{/g} gain the flaming weapon special ability for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. At 12th level, you can use this ability five times per day, and the effect is treated as flaming burst.
45348771-9938-4aa7-9ee3-22760d89bb47: At 1st level, as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g} you can focus your own strength. You gain an enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} equal to 1/2 your warpriest level (minimum +1) on {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g} rolls, {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}combat maneuver{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g} that rely on {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g}, Strength-based {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g}, and Strength checks for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}.
f424e7ea-73fe-4407-a614-bc37a3cafa22:
At 1st level, as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g} you can focus your own strength. You gain an enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} equal to 1/2 your warpriest level (minimum +1) on {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g} rolls, {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}combat maneuver{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g} that rely on {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g}, Strength-based {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g}, and Strength checks for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}.
At 10th level, as a swift {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}action{/g} you can ignore the movement {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalties{/g} caused by wearing medium or heavy armor. This effect lasts for 1 minute. During this time, you can add your Strength modifier on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against effects that would cause you to become entangled, staggered, or paralyzed.
fc23e294-5792-4a08-b290-a44b14f5b36b: At 1st level, as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g} you can target a creature within 30 feet that has the cowering, frightened or paralyzed condition. That condition is suspended for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}, and the chosen creature gains the confused condition instead. The confused creature {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}rerolls{/g} any result other than "{g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} self" or "attack nearest creature." The round spent confused counts toward the duration of the suspended effect. At the end of the confused round, the suspended condition resumes.
8e827389-aa6a-4566-a7b4-e1036b3dc165:
At 1st level, as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g} you can target a creature within 30 feet that has the cowering, frightened, panicked, or paralyzed condition. That condition is suspended for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}, and the chosen creature gains the confused condition instead. The confused creature {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}rerolls{/g} any result other than "{g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} self" or "attack nearest creature." The round spent confused counts toward the duration of the suspended effect. At the end of the confused round, the suspended condition resumes.
At 10th level, as a swift {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}action{/g} you can choose one behavior for all confused creatures within 30 feet to exhibit (as if all creatures rolled the same result). This effect lasts for 1 round. You can use this ability even while you are confused.
93523374-37df-46ae-95f6-edda89233093: At 1st level, as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g} you gain increased mobility. For 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}, you ignore all difficult terrain (including magical terrain) and take no {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalties{/g} for moving through it.
4d6ea4e2-ed69-4a0e-bd6c-0e692e4d5385:
At 1st level, as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g} you gain increased mobility. For 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}, you ignore all difficult terrain (including magical terrain) and take no {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalties{/g} for moving through it.
At 10th level, you can teleport up to 20 feet as a {g|Encyclopedia:Move_Action}move action{/g}. You must have line of sight to your destination. This teleportation doesn't provoke {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attacks of opportunity{/g}
8b1fe508-c33b-4da0-8fe9-f1bbd866d703: At 1st level, as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}, an arcane bomber can sacrifice one of his {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} to empower the next bomb he throws during his turn. When he does, he gains a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to hit with the next bomb he throws before the end of his turn equal to the level of the spell he sacrificed, and a bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} equal to twice the level of the spell.
3f86bc3f-7759-4755-b700-70e6866581b9: At 1st level, enemies within 10 feet of you have -2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Concentration}concentration checks{/g}. This increase stacks with that granted by the Disruptive {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}.
ef8207fd-e49e-4ea7-b56c-41a007f463d7: At 1st level, fey power courses through your {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g}. Each time you confirm a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g}, the target must succeed at a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will saving throw{/g} or be confused for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. The {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of this save is equal to 10 + half your bloodrager level + your {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} modifier. This is a mind-affecting compulsion effect.
40f159c9-1093-4f05-8947-f48caf8c0889: At 1st level, for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}, you can ignore impediments to your mobility and effects that cause paralysis (as freedom of movement). You can activate this blessing even if you're otherwise unable to take {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}actions{/g}, but not if you're {g|Encyclopedia:Injury_Death}unconscious{/g}.
e5c7a332-1d0e-46a5-bfb9-4a25388b4477:
At 1st level, for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}, you can ignore impediments to your mobility and effects that cause paralysis (as freedom of movement). You can activate this blessing even if you're otherwise unable to take {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}actions{/g}, but not if you're {g|Encyclopedia:Injury_Death}unconscious{/g}.
At 10th level, as a swift action you can emit a 30-foot aura that affects all allies with the liberation blessing described above. This effect lasts for 1 round.
498d55c4-bec0-4889-a98d-175380948f80: At 1st level, once per day the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} master's understanding of spells allows him to increase his {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} by 4 for a single spell cast. He can do this twice per day at 8th level, and three times per day at 16th level.
0fe94784-b993-4445-b127-7486516141e5: At 1st level, skald gets a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} from the list.
9ab57b9f-34de-4927-b910-beae3a12a1cd:
At 1st level, the arcane bomber gains an ability nearly identical to the alchemist's bomb ability. Unlike the alchemist, at 1st level, the arcane bomber chooses one type of energy from the following list: acid, cold, fire, and electricity. He can throw bombs of that type, but cannot modify them with discoveries. An arcane bomber can use a number of bombs each day equal to his {g|Encyclopedia:Class_Level}class level{/g} + his {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier.
Thrown bombs have a range of 30 feet and use the Throw Splash Weapon special {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}. Bombs are considered weapons and can be selected using {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g} such as Point-Blank Shot and Weapon Focus. On a direct hit, an arcane bomber's bomb inflicts {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} of the chosen energy type + additional damage equal to the arcane bomber's Intelligence modifier. The damage of an arcane bomber's bomb increases by 1d6 points at every odd-numbered arcane bomber level. Splash damage from an arcane bomber's bomb is always equal to the bomb's minimum damage (so if the bomb would deal 2d6+4 points of damage of the chosen energy type on a direct hit, its splash damage would be 6 points of damage of chosen energy type). Those caught in the splash damage can attempt a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} for half damage. The {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of this save is equal to 10 + 1/2 the arcane bomber's level + the arcane bomber's Intelligence modifier.
5fc4ec8e-25c4-45e8-a9be-5247968800f9: At 1st level, the elemental master must select one element: air, earth, fire, or water. The arcanist can prepare one additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} per day of each level she can cast, but it must have the elemental descriptor of her chosen element. In addition, any spell she prepares from the opposite elemental school (air opposes earth, fire opposes water) takes up two of her prepared spell slots.
19eaef72-f8c3-4dac-8974-ababb11ae636: At 1st level, the freebooter can, as a {g|Encyclopedia:Move_Action}move action{/g}, indicate an enemy in combat and rally her allies to focus on that target. The freebooter and her allies gain a +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} against the target. At 5th level and every 5 levels thereafter (10th, 15th, and 20th level), the bonus increases by 1. The freebooter's bane lasts until the target dies or the freebooter selects a new target.
4865101c-aac9-4fb8-9951-95fc9176d491:
At 1st level, the hunter can grant an animal aspect to her animal companion. Unlike with the hunter herself, there is no duration on the animal aspect applied to her animal companion. An aspect applied in this way remains in effect until the hunter changes it.
If the hunter's animal companion is dead, the hunter can apply her companion's animal focus to herself instead of her animal companion.
Additionally, a hunter can take on the aspect of an animal as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}. She gets the same benefits as the current animal companion focus. The hunter can use this ability for a number of minutes per day equal to her level. This duration does not need to be consecutive, but must be spent in 1-minute increments.
9d760d4d-c9e1-4518-a797-6d423d65d7cb:
At 1st level, the kinetic knight becomes proficient with medium and heavy armor and shields (except tower shields).
A kinetic knight gains the elemental defense ability at 4th level, rather than 2nd.
This ability alters elemental defense.
04ad9663-8009-4c49-ac00-148ec759f97e:
At 1st level, the magus gains a reservoir of mystical arcane energy that he can draw upon to fuel his powers and enhance his weapon. This arcane pool has a number of points equal to 1/2 his magus level (minimum 1) + his {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier. The pool refreshes once per day when the magus prepares his {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}.
At 1st level, a magus can expend 1 point from his arcane pool as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g} to grant any weapon he is holding a +1 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} for 1 minute. For every four levels beyond 1st, the weapon gains another +1 enhancement bonus, to a maximum of +5 at 17th level. These bonuses can be added to the weapon, stacking with existing weapon enhancement to a maximum of +5. Multiple uses of this ability do not stack with themselves.
At 5th level, these bonuses can be used to add any of the following weapon properties: flaming, flaming burst, frost, icy burst, keen, shock, shocking burst, or speed.
Adding these properties consumes an amount of bonus equal to the property's base price modifier. These properties are added to any the weapon already has, but duplicates do not stack. If the weapon is not magical, at least a +1 enhancement bonus must be added before any other properties can be added. These bonuses and properties are decided when the arcane pool point is spent and cannot be changed until the next time the magus uses this ability. These bonuses do not function if the weapon is wielded by anyone other than the magus.
A magus can only enhance one weapon in this way at one time. If he uses this ability again, the first use immediately ends.
019a1f4c-5aca-4ab2-be6b-7558d4b2393e:
At 1st level, the magus gains a reservoir of mystical arcane energy that he can draw upon to fuel his powers and enhance his weapon. This arcane pool has a number of points equal to 1/2 his magus level (minimum 1) + his {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier. The pool refreshes once per day when the magus prepares his {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}.
At 1st level, a magus can expend 1 point from his arcane pool as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g} to grant any weapon he is holding a +1 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} for 1 minute. For every four levels beyond 1st, the weapon gains another +1 enhancement bonus, to a maximum of +5 at 17th level. These bonuses can be added to the weapon, stacking with existing weapon enhancement to a maximum of +5. Multiple uses of this ability do not stack with themselves.
At 5th level, these bonuses can be used to add any of the following weapon properties: flaming, flaming burst, frost, icy burst, keen, shock, shocking burst, or speed.
Adding these properties consumes an amount of bonus equal to the property's base price modifier. These properties are added to any the weapon already has, but duplicates do not stack. If the weapon is not magical, at least a +1 enhancement bonus must be added before any other properties can be added. These bonuses and properties are decided when the arcane pool point is spent and cannot be changed until the next time the magus uses this ability. These bonuses do not function if the weapon is wielded by anyone other than the magus.
A magus can only enhance one weapon in this way at one time. If he uses this ability again, the first use immediately ends.
801d1633-efa1-4ed2-83d1-337231705ae7: At 1st level, the mystic theurge selects a divine {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spellcasting{/g} class she belonged to before adding the prestige class. When a new mystic theurge level is gained, the character gains new spells per day and new spells known as if she had also gained a level in that spellcasting class.
296a19d9-bc24-47fd-a608-ba1aad556b9c: At 1st level, the mystic theurge selects an arcane {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spellcasting{/g} class she belonged to before adding the prestige class. When a new mystic theurge level is gained, the character gains new spells per day and new spells known as if she had also gained a level in that spellcasting class.
2eb59d17-3e9b-430c-9cf9-fc38f9d19a32: At 1st level, the spirit warden's dealings with the spirit world give her an unsettling demeanor. She gains a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on Intimidate {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g}.
20d096a9-b562-46a3-975b-02530ca6a4ce:
At 1st level, the unsworn shaman also forms a temporary bond with a minor spirit each day, granting her access to a shaman or witch hex of her choosing, but not a major hex or a grand hex. Until she changes the minor spirit, she continues to have access to the shaman or witch hex. At 2nd level, she can instead select a hex from one of her wandering spirits selected for that day.
She can make temporary bonds with two minor spirits (thus gaining two hexes) at 4th level, and with one additional minor spirit (and hex) every 4 levels thereafter.
c5a00f7f-406d-4c95-8077-bdfbff86831d: At 1st level, three times a day as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g} you can imbue your {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attacks{/g} with elemental energy. For 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}, your melee attacks deal {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of additional {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} of your energy type. At 8th level, you can use this ability up to five times per day. At 20th level, all your melee attacks deal this damage, and this ability no longer requires a swift {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}action{/g} to activate.
063a9833-4479-4c0a-847b-2f9204be7d7a: At 1st level, weapons wielded by a warpriest are charged with the power of his faith. In addition to the favored weapon of his deity, the warpriest can designate a weapon as a sacred weapon by selecting that weapon with the Weapon Focus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}; if he has multiple Weapon Focus feats, this ability applies to all of them. Whenever the warpriest hits with his sacred weapon, the weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} is based on his level and not the weapon type. The warpriest can decide to use the weapon's base damage instead of the sacred weapon damage. This increase in damage does not affect any other aspect of the weapon, and doesn't apply to alchemical items, bombs, or other weapons that only deal {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}energy damage{/g}.
fab22c51-597a-4775-85b1-ef9543a96d01:
At 1st level, when a witch gains her familiar, she must also select a patron. This patron is a vague and mysterious force, granting the witch power for reasons that she might not entirely understand. While these forces need not be named, they typically hold influence over one of the following forces.
At 2nd level, and every two levels thereafter, a witch's patron adds new {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} to a witch's list of spells known. These spells are also automatically added to the list of spells stored by the familiar. The spells gained depend upon the patron chosen.
a4eb1266-75bf-4436-a3d5-ebd5a8163f52: At 1st level, when an ecclesitheurge chooses his cleric domains, he designates one as his primary domain and the other as his secondary domain. An ecclesitheurge can use his non-domain {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} slots to prepare spells from his primary domain's spell list. Each day when he prepares spells, an ecclesitheurge can select a different domain granted by his deity to gain access to that domain's spell list instead of his secondary domain spell list. He does not lose access to his actual secondary domain's granted powers or gain access to the other domain's granted powers.
e672e04d-3ce4-4a68-9379-a7229ccac642: At 1st level, when you hit a creature with a charge {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}, that creature becomes shaken for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to 1/2 your bloodrager level (minimum 1). This effect does not cause an existing shaken or frightened condition (from this ability or another source) to turn into frightened or panicked. This is a mind-affecting fear effect.
1b781fce-5adb-4c5b-a7f2-e3ccdd49bb48: At 1st level, whenever you receive {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g}, you gain {g|Encyclopedia:Fast_Healing}fast healing{/g} 5 for the number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to your level in this prestige class. At 5th level you gain fast healing 10 and at 9th level you gain fast healing 15 instead.
12354113-f28b-4999-98ba-6656f44db03c: At 1st level, wizards form a powerful bond with an object or a creature. This bond can take one of two forms: a familiar or a bonded object. A familiar is a magical pet that enhances the wizard's {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g} and senses, while a bonded object is an item a wizard can use to cast additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}.
0cc82282-3fcc-424c-a11f-b95116ce59a1: At 1st level, you can add power to a {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}cure{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} as you cast it. As a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}, you can make your next cure spell empowered (as though using the Empower Spell {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}), causing it to heal 50% more {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} (or deal 50% more damage if used against undead). This ability doesn't stack with itself or the Empower Spell feat.
75945770-52b3-4027-aa47-2ef83afe0351:
At 1st level, you can add power to a {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}cure{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} as you cast it. As a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}, you can make your next cure spell empowered (as though using the Empower Spell {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}), causing it to heal 50% more {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} (or deal 50% more damage if used against undead). This ability doesn't stack with itself or the Empower Spell feat.
At 10th level, you can touch an ally and grant them {g|Encyclopedia:Fast_Healing}fast healing{/g} 3 for 1 minute
7255a12e-c8e2-460f-bace-aaa8269fd037: At 1st level, you can cause a creature to become shaken as a melee {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g}. This effect persists for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to 1/2 your sorcerer level (minimum 1). Multiple touches do not stack, but they do add to the duration. You can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + your {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier.
89ab6a69-37c1-4ecc-a2f2-ce5fa10f91c4: At 1st level, you can cause a creature to burst out laughing for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} as a melee {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g}. A laughing creature can only take a {g|Encyclopedia:Move_Action}move action{/g} but can defend itself normally. Once a creature has been affected by laughing touch, it is immune to its effects for 24 hours. You can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + your {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier. This is a mind-affecting effect.
8e26f6dd-e1ef-444e-aa9c-aeb4de54dff4: At 1st level, you can cause your melee weapon to fly from your grasp and strike an opponent, then instantly return to you. You can make a single {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} using a melee weapon at a range of 30 feet. This attack is treated as a {g|Encyclopedia:RangedAttack}ranged attack{/g} with a thrown weapon, except that you add your {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier to the attack roll instead of your {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} modifier (you still add your {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} modifier to the {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage roll{/g} as normal). This ability cannot be used to perform a {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}combat maneuver{/g}.
22b53791-96e3-47e0-a5e8-5b06551af8c3:
At 1st level, you can cause your melee weapon to fly from your grasp and strike an opponent, then instantly return to you. You can make a single {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} using a melee weapon at a range of 30 feet. This attack is treated as a {g|Encyclopedia:RangedAttack}ranged attack{/g} with a thrown weapon, except that you add your {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier to the attack roll instead of your {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} modifier (you still add your {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} modifier to the {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage roll{/g} as normal). This ability cannot be used to perform a {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}combat maneuver{/g}.
At 10th level, with a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g} he can recall any single warpriest {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} that he has already prepared and cast that day. The spell is prepared again, just as if it had not been cast.
5e76adab-9b10-4139-b016-aa034fc6cf17: At 1st level, you can create a flash of sunlight in the eyes of one of your opponents. The target is blinded for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. An undead creature that's touched is staggered for a number of rounds equal to your {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier (minimum 1).

At 8th level, the damage increases to 1d8 points (1d6 if you are Small). At 12th level, these claws deal an additional 1d6 points of damage of your energy type on a hit.
329f22d3-e628-48d2-9e6e-b8fe33373cd1: At 1st level, your {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attacks{/g} are considered {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}good-aligned{/g} weapons for the purpose of bypassing {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g}. Furthermore, when you deal {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} with a melee attack to an evil outsider, you deal an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of damage. This additional damage stacks with effects such as align weapon and those granted by a weapon with the holy weapon special ability.
5267d29b-db6a-4169-8ef8-9d1b5fd03136: At 1st, 5th, 10th, 15th, and 20th level, a wizard gains a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}. At each such opportunity, he can choose a metamagic feat, spell focus feat, or any other {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spellcaster{/g} feat. The wizard must still meet all prerequisites for a bonus feat, including {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} minimums.
6ba78564-894e-48e7-92b4-93ce3941a788: At 20th level, a barbarian's {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g} rolls, melee {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}, thrown weapon damage rolls, and Will {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g} while raging increases to +4. In addition, the amount of temporary {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} gained when entering a rage increases to 4 per {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}Hit Die{/g}.
b1cd4047-18e6-419c-bbd2-bfa05aba67cc: At 20th level, a battle scion becomes extremely difficult to kill. Once per day whenever she is slain, as long as her body isn't destroyed, once the combat ends she is resurrected with full {g|Encyclopedia:HP}HP{/g}.
8972dfde-2222-4b57-967f-8943b8b022af: At 20th level, a blood kineticist, because of her utter control over her own blood, is immune to bleed, poisons, diseases, and the sickened and nauseated conditions.
366298a8-fc06-4433-88ee-abc1d9803faa:
At 20th level, a colluding scoundrel becomes a master at dispatching distracted targets. As a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, she can make a single {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} against a foe that is taking the {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalties{/g} of her scapegoat ability and is adjacent to an ally currently designated as the scapegoat.
If the attack hits, the target takes {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} normally and must succeed at a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude saving throw{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} = 10 + half the colluding scoundrel's level + her {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier) or be slain. Whether or not the target succeeds, it cannot be targeted by this ability again (by any colluding scoundrel) for 24 hours.
c50c245f-7876-4ebc-bb58-5d02568355e0: At 20th level, a cruoromancer can use his blood infusions without taking {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}.
ed47de61-8fed-4202-8ac2-694ca0a370a1: At 20th level, a dragonblood shifter's tie to her draconic abilities reaches its peak. She becomes immune to sleep and paralysis effects. She can use wild shape to transform into a dragon at will.
3210bef8-5571-4e4d-9fd9-b510ef67f257: At 20th level, a dragonheir scion's draconic heritage becomes manifest. She gains immunity to paralysis, sleep, and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} of her energy type, as well as {g|Encyclopedia:Blindsense}blindsense{/g} with a range of 60 feet.
f896c164-8cbd-4438-b206-5f6ea1801f73: At 20th level, a feyform shifter gains access to a fourth aspect. When she uses shifter aspect, she can assume the minor forms of all her aspects in addition to her fey aspect, and she can use her major and minor forms at will.
375a26fb-a31a-4988-90b8-c1ef069141e9: At 20th level, a fiendflesh shifter can assume the minor forms of all her aspects at will.
295a4015-5b5b-47e0-8fad-7ac8d9a1ca70: At 20th level, a fighter chooses one weapon, such as the longsword, greataxe, or longbow. Any {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} made with that weapon automatically confirm all {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical{/g} threats and have their {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} multiplier increased by 1 (×2 becomes ×3, for example). In addition, he cannot be disarmed while wielding a weapon of this type.
e7226694-0337-4e69-9b77-ffc9cce18fcd: At 20th level, a gendarme represents the epitome of mounted combat. Whenever he makes a charge {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} while mounted, he deals triple the normal {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}. In addition, if the gendarme confirms a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g} on a charge attack while mounted, the attack deals additional damage equal to his weapon damage. Additional damage from weapon properties, magic effects, precision-based {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonuses{/g}, or other increases are {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}rolled{/g} normally.
cc3d6e84-09eb-4367-a6d7-807d3f285c98: At 20th level, a griffonheart shifter can use her major and minor forms at will.
b7547df9-1c05-4a0b-ae7b-8f0f37c50f18: At 20th level, a hunter becomes a master hunter. He gains the ability to receive the animal focus benefits any amount of times per day.
1b6b530c-73dd-4cb8-8cf2-97bd916179c0: At 20th level, a monk becomes a magical creature. The monk gains {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g} 10/chaotic, which allows him to ignore the first 10 points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} from any {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} made by a nonchaotic weapon or by any {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural attack{/g} made by a creature that doesn't have similar damage reduction.
9c451421-a04c-479e-969a-beee9b8bd19b: At 20th level, a paladin becomes a conduit for the power of her god. Her {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} increases to 10/evil and whenever she channels positive energy or uses lay on hands to {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g} a creature, she heals the maximum possible amount.
d7038062-a9c5-4e34-89ed-66192939fda0: At 20th level, a shifter gains access to a fifth aspect, and when she uses her shifter aspect ability, she can assume the minor forms of all her aspects; the shifter can also use her major and minor forms at will.
27b91e33-687f-4702-90f7-8a15fbd50019: At 20th level, a skald's inspired rage no longer gives allies a {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}, nor limits what skills or abilities they can use. Additionally, they act as if under a haste effect.
216bac92-c301-4845-99d8-b9b96c86af3a: At 20th level, a standard bearer's banner has become a powerful rallying point to his allies, and a bane to his foes. Whenever his banner is visible, allies of the standard bearer within 60 feet gain a +1 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g}, immunity to fear effects, and a +3 morale bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against mind-affecting effects.
43a34651-1b70-4ef1-990c-dffc17f0b8c4: At 20th level, a stonelord's body transforms into living stone. She no longer needs to eat, drink, breathe, or sleep, and she becomes immune to paralysis, poison, and stunning. She also becomes immune to {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hits{/g} and precision {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}.
d6b698a3-fa21-4877-8490-b0229cd703f5: At 20th level, a student of stone becomes an outsider with the earth subtype. He gains {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} 5/chaotic, and tremorsense 20 feet.
975f725b-1c03-4433-a9c2-a42d5729a20c: At 20th level, all {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} with acid descriptor cast by the oracle are always empowered, as though using the Empower Spell {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}.
9b6e2cdb-c8f8-4e4c-ad7c-e4bbc644f192: At 20th level, all {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} with cold descriptor cast by the oracle are always empowered, as though using the Empower Spell {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}.
4a6c9513-7e07-4fe3-9a06-a8a2f9520570: At 20th level, all {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} with electricity descriptor cast by the oracle are always empowered, as though using the Empower Spell {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}.
4a88185b-7823-4453-8152-c330d2af7e4c: At 20th level, all {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} with fire descriptor cast by the oracle are always empowered, as though using the Empower Spell {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}.
a099b5c8-82ef-4198-b96e-3a1a82233fe1: At 20th level, an elemental rampager become immune to his chosen energy type.
16f219b7-34eb-425c-bdde-2f3290494ae3: At 20th level, an inquisitor can call true judgment down upon a foe during combat. Whenever an inquisitor uses her judgment ability, the inquisitor can invoke true judgment on a foe as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}. Once declared, the inquisitor can make a single {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}. If the attack hits, it deals {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} normally and the target must make a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g} or die. The {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of this save is equal to 10 + 1/2 the inquisitor's level + the inquisitor's {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier. Regardless of whether or not the save is made, the target creature is immune to the inquisitor's true judgment ability for 24 hours.
a8485c0a-117c-40c4-809f-6e0808ece448: At 20th level, an instinctual warrior's {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} while raging increases to +4. In addition, the amount of temporary {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} gained when entering a focused rage increases to 4 per {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}Hit Die{/g}.
9defec15-e391-401d-acac-df2115ab637d: At 20th level, an oracle learns the final revelation about her mystery, granting her amazing powers and abilities. The nature of these bonuses depends upon the oracle's mystery.
cca54c6d-67b4-4835-a719-e5ad25c85392: At 20th level, any {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} a sword saint makes with his chosen weapon automatically confirm all {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical{/g} threats and have their {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} multiplier increased by 1 (×2 becomes ×3, for example).
06a542dc-9b1a-4827-970f-dd3c15f6cd53: At 20th level, anytime you {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}roll{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g}, assume the roll resulted in a natural 20.
956a1ff8-6d68-48e4-9ae2-d4c13035e0a3: At 20th level, elemental power surges through your body. You gain immunity to sneak attacks, {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hits{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} from your energy type. You have this benefit constantly, even while not bloodraging.
8abd96e0-190d-4617-821b-d1cc434449f3: At 20th level, elemental power surges through your body. You gain immunity to sneak attacks, {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hits{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}acid damage{/g}.
1fb5cdcf-1e6b-4d61-ad04-8ddd80144635: At 20th level, elemental power surges through your body. You gain immunity to sneak attacks, {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hits{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}cold damage{/g}.
66580247-6757-459a-840c-284d3949be6a: At 20th level, elemental power surges through your body. You gain immunity to sneak attacks, {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hits{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}electricity damage{/g}.
dcb37e39-98bc-4151-ae22-af16223a1f09: At 20th level, elemental power surges through your body. You gain immunity to sneak attacks, {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hits{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g}.
2106421b-876b-45be-a2a2-a0040d6fb737: At 20th level, freebooter becomes a master hunter. She can, as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, make a single {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} against a target of freebooter's bane at her full attack bonus. If the attack hits, the target takes {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} normally and must make a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g} or die. The {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of this save is equal to 10 + 1/2 the freebooter's level + the freebooter's {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier. A freebooter can use this ability four times per day, but not against the same creature more than once in a 24-hour period.
3dfe32f2-d503-44c3-b046-7ea1ee160007: At 20th level, in hands of a quarterstaff master all quarterstaves deal {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} as if it was three {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} categories larger.
486d64db-af27-4c1d-a174-9472e3604750: At 20th level, once per day an eldritch font can spend a {g|Encyclopedia:Full_Round_Action}full-round action{/g} to refuel herself. Doing so allows her to prepare new {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} and regain points of arcane reservoir equal to 1/2 her level.
0ae41413-078f-4c1b-abef-ace26568fb6a: At 20th level, the alchemist makes a grand discovery. For many alchemists, the promise of one of these grand discoveries is the primary goal of their experiments and hard work.
c1584151-6426-4aaa-bb8e-cce59dfb485b: At 20th level, the arcanist learns how to convert her arcane reservoir into {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} and back again. She can cast any spell she has prepared by expending a number of points from her arcane reservoir equal to the level of the spell to be cast instead of expending a spell slot.
2f412775-5635-4a7b-9ab6-f86dca780229: At 20th level, the brown-fur transmuter learns to fully master the power of transmutation. Whenever she casts a transmutation {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, it is treated as it were affected by the Extend Spell {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} without altering the {g|Encyclopedia:Casting_Time}casting time{/g} or slot used. Whenever she uses her powerful change ability, the {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} increases by 4 instead of 2. Her share transmutation ability can now target a willing creature within close range.
bb612921-6275-4f03-b446-b43252b6ead1: At 20th level, the cost of the phantasmal mage's metamagic abilities is reduced by 1 arcane pool point.
12ccc7d2-5614-484e-a401-887201732786: At 20th level, the drovier can use this ability at will.
86a09d90-aee7-455c-84b4-a5008ae758b2: At 20th level, the flamewarden gains {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Immunity}immunity{/g} to fire, and once per day, the flamewarden rises from the ashes of his own destruction 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} after dying. The flamewarden's body re-forms with all his equipment, and he returns to life with half his maximum {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g}.
9e9e5e84-6ee2-40d1-aa5b-9dd7d2134294: At 20th level, the hagbound transforms into a true hag, purging all goodness and light from her in exchange for dark power. Her type changes to monstrous humanoid; she gains immunity to charm and fear effects. She also gains {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g} 31.
8e366c4d-5bb5-49f1-9f36-3cddc9f1c215:
At 20th level, the magus becomes a master of {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} and combat. Whenever he uses his spell combat ability, he does not need to make a {g|Encyclopedia:Concentration}concentration check{/g} to cast the spell defensively.
Whenever the magus uses spell combat, he can choose to either increase the {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}resist his spells{/g} by 2, grant himself a +2 circumstance {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on any {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g} made to overcome spell resistance, or grant himself a +2 circumstance bonus on all {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g}.
c1e1fac3-8ac2-4a07-a9ab-d022f0d37744: At 20th level, the nimbus of light increases in {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} out to a range of 50 feet. In addition, all of its bonuses increase. The morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} and on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against fear increases to +2. The amount of {g|Encyclopedia:AbilityDamage}ability damage{/g} healed increases to {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d4{/g}. Finally, protection against {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hits{/g} increases to 50%.
57e4fed8-d085-46e2-a2b8-77452e1632fd: At 20th level, the power of the Abyss flows through you. You gain {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Immunity}immunity{/g} to electricity and poison. You also gain {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resistance{/g} to acid 10, cold 10, and fire 10.
8628bf67-ee98-455f-94c4-ed3b7b246e01: At 20th level, the rageshaper gains a +4 racial {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to his {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability score{/g} and the {g|Encyclopedia:Improved_NaturalAttack}improved natural attack{/g} ability with his slam {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} in devastating form; his rage is now treated as mighty rage, as the barbarian ability of the same name; and the {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} die of his ground slam ability increases to {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}d10{/g}.
a16d74c5-ee19-45c2-a01a-c4d50ec4430b: At 20th level, the slayer becomes a master at capturing or killing his studied targets. As a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, he can make a single {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} against a studied target at his full attack bonus. If the attack succeeds, the target takes {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} normally and must succeed at a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude saving throw{/g} or die. The {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} for this save is 10 + 1/2 the slayer's level + the slayer's {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier. Whether or not the target succeeds, it cannot be targeted by this ability again (by any slayer) for 24 hours.
50354e70-fe23-43ca-af9b-62931098c401: At 20th level, the tower shield specialist gains improved evasion, as the rogue advanced talent, while using a tower shield. This works like evasion, except that while the tower shield specialist still takes no {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} on a successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex saving throw{/g} against {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g}, he henceforth takes only half damage on a failed save.
40a2bf04-39d7-4867-bc10-5fcf0f06bb44: At 20th level, the warpriest can channel an aspect of war, growing in power and martial ability. Once per day as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}, a warpriest can treat his level as his {g|Encyclopedia:BAB}base attack bonus{/g}, gains {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} 10/—, and can move at his full {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} regardless of the armor he is wearing or his encumbrance. In addition, the blessings he calls upon don't count against his daily limit during this time. This ability lasts for 1 minute.
85457254-0f98-489d-83b0-72ada3b5930e: At 20th level, tranquil whisperer's mind changes completely. He gains immunity to confusion and mind-affecting effects, and counts as an outsider.
38134956-9096-4b08-a26f-a2112dd30dfb: At 20th level, when a bloodrager enters a bloodrage, the morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to his {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} increases to +4, and the morale bonus on his Will {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g} increases to +4. Furthermore, the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} he can apply to himself at the beginning of a bloodrage due to the greater bloodrage class feature is not limited to only spells of 2nd level or lower.
9a64746d-1beb-4510-a533-9036c8136b74: At 20th level, when entering a bloodrage all of your {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attacks{/g} are considered to have bane enchantment. This ability doesn't stack with other forms of bane.
bcd4a4ac-ed06-4997-acdd-0c266b643531: At 20th level, whenever a disciple of the pike makes a charge {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} with a polearm or spear, he deals double the normal amount of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}. In addition, if he confirms a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g} on a deadly charge, the target is stunned for {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g}. If the target succeeds at a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} = 10 + the cavalier's {g|Encyclopedia:BAB}base attack bonus{/g}), it is instead staggered for 1d4 rounds.
b698e8e1-98fe-40b7-84e1-451b0bdb3f00: At 20th level, whenever the cavalier makes a charge {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} while mounted, he deals double the normal amount of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} (or triple if using shortspear, spear or longspear or with spirited charge or quadruple if both). In addition, if the cavalier confirms a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g} on a charge attack while mounted, the target is stunned for {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g}. A {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g} reduces this to staggered for 1d4 rounds. The {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} is equal to 10 + the cavalier's {g|Encyclopedia:BAB}base attack bonus{/g}.
d313ea1c-69c9-414d-b850-2a18b0a880b8: At 20th level, whenever you cast an Evocation {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, you can {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}roll{/g} twice to penetrate a creature's {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g} and take the better result.
ab3e7009-a913-467e-b3d4-e2f877dcdf89: At 20th level, you become infused with the power of the heavens. You gain {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Immunity}immunity{/g} to acid, cold, and petrification, {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resist{/g} electricity 10, resist fire 10, and a +4 racial {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g} against poison.
9a6ff969-6757-4708-98a7-eb7d17cd201e: At 20th level, you become infused with the power of the heavens. You gain {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Immunity}immunity{/g} to acid, cold, and petrification. You also gain {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resistance{/g} 10 to electricity and fire, as well as a +4 racial {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against poison. You have these benefits constantly, even while not bloodraging.
4802e22f-0ebe-4fde-aec0-cd0afc6bc5a6:
At 20th level, you can quicken your next {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} as though using the Quicken Spell {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}. Quickening costs 4 daily usages of metamagic mastery.
Quicken Spell: Casting a quickened spell is a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}. You can perform another {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}action{/g}, even casting another spell, in the same {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} as you cast a quickened spell. A spell whose {g|Encyclopedia:Casting_Time}casting time{/g} is more than 1 round or 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Full_Round_Action}full-round action{/g} cannot be quickened.
3dcd6d50-a24e-44dd-85b5-fc8c246e7c9a: At 20th level, you gain ability to turn yourself into a Large spirit Naga (as beast shape III) and back again at will. You also become immune to poison and paralysis. You may use serpent's fang as often as desired, and you may choose to inflict {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} to any {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability score{/g}.
1d77dc9b-a82c-41d5-a2bf-fef6e93b1f97: At 20th level, you gain immunity to paralysis, sleep, and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} from your energy type. You also gain {g|Encyclopedia:Blindsense}blindsense{/g} with a range of 60 feet. You have these benefits constantly, even while not bloodraging.
6f472f8a-de70-46bd-9f36-a4bd81e56f0a: At 20th level, you gain {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Immunity}immunity{/g} to cold, paralysis, and sleep. The {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} from your {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} reduction ability increases to 8. You gain a +4 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} made against {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}spell-like abilities{/g} cast by undead. You have these benefits constantly, even while not bloodraging.
9f568a2f-df51-45d5-8832-ad02b2fbe910: At 20th level, you gain {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Immunity}immunity{/g} to fire and poison. You also gain {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resistance{/g} 10 to acid and cold. You have these benefits constantly, even while not bloodraging.
49b83909-9946-48bf-9b85-19a49eee4173: At 20th level, you gain {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Immunity}immunity{/g} to poison. Additionally, you can't be caught {g|Encyclopedia:Flat_Footed}flat-footed{/g} and don't provoke {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attacks of opportunity{/g}. You have these benefits constantly, even while not bloodraging.
9fffa005-445a-4f49-a6e5-361c051a0c72: At 20th level, you have discovered the intrinsic secrets of life itself, granting you incredible control over your own body. Once per day, you can change your type to plant, animal, or humanoid, gaining superficial physical characteristics as appropriate, as a {g|Encyclopedia:Full_Round_Action}full-round action{/g}. This change does not alter your {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}Hit Dice{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill{/g} points, class skills, or proficiencies. Each time the transformation is made, you are cleansed of all poisons or diseases, are restored to full hit points, and {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g} all {g|Encyclopedia:AbilityDamage}ability damage{/g}. You must select a new type every time the transformation is made.
7c518489-cdcf-4942-af5a-0079b072dc88: At 20th level, you're {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Immunity}immune{/g} to electricity and poison. You have this benefit constantly, even while not bloodraging.
1c8f13af-6ca3-4ee7-ad9a-f6221cc242cd: At 20th level, your body surges with arcane power. All your {g|Encyclopedia:Concentration}concentration checks{/g} made to cast a {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} or use a {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}spell-like ability{/g} are automatic successes.
12603489-c400-458e-8649-9c4e41c262cb: At 20th level, your draconic heritage becomes manifest. You gain immunity to paralysis, sleep, and {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}acid damage{/g}. You also gain {g|Encyclopedia:Blindsense}blindsense{/g} with a range of 60 feet.
6c75708f-3173-4273-8dfc-2c9d5151e4c7: At 20th level, your draconic heritage becomes manifest. You gain immunity to paralysis, sleep, and {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}cold damage{/g}. You also gain {g|Encyclopedia:Blindsense}blindsense{/g} with a range of 60 feet.
d2aab46c-d151-48cc-94c2-6ab20702a097: At 20th level, your draconic heritage becomes manifest. You gain immunity to paralysis, sleep, and {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}electricity damage{/g}. You also gain {g|Encyclopedia:Blindsense}blindsense{/g} with a range of 60 feet.
93716175-14c3-4b66-a476-b9bde3dc3f3d: At 20th level, your draconic heritage becomes manifest. You gain immunity to paralysis, sleep, and {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g}. You also gain {g|Encyclopedia:Blindsense}blindsense{/g} with a range of 60 feet.
8d1b6b67-64c1-4592-92d9-2a1a65c02c49: At 20th level, your form becomes infused with vile power. You gain {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Immunity}immunity{/g} to fire and poison. You also gain {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resistance{/g} to acid 10 and cold 10.
06a33f14-c0c4-44d5-b457-53b6233b8695: At 20th level, your form begins to rot and undead see you as one of them. You gain {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Immunity}immunity{/g} to cold, paralysis, and sleep. You also gain {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} 5/—. You receive a +4 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} made against {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}spell-like abilities{/g} cast by undead.
eee80cde-2468-4d8e-a87c-5529e64d32a7: At 20th level, your soul becomes one with the world of the fey. You gain immunity to poison and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} 10/cold iron. Once per day, you can cast cloak of dreams as a {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}spell-like ability{/g} using your sorcerer level as your {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}.
ae627da8-6401-4d82-8d1b-c12dceb51714: At 20th level, {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spellcasters{/g} within 10 feet of you automatically fail attempts at casting defensively. You have this ability constantly, even while not bloodraging.
af114d4b-93f5-4adb-9c5e-2700b602afeb: At 2nd level and every 4 levels thereafter, the pack rager can take a bonus teamwork {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}. This teamwork feat must also be a combat feat.
ee247c8a-c85a-470e-bda6-832180923d42: At 2nd level dragon disciple gains a bite {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}. This is a primary {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural attack{/g} that deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} (1d4 if the dragon disciple is Small), plus 1.5 times the dragon disciple's {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} modifier. Upon reaching 6th level, this bite also deals 1d6 points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}energy damage{/g}. The type of damage dealt is determined by the dragon disciple's bloodline.
fee66f46-c53b-4b1a-a1a7-86b10d25c8df: At 2nd level, a Hellknight gains armor training, as the fighter ability of the same name. If the Hellknight already has this ability, its bonuses instead increase by 1. At 5th level and 8th level, the bonuses provided by armor training increase by an additional 1.
cb43c776-8f96-449e-8182-914cb635c3a1: At 2nd level, a chirurgeon's extracts of remove disease, remove blindness, neutralize poison, and {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}cure{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} automatically act as infusions and can be used not only on himself but on other people as well.
33f6f44c-5a79-4972-826b-6fe4503f046c: At 2nd level, a court poet gains a +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} when adjacent to two or more creatures. In addition, she gains a bonus equal to half her skald level on {g|Encyclopedia:Persuasion}Persuasion{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g}.
ed251836-27c9-4647-81e3-1dfcbfcf53ec:
At 2nd level, a deliverer shrugs off attempts by his moral opposite to control or kill him. On any {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} in which deliverer {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} an opponent whose {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}alignment{/g} is at least two steps away from his own (such as a lawful good deliverer fighting a chaotic good or lawful evil foe, or a neutral foe with no other alignment components), he gains a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on Will {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against that opponent's abilities, as well as the benefit of the Diehard {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} until the end of his next turn.
This ability replaces the slayer talent gained at 2nd level.
dfa33574-f3f2-487d-be86-43f31f0ec299: At 2nd level, a dirge bard gains a +4 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g} against fear, curses, death effects, and necromantic effects.
f3001f33-82da-404e-bc5e-7f18ae9e7dc9: At 2nd level, a dirge bard gains a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} equal to half his bard level on {g|Encyclopedia:Lore_Religion}Lore (religion) checks{/g}. A dirge bard may use mind-affecting {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} to affect undead as if they were living creatures, undead creatures are treated as humanoids for the purposes of determining which spells affect them. In addition, he adds the following necromantic spells to his list of spells known: cause fear at 2nd level; command undead at 6th level; fear at 10th level; waves of fatigue at 14th level; banshee blast at 18th level.
ca927783-5bfe-4574-b151-db4d3bb43a9e: At 2nd level, a dragonheir scion gains a +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Persuasion}Persuasion{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g} made to intimidate. This bonus increases to +2 at 6th level and by an additional 1 every 4 fighter levels thereafter to a maximum of +5 at 18th level.
cc52f632-0508-417c-87cf-c8866ac25ac4: At 2nd level, a duelist gains a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g}. At 8th level, the bonus increases to +4. This bonus stacks with the benefit provided by the Improved Initiative {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}.
7e12c2fe-3940-44a9-8c3a-256671e9c008:
At 2nd level, a duelist learns to parry {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attacks{/g} of other creatures, causing them to miss. Whenever the duelist makes a full {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} with a light or {g|Encyclopedia:Light_Weapon}one-handed{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}piercing{/g} weapon, she can attempt to parry the first attack against her or the first attack against adjacent ally.
To parry the attack, the duelist makes an attack roll, using the same bonuses as the attack she chose to forego during her previous {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}action{/g}. If her attack roll is greater than the {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}roll{/g} of the attacking creature, the attack automatically misses. For each {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} category that the attacking creature is larger than the duelist, the duelist takes a –4 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on her attack roll. The duelist also takes a –4 penalty when attempting to parry an attack made against an adjacent ally.
e7f4bb4d-8d47-48c1-9abe-bbc857f56d0f:
At 2nd level, a fiendflesh shifter gains a +1 natural armor {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to her {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resistance{/g} 5 to electricity and fire, but only while unencumbered and either wearing no armor or wearing light or medium nonmetal armor. At 4th level, 12th level, and 20th level, this natural armor bonus increases by 1. At 8th level and 16th level, the fiendflesh shifter's resistance to electricity and fire increases by 10.
This replaces defensive instinct.
4ad006b6-8e00-4f41-b09a-4f6f3d43144c: At 2nd level, a grenadier can infuse a weapon or piece of ammunition with a single harmful alchemical liquid or powder, in this case alchemist's fire. This {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}action{/g} consumes the alchemical item, but transfers its effect to the weapon in question. The alchemical item takes full effect on the next creature struck by the weapon, but does not splash, spread, affect additional targets, or benefit from any other effects that specifically affect splash weapons. Any extra {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} added is not doubled on a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g}. The alchemical treatment causes no harm to the weapon treated, and wears off 1 minute after being applied if no blow is struck. Infusing a new alchemical item also removes the effect of any alchemical liquid or powder previously applied with this ability. At 6th level, a grenadier can use her alchemical weapon ability as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}. At 15th level, this ability becomes a {g|Encyclopedia:Free_Action}free action{/g}.
e8bc682c-d547-4954-bae2-b55021ac26b3: At 2nd level, a grenadier can infuse a weapon or piece of ammunition with a single harmful alchemical liquid or powder, in this case an acid flask. This {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}action{/g} consumes the alchemical item, but transfers its effect to the weapon in question. The alchemical item takes full effect on the next creature struck by the weapon, but does not splash, spread, affect additional targets, or benefit from any other effects that specifically affect splash weapons. Any extra {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} added is not multiplied on a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g}. The alchemical treatment causes no harm to the weapon treated, and wears off 1 minute after being applied if no blow is struck. Infusing a new alchemical item also removes the effect of any alchemical liquid or powder previously applied with this ability. At 6th level, a grenadier can use her alchemical weapon ability as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}. At 15th level, this ability becomes a {g|Encyclopedia:Free_Action}free action{/g}.
f673be29-5a52-44b3-b96f-30e8cf94ed4e: At 2nd level, a grenadier can infuse a weapon or piece of ammunition with a single harmful alchemical liquid or powder, in this case holy water. This {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}action{/g} consumes the alchemical item, but transfers its effect to the weapon in question. The alchemical item takes full effect on the next creature struck by the weapon, but does not splash, spread, affect additional targets, or benefit from any other effects that specifically affect splash weapons. Any extra {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} added is not doubled on a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g}. The alchemical treatment causes no harm to the weapon treated, and wears off 1 minute after being applied if no blow is struck. Infusing a new alchemical item also removes the effect of any alchemical liquid or powder previously applied with this ability. At 6th level, a grenadier can use her alchemical weapon ability as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}. At 15th level, this ability becomes a {g|Encyclopedia:Free_Action}free action{/g}.
718b5560-5c5e-4cc4-9708-416cd70d17bf: At 2nd level, a grenadier can infuse a weapon or piece of ammunition with a single harmful alchemical liquid or powder, such as an acid flask or alchemist's fire. This {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}action{/g} consumes the alchemical item, but transfers its effect to the weapon in question. The alchemical item takes full effect on the next creature struck by the weapon, but does not splash, spread, affect additional targets, or benefit from any other effects that specifically affect splash weapons. Any extra {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} added is not doubled on a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g}. The alchemical treatment causes no harm to the weapon treated, and wears off 1 minute after being applied if no blow is struck. Infusing a new alchemical item also removes the effect of any alchemical liquid or powder previously applied with this ability. At 6th level, a grenadier can use her alchemical weapon ability as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}. At 15th level, this ability becomes a {g|Encyclopedia:Free_Action}free action{/g}.
b588c834-a304-426f-a840-8d25d64c055b:
At 2nd level, a hex channeler can call upon her patron to release a wave of energy from herself. A good witch channels positive energy (like a good cleric), and an evil witch channels negative energy (like an evil cleric). A witch who is neither good nor evil must choose whether she channels positive or negative energy; once this choice is made, it cannot be reversed.
Channeling energy causes a burst that affects all creatures of one type (either undead or living) in a 30-foot radius centered on the witch. The witch can channel energy a number of times per day equal to 3 + her {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier (minimum 1). The hex channeler uses her witch level as her cleric level for all other effects dependent upon channel energy (except increasing the amount of damage {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}healed{/g} or dealt). The hex channeler can choose whether or not to include herself or her familiar in this effect.
This burst heals or deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of damage. Every time the hex channeler is able to learn a new hex (including major or grand hexes), she can instead increase her channel energy amount by 1d6.
5d55f76a-9e69-4ddd-93a4-7d8a0d1a9cde: At 2nd level, a hunter chooses either Precise Shot or Outflank as a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}. She does not need to meet the prerequisites for this feat.
2402aaf1-7433-4932-81f9-8ebdc86cde44: At 2nd level, a loremaster adds half his level to all Lore and Knowledge {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g}.
a298d44c-82f6-4b5b-81f6-c2785d2b0f6d: At 2nd level, a mad dog and her war beast gain a +4 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} while {g|Encyclopedia:Flanking}flanking{/g} the same opponent (instead of the normal +2 bonus).
f16e064f-96a7-46a6-9afa-089964d1f877: At 2nd level, a paladin gains a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} equal to her {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} bonus (if any) on all {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g}.
3d74d54a-fdbf-4b2d-b7a1-b5368780fdc1: At 2nd level, a preservationist adds summon nature's ally I to his formula book as a 1st-level extract.
188d7fb2-17f6-4b14-84d9-6613b69f3d44: At 2nd level, a proclaimer can hold his weapon aloft and shout his deity's name as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}, spending one use of fervor to deal {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}holy damage{/g} to all evil outsiders within 5 feet. At 5th level and every 3 levels thereafter, this {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} increases by an additional 1d6. At 7th level, the effect expands to include an area within 10 feet of the proclaimer, and it expands by 5 feet every 6 levels thereafter. A proclaimer can't use fervor to damage undead or to {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g}.
d85476a1-0980-491b-ae1c-b51bf6690d78:
At 2nd level, a rageshaper becomes difficult to harm in his devastating form. Whenever the rageshaper takes on his devastating form and is unencumbered and either wearing no armor or wearing light or medium nonmetal armor, he gains a +2 natural armor {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to his {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} 2/-. At 10th level, the rageshaper's DR increases to 5/-. At 15th level, the rageshaper's DR increases to 7/-. At 20th level, the rageshaper's DR increases to 10/-, and his natural armor bonus to AC increases to +4.
This replaces defensive instinct, chimeric aspect, and greater chimeric aspect.
130fd646-0c50-4ecd-a54e-48e5e4b8eaf8:
At 2nd level, a ranger must select one combat style to pursue.
The ranger's expertise manifests in the form of bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g} at 2nd, 6th, 10th, 14th, and 18th level. He can choose feats from his selected combat style's list, even if he does not have the normal prerequisites.
Every style can also choose the following feats: Dodge, Great Fortitude, Lightning Reflexes, Toughness.
7bb27312-0c9b-4f6a-8e72-d84897a01b46: At 2nd level, a sensei may use his {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} bonus in lieu of his {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} or {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}combat maneuver{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g} with {g|Encyclopedia:UnarmedAttack}unarmed{/g} strikes or monk weapons.
8109347c-0e5b-49e1-b891-ea18c3f14800: At 2nd level, a shifter adds half her {g|Encyclopedia:Class_Level}class level{/g} as a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Lore_Nature}Lore (nature) checks{/g}.
8fec1570-7f9b-492f-9c4c-7c5ff0c897b9: At 2nd level, a steelblood moves faster in medium and heavy armor. When wearing medium or heavy armor, a steelblood can move 5 feet faster than normal in that armor, to a maximum of his unencumbered {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g}.
f75717d0-095e-4ce6-b52e-09c59720c6d1: At 2nd level, a stonelord's flesh becomes progressively rockier. She gains a +1 natural armor {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} N/adamantine where N is equal to half her paladin level. The natural armor bonus increases by +1 at 6th level, and every four levels thereafter, to a maximum of +5 at 18th level.
7d2bd72f-30f6-4fac-9e28-3aa2a8a330d0: At 2nd level, a student of war can use her {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier in place of her {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} modifier for determining her {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}Armor Class{/g}. The armor's normal {g|Encyclopedia:Max_Dex_Bonus}maximum Dexterity bonus{/g} still applies (limiting how much of the character's Intelligence bonus she can apply to her AC).
4f41c064-8866-4201-8f26-163282d98583: At 2nd level, a tower shield specialist can use his shield to screen himself from burst {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} and effects, gaining a +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex saves{/g} against them while employing a tower shield. This bonus increases by +1 for every four levels after 2nd (to a maximum of +5 at 18th level).
4f427d5b-a21c-4f02-b0c4-ff0cf023463f: At 2nd level, a two-handed fighter gains a +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:CMB}CMB{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:CMD}CMD{/g} on sunder attempts and on disarm attempts. These bonuses increase by +1 for every four levels beyond 2nd.
96f83998-2f86-459f-9ccb-67168f6dd94d:
At 2nd level, a vanguard receives a teamwork {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} as a bonus feat. He must meet the prerequisites for this feat. Once per day as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, the vanguard can grant one of his teamwork feats to all allies within 30 feet who can see and hear him. Allies retain the use of this bonus feat for 3 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} plus 1 round for every 2 levels the vanguard possesses. Allies do not need to meet the prerequisites of this bonus feat. Whenever the vanguard is able to select a new slayer talent, he can instead choose to gain an additional use per day of this ability.
This ability replaces the slayer talent gained at 2nd level.
23bcb1ab-ce8a-4d5d-9b68-4d4971c0369b:
At 2nd level, a warpriest can draw upon the power of his faith to {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g} wounds or harm foes. He can also use this ability to quickly cast {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} that aid in his struggles. This ability can be used a number of times per day equal to 1/2 his warpriest level + his {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier. By expending one use of this ability, a good warpriest (or one who worships a good deity) can touch a creature to heal it of {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of damage, plus an additional 1d6 points of damage for every 3 warpriest levels he possesses above 2nd (to a maximum of 7d6 at 20th level). Using this ability is a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} (unless the warpriest targets himself, in which case it's a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}). Alternatively, the warpriest can use this ability to harm an undead creature, dealing the same amount of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} he would otherwise heal with a melee {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g}. Using fervor in this way is a standard {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}action{/g} that provokes an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attack of opportunity{/g}. Undead do not receive a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g} against this damage. This counts as positive energy.
An evil warpriest (or one who worships an evil deity) can use this ability to instead deal damage to living creatures with a melee touch {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} and heal undead creatures with a touch. This counts as negative energy.
A neutral warpriest who worships a neutral deity (or one who is not devoted to a particular deity) uses this ability as a good warpriest if he chose to spontaneously cast cure spells or as an evil warpriest if he chose to spontaneously cast inflict spells.
9d7cea49-587f-46f9-8c31-4f003df29322:
At 2nd level, a witch of the veil gains the ability to become invisible for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to her {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} bonus as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}.
At 8th level, she also can teleport 30 feet and then become invisible, as per the invisibility {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}.
At 16th level, she gains the benefits of the greater invisibility spell instead.
5d06d6a5-532a-4206-b1c7-851aabc7585a:
At 2nd level, a zen archer gains Weapon Focus as a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} with one type of bow.
At 6th level, the monk gains Weapon Specialization with the same weapon as a bonus feat, even if he does not meet the prerequisites.
9d8fe221-c809-45db-833e-c2d4164d2c16: At 2nd level, an Aldori swordlord adds a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} equal to half his {g|Encyclopedia:Class_Level}class level{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Persuasion}Persuasion{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g} made to intimidate. He also gains an additional +1 bonus on Persuasion skill {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g} made to intimidate while using Dazzling Display with a dueling sword for each of the following {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g} he has with the dueling sword: Greater Weapon Focus, Greater Weapon Specialization, Improved {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}Critical{/g}, Weapon Focus, or Weapon Specialization.
6315ebab-be54-4b81-b769-b3edf94d31db: At 2nd level, an alchemist gains a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on all {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against poison. This bonus increases to +4 at 5th level, and then again to +6 at 8th level. At 10th level, an alchemist becomes completely immune to poison.
a2603608-78be-487d-b11b-de5fbc372e20: At 2nd level, an archaeologist gains a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} equal to half his {g|Encyclopedia:Class_Level}class level{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Trickery}Trickery{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Perception}Perception checks{/g}.
036c73a6-0071-4bdc-8747-6accf89ac92a: At 2nd level, an armored hulk moves 5 feet faster than normal in medium and heavy armor.
5b8db4bf-16e8-4dc5-bdcb-a64609b7fda3: At 2nd level, an inquisitor adds her {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier on {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g}, in addition to her {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} modifier.
4eb0aadf-ff90-4d06-ac3e-b858da1b2fd1: At 2nd level, an order of the lion cavalier gains the ability to rally his allies.
