As a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, he can give an encouraging speech which grants all allies within 60 feet a competence {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on their {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against fear equal to his {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier and a +1 competence bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to his cavalier level. Any time when ally under effect should make saving throw against frightened or panicked, he may make two saving throws to avoid the effect (if a saving throw is allowed), taking the better of the two results as his actual saving throw.
0020e927-90df-46e4-b822-309502f74477: At 2nd level, an underground chemist is able to retrieve an alchemical item as if drawing a weapon. She adds her {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier to {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} dealt with splash weapons, including any splash damage. She also gains the Throw Anything {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} as a bonus feat.
cf828ba6-8a11-48b0-aa36-2d7972b51a5f: At 2nd level, and at every level thereafter, an eldritch knight gains new {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} per day as if he had also gained a level in an arcane spellcasting class he belonged to before adding the prestige class. He does not, however, gain any other benefit a character of that class would have gained, except for additional spells per day, spells known, and an increased effective level of spellcasting. If a character had more than one arcane spellcasting class before becoming an eldritch knight, he must decide to which class he adds the new level for purposes of determining spells per day.
9a186e08-9d9e-4dfb-98b9-d35127bad905: At 2nd level, and at every level thereafter, with an exception for 5th and 9th levels, a Dragon Disciple gains new {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} per day as if he had also gained a level in an arcane spellcasting class he belonged to before adding the prestige class. He does not, however, gain any other benefit a character of that class would have gained, except for additional spells per day, spells known, and an increased effective level of spellcasting. If a character had more than one arcane spellcasting class before becoming an Dragon Disciple, he must decide to which class he adds the new level for purposes of determining spells per day.
8864020f-b8ac-4dba-b3a2-41a64dbfddf7: At 2nd level, and every two levels thereafter, a witch's patron adds new {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} to a witch's list of spells known. These spells are also automatically added to the list of spells stored by the familiar. The spells gained depend upon the patron chosen. Each patron is listed by its theme. The witch might never know its actual name.
7d020707-d508-4714-8469-60babf9aee38: At 2nd level, and then again every 2 levels thereafter (up to 18th level), a vivesectionist makes an incredible medical discovery. The {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of any {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g} called for by a discovery is equal to 10 + 1/2 the vivisectionist's level + the vivisectionist's {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier.
ad74828b-5fcc-4ab6-84d3-e8c4b85e605a: At 2nd level, and then again every 2 levels thereafter, an alchemist makes an incredible alchemical discovery. At 20th level, the alchemist makes an additional discovery. Unless otherwise noted, an alchemist cannot select an individual discovery more than once. Some discoveries can only be made if the alchemist has met certain prerequisites first, such as uncovering other discoveries. Only one such discovery can be applied to an individual bomb. The {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of any {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g} called for by a discovery is equal to 10 + 1/2 the alchemist's level + the alchemist's {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier.
4dc077b0-9c29-4698-b4b3-5e82f2305559: At 2nd level, if a Hellknight signifer has the Arcane Armor Training {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}, he gains Arcane Armor Mastery as a bonus feat.
b3897d7a-ff74-4d74-be69-9c63f76c8723: At 2nd level, the assassin gains a +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against poisons. This bonus increases by +1 every two levels.
df5061a1-b411-40bb-bb7e-1f20b5e12b8d: At 2nd level, the bard becomes resistant to the bardic performance of others, and to sonic effects in general. The bard gains a +4 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} made against bardic performance and sonic effects.
bb1bb0de-457e-47b5-a7ba-4cd54918aa1e: At 2nd level, the cavalier can call upon the spirits of the fallen for protection. The cavalier gains a a +1 sacred {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to his {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} when {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacked{/g} by an undead target of his challenge. The bonus increases by 1 for every 4 class levels the cavalier possesses.
16ec2bdc-8e3a-4d6c-ba3f-c9a8cb6de076:
At 2nd level, the cavalier can make a short prayer as a {g|Encyclopedia:Free_Action}free action{/g}, filling him with confidence in his abilities. At any point in the next minute, he can receive a competence {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} equal to his {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier on his next {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack roll{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g}, or {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill check{/g}. He can use this ability up to four times per day.
In addition, the cavalier adds half his cavalier level to any levels of paladin or cleric he might possess for the purposes of determining the effects of channel energy or lay on hands.
0b98229c-429d-4f1b-bf6a-eaf3d5bc24c5: At 2nd level, the cavalier can ready his allies for impending danger. As a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, he can ready all allies within 30 feet of the danger ahead, granting a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g}. At any point in the next minute, when these allies fail a saving throw, they {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}reroll{/g} the saving throw with a +4 competence bonus as an immediate {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}action{/g}, but must take the results of the reroll even if it is worse. He can use this ability up to three times per day.
edcc145f-84ea-487d-937e-9bdf73753b9d: At 2nd level, the cavalier must select one {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}alignment{/g}. As long as he maintains the selected alignment, he receives a +2 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to one {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g} of his choice.
1b850040-80c6-4bbd-b74a-bbdd03fcac0e: At 2nd level, the cavalier receives Dazzling Display as a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}. The cavalier receives a +2 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g} rolls made against targets under fear effects.
b7e69ae3-60e0-40bb-ade0-7352e1f8dd53: At 2nd level, the hunt caller's raging song unlocks animalistic senses in her allies. By spending 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} of raging song, the hunt caller can affect all allies within 30 feet for 1 hour. The allies gain +3 competence {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Perception}Perception{/g} and Survival {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g}.
27cc8165-bb66-45ee-91c1-4bb9202ce0b0: At 2nd level, the invulnerable rager gains {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g}/— equal to half her barbarian level. Damage reduction can reduce {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} to 0 but not below 0.
c7f489a9-282f-4332-9b57-27e16b79e2cb: At 2nd level, the martyr and all allies within 20 feet of him gain a +4 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against sonic effects and gaze {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g}. This ability functions only when the martyr is conscious.
d30ec7dc-c6e6-42a2-a400-a3200adc0b5a:
At 2nd level, the ranger can select from Cleave, Power Attack, and Intimidating Prowess.
At 6th level, he adds Cleaving Finish and Great Cleave to the list.
At 10th level, he adds Dreadful Carnage and {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}Critical{/g} Focus to the list.
c4898332-5347-49a4-bb1e-e59a5e040cee:
At 2nd level, the ranger can select from Dazzling Display, Power Attack, and Intimidating Prowess.
At 6th level, he adds Cornugon Smash and Shatter Defenses to the list.
At 10th level, he adds Dreadful Carnage and Improved {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}Critical{/g} to the list.
226e36af-97b8-40ad-9549-195635242cf0:
At 2nd level, the ranger can select from Double Slice, Shield Bash, and Two-Weapon Fighting.
At 6th level, he adds Improved Two-Weapon Fighting to the list.
At 10th level, he adds Greater Two-Weapon Fighting to the list.
39ae1181-4eb0-4fb6-8267-674769ac8f52:
At 2nd level, the ranger can select from Point-Blank Shot, Precise Shot, and Rapid Shot.
At 6th level, he adds Improved Precise Shot, Point-Blank Master, and Manyshot to the list.
At 10th level, he adds Improved {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}Critical{/g} to the list.
3bdd7135-b276-488e-a196-3734b56f6399:
At 2nd level, the ranger can select from Shield Bash, Shield Focus, and Two-Weapon Fighting.
At 6th level, he adds Improved Two-Weapon Fighting and Shield Master to the list.
At 10th level, he adds Bashing Finish and Greater Two-Weapon Fighting to the list.
ce0a48e4-ee38-463a-8c52-7fc554e5706d: At 2nd level, the skald becomes resistant to sonic effects. The skald gains a +4 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} made against bardic performance, as well as all sonic effects.
aa53a78e-1686-4094-a899-3de84267ad3d: At 2nd level, the spirit warden gains the ability to channel positive energy as a cleric of her level. Regardless of her {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}alignment{/g}, she can only use this ability to harm undead creatures. The spirit warden can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + her {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier.
01ed822d-a0aa-4d18-acc9-54b36156a59e:
At 2nd level, the unsworn shaman gains access to the wandering spirit class feature. At 10th level, she gains the abilities listed in the greater version of her wandering spirit. At 18th level, she gains the abilities listed in the true version of her wandering spirit.
Additionally, at 6th level, she also gains a second wandering spirit, gaining the abilities listed in the greater version of that spirit at 14th level, and the abilities listed in the true version at 20th level.
ae6c907c-86a5-46a7-8dfa-de7ea3458613: At 2nd level, warty growths and knobby muscles twist the hagbound's body. She gains a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to her {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} score. This bonus increases by 2 at 8th level and 14th level, to a maximum of +6.
703e5527-6752-4a8b-afa2-8183ca474a65:
At 2nd level, when unarmored, not using a shield, and conscious, the shifter adds her {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} bonus (if any) to her {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:CMD}CMD{/g}. In addition, the shifter gains a +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to her AC and CMD at 4th level. This bonus increases by 1 for every 4 shifter levels thereafter (up to a maximum of +5 at 20th level). If she is wearing nonmetal armor, she instead adds half her Wisdom bonus to her AC (minimum 0).
These bonuses to AC apply even against {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attacks{/g} and when the shifter is {g|Encyclopedia:Flat_Footed}flat-footed{/g}. She loses these bonuses when she is immobilized or {g|Encyclopedia:Helpless}helpless{/g}. These bonuses do not stack with the monk AC bonus class feature.
8f41f1b1-4376-46dd-90fa-44374483280d:
At 2nd level, whenever a magus casts a {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} with a range of "touch" from the magus spell list, he can deliver the spell through any weapon he is wielding as part of a {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g}.
Instead of the free melee {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g} normally allowed to deliver the spell, a magus can make one free melee attack with his weapon (at his highest {g|Encyclopedia:BAB}base attack bonus{/g}) as part of casting this spell. If successful, this melee attack deals its normal {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} as well as the effects of the spell. If the magus makes this {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} in concert with spell combat, this melee attack takes all the {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalties{/g} accrued by spell combat melee attacks.
This attack uses the weapon's {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical{/g} range (20, 19–20, or 18–20 and modified by the keen weapon property or similar effects), but the spell effect only deals ×2 damage on a successful critical hit, while the weapon damage uses its own critical modifier.
f4a0d617-8336-4587-bb47-fec1369d8eed: At 2nd level, whenever a possessed shaman fails a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g} against a charm or compulsion {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} or effect, she can attempt a new saving throw (using the original {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g}) as the spirits inside her attempt to regain control. If the saving throw is successful, the charm or compulsion effect ends. If the saving throw fails, she is affected as normal for the remainder of the duration.
17c64d19-165c-49d9-b8c0-c8a9131fe380: At 2nd level, whenever an eldritch archer casts a {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} that calls for a {g|Encyclopedia:RangedAttack}ranged attack{/g}, she can deliver the spell through a ranged weapon she wields as part of a ranged {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}. Instead of the free ranged attack normally allowed to deliver the spell, an eldritch archer can make one free ranged attack with a ranged weapon (at her highest {g|Encyclopedia:BAB}base attack bonus{/g}) as part of casting this spell. The attack does not increase the spell's range.
50cf3db8-9dd5-46e5-9658-c63dc919ccbc: At 2nd level, whenever an opponent {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}rolls{/g} to confirm a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g} against a student of stone, treat the student of stone's {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} as +4 higher than normal.
a40187de-a85a-4352-a8dd-08a990a05416: At 2nd, 5th, and 8th levels, a student of war gains a bonus combat {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}.
8601c10b-8db3-4e5e-87a6-be694e6a421b: At 3rd level a divine guardian can intercept {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} directed at the target of her divine troth as if she had the Bodyguard and In Harm's Way {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g}. The divine guardian's aura of courage does not grant a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to allies within 10 feet, but still grants her immunity to fear effects.
5c38a0ff-e6a9-4930-a537-5123c0ff90f7: At 3rd level and every 2 levels thereafter, a nine-tailed heir gains Magical Tail as a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}. If the nine-tailed heir already has nine tails, each additional time the feat is taken, the sorcerer gains one additional daily use of the lowest level Magical Tail ability not already affected by this effect.
823b65ca-0d29-452f-a819-e5c9b3ae8865:
At 3rd level and every 3 levels thereafter, a skald learns a rage power that affects the skald and any allies under the influence of his inspired rage.
If a rage power requires another rage power (such as disruptive, which requires superstition), the skald cannot grant that rage power to allies unless he can also grant that power's prerequisite. He may add multiple rage powers to an inspired rage at the same time using this ability (such as granting superstition and disruptive simultaneously).
If a rage power can only be used a certain number of times per day or per rage (such as renewed vigor), each ally affected by the inspired rage song is subject to that limit (with once per rage abilities limited to once per inspired rage).
If the skald has rage powers from another source, he can use those rage powers during an inspired rage.
If the skald has the ability to rage from another source, he can use his skald rage powers during that rage as well.
75e5962a-409d-4374-8d4b-a9b84c5289fe: At 3rd level and every 3 levels thereafter, a warpriest gains a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} in addition to those gained from normal advancement. These bonus feats must be selected from those listed as Combat Feats, sometimes also called "fighter bonus feats."
359cc502-8610-4637-b7ca-f6d637b8cd25: At 3rd level and every 3 levels thereafter, the hunter gains a bonus teamwork {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} in addition to those gained from normal advancement. The hunter must meet the prerequisites of the selected bonus teamwork feat.
5ef74c4e-6e09-4340-9a68-c087a2a5aa8e: At 3rd level and every 6 levels thereafter, a master of all gains the Skill Focus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}.
60fcaec1-2cd4-47d7-9bd7-6b60ebe39b9b:
At 3rd level as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, a forester can grant the benefits of one teamwork {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} to all allies within 30 feet who can see and hear her. Allies retain the use of this bonus feat for 3 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} plus 1 round for every 2 levels the forester has. Allies do not need to meet the prerequisites of these bonus feats. The forester can use this ability once per day at 3rd level, plus one additional time per day at 7th level and every 5 levels thereafter.
This replaces hunter tactics.
e3d4757d-a95a-455c-bf2c-b53eda617bc8:
At 3rd level, 9th level, and 18th level, a tactical leader gains a teamwork {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} as a bonus feat. He must meet the prerequisites for this feat. As a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, the tactical leader can grant these feats to all allies within 30 feet who can see and hear him. Allies retain the use of these bonus feats for 3 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} plus 1 round for every 2 inquisitor levels the tactical leader has. Allies do not need to meet the prerequisites of these bonus feats.
The tactical leader can use this ability once per day at 3rd level, plus one additional time per day at 6th, 9th, 15th, and 18th level.
At 12th level, a tactical leader can use the tactician ability as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}.
92fe5ee1-137f-442c-80ce-f389016a0d64: At 3rd level, a Hellknight gains a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on Will {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g} against {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} with any one of the following subschools or descriptors: charm, compulsion, fear. At 6th level, the Hellknight chooses another subschool or descriptor from the list and gains a +2 bonus on his Will save against spells of that type, and the bonus provided by his first selection increases to +4. At 9th level, he chooses from the list again, and both previous selections increase by +2, so that he has a +6, a +4, and a +2 bonus, respectively, against spells of three different groups.
5695a58f-4de3-4ed1-a5a2-0c08a9fe6c58: At 3rd level, a Hellknight gains access to his first discipline. At 6th level, the Hellknight gains a second discipline. At 9th level, the Hellknight gains his third discipline. When applicable, the {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}save{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} to resist a discipline's effect is equal to DC 10 + the Hellknight's level + his {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier. The Hellknight can use any one discipline a number of times per day equal to the total number of disciplines he has access to, so at 3rd level he can use his discipline once per day. At 6th level, he can use both disciplines twice per day each. At 9th level, he can use all three of his disciplines three times per day.
44e65c8b-4c95-4b36-b3d2-631991bf351e: At 3rd level, a barbarian gains a +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex saves{/g} to avoid traps and a +1 dodge bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} against {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} by traps. These bonuses increase by 1 every 3 levels thereafter (to a maximum of +6 at 18th level).
6397c75c-b211-4c26-be2d-7a888918827f: At 3rd level, a cavalier learns to make more accurate charge {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} while mounted. The cavalier receives a +4 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g} rolls on a charge while mounted (instead of the normal +2). In addition, the cavalier does not suffer any {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to his {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} after making a charge attack while mounted.
3e519a53-b4f9-436b-8279-19528fc02989: At 3rd level, a demonslayer gains insight into his Abyssal enemies. The demonslayer gains a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} equal to half his {g|Encyclopedia:Class_Level}class level{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Knowledge_Arcana}Knowledge (arcana){/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g}.
2cdfda23-a2b1-46be-8a1d-43c4ba5a5778: At 3rd level, a disciple of the pike learns to make more accurate charge {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} with weapons from the polearms or spears fighter weapon group. He receives a +4 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attacks{/g} when charging with a polearm or spear (instead of the normal +2). In addition, the disciple of the pike takes no {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to his {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} after making a charge attack with a polearm or spear.
3385d165-bda8-4e5b-a395-50b742eb6247:
At 3rd level, a divine hunter learns to call upon the power of her deity. The divine hunter must select one domain from those available to her deity. She gains the granted powers of this domain, using (her hunter level – 2) as her cleric level for determining when the powers are gained and what effects they have. Once she chooses this domain, it cannot be changed.
If the divine hunter selects the animal domain, she does not gain a second animal companion upon reaching an effective cleric level of 4th. When the divine hunter would gain that ability, her animal companion instead gains two {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability score{/g} points increases (gaining +1 to two different ability scores or +2 to one ability score).
In addition, the divine hunter adds the 1-level domain {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} from her domain to her list of spells known. She adds the 2-level domain spell at 6th level, the 3-level domain spell at 9th level, the 4-level domain spell at 12th level, the 5-level domain spell at 15th level, and the 6-level domain spell at 18th level.
f8b21dc7-8cea-429b-bbe5-4a8a69a8306b: At 3rd level, a dragon disciple gains the breath weapon bloodline power, even if his level does not yet grant that power. Once his level is high enough to grant this ability through the bloodline, the dragon disciple gains an additional use of his breath weapon each day. The type and shape of the breath weapon depends on the type of dragon selected by the dragon disciple.
e7cc1820-e107-4fb2-a5ee-2943ae5981b4: At 3rd level, a dragonheir scion gains a +1 natural armor {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}energy resistance{/g} 5 against her energy type. At 7th level, this increases to a +2 natural armor bonus and energy resistance 10; at 13th level, it increases to a +3 natural armor bonus and energy resistance 20.
ec34c2c5-ad6a-41a7-aa30-d896d098431f: At 3rd level, a fearsome leader gains a +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Persuasion}Persuasion{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g} made to intimidate, increasing by +1 for every three levels thereafter.
67a97c6d-bae5-4024-84bb-c4c7fbcfa96b: At 3rd level, a fire dancer's performance can bend flames away from others. Any ally within 30 feet of the bard who can hear or see the bardic performance gains {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resist{/g} fire 10 as long as the performance is maintained. At 6th level, this resistance increases to 20. At 11th level, this resistance increases to 30.
138a34da-ef6f-4719-bb0f-c665e26c6344: At 3rd level, a greenrager's fury allows him to move through undergrowth with frightening {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} and grace. He can move through any sort difficult terrain at his normal speed and without taking {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} or suffering any other impairment.
ddb784b9-2f52-409f-bfca-6650825391dc: At 3rd level, a hunter's companion takes on otherworldly features. If the divine hunter is good, the animal companion gains the celestial template. If the hunter is evil, the animal companion gains the fiendish template. If the hunter is neutral, she must choose either the celestial or fiendish template; once this choice is made, it cannot be changed.
f301e0dd-c907-4892-97cf-e3657deff72c: At 3rd level, a judge gains the ability to share his judgments with all allies in a 30-foot radius. He can use this ability as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g} once plus one time for every 6 levels thereafter. The bonuses work until the end of combat.
28ae165d-4cd7-41f1-9e0f-7f8586e65811:
At 3rd level, a kineticist's body surges with energy from her chosen element whenever she accepts burn. In addition, she receives a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on her {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} with kinetic blasts equal to the total number of points of burn she currently has, to a maximum bonus of +1 for every 3 kineticist levels she possesses. She also receives a bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} with her kinetic blast equal to double the bonus on attack rolls.
As a kineticist's body becomes more and more suffused with her element, she begins to gain more powerful benefits.
Starting at 6th level, whenever she has at least 3 points of burn, the kineticist gains a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} bonus to two physical {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability scores{/g} of her choice. She also gains a chance to ignore the effects of a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g} or sneak attack equal to 5% for every current point of burn. At 11th level, whenever the kineticist has at least 5 points of burn, these bonuses increase to a +4 size bonus to one physical ability score of her choice and a +2 size bonus to each of her other two physical ability scores.
At 16th level, whenever the kineticist has at least 7 points of burn, these bonuses increase to a +6 size bonus to one physical ability score of her choice, a +4 size bonus to a second physical ability score of her choice, and a +2 size bonus to the remaining physical ability score.
c610ff4e-197c-4578-95bc-4d7318b1c893:
At 3rd level, a kineticist's body surges with energy from her chosen element whenever she accepts burn. In addition, she receives a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on her {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} with kinetic blasts equal to the total number of points of burn she currently has, to a maximum bonus of +1 for every 3 kineticist levels she possesses. She also receives a bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} with her kinetic blast equal to double the bonus on attack rolls.
Furthermore, an elemental engine, while at maximum burn, doubles those bonuses, and when using gather power, she reduces the burn cost by 1 additional point.
17e77d8a-66d6-4dac-b9dc-7d34988ab0ff: At 3rd level, a knife master is so skilled in combat involving light blades that she gains a +1 dodge {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} against {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} made against her with light blades. This bonus increases by +1 for every three levels, to a maximum of +6 at 18th level.
b734f644-913f-4f58-b4ac-d06c8bc2c63d:
At 3rd level, a martyr can apply Mercy — Shaken, even if he didn't select that mercy (or its prerequisites). However, when he uses a mercy he didn't select, he loses his See No Evil, Hear No Evil aura for one {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. As long as martyr's aura is disabled, he cannot apply corresponding mercies.
At 6th level, a martyr can also apply Mercy — Dazed and Staggered, at 9th level — Confused, Cursed and Frightened, and at 12th level — Stunned and Paralyzed.
916203f8-ffc5-4c07-82ef-590066c8bfb5:
At 3rd level, a martyr can apply Mercy — Sickened and Fatigued, even if he didn't select that mercy (or its prerequisites). However, when he uses a mercy he didn't select, he loses his Aura of Health for one {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. As long as martyr's aura is disabled, he cannot apply corresponding mercies.
At 6th level, a martyr can also apply Mercy — Diseased, at 9th level — Nauseated, Exhausted and Poisoned, and at 12th level — Blinded.
2be830b2-ea0f-4c18-b7d7-2d7d64faeb16:
At 3rd level, a martyr can apply any of the mercies for which he qualifies based on his paladin level to his lay on hands, even if he didn't select that mercy (or its prerequisites). However, when he uses a mercy he didn't select, he loses his Aura of {g|Encyclopedia:HP}Health{/g} or See No Evil, Hear No Evil aura (depending on the mercy) for one {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. As long as martyr's aura is disabled, he cannot apply corresponding mercies.
The martyr can use lay on hands on any ally within short range, rather than needing to touch the ally.
419f9af9-a6e6-4ff6-93a5-4bd4cee5b56c: At 3rd level, a metamorph gains a 25% chance to negate {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hits{/g} and precision {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}, similar to the preserve organs discovery. This chance increases to 50% at 6th level, and to 75% at 18th level.
ee7106d2-6f13-418a-958d-2870691df5a4: At 3rd level, a monk gains a +10 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to his base {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g}, which increases by 10 feet every 3 levels thereafter. A monk in armor loses this extra speed.
9901f106-3df9-4880-8231-4ac7157b38eb:
At 3rd level, a monk gains a +10 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to his base {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g}. A monk in armor or carrying a medium or heavy load loses this extra speed.
For every 3 levels above 3rd, the bonus improves by 10 feet.
6a840217-13d0-47d8-be61-540fa80dc11f:
At 3rd level, a monk gains a pool of ki points, supernatural energy he can use to accomplish amazing feats. The number of points in a monk's ki pool is equal to 1/2 his monk level + his {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier. As long as he has at least 1 point in his ki pool, he can make a ki strike.
At 3rd level, ki strike allows his {g|Encyclopedia:UnarmedAttack}unarmed attacks{/g} to be treated as magic weapons for the purpose of overcoming {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g}.
At 7th level, his unarmed {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} are also treated as cold iron and silver for the purpose of overcoming {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} reduction.
At 10th level, his unarmed attacks are also treated as lawful weapons for the purpose of overcoming damage reduction.
At 16th level, his unarmed attacks are treated as adamantine weapons for the purpose of overcoming damage reduction and bypassing hardness.
By spending 1 point from his ki pool as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}, a monk can make one additional unarmed strike at his highest attack bonus when making a flurry of blows attack. This bonus attack stacks with all bonus attacks gained from flurry of blows, as well as those from haste and similar effects. A monk gains additional powers that consume points from his ki pool as he gains levels.
The ki pool is replenished each morning after 8 hours of {g|Encyclopedia:Rest}rest{/g} or meditation; these hours do not need to be consecutive.
be8ba759-de8b-4355-88d1-aafab7d9fb9c: At 3rd level, a mutation warrior discovers how to create a mutagen that he can imbibe in order to heighten his physical prowess at the cost of his personality. This ability functions as the alchemist's mutagen ability, using his fighter level as his alchemist level.
901eb921-1c72-405a-ace1-4fef945d75fc: At 3rd level, a paladin is immune to all diseases, including supernatural and magical diseases, including mummy rot.
a314f5c7-5029-41c3-85c6-28c8d11e6443:
At 3rd level, a paladin is immune to fear (magical or otherwise). Each ally within 10 feet of her gains a +4 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against fear effects.
This ability functions only while the paladin is conscious, not if she is {g|Encyclopedia:Injury_Death}unconscious{/g} or dead.
6f8b209e-170a-465a-aa16-515fca0f7e6f:
At 3rd level, a ranger may select a type of terrain. The ranger gains a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Lore_Nature}Lore (nature){/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Perception}Perception{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Stealth}Stealth{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g} when he is in this terrain.
At 8th level and every five levels thereafter, the ranger may select an additional favored terrain. In addition, at each such interval, the skill bonus and initiative bonus in any one favored terrain (including the one just selected, if so desired) increases by +2.
ecff1cae-7f69-446c-baca-64193dcf200c: At 3rd level, a rogue gains a +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex saves{/g} to avoid traps and a +1 dodge bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} against {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} made by traps. These bonuses increase by 1 every 3 rogue levels thereafter (to a maximum of +6 at 18th level).
a25ebe91-bec7-4be1-809c-f5979a5a062b: At 3rd level, a sacred huntsmaster automatically grants her teamwork {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g} to her animal companion. The companion doesn't need to meet the prerequisites of these teamwork feats.
18873cf9-efff-42b1-9248-8ebd4cd5c104: At 3rd level, a scaled fist gains a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} attempted against all fear, paralysis, and sleep effects.
696b529d-9d3b-4edf-82fe-e859e93c9ac4: At 3rd level, a shifter ignores movement {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalties{/g} caused by difficult terrain, is immune to the entangled condition, and gains a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} against {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attacks of opportunity{/g}.
2573deff-a716-41e1-8dfd-4a862f1a7725:
At 3rd level, a stonelord's vitals begin to calcify and her blood transforms into liquid stone. She gains a 25% chance to ignore a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g} or precision {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}. This does not stack with fortification armor or similar effects.
At 9th level, this chance increases to 50% and she becomes immune to petrification.
At 15th level, this chance increases to 75% and she becomes immune to bleed.
4046d569-77e3-4a4a-82aa-865fd150867a: At 3rd level, a student of stone learns to draw strength from the earth. So long as he is touching the ground, the student of stone gains a +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}, bull rush and trip {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}combat maneuver{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}rolls{/g}, and to his {g|Encyclopedia:CMD}CMD{/g} when resisting a bull rush or trip attempt.
d982edd7-d026-46f5-a4ac-0cacba4a3d9c: At 3rd level, a tower shield specialist gains armor training as normal, but while he employs a tower shield, the {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Check_Penalty}armor penalty{/g} is reduced by 3 and the {g|Encyclopedia:Max_Dex_Bonus}maximum Dexterity bonus{/g} allowed by his tower shield increases by 2. The benefit increases every four levels thereafter as per standard armor training; if the tower shield specialist is not employing a tower shield, the benefits to armor training revert to the normal bonuses.
543f3aba-6e54-432e-8682-7a90bc53336a: At 3rd level, a winter witch's {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} become incredibly cold, increasing their {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} by 1. At 6th level this {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} increases to 2.
1176b6e7-a3ad-4a44-b97f-9f4b8a310fc8: At 3rd level, a zen archer gains Point-Blank Master as a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}, even if he does not meet the prerequisites.
620a01ed-77b3-4fdf-8c22-8a1d8d4b9b2e: At 3rd level, a zen archer may use his {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier instead of his {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} modifier on {g|Encyclopedia:RangedAttack}ranged attack{/g} rolls when using a bow.
1c8dec46-50f7-4262-995d-0cc1d943c906: At 3rd level, all of the inquisitor's allies are treated as if they possessed the same teamwork {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g} as the inquisitor for the purpose of determining whether the inquisitor receives a bonus from her teamwork feats. Her allies do not receive any bonuses from these feats unless they actually possess the feats themselves. The allies' positioning and {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}actions{/g} must still meet the prerequisites listed in the teamwork feat for the inquisitor to receive the listed bonus.
32ef966c-53f7-4c70-9971-7ce946fbd419: At 3rd level, an Aldori swordlord gains a +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to his {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} against {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attacks{/g} when making a full {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} with a dueling sword. This AC bonus increases to +2 at 7th level. If an Aldori swordlord is also a fighter with the Aldori defender fighter archetype, levels in this class stack with his fighter levels when determining the AC bonus from this ability.
5b83bd6c-d954-4a23-ba8a-9cc86387f1ba: At 3rd level, an archaeologist gains a +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on Reflex {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g} to avoid traps and a +1 dodge bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} against {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} made by traps. These bonuses increase by 1 every 3 bard levels thereafter (to a maximum of +6 at 18th level).
1727cde1-589e-4db6-8499-919fca1899ee:
At 3rd level, an armored battlemage gains armor training, as per the fighter ability.
At 8th level, he gains armor training 2.
At 13th level, he gains armor training 3.
At 18th level, he gains armor training 4.
85f562b7-030b-4d19-a043-3dc54049acdb: At 3rd level, an armored hulk is able to use her armor to help avoid deadly hits. While wearing heavy armor, she gains a +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} that applies only on {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g} confirmation {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}rolls{/g}. This bonus increases by +1 every 3 levels beyond 3rd (maximum +6 at 18th level).
a4db8505-1c59-48b5-94c8-5f831ef2c4db: At 3rd level, an eldritch font can, as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}, pour more power into her {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} and abilities. She can add 2 to the {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of a spell, or increase her effective arcanist level by 2 when using an arcanist exploit. She becomes fatigued upon using this ability. If she is already fatigued, she becomes exhausted. If she's already exhausted, she cannot use this ability. This ability does not stack with spending points from her arcane reservoir to increase the spell's caster level or DC (as the arcane reservoir class feature).
90c9fe9c-20b8-4baa-8a8a-1c5e12c7096d:
At 3rd level, an overwhelming soul gains a +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} with her kinetic blasts. The damage bonus doesn't apply to kinetic blade, kinetic whip, or other infusions that don't apply the damage bonus from elemental overflow.
This bonus increases by 1 at 6th level and every 3 levels thereafter.
36ca4761-86be-45a6-bade-b40c408ba099:
At 3rd level, and every three levels thereafter, a paladin can select one mercy.
Each mercy adds an effect to the paladin's lay on hands ability. Whenever the paladin uses lay on hands to {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} to one target, the target also receives the additional effects from all of the mercies possessed by the paladin.
8681adfb-b3f8-4807-afcd-e0f923500b82: At 3rd level, and every three levels thereafter, the inquisitor gains a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} in addition to those gained from normal advancement. These bonus feats must be selected from those listed as teamwork feats. The inquisitor must meet the prerequisites of the selected bonus feat.
bf94c6e3-bfe9-455c-9ee0-8c4ea96fad89:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Animate Dead: This spell raises {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g}+2 skeletons. Summoned monsters appear where you designate and act according to their {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} results. They {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} your opponents to the best of their ability.
7908215f-1a2c-430f-b9c2-e4df1732cbba:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Banishment: This spell is a more powerful version of the dismissal spell. It enables you to force extraplanar creatures out of your home plane. As many as 2 {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}Hit Dice{/g} of creatures per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} can be banished in a 30-foot radius; creatures who are closest to the burst's point of origin are affected first.
327793bc-8b8f-4828-a1fa-063324b3cc4d:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Banishment: This spell is a more powerful version of the dismissal spell. It enables you to force extraplanar creatures out of your home plane. As many as 2 {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}Hit Dice{/g} of creatures per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} can be banished in a 30-foot radius; creatures who are closest to the burst's point of origin are affected first.
Dismissal: This spell forces an extraplanar creature back to its proper plane if it fails a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g}. If the spell is successful, the creature is instantly whisked away.
6dd77889-7a01-4643-badf-7c7a60a83b6b:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Bless: This spell fills your allies with courage. Each ally gains a +1 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} and on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against fear effects.
Bless dispels bane.
67f476f5-a17d-430d-9c91-c76ec7a80389:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Break Enchantment: This spell frees victims from enchantments, transmutations, and curses. Break enchantment can reverse even an instantaneous effect. For each such effect, you make a {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d20{/g} + caster level, maximum +15) against a {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of 11 + caster level of the effect. Success means that the creature is free of the spell, curse, or effect.
a7e9d90a-e6e4-4187-a1c3-c798f5220f56:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Bull's Strength: The subject becomes stronger. The spell grants a +4 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} for 5 minutes, adding the usual benefits to {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g} rolls, melee {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}, and other uses of the Strength modifier. Enhancement bonuses do not stack with other enhancement bonuses, for example with bonuses from belts.
50d9d0b2-85cc-47fb-af4d-ada8925f62eb:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Burning Hands (Acid): This spell always deals a type of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} determined by your element (earth). In addition, the subtype of this spell changes to match the energy type of your element.
Any creature in the area takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}acid damage{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum 5d4).
e1af6e30-576c-4878-9232-dd1fa3eaa8a3:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Burning Hands (Cold): This spell always deals a type of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} determined by your element (water). In addition, the subtype of this spell changes to match the energy type of your element.
Any creature in the area takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}cold damage{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum 5d4).
df02dd98-cafa-477e-be8d-0f2e9def0d1f:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Burning Hands (Electricity): This spell always deals a type of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} determined by your element (air). In addition, the subtype of this spell changes to match the energy type of your element.
Any creature in the area takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}electricity damage{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum 5d4).
5ab7e33a-9c52-4977-8cf5-776eb2ee3b58:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Burning Hands: Any creature in the area of the flames takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum 5d4).
abf8863c-32dc-4ba6-a8db-bcee8224a353:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Cause Fear: The affected creature becomes frightened. If the subject succeeds at a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g}, it is instead shaken for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. Creatures with 6 or more {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}HD{/g} are immune to this effect. Cause fear counters and dispels remove fear.
6244f801-2b17-4d5b-94d9-b724e4f17d6b:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Cause Fear: The affected creature becomes frightened. If the subject succeeds at a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g}, it is instead shaken for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. Creatures with 6 or more {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}HD{/g} are immune to this effect. Cause fear dispels remove fear.
14cc7277-d467-4bb7-9a89-53e3910d4f89:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Changestaff: This spell changes an ordinary quarterstaff into a treant creature. It appears where you designate and acts according to its {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} results. It {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} your opponents to the best of its ability.
c6508d62-9bb5-4d62-9010-bcd290476b5d:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Clashing Rocks: You create two Colossal-sized masses of rock, dirt, and stone and slam them together against a single creature between them. The clashing rocks appear up to 30 feet away from the target on opposite sides and rush toward it with a mighty grinding crash. You must make a ranged {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g} to hit the target with the rocks. The clashing rocks ignore {g|Encyclopedia:Concealment}concealment{/g} and cover. A creature struck by the clashing rocks takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}20d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}bludgeoning damage{/g} and is knocked prone.
If the clashing rocks miss the target, the target still takes 10d6 points of bludgeoning {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} from falling rocks and is knocked prone. A successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} reduces this damage to half and the target remains standing. Creatures other than the target that occupy the spaces where the clashing rocks appear or within their path must also make Reflex saves or take 10d6 points of bludgeoning damage and be knocked prone (save for half and remain standing).
f2143a65-d2b4-4b24-a0ca-7eea5fa7229f:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Crushing Despair: An invisible cone of despair causes great sadness in the subjects. Each affected creature takes a -2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability checks{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g}, and weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}. Crushing despair dispels good hope.
7d01c66c-78b7-4a87-823c-44e9804eb139:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Deep Slumber: This spell causes a magical slumber to come upon 10 {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}HD{/g} of creatures; those who are closest to the spell's point of origin are affected first. HD that are not sufficient to affect a creature are wasted. Sleeping creatures are {g|Encyclopedia:Helpless}helpless{/g}. Slapping or wounding awakens an affected creature, but normal noise does not. This spell does not target {g|Encyclopedia:Injury_Death}unconscious{/g} creatures, constructs, or undead creatures.
d7b48d83-82d3-4505-a6cf-eef5144aaf95:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Delay Poison: The subject becomes temporarily immune to poison. Any poison in its system or any poison to which it is exposed during the spell's duration does not affect the subject until the spell's duration has expired. Delay poison does not {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}cure{/g} any {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} that poison may have already done.
b8d6f4c9-081b-4d64-8fa6-9d184eba2f3c:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Dimension Door: You instantly transfer yourself from your current location to any other spot within range.
ae4b3918-c422-4bc1-a272-0249b6249bef:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Dismissal: This spell forces an extraplanar creature back to its proper plane if it fails a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g}.
21c9b4f3-bf2d-4924-931f-940750efff70:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Dispel Magic, Greater: This functions as a targeted dispel magic, but it can dispel multiple spells, starting with the highest level spells and proceeding to lower level spells.
467e899f-d8e9-4f5a-9da5-bdd5fffe4e71:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Dispel Magic: One object, creature, or spell is the target of the dispel magic spell. You make one dispel {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d20{/g} + your {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}) and compare that to the spell with highest caster level ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} = 11 + the spell's caster level). If successful, that spell ends.
If not, compare the same result to the spell with the next highest caster level. Repeat this process until you have dispelled one spell affecting the target, or you have failed to dispel every spell.
8fa53b9e-4998-4257-86a3-b6ac06769b22:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Dispel Magic: You can use dispel magic to end one ongoing spell that has been cast on a creature.
You make one dispel {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d20{/g} + your {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}) and compare that to the spell with highest caster level ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} = 11 + the spell's caster level). If successful, that spell ends. If not, compare the same result to the spell with the next highest caster level. Repeat this process until you have dispelled one spell affecting the target, or you have failed to dispel every spell.
36f44e16-377a-4f96-bdac-f1c40d827d22:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Dragonkind I: You become a {g|Encyclopedia:Size}Medium{/g} dragon-like creature. You gain a +4 size {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g}, a +2 size bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g}, a +4 natural armor bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}, immunity to difficult terrain, a breath weapon, and resistance to one element. You also gain one bite ({g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d8{/g}), two claws (1d6), and two wing {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} (1d4). Your breath weapon and resistance depend on the type of your dragon prototype. You can only use the breath weapon once per casting of this spell. All breath weapons deal 6d8 points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} and allow a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} for half damage.
f032feda-2024-4ff7-a4a1-3dc491f0fa39:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Dragonkind II: This spell functions as dragonkind I except that it also allows you to assume the form of a {g|Encyclopedia:Size}Large{/g} dragon-like creature. You gain the following abilities: a +6 size {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g}, a +4 size bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g}, a +6 natural armor bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}, immunity to difficult terrain, a breath weapon, {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g} 5/magic, and resistance to one element. You also gain one bite ({g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d6{/g}), two claws (1d8), two wing {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} (1d6), and one tail slap attack (1d8). You can only use the breath weapon twice per casting of this spell (when you use it, the duration of your breath weapon ability is reduced by 1/2 your {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} in minutes). All breath weapons deal 8d8 points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} and allow a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} for half damage. Line breath weapons increase to 80-foot lines and cones increase to 40-foot cones.
98d9ee61-f77d-4d23-bce9-7fdddc058b51:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Dragonkind III: This spell functions as dragonkind II save that it also allows you to take the form of a {g|Encyclopedia:Size}Huge{/g} dragon-like creature. You gain the following abilities: a +10 size {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g}, a +8 size bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g}, a +8 natural armor bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}, immunity to difficult terrain, blindsight with a range of 30 feet, a breath weapon, {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g} 10/magic, frightful presence ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} equal to the DC for this spell) and immunity to one element. You also gain one bite ({g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d8{/g}), two claws (2d6), two wing {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} (1d8), and one tail slap attack (2d6). You can use the breath weapon as often as you like, but you must wait 1d4 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} between uses. All breath weapons deal 12d8 points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} and allow a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} for half damage. Line breath weapons increase to 100-foot lines and cones increase to 50-foot cones.
a7c856ce-39c2-4ff6-bb64-1ef7df4f510b:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Elemental Body I: When you cast this spell, you can assume the form of a small air elemental, small earth elemental, small fire elemental, or small water elemental. The abilities you gain depend upon the type of elemental into which you change. Elemental abilities based on {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} use the size of the elemental you transform into to determine their effect.
180c2c43-25b2-4309-be46-f748c728dc23:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Elemental Body II: When you cast this spell, you can assume the form of a medium air elemental, medium earth elemental, medium fire elemental, or medium water elemental. The abilities you gain depend upon the type of elemental into which you change. Elemental abilities based on {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} use the size of the elemental you transform into to determine their effect.
6e736a86-e47e-4b14-a1c8-28e1da637c6e:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Elemental Body III: When you cast this spell, you can assume the form of a large air elemental, large earth elemental, large fire elemental, or large water elemental. The abilities you gain depend upon the type of elemental into which you change. Elemental abilities based on {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} use the size of the elemental you transform into to determine their effect.
16f209b2-0245-4208-8844-5b547157c792:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Elemental Body IV: When you cast this spell, you can assume the form of a Huge air elemental, huge earth elemental, huge fire elemental, or huge water elemental. The abilities you gain depend upon the type of elemental into which you change. Elemental abilities based on {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} use the size of the elemental you transform into to determine their effect. You are also immune to {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hits{/g} and sneak attacks while in elemental form and gain {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} 5/—.
24c83edb-763e-492b-9641-c06c71a91608:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Elemental Swarm: This spell opens a portal to an Elemental Plane and summons elementals from it. When the spell is complete, {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d4{/g} large elementals appear. Five {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} later, 1d4 huge elementals appear. Five rounds after that, one greater elemental appears. The summoned elementals appear where you designate and act according to their {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} results. They {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} your opponents to the best of its ability.
7aab9058-93c6-48a4-a3ff-0a3017460e27:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Energy Drain: You point your finger and fire a black ray of negative energy that suppresses the life force of any living creature it strikes. You must make a ranged {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g} to hit. If you hit, the subject gains {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} temporary negative levels. Negative levels stack.
Twenty-four hours after gaining them, the subject must make a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude saving throw{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} = energy drain spell's save DC) for each negative level. If the save succeeds, that negative level is removed. If it fails, that negative level becomes permanent.
An undead creature struck by the ray gains 10d4 temporary {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} for 1 hour.
d67fedca-9a8b-4cbc-9884-295223dd55d1:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Entangle: This spell causes tall grass, weeds, and other plants to wrap around creatures in the area of effect or those that enter the area. Creatures that fail their {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}save{/g} gain the entangled condition for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}.
The entire area of effect is considered difficult terrain while the effect lasts.
b10f5d41-c790-4996-949b-d7de714ce3d9:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
False Life: You harness the power of unlife to grant yourself a limited ability to avoid {g|Encyclopedia:Injury_Death}death{/g}. While this spell is in effect, you gain temporary {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} equal to {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d10{/g} + 1 per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum +10).
b45256b0-6092-4b7b-a20a-0b5f4ec47274:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Fear: An invisible cone of terror causes each living creature in the area to become panicked unless it succeeds at a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g}. If cornered, a panicked creature begins cowering. If the Will save succeeds, the creature is instead shaken for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}.
f15c1a2f-ce0c-44de-a18f-69156f6c4527:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Finger of Death: This spell instantly delivers 10 points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}. If the target's {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude saving throw{/g} succeeds, it instead takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}3d6{/g} points of damage + 1 point per caster level.
a07f1c1a-6fda-4af3-a7a1-0e656dd5ad20:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Firebrand: You mark several allies with a flaming rune. This rune does not cause {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}, and sheds light as if it were a torch. While the firebrand burns, any creature it marks is immune to damage from any fire spell you cast. All of the target's weapons (both natural and manufactured) inflict {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}+1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g} on a hit (this {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} fire damage stacks with any amount of fire damage a creature's weapons might already inflict). At any point during the spell's duration, a creature bearing a firebrand can launch a beam of fire at any target within 30 feet as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}. This ray requires a ranged {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g} to hit and deals 6d6 points of fire damage. Once a creature uses its firebrand to fire a ray in this manner, the effects of the spell end for that creature.
586f1811-0ef9-4901-9fd8-7220db144ed6:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Flame Strike: A flame strike evokes a vertical column of divine fire. The spell deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum 15d6). Half the damage is {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g}, but the other half results directly from divine power and is therefore not subject to being reduced by {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resistance{/g} to fire-based {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g}.
fa21ad32-6d5c-413f-8458-53e637ed67b2:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Frightful Aspect: You become a larger, awful version of yourself. You gain the following abilities: a +6 {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g}, a +4 size bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g}, a +6 natural armor bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} 10/magic, and {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g} equal to 10 + half your {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}. You also emit an aura that emanates 30 feet from you. Enemy creatures within the aura are shaken. Each time a creature shaken by this aura hits you with a {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g}, that creature becomes frightened for {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g}.
cbbbfa2f-4924-4535-afc2-58b150c1a240:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Hellfire Ray: A blast of hellfire blazes from your hands. You can fire one ray, plus one additional ray for every 4 {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster levels{/g} beyond 11th (to a maximum of three rays at 19th level). Each ray requires a ranged {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g} to hit and deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} per caster level (maximum 15d6). Half the damage is {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g}, but the other half results directly from unholy power and is therefore not subject to being reduced by fire {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resistance{/g}.
eb3ba526-3b66-4ce4-8833-af7dc9fde083:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Hideous Laughter: This spell afflicts the subject with uncontrollable laughter. It collapses into gales of manic laughter, falling prone. The subject can take no {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}actions{/g} while laughing, but is not considered {g|Encyclopedia:Helpless}helpless{/g}. After the spell ends, it can act normally. On the creature's next turn, it may attempt a new {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g} to end the effect. A creature with an {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} score of 2 or lower is not affected.
8403e9e8-01f3-4079-a4e4-b6934a9f4dd1:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Hold Monster: This spell functions like hold person, except that it affects any living creature that fails its {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g}.
8352ef0f-7e9e-44e1-80b8-4cb6aae27007:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Hold Person: The subject becomes paralyzed and freezes in place. It is aware and breathes normally but cannot take any {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}actions{/g}, even speech. Each {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} on its turn, the subject may attempt a new {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g} to end the effect. This is a {g|Encyclopedia:Full_Round_Action}full-round action{/g} that does not provoke {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attacks of opportunity{/g}.
bbb00af5-14a0-44df-b52f-056def6779d8:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Horrid Wilting: This spell evaporates moisture from the body of each subject living creature, causing flesh to wither and crack and crumble to dust. This deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum 20d6). This spell is especially devastating to water elementals and plant creatures, which instead take 1d8 points of damage per caster level (maximum 20d8).
7bfbfc48-291b-4152-96b5-24398c018346:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Hypnotism: Your gestures and droning incantation fascinate nearby creatures, causing them to stop and stare blankly at you. {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}Roll{/g} 2d4 to see how many total {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}HD{/g} of creatures you affect.
96548d45-c0ac-421f-b592-dcc5e1c340b0:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Invisibility: The touched creature becomes invisible.
If a {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} is required, an invisible creature has a +20 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on its {g|Encyclopedia:Stealth}Stealth checks{/g}. The spell ends if the subject {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} any creature. For the purposes of this spell, an attack includes any spell targeting a foe or whose area or effect includes a foe. {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}Actions{/g} directed at unattended objects do not break the spell. Causing harm indirectly is not an attack. Thus, an invisible being can open doors, talk, eat, climb stairs, summon monsters and have them attack, cut the ropes holding a rope bridge while enemies are on the bridge, remotely trigger traps, open a portcullis to release attack dogs, and so forth. If the subject attacks directly, however, it immediately becomes visible along with all its gear. Spells such as bless that specifically affect allies but not foes are not attacks for this purpose, even when they include foes in their area.
a9b992bc-6391-493b-8de9-66d6859e80bd:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Mage Armor: An invisible but tangible field of force surrounds the subject of a mage armor spell, providing a +4 armor {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}.
Unlike mundane armor, mage armor entails no {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Check_Penalty}armor check penalty{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Fail_Chance}arcane spell failure chance{/g}, or {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} reduction. Since mage armor is made of force, incorporeal creatures can't bypass it the way they do normal armor.
7b60b35f-3af4-4df9-9f52-d03c7baf0048:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Magic Missile: A missile of magical energy darts forth from your fingertip and strikes its target, dealing {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g}+1 points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}force damage{/g}.
The missile strikes unerringly, even if the target is in melee combat, so long as it has less than total cover or total {g|Encyclopedia:Concealment}concealment{/g}.
For every two {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster levels{/g} beyond 1st, you gain an additional missile — two at 3rd level, three at 5th, four at 7th, and the maximum of five missiles at 9th level or higher.
2afdd436-c5c2-491f-8bec-697d2bba5173:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Mind Fog: This spell produces a bank of thin mist that weakens the mental resistance of those caught in it. Creatures in the mind fog take a –10 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will saves{/g}. Affected creatures take the penalty as long as they remain in the fog and for {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d6{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} thereafter. The fog is stationary and lasts for 30 minutes.
5fe27717-92aa-4b6f-bcf7-6ebb82b69c2c:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Overwhelming Presence: Your presence inspires incredible awe in those nearby. A creature that fails a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}save{/g} against this spell falls to the ground and prostrates itself before you, believing it bows before a divine presence. These creatures are considered to be {g|Encyclopedia:Helpless}helpless{/g} for the duration of the spell. Each {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} on its turn, a target of this spell may attempt a new saving throw to end the effect; this is a {g|Encyclopedia:Full_Round_Action}full-round action{/g} that does not provoke {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attacks of opportunity{/g}. A creature that recovers from this spell early after being affected by it for at least 1 round takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} drain and is staggered for 1d4 rounds. A creature that makes the initial save to resist this spell is merely staggered for 1 round.
a4290de2-ad42-42ab-98a4-bf2fa7e9a984:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Poison: Calling upon the venomous powers of natural predators, you infect the subject with a horrible poison by making a successful melee {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g}. This poison deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d3{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:AbilityDamage}damage{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} for 6 rounds. Poisoned creatures can make a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g} each round to negate the {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} and end the affliction.
d42ff6b7-ca20-4f0c-902f-4e75cc4bb75c:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Polar Midnight: You plunge an area into the brutal chill of the arctic night. All creatures in the area take {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}5d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}cold damage{/g} and 1d6 points of {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:AbilityDamage}damage{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. A successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g} each round negates the Dexterity damage but not the cold {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}.
7cb49607-13f8-455f-a1c0-6a3de2b681df:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Power Word Stun: You utter a single word of power that instantly causes one creature of your choice to become stunned, whether the creature can hear the word or not. The duration of the spell depends on the target's current {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit point{/g} total. Any creature that currently has 151 or more hit points is unaffected by power word stun.
12af424d-450e-42a9-a777-3f37bb2d3783:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
