Protection from Energy: This spell grants temporary immunity to the type of energy you specify when you cast it (acid, cold, electricity, fire, or sonic). When the spell absorbs 12 points per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}energy damage{/g} (to a maximum of 120 points at 10th level), it is discharged.
df9d0f31-a6f7-4370-abf2-6a1f01c9a714:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Protection from Good: The subject gains a +2 deflection {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} and a +2 resistance bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g}. Both these bonuses apply against {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} made or effects created by good creatures.
1e2ebe87-5c5b-4d9d-8907-816f59b7db55:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Rage: Each affected creature gains a +2 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g}, a +1 morale bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will saves{/g}, and a -2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}. The effect is otherwise identical with a barbarian's rage except that the subjects aren't fatigued at the end of the rage.
a9ae7ef7-9443-4f2a-bd52-41818c01e824:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Remove Curse: This spell can remove all curses on an object or a creature. If the target is a creature, you must make a {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d20{/g} + caster level) against the {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of each curse affecting the target. Success means that the curse is removed.
30569881-04d6-4e2f-a40f-f0f839477e88:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Resist Energy: This abjuration grants a creature limited protection from {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} of whichever one of five energy types you select: acid, cold, electricity, fire, or sonic. The subject gains resist energy 10 against the energy type chosen, meaning that each time the creature is subjected to such damage (whether from a natural or magical source), that damage is reduced by 10 points before being applied to the creature's {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g}. The value of the energy {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resistance{/g} granted increases to 20 points at 7th level and to a maximum of 30 points at 11th level. The spell protects the recipient's equipment as well.
a25390fa-ec8b-478f-9906-303f29c3760f:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Scorching Ray (Acid): This spell always deals a type of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} determined by your element (earth). In addition, the subtype of this spell changes to match the energy type of your element.
You blast your enemies with a beam of acid. You may fire one ray, plus one additional ray for every four levels beyond 3rd (to a maximum of three rays at 11th level). Each ray requires a ranged {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g} to hit and deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}4d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}acid damage{/g}.
1177d673-4b05-452b-ae12-3178e9dc1ff1:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Scorching Ray (Cold): This spell always deals a type of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} determined by your element (water). In addition, the subtype of this spell changes to match the energy type of your element.
You blast your enemies with a beam of cold. You may fire one ray, plus one additional ray for every four levels beyond 3rd (to a maximum of three rays at 11th level). Each ray requires a ranged {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g} to hit and deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}4d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}cold damage{/g}.
d8e7ec55-acb0-46ba-bb32-7aec1d6e628f:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Scorching Ray (Electricity): This spell always deals a type of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} determined by your element (air). In addition, the subtype of this spell changes to match the energy type of your element.
You blast your enemies with a beam of electricity. You may fire one ray, plus one additional ray for every four levels beyond 3rd (to a maximum of three rays at 11th level). Each ray requires a ranged {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g} to hit and deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}4d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}electricity damage{/g}.
d5736a36-c962-4d07-813e-440e51c11839:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Scorching Ray: You blast your enemies with a searing beam of fire. You may fire one ray, plus one additional ray for every four levels beyond 3rd (to a maximum of three rays at 11th level). Each ray requires a ranged {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g} to hit and deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}4d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g}.
e34f048a-802a-4566-8815-ad97cf9d7f88:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Stoneskin: The warded creature gains resistance to blows, cuts, stabs, and slashes. The subject gains {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} 10/adamantine. It ignores the first 10 points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} each time it takes damage from a weapon, though an adamantine weapon overcomes the damage reduction. Once the spell has prevented a total of 10 points of damage per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum 150 points), it is discharged.
84c5154f-4139-4fce-b4c0-8eebcd79b837:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Summon Hamadryad: This spell summons to your side a natural hamadryad. The summoned ally appears where you designate and acts according to its {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} results. It {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} your opponents to the best of its ability.
3299a0bb-e98f-4e19-95bd-32e52f7f6724:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Summon Monster III: This spell summons an extraplanar monitor lizard, {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d3{/g} extraplanar wolves, or 1d4+1 extraplanar dogs. Summoned monsters appear where you designate and act according to their {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} results. They {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} your opponents to the best of their ability.
71dee4c3-3fa2-41bd-9a9d-16c276233b89:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Summon Monster IX: This spell summons {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d3{/g} extraplanar movanic devas if you are good or neutral and 1d3 extraplanar frost giants if you are evil, 1d4+1 rocs, or one ghaele azata if you are good or neutral and one thanadaemon if you are evil. Summoned monsters appear where you designate and act according to their {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} results. They {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} your opponents to the best of their ability.
856584b0-274f-4590-9c70-4c20b9cdcdad:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Summon Monster VII: This spell summons {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d3{/g} extraplanar axiomites if you are good or neutral and 1d3 extraplanar soul eaters if you are evil, 1d4+1 extraplanar bralani azatas if you are good or neutral and 1d4+1 extraplanar redcaps if you are evil, or one roc. Summoned monsters appear where you designate and act according to their {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} results. They {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} your opponents to the best of their ability.
065da5e0-9860-4028-aa3a-291d274617a6:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Summon Monster VIII: This spell summons {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d3{/g} extraplanar rocs, 1d4+1 extraplanar axiomites if you are good or neutral and 1d4+1 extraplanar soul eaters if you are evil, or one movanic deva if you are good or neutral and one frost giant if you are evil. Summoned monsters appear where you designate and act according to their {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} results. They {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} your opponents to the best of their ability.
14134d67-31b0-41f3-a80f-0c1118b6ad97:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Summon Nereid: This spell summons to your side a natural nereid. The summoned ally appears where you designate and acts according to its {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} results. It {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} your opponents to the best of its ability.
d23c1ab8-6f99-42d8-8e7b-891b0e6f9c49:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Sunburst: This spell causes a globe of searing radiance to explode silently from a point you select. All creatures in the globe are blinded and take {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}6d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}. A successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} negates the blindness and reduces the damage by half.
An undead creature caught within the globe takes 1d6 points of damage per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum 25d6), or half damage with a successful Reflex save.
823fb11a-67ac-42a0-9e15-9fee9205b90f:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Transformation: You become a fighting machine – stronger, tougher, faster, and more skilled in combat. Your mindset changes so that you relish combat and you can't cast spells, even from magic items.
You gain a +4 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g}, a +4 natural armor bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}, a +5 competence bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude saves{/g}, and proficiency with all simple and {g|Encyclopedia:Weapon_Proficiency}martial weapons{/g}. Your {g|Encyclopedia:BAB}base attack bonus{/g} equals your {g|Encyclopedia:Character_Level}character level{/g} (but not higher than 20), which may give you multiple {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g}.
bd7c653b-f8c3-4baa-b44f-a00b2609ab4e:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
True Seeing: You confer on the subject the ability to see all things as they actually are. The subject sees through normal and magical darkness, notices secret doors hidden by magic, sees the exact locations of creatures or objects under blur or displacement effects, sees invisible creatures or objects normally, sees through illusions, and sees the true form of polymorphed, changed, or transmuted things.
8989bd83-f616-49fd-8bbd-7692c925a266:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Undeath to Death: This spell snuffs out the life force of undead creatures, killing them instantly. The spell slays {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}HD{/g} worth of undead creatures per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum 20d4). Creatures with the fewest HD are affected first; among creatures with equal HD, those who are closest to the burst's point of origin are affected first. No creature of 9 or more HD can be affected, and HD that are not sufficient to affect a creature are wasted.
a42370cf-294f-414a-b9d9-92a834965929:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Unholy Aura: A malevolent darkness surrounds the subjects, protecting them from {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g}, granting them {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}resistance to spells{/g} cast by good creatures, and weakening good creatures when they strike the subjects. This abjuration has four effects.
First, each warded creature gains a +4 deflection {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} and a +4 resistance bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g}. Unlike the effect of protection from good, this benefit applies against all attacks, not just against attacks by good creatures.
Second, each warded creature gains spell resistance 25 against good spells and spells cast by good creatures.
Third, the abjuration protects the recipient from possession and mental influence, just as protection from good does.
Finally, if a good creature succeeds on a {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g} against a warded creature, the offending attacker takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:AbilityDamage}damage{/g} (Fortitude negates).
422f54c1-5c18-42a6-b746-78d388463c7c:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Vampiric Touch: You must succeed on a melee {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g}. Your touch deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} per two {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster levels{/g} (maximum 10d6). You gain temporary {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} equal to the damage you deal. You can't gain more than the subject's current hit points + the subject's {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} score (which is enough to kill the subject). The temporary hit points disappear 1 hour later.
ca7c84ef-aaa0-4f4c-b785-795bc2ed6c27:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Vinetrap: Vines choked with thorns, blossoms, leaflets, and other floral debris burst to life on and around the subject of this spell. When this spell is cast, the subject becomes paralyzed and entangled, though a successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} negates the paralysis. Each {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} on its turn, the subject may attempt a new saving throw to end both the paralysis and entangle effects.
The subject takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d4{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}piercing damage{/g} each turn from the sharp thorns. This {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} is considered to be cold iron for the purposes of overcoming {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g}.
31cb58a0-77f4-4d02-b950-14eb08570e2e:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Waves of Fatigue: Waves of negative energy render all living creatures in the spell's area fatigued. This spell has no effect on a creature that is already fatigued.
926ed010-81ba-485a-be93-9e7ef87802c6:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
You plunge an area into the brutal chill of the arctic night.
All creatures in the area take {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}5d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}cold damage{/g} and 1d6 points of {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:AbilityDamage}damage{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. A successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g} each round negates the Dexterity damage but not the cold {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}.
b3058b47-b0d9-453b-b478-cedd91594de5:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
{g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}Spell Resistance{/g}: The target gains spell resistance equal to 12 + your {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}.
da666fcb-dd02-4f0c-84ae-9e19dffee3ba: At 3rd level, due to the power of his blood, a bloodrager can stand confidently amid the effects of {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} cast by himself or his allies. He gains a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against spells that he or an ally casts.
294a91c4-6835-42a2-9a64-d7c5e95fa246: At 3rd level, her claws bypass {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} N/cold iron, N/magic, and N/silver.
325c29f6-09e3-42e7-bdda-7af5a5ac2118: At 3rd level, her spikes bypass {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} N/cold iron, N/magic, and N/silver.
0e3c4717-c141-4602-9de8-49b8462ed95b: At 3rd level, his slams bypass {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} N/cold iron, N/magic, and N/silver.
5405cd74-8738-4b79-b717-7b9b3ef17aaa: At 3rd level, ki strike allows the monk's {g|Encyclopedia:UnarmedAttack}unarmed attacks{/g} to be treated as magic weapons for the purpose of overcoming {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g}.
c100ff3d-3b37-453d-bffd-48d9a435ed47: At 3rd level, ki strike allows the sohei's {g|Encyclopedia:UnarmedAttack}unarmed attacks{/g} and any {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} with weapons for which he has weapon training to be treated as magic weapons for the purpose of overcoming {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g}.
f0b23863-50bc-4f3c-ba7f-528e415b1dab: At 3rd level, student of war can withstand even mental and unusual {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} with great will. If she makes a successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will saving throw{/g} against an attack that normally deals half {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} on a successful save, she instead takes no damage.
cc6ced98-161b-46a1-9d7b-45cfdf277f93: At 3rd level, the brown-fur transmuter learns to harness the power of her magic to empower her transmutations. Whenever the brown-fur transmuter casts a transmutation {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} using one of her arcanist spell slots, she can expend 1 point from her arcane reservoir as a {g|Encyclopedia:Free_Action}free action{/g} to bolster the spell. If the spell grants a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to an {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability score{/g}, the bonus then increases by 2. The brown-fur transmuter cannot expend more than 1 point from her arcane reservoir in this way.
164a7e03-b8d9-4568-b004-1854c58eeb23: At 3rd level, the defender of the true world's animal companion and any creatures she summons with summon nature's ally gain a +1 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} against fey creatures. This bonus increases to +2 at 8th level, +3 at 13th level, and +4 at 18th level.
bf470a7c-51e5-4034-98e1-18bda4e12702: At 3rd level, the hunter automatically grants her teamwork {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g} to her animal companion. The companion doesn't need to meet the prerequisites of these teamwork feats.
40d62869-cbe5-4e60-a54f-dc267eacf4d9: At 3rd level, the invulnerable rager gains 1 point of fire resistance and 1 point of cold resistance. At 6th level and every 3 levels thereafter, these resistances increase by 1 point (up to 6 points at 18th level).
33c07588-3c8e-44f2-88ce-e74308cb3634: At 3rd level, the martyr and all allies within 20 feet of him gain a +4 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against diseases. This ability functions only when the martyr is conscious.
f05425b4-86a3-4f5b-9784-b45a7dc4bf1c:
At 3rd level, the scaled fist has gained some control over the draconic energies she studies. She must select one type of dragon.
Once this choice is made, it cannot be changed. The scaled fist can expend 1 point from her ki pool as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g} to imbue her {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural attacks{/g} with the energy specific to this dragon, causing them to deal an extra {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} of the chosen energy type for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to 1/2 her monk level.
At 12th level, a scaled fist can spend 3 points from her ki pool to make a breath weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}. This breath weapon deals 1d6 points of damage of her energy type per monk level in a 30-foot cone or 60-foot line. Those caught in the area of the breath can attempt a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} = 10 + 1/2 the scaled fist's monk level + her {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier) to halve the normal damage.
9b4d9c59-3e26-4b30-ba4a-bfc047d825da: At 3rd level, the thundercaller can use her performance to unleash a deafening peal of thunder, blasting an area in a 10-foot range with a tremendous cacophony. Every creature in the area takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d8{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}sonic damage{/g} and must succeed at a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g} to avoid being stunned for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. Creatures that cannot hear are not stunned but are still {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damaged{/g}. At 7th level, the sonic damage that is dealt by this blast of sound increases to 3d8. This damage further increases to 5d8 at 11th level, 7d8 at 15th level, and 9d8 at 19th level.
e32a3967-55c2-4bb5-8d1d-9af7bb7b252d: At 3rd level, when a swordlord makes a full {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} with a dueling sword, he gains a +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} against {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attacks{/g} until the beginning of his next turn. This bonus increases by +1 every four levels after 3rd.
67e459f4-f554-4a23-9163-590fbc07a091: At 3rd level, when a two-handed fighter makes a single {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} (with the attack action or a charge) with a {g|Encyclopedia:Light_Weapon}two-handed{/g} weapon, he adds double his {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}.
b8dd5d0f-4574-4991-8518-67f5bc06f615: At 3rd level, whenever a demon dancer inspires rage, all who accept his rage gain a bite {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} dealing {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}. This damage increases to 1d8 at 7th level, to 2d6 at 12th level, and to 3d6 at 17th level.
68bab5b3-b49d-4c80-ad5f-12c46022fd6b: At 3rd level, whenever a thug deals sneak attack {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}, she can choose to forgo {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of sneak attack damage to make the target sickened for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to 1/2 her rogue level. This ability does not stack with itself — only the most recent duration applies.
42c04cd8-80d2-40ca-9e83-e5f4df6483b8: At 3rd level, whenever the hunter {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} the enemy who is engaged in melee combat with his animal companion, the hunter gets a +1 circumstance {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to attack and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}. This bonus increases to +2 at 12th level and to a +3 at 18th level.
0b07a429-b630-4b92-afc7-0456172b5c24:
At 3rd level, while a Hellknight signifer wears armor, he reduces the {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Check_Penalty}armor check penalty{/g} by 1 (to a minimum of 0), and reduces the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Fail_Chance}arcane spell failure chance{/g} by 5%.
At 8th level, he reduces his armor check {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} by an additional 1, and reduces his arcane {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} failure by an additional 5%.
Additionally, a Hellknight signifer's {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} is not reduced by wearing medium or heavy armor.
6edf4907-9146-4479-9499-53aa60ee3045: At 3rd level, you can move through any sort difficult terrain at your normal {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} and without taking {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} or suffering any other impairment.
dd3adcab-3910-437a-89ff-0f1e2a134bc9: At 3rd level, you gain a viper familiar. A familiar is a magical pet that enhances your {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g} and senses. A vipers's master gains a +3 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Persuasion}Persuasion checks{/g} and a +3 bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Perception}Perception checks{/g}.
d07de44e-ec93-413b-81b5-6e2b3a0fa528: At 3rd level, you gain acid {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resistance{/g} 10. At 9th level, your acid resistance increases to 20.
8dcca161-85e9-448e-b58d-ad9a85abe07a: At 3rd level, you gain cold {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resistance{/g} 10. At 9th level, your cold resistance increases to 20.
e3c03066-63a6-4a3c-81e5-1d92f79f27b3: At 3rd level, you gain electricity {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resistance{/g} 10. At 9th level, your electricity resistance increases to 20.
a6281ba8-e9a7-4b45-9b01-4a773f0286ce: At 3rd level, you gain fire {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resistance{/g} 10. At 9th level, your fire resistance increases to 20.
8f4f7267-be60-4409-9e53-32602af6469b: At 3rd level, you gain {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resist{/g} 5 against acid and a +1 natural armor {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}. At 9th level, your acid resistance increases to 10 and your natural armor bonus increases to +2. At 15th level, your natural armor bonus to AC increases to +4.
d53c072f-7232-4241-8083-e73681e0c178: At 3rd level, you gain {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resist{/g} 5 against cold and a +1 natural armor {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}. At 9th level, your cold resistance increases to 10 and your natural armor bonus to AC increases to +2. At 15th level, your natural armor bonus increases to +4.
7a9ac8a1-726f-4fd5-9e5b-0f59bd4b954d: At 3rd level, you gain {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resist{/g} 5 against electricity and a +1 natural armor {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}. At 9th level, your electricity resistance increases to 10 and your natural armor bonus to AC increases to +2. At 15th level, your natural armor bonus increases to +4.
aa80d94b-25bb-4bfb-9f0a-b9d9b36b9df5: At 3rd level, you gain {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resist{/g} 5 against fire and a +1 natural armor {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}. At 9th level, your fire resistance increases to 10 and your natural armor bonus to AC increases to +2. At 15th level, your natural armor bonus increases to +4.
fe0f1900-6db4-4f7c-ad42-1dd9eb51a974: At 3rd level, you gain {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resist{/g} acid 5 and resist cold 5. At 9th level, your resistances increase to 10.
64200d8f-3b8a-4c6b-b68a-ac516d524edc: At 3rd level, you gain {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resist{/g} cold 5 and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} 5/magic. At 9th level, your resistance to cold increases to 10 and your DR increases to 10/magic.
004f6302-1da3-4659-94de-fbb42f3bf4ee: At 3rd level, you gain {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resist{/g} electricity 5 and a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} made against poison. At 9th level, your resistance to electricity increases to 10 and your bonus on poison saving throws increases to +4.
cf1268a4-504c-438e-a1c6-77037063f7be: At 3rd level, you gain {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resist{/g} fire 5 and a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} made against poison. At 9th level, your resistance to fire increases to 10 and your bonus on poison saving throws increases to +4.
92fa3815-321d-4f13-a764-bc254f0deff4: At 3rd level, you get a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Concentration}concentration checks{/g} made to cast a {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} or use a {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}spell-like ability{/g}. At 9th level, your concentration {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} bonus increases to +3, and at 15th level, it increases to +4. At 20th level, this ability is replaced by arcane apotheosis.
2a8b632a-2796-4c2d-bafc-f886a3fb0864: At 3rd, 6th and 8th level, the duration of the poisons increases by 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}.
bb8118d5-856d-4d69-a821-dd39716d81da:
At 4th level a Hellknight signifer gains the assiduous gaze ability. He can use it for the number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to his {g|Encyclopedia:Class_Level}class level{/g} once per day. He gains the benefits of True Seeing for the duration.
At 7th level, a Hellknight signifer can use this ability two times per day.
89bd126e-d733-49a1-85e3-1ca16f95610f:
At 4th level and 8th level, the cleric gains a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}.
This must be a teamwork feat, {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}Spell{/g} Penetration or Greater Spell Penetration. The cleric must meet the prerequisites of the selected bonus feat.
ef1f13b1-b04d-40ce-9ce9-fef58cb097d5: At 4th level and every 2 levels thereafter, a monk can select one ki power. These powers allow the monk to perform amazing feats of mystical power and acrobatic prowess by expending points from his ki pool. Once a ki power is selected, it cannot be changed. Some ki powers require the monk to be of a specific level or higher before they can be chosen. Unless otherwise noted, a monk cannot select an individual ki power more than once.
3c5c8a35-a04d-4c09-a369-0ed005e0a2ce: At 4th level and every 4 levels thereafter, a primalist can choose to take either his bloodline power or two barbarian rage powers. If the primalist chooses rage powers, those rage powers can be used in conjunction with his bloodrage, and his bloodrager level acts as his barbarian level when determining the effect of those bloodrage powers and any prerequisites. Any other prerequisites for a rage power must be met before a primalist can choose it. This ability does not count as the rage power class feature for determining {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} prerequisites and other requirements.
b0b7f93c-3765-43d0-859f-b342ff7f5883:
At 4th level, a champion of the faith can focus his powers against his chosen foes. As a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}, the champion of the faith chooses one target within sight to smite. If this target is of his opposed {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}alignment{/g}, the champion of the faith adds his {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} bonus (if any) to his {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} and adds his warpriest level to all {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} made against the target of his smite. Smite attacks automatically bypass any {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} the target possesses.
In addition, while smite is in effect, the champion of the faith gains a deflection {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} equal to his Charisma modifier (if any) to his {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} against attacks made by the target of the smite. If the smite targets a creature that's not of the champion of the faith's opposed alignment, the smite is wasted with no effect.
The smite effect remains until the target of the smite is dead or the next time the champion of the faith regains {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}. The champion of the faith can use this ability once per day, plus one additional time per day for every 4 levels beyond 4th (to a maximum of five times per day at 20th level). Using this ability consumes two uses of his fervor ability.
dd2c9ecf-2d18-4a51-908e-db95dae78b87:
At 4th level, a child of the manticore can use her wild shape ability to become a manticore. This ability lasts for 1 minute (the Master Shapeshifter mythic ability makes this duration permanent). Using manticore shape is a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} that does not cause {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attacks of opportunity{/g}. The child of the manticore can use manticore shape a number of times per day equal to her shifter level + her {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier. While in this form, she gains a {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} bonus of +10 feet, the {g|Encyclopedia:Scent}scent{/g} ability (30 feet), and four spike natural throwing {g|Encyclopedia:RangedAttack}ranged attacks{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}). At 9th level, the child of the manticore gains immunity to ground-based effects and a +4 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on damage rolls with {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural attacks{/g}. At 14th level, the child of the manticore gains the {g|Encyclopedia:Improved_NaturalAttack}improved natural attack{/g} ability with her spike {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}.
Primary natural attacks: spike
This alters wild shape and replaces chimeric aspect and greater chimeric aspect.
e6b8ba25-aa24-4ae1-a5cf-d3bdb04fdb47: At 4th level, a cult leader can try to fascinate all enemies in a 30-foot radius. If the enemies fail their {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will saving throw{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} 10 + half his warpriest level + his {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier), they are fascinated for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to his Wisdom modifier. Using this ability consumes two uses of his fervor ability.
ed56d52a-438a-4407-8be3-9320fdf8b6f8: At 4th level, a disciple of the pike has an uncanny ability to identify monsters. He gains a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} equal to half of his cavalier level on {g|Encyclopedia:Knowledge_Arcana}Knowledge (arcana){/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Lore_Nature}Lore (nature) checks{/g}.
ce8835aa-8d5f-4c8b-a2d2-aea7affdfd01: At 4th level, a disenchanter can channel a burst of pure Abjuration magic to grant protection to himself and all allies with 30 feet. Affected creatures receive a +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}spell-like abilities{/g} for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to his warpriest level. This is a sacred bonus if the warpriest is {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}good-aligned{/g} or able to spontaneously cast {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}cure{/g} spells, and a profane bonus if the warpriest is evil-aligned or able to spontaneously cast inflict spells. Using this ability consumes two uses of his fervor ability. At 8th level and every 4 levels thereafter, the bonus granted by mystic interference increases by 1 (to a maximum of +5 at 20th level).
9aa05bbf-db52-43dc-a9c1-7342fa6c3b25: At 4th level, a drovier can imbue her allies (including herself ) with an aspect of a wild animal. As a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, she chooses an animal totem and grants the abilities of that totem to every ally within 30 feet. This otherwise functions like the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} animal aspect. She can use this ability for 10 minutes per druid level each day. This duration does not need to be consecutive, but it must be used in 10-minute increments. If she uses the ability to grant a new aspect, any previous aspect immediately ends.
a376c6d8-3eb5-414d-bdd8-521f44cd9b8b:
At 4th level, a drovier can imbue her allies (including herself ) with an aspect of a wild animal. As a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, she chooses an animal totem and grants the abilities of that totem to every ally within 30 feet. This otherwise functions like the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} animal aspect. She can use this ability for 10 minutes per druid level each day. This duration does not need to be consecutive, but it must be used in 10-minute increments. If she uses the ability to grant a new aspect, any previous aspect immediately ends.
At 6th level, the drovier's communal aspect ability grants the benefits of the spell greater animal aspect.
At 8th level, the drovier can choose to grant her allies the benefits of the spell aspect of the falcon instead of an animal aspect.
At 10th level, the drovier can choose to grant her allies the benefits of the spell aspect of the bear instead of an animal aspect.
At 12th level, the drovier can choose to grant her allies the benefits of the spell aspect of the stag instead of an animal aspect.
At 14th level, the drovier can choose to grant her allies the benefits of the spell aspect of the wolf rather than an animal aspect.
At 20th level, the drovier can use this ability at will.
This replaces wild shape.
1f0d09b5-a0a8-4eb5-903f-71d72104cf59:
At 4th level, a druid gains the ability to turn herself into a wolf and back again once per day. The effect lasts for 1 hour per druid level, or until she changes back.
Changing form is a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} and doesn't provoke an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attack of opportunity{/g}. A druid can use this ability an additional time per day at 6th level and every two levels thereafter, for a total of eight times at 18th level.
At 6th level, a druid can use wild shape to change into a leopard or a small elemental. At 8th level, a druid can use wild shape to change into a bear or a medium elemental. At 10th level, a druid can use wild shape to change into a smilodon, a shambling mound, or a large elemental. At 12th level, a druid can use wild shape to change into a huge elemental.
For the feyspeaker archetype, all level prerequisites are increased by 2.
51476a4c-58ba-4606-9a5e-94f3b09fa16d: At 4th level, a duelist gains an additional +2 competence {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on all Reflex {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g}.
3089c93d-7881-471d-aeea-a872296e0d72:
At 4th level, a feyform shifter can use her wild shape ability to become a {g|Encyclopedia:Size}large{/g} fey creature — an ankou. This ability lasts for 1 minute (the Master Shapeshifter mythic ability makes this duration permanent). Using fey shape is a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} that does not cause {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attacks of opportunity{/g}. The feyform shifter can use fey shape a number of times per day equal to her shifter level + her {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier. While in this form, she gains a {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} bonus of +20 feet, two claw {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}), two wing attacks (1d4 damage), and a tail attack (1d4 damage). While in this form, the feyform shifter can make sneak attacks, as the rogue ability of the same name, using her shifter level as her effective rogue level for the purpose of determining damage. At 8th level, the feyform shifter can select a rogue talent, using her shifter level as her effective rogue level for the purpose of meeting the prerequisites. At 10th level, the feyform shifter gains evasion, as the rogue class feature of the same name, and at 14th level, she can select another rogue talent.
Primary {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural attacks{/g}: claw, wing, and tail
This alters wild shape.
6c87e7dc-4abd-4ce4-99ac-e00867737c3b: At 4th level, a flamewarden adds firebelly and summon small fire elemental to his ranger {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} list as 1st-level spells.
6f612fcd-da52-435e-b894-88aa24b7b2a1: At 4th level, a flamewarden can cause his weapons to burst into flame. As a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, the ranger can grant a single weapon he holds the flaming special ability for 1 minute; while under this effect, the weapon counts as magic for the purpose of overcoming {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g}. A flamewarden can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + his {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier. At 12th level, weapons affected by this ability gain the flaming burst special ability instead.
fa088d0c-be96-4bc4-8427-e5efe119a3b4: At 4th level, a freebooter forms a bond with her crewmates. This bond allows her to spend a {g|Encyclopedia:Move_Action}move action{/g} to grant her allies extra combat prowess when they work as a team. All allies within 30 feet who can see or hear the freebooter gain an additional +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} when {g|Encyclopedia:Flanking}flanking{/g} for 1 minute.
ecc5cb00-bed7-4c44-b14d-ed3a5ef85878: At 4th level, a griffonheart shifter can use her wild shape ability to become a griffon. This ability lasts for 1 minute (the Master Shapeshifter mythic ability makes this duration permanent). Using griffon shape is a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} that does not cause {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attacks of opportunity{/g}. The griffonheart shifter can use griffon shape a number of times per day equal to her shifter level + her {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier. While in this form, she gains a base {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} of 50 feet, two claw {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}), a bite attack (1d8 damage), and immunity to ground-based effects. While in this form, the griffonheart shifter gains the grabber ability with her claw attacks. She also gains a combat {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}, using her shifter level as her effective fighter level for the purpose of meeting the prerequisites. If he has levels in fighter, these levels stack. At 9th level, the griffonheart shifter gains the pounce ability and the {g|Encyclopedia:Improved_NaturalAttack}improved natural attack{/g} ability with her bite attack, and she can select another combat feat. At 14th level, the griffonheart shifter can select a third combat feat and gains the {g|Encyclopedia:Rake}rake{/g} ability.
41f36068-7d71-49ef-a391-32ffef0e6d13:
At 4th level, a herald caller receives Augment Summoning as a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}.
Augment Summoning: Your summoned creatures are more powerful and robust.
Each creature you conjure with any summon {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} gains a +4 enhancement bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} for the duration of the spell that summoned it.
0848a0f7-ee69-4dcd-b717-56c7c9ad9fee: At 4th level, a knight of the wall specializes in using his shield to deflect {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g}. He adds a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} equal to his shield bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} to his {g|Encyclopedia:Touch_AC}touch AC{/g} and his {g|Encyclopedia:CMD}CMD{/g}. He does not include any enhancement bonus he has from a magic shield in this calculation.
6234afa1-b257-4503-9064-85a05792a4d8: At 4th level, a monk gains a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against Enchantment {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} and effects.
c628f52c-9eb1-4e83-980b-4582afbeaeb5: At 4th level, a proclaimer can spend two uses of fervor as a {g|Encyclopedia:Move_Action}move action{/g} to use his cleanser of evil ability and create a zone of sanctification in the same area. All evil outsiders in the zone when it becomes active must succeed at a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will saving throw{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} 10 + half the proclaimer's level + his {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier) or be pushed back until they are out of the area.
82fb9a25-2596-4650-9c0f-9a8b2f04b2a4:
At 4th level, a ranger forms a bond with his hunting companions. This bond can take one of two forms. Once the form is chosen, it cannot be changed.
The first is a bond to his companions. This bond allows him to spend a {g|Encyclopedia:Move_Action}move action{/g} to grant half his favored enemy bonus against a single target of the appropriate type to all allies within 30 feet who can see or hear him. This bonus lasts for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to the ranger's {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier (minimum 1). This bonus does not stack with any favored enemy bonuses possessed by his allies; they use whichever bonus is higher.
The second option is to form a close bond with an animal companion. A ranger who selects an animal companion can choose one from the list of available creatures. This animal is a loyal companion that accompanies the ranger on his adventures as appropriate for its kind. A ranger's animal companion shares his favored enemy and favored terrain bonuses.
This ability functions like the druid animal companion ability, except that the ranger's effective druid level is equal to his ranger level –3.
f8be7f4b-d2c3-401b-a2f2-4071fc9cda6f:
At 4th level, a shadow shaman gains the ability to use the shadows around to {g|Encyclopedia:Concealment}conceal{/g} himself. A number of times per day equal to his {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier, a shadow shaman can gain the benefits of the blur {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} for 1 minute.
Starting at 9th level, he gains the benefits of displacement instead.
Starting at 14th level, he additionally receives the effect of greater invisibility.
4f9330f4-859c-44a3-8dc7-e452d589ae17: At 4th level, a shaman can form a temporary bond with a spirit other than the one selected using her spirit class feature. She must make this selection each day when preparing her {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}. While this feature is active, she gains the spirit ability granted by the spirit. She also adds the spells granted by that spirit to her list of spells that she can cast using spirit magic. She does not add the hexes from her wandering spirit to her list of hexes that she can choose from with the hex class feature. At 12th level, she gains the abilities listed in the greater version of her wandering spirit. At 20th level, she gains the ability listed in the true version of her wandering spirit.
9c2e91a1-df35-4f4d-93e5-b1531ecc431c:
At 4th level, a shieldbearer gains the ability to enhance his shield with divine power as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}. This ability functions as the sacred armor ability, except as follows. This power grants the shield a +1 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} (this bonus does not act as an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} or {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} bonus when the shield is used in a shield bash). For every 4 warpriest levels beyond 4th, this bonus increases by 1 (to a maximum of +5 at 20th level).
The shieldbearer can enhance a shield with any of the following armor special abilities (instead of those listed for sacred armor): arrow deflection, blinding, fortification (heavy, light, or moderate), reflecting, and {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g} (13, 15, 17, and 19).
74bf39b3-fb34-4561-ba90-98b909c58d4b: At 4th level, a stormwalker can wreathe his weapon in lightning. As a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, he can grant a single weapon he holds the shock special ability for 1 minute; while under this effect, the weapon counts as magic for the purpose of overcoming {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g}. A stormwalker can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + his {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier. At 12th level, weapons affected by this ability gain the shocking burst special ability.
ecd00d80-f2d6-4410-a9b5-420a7174f2f3: At 4th level, a stygian slayer can cast invisibility once per day, using his slayer level as his {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}. The slayer uses his {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier for {g|Encyclopedia:Concentration}concentration checks{/g} when using this ability. The slayer can use this an additional time per day at 8th level and every 4 levels thereafter.
995c224b-6515-4b2f-afc2-16e2d08f5a7f:
At 4th level, a vanguard forms a bond with his fighting companions. As a {g|Encyclopedia:Move_Action}move action{/g}, he can choose one of his current studied targets and grant half his studied target bonus against that target to all allies. This bonus lasts for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to the slayer's {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier (minimum 1).
This ability replaces the slayer talent gained at 4th level.
67914aeb-6f34-412d-bd03-e12440e3e995:
At 4th level, a wild effigy's stone aspects no longer require even the semblance of flesh and blood to function. When a wild effigy is shifted into a minor or major aspect, or is transformed into one of her aspects using wild shape, she adds the ferocity ability to the list of that aspect's features and gains a 25% chance to ignore a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g} or precision {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}. This does not stack with the fortification armor property or similar effects.
At 9th level, this chance increases to 50%, and she becomes immune to petrification.
At 15th level, this chance increases to 75%, and she becomes immune to bleed effects.
This replaces defensive instinct.
0e2e83f7-c17b-4b1b-923c-04593f5a128b:
At 4th level, an Aldori swordlord learns to adapt his fighting style to counter his enemy's strengths. An Aldori swordlord reduces the {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack roll{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} for fighting defensively or using Combat Expertise by 1 at 4th level and by 2 at 8th level.
In addition, after a creature attacks an Aldori swordlord for the first time, he attempts a {g|Encyclopedia:Perception}Perception check{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} = 10 + the opponent's {g|Encyclopedia:BAB}base attack bonus{/g}). If successful, the Aldori swordlord gains a +2 circumstance {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on attack rolls and to his {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} against that creature until the end of combat.
5005ee77-50d1-48c6-9cf5-186b6cfbe12f: At 4th level, an assassin gains access to poison that deals {g|Encyclopedia:AbilityDamage}Constitution damage{/g}.
87f41e9e-f4ab-4ae8-a746-dc4f7412edf4: At 4th level, an elemental rampager selects one element. He gains a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} with {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural attacks{/g} while rampaging, {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}energy resistance{/g} to the chosen element and other bonuses, depending on the selected element.
5206b795-4031-4318-9224-d6a785c4661f: At 4th level, an executioner automatically gains this talent. A creature that takes sneak attack {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} from an executioner must make a successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} = 10 + half the executioner's {g|Encyclopedia:Class_Level}class level{/g} + his {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier) or become sickened for {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g}.
e53fed30-1d11-42ec-b5f7-9d471e48fbff:
At 4th level, an underground chemist can deal sneak attack {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} with splash weapons.
This ability replaces the rogue talent gained at 4th level.
2cb1a81e-9987-4caa-9262-652008ca16ad: At 4th level, any weapon wielded by a champion of the faith counts as having his chosen {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}alignment{/g} for the purposes of overcoming {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g}.
f4fd4135-a9ff-4e24-9e44-bf1eda8370a7: At 4th level, as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}, a sohei may spend 1 point from his ki pool to grant any weapon he wields (including his {g|Encyclopedia:UnarmedAttack}unarmed{/g} strike) a +1 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}, increasing by +1 per four levels after 4th to a maximum bonus of +5 at 20th level, until the end of his next turn.
28fc1b52-3646-4bac-9c7e-7cf0d1cf1669: At 4th level, in hands of a quarterstaff master all quarterstaves deal {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} as if it was one {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} category larger.
62be88f0-d42a-48e6-9768-000a5e88fd73:
At 4th level, the hexcrafter magus gains access to a small number of witch's hexes. The hexcrafter magus picks one hex from the witch's hex class feature. He gains the benefit of or uses that hex as if he were a witch of a level equal to his magus level.
This feature replaces {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} recall.
a9d5dc1f-553b-46b4-a1de-75f3180bb96a: At 4th level, the magus learns to use his arcane pool to recall {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} he has already cast. With a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g} he can recall any single magus spell that he has already prepared and cast that day by expending a number of points from his arcane pool equal to the spell's level (minimum 1). The spell is prepared again, just as if it had not been cast.
b12f6258-e538-4a8c-bb0d-4329f5f01957: At 4th level, the student of war gets a +3 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to her {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g} confirmation {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}rolls{/g} while in martial stance.
dff2d29b-699b-4023-b5ad-dcfe6a60b104:
At 4th level, the warpriest gains the ability to enhance one of his sacred weapons with divine power as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}. This power grants the weapon a +1 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g}. For every 4 levels beyond 4th, this bonus increases by 1 (to a maximum of +5 at 20th level). If the warpriest has more than one sacred weapon, he can enhance another on the following {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} by using another swift {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}action{/g}. The warpriest can use this ability a number of rounds per day equal to his warpriest level, but these rounds need not be consecutive.
These bonuses stack with any existing bonuses the weapon might have, to a maximum of +5. The warpriest can enhance a weapon with any of the following weapon special abilities: brilliant energy, flaming, frost, keen, and shock. In addition, if the warpriest is chaotic, he can add anarchic. If he is evil, he can add unholy. If he is good, he can add holy. If he is lawful, he can add axiomatic. Adding any of these {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}special abilities{/g} replaces an amount of bonus equal to the special ability's base cost. Duplicate abilities do not stack. The weapon must have at least a +1 enhancement bonus before any other special abilities can be added.
dafab609-2f79-431d-a4f8-a08581d5d844: At 4th level, the warrior of the holy light gains one additional use of her lay on hands ability per day. She gains one additional use of lay on hands per day for every four levels she attains beyond 4th. She can spend a use of her lay on hands ability to call upon the power of her faith as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}. This causes a nimbus of light to emanate from the warrior of the holy light in a 30-foot radius. All allies in this area (including the warrior of the holy light) receive a +1 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} and on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against fear as long as they remain in the area of light. This power lasts for 1 minute.
48a0c9c8-5ebd-4124-a1fe-2714013cd8c7: At 4th level, the witch doctor can draw transcendental energies to her location, flooding it with positive energy as the cleric class feature. The witch doctor uses her shaman level – 3 as her effective cleric level, and can channel energy a number of times per day equal to 3 + her {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier. This is a separate pool of channel energy that does not stack with the life spirit's channel spirit ability.
dcc16fc0-3867-4a45-be80-8afc77b1ffc6: At 4th level, when a sword saint confirms a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g}, he can spend 1 point from his arcane pool to increase his weapon's critical multiplier by 1.
bc386a64-4f83-4ee7-a76e-fa0944eb22a0: At 4th level, when a sword saint hits with his chosen weapon, he can spend 1 point from his arcane pool in order to maximize his weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}. Don't {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}roll{/g} for damage — the weapon deals maximum damage. This affects only the weapon's base damage dice, not additional damage from sneak attack, magical weapon properties, spellstrike, or {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hits{/g}.
3eddd1e6-433f-43df-b7db-15df027a6ca4: At 4th level, when a sword saint hits with his chosen weapon, he can spend 1 point from his arcane pool in order to maximize his weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}. Don't {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}roll{/g} for damage — the weapon deals maximum damage. This affects only the weapon's base damage dice, not additional damage from sneak attack, magical weapon properties, spellstrike, or {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hits{/g}. If the sword saint confirms a critical hit, he can instead spend 2 points from his arcane pool to increase his weapon's critical multiplier by 1.
b1168ad7-ab94-40a5-b84d-0e7301611a06: At 4th level, when entering a bloodrage you can choose one of the following {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} and apply its effects to yourself: blur, protection from arrows, or resist energy (choose one energy type).
3bd5acad-a09b-4e50-90f1-59dcdfa3fd66: At 4th level, when entering a bloodrage, you can choose to grow one {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} category larger than your base size (as enlarge person) even if you aren't humanoid.
649e5002-bf21-46d8-a8e6-b85a1ecebce8: At 4th level, when entering a rage, a beastkin berserker can take the form of a Medium wolf. This functions as beast shape I, except the duration is for as long as the beastkin berserker rages.
14e1d41f-4695-497f-b82c-514aed482298: At 4th level, whenever a court poet casts a {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} that deals hit point {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}, she adds +1 to the spell damage. For every four levels beyond 4th, she adds another +1 to spell damage bonus, to a maximum of +5 at 20th level. Additionally, the court poet grants this spell damage {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to all allies affected by her Insightful Contemplation ability.
2e2f112c-f038-4cf9-aa9a-51df16824154:
At 4th level, whenever a rogue deals sneak attack {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} to a foe, she can also debilitate the target of her {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}, causing it to take a {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} (this is in addition to any penalty caused by a rogue talent or other {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}special ability{/g}).
Bewildered: The target becomes bewildered, taking a –2 penalty to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}. The target takes an additional –2 penalty to AC against all attacks made by the rogue. At 10th level and 16th level, the penalty to AC against attacks made by the rogue increases by –2 (to a total maximum of –8).
1098aaa3-f56f-46c1-819c-a1d549358c73:
At 4th level, whenever a rogue deals sneak attack {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} to a foe, she can also debilitate the target of her {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}, causing it to take a {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} (this is in addition to any penalty caused by a rogue talent or other {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}special ability{/g}).
Disoriented: The target takes a –2 penalty on attack rolls. In addition, the target takes an additional –2 penalty on all attack rolls it makes against the rogue. At 10th level and 16th level, the penalty on attack rolls made against the rogue increases by –2 (to a total maximum of –8).
79f919e1-fc31-4009-b9e1-5c7b1824b8d8:
At 4th level, whenever a rogue deals sneak attack {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} to a foe, she can also debilitate the target of her {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}, causing it to take a {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} (this is in addition to any penalty caused by a rogue talent or other {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}special ability{/g}).
Hampered: All of the target's speeds are reduced by half (to a minimum of 5 feet).
4537655d-7ec2-47c5-9d6c-03580a258b9b:
At 4th level, whenever a rogue deals sneak attack {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} to a foe, she can also debilitate the target of her {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}, causing it to take a {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} (this is in addition to any penalty caused by a rogue talent or other {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}special ability{/g}). The rogue can choose to apply any one of the following penalties when the damage is dealt.
Bewildered: The target becomes bewildered, taking a –2 penalty to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}. The target takes an additional –2 penalty to AC against all attacks made by the rogue. At 10th level and 16th level, the penalty to AC against attacks made by the rogue increases by –2 (to a total maximum of –8).
Disoriented: The target takes a –2 penalty on attack rolls. In addition, the target takes an additional –2 penalty on all attack rolls it makes against the rogue. At 10th level and 16th level, the penalty on attack rolls made against the rogue increases by –2 (to a total maximum of –8).
Hampered: All of the target's speeds are reduced by half (to a minimum of 5 feet).
These penalties do not stack with themselves, but additional attacks that deal sneak attack damage extend the duration by 1 round. A creature cannot suffer from more than one penalty from this ability at a time. If a new penalty is applied, the old penalty immediately ends. Any form of {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}healing{/g} applied to a target suffering from one of these penalties also removes the penalty.
fa94c291-fb29-4e9d-8017-d537b3a053a2: At 4th level, whenever the dragonheir scion {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damages{/g} a target with an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} augmented by Arcane Strike, the attack deals an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} points of damage of the dragonheir scion's energy type.
df3c2a1e-4ef5-48a0-972a-4b7b49a6e8da: At 4th level, you gain +1 natural armor {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} and +1 bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against poison. At 8th level and every 4 levels after, those bonuses increase by 1.
2765f5e2-de5c-404c-958d-dfdd88102644: At 4th level, you gain fire {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resistance{/g} 5, as well as a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against poison. At 8th level, your fire resistance increases to 10, and the bonus on saving throws against poison increases to +4.
d6252299-96ca-48dd-ac43-eaee8f6e4228: At 4th level, you gain the service of an animal companion. Your effective druid level for this animal companion is equal to your level in the class that gave you access to this domain – 3. (Druids who take this ability through their nature bond class feature use their druid level – 3 to determine the abilities of their animal companions.)
a67f1d5f-cbf4-4aaa-b73d-f75b4c227fac: At 4th level, you gain {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}energy resistance{/g} 10 against your energy type.
79d4c03f-99f2-4411-b7bb-09cfdeaf6a3c: At 4th level, you gain {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}energy resistance{/g} 5 against the chosen element. At 9th level it increases to 10, at 15th level to 20.
8551d13f-3e23-4055-9bdb-310c84980f57: At 4th level, you gain {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resistance{/g} 5 against your energy type and a +1 natural armor {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}. At 8th level, your energy resistance increases to 10 and your natural armor bonus to AC increases to +2. At 16th level, your natural armor bonus increases to +4.
4d6224a8-8cb8-4649-a8c2-89df7e99bea8: At 4th level, you gain {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resistance{/g} 5 to acid and cold. At 12th level, these resistances increase to 10.
95d94527-ee9b-49da-ad85-93c282f73995: At 4th level, you ignore difficult terrain. You can move through it at normal {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g}, and it does not impede your charge.
746edc18-4f5a-4448-8e3a-fc6e6b53a270: At 4th level, your {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attacks{/g} are treated as if they have the ghost touch weapon special ability.
e541e8f3-1b21-47cc-bf22-759d8e35d78d: At 5th level and again at 11th level and 17th level, the hunt caller adds two {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} of any level she can cast from the druid spell list to her class spell list and list of skald spells known.
2c0897fc-1620-4a6f-bc8d-534d9b0b9438: At 5th level and every 5 levels thereafter, a {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} master gains an additional use of his arcane bond — object class feature.
58665350-e270-4680-bb11-d69da415053d: At 5th level, a blood kineticist can infuse her blasts with a vicious power that causes internal or external bleeding. On a failed {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g}, the target takes 1 point of bleed {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} for every die of the blast's damage. This is a 2nd-level substance infusion that costs 2 points of burn and can be used with water and blood blasts.
0e2eee2a-97f3-42d1-97cb-037b13dfff9f: At 5th level, a cavalier's banner becomes a symbol of inspiration to his allies and companions. As long as the cavalier's banner is clearly visible, all allies within 60 feet receive a +2 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against fear and a +1 morale bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} made as part of a charge. At 10th level, and every five levels thereafter, these bonuses increase by +1.
97c19930-ec82-4194-9ea5-795dcafa8cfe: At 5th level, a dirge bard is able to stir primal terrors in the hearts of listeners. He gains a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on Intimidate {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g} equal to half his level. In addition, he gains a +2 bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} with fear effect, and this bonus increases by 1 every 5 levels beyond 5th.
0a25de06-83a9-4b26-a18a-f96c4f0b87c1: At 5th level, a herald of the horn can use raging song to free allies from enchantment effects and fear. A herald can expend 4 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} of that ability to grant all allies within 30 feet a new {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g} against an ongoing enchantment or fear effect. The allies gain a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on this new saving throw.
1d526bec-a888-43df-bbc2-6f3820fe5ade: At 5th level, a judge gains the ability to sentence a target as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}. Until the end of combat, all {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} against the target made by your allies deal additional {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} equal to 1 point for every 3 inquisitor levels you have. You can use this ability once plus one time for every 5 levels thereafter.
7eef3c99-2c21-400b-b27b-0d2b8e1b9235: At 5th level, a kineticist gains the ability to alter her kinetic blasts as if with metamagic {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g} by accepting burn. By accepting 1 point of burn, she can empower her kinetic blast (as if using Empower {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}Spell{/g}). At 9th level, by accepting 2 points of burn, she can maximize her kinetic blast as if using Maximize Spell. At 13th level, by accepting 3 points of burn, she can quicken her kinetic blast as if using Quicken Spell.
0633a613-4e97-4c89-9c2e-090df0096d36:
At 5th level, a mad dog's war beast gains Trip as a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}.
Trip: This feat gives the character an ability to perform the trip {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}combat maneuver{/g}. It also grants a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:CMB}CMB{/g} when performing this maneuver, and a +2 bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:CMD}CMD{/g} when defending against it.
You can attempt to trip your opponent in place of a {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g}. If your combat maneuver is successful, the target is knocked prone.
If the target has more than two legs, add +2 to the {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of the combat maneuver {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack roll{/g} for each additional leg it has. Some creatures — such as oozes, creatures without legs, and flying creatures — cannot be tripped.
0600b107-96ed-4e4d-9892-6e26bb6c6226: At 5th level, a monk can learn one type of style strike. Whenever he makes a flurry of blows, he can designate one of his {g|Encyclopedia:UnarmedAttack}unarmed{/g} strikes as a style strike. This {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} is resolved as normal, but it has an additional effect depending on the type of strike chosen. At 9th level, and every 4 levels thereafter, a monk learns an additional style strike. He must choose which style strike to apply before the attack roll is made. At 15th level, he can designate up to two of his unarmed strikes each {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} as a style strike, and each one can be a different type.
175e97dd-8f13-4b66-9878-750453a3d13f: At 5th level, a monk gains immunity to all diseases, including supernatural and magical diseases.
82043a4f-02b9-4e4f-9478-b1240f458392: At 5th level, a nomad gains the Point-Blank Master {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}, ignoring all the prerequisites.
123e24d0-c733-49d5-9409-7f9b818c305c: At 5th level, a preservationist adds summon nature's ally II to his formula book as a 2nd-level extract.
b9d949b2-f6f9-4ab4-8065-c3dfc894c48a: At 5th level, a purifier may channel holy power as a cleric of her level to harm evil outsiders . She may use this ability a number of times per day equal to 1 + her {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier.
758129f3-b28f-4e7a-8d9d-efb5349fb5fa: At 5th level, a quarterstaff master can use his quarterstaff to make his first {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} during a flurry of blows make a free trip attempt, which does not provoke {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attack of opportunity{/g}.
6d915ef1-326a-41d4-a30b-65be66f2c6d1: At 5th level, a reformed fiend gains a +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} against evil creatures while in bloodrage. This bonus increases by +1 for every 5 levels.
e377ed99-cd3d-4725-b6bd-91df0b444542:
At 5th level, a skald is learned in the magic of other {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spellcasters{/g}, and can use his own magic to duplicate those classes' spells. Once per day, a skald can cast any spell on the bard, cleric, or sorcerer/wizard spell list as if it were one of his skald spells known, expending a skald spell slot of the same spell level to cast the desired spell.
At 11th level, a skald can use this ability twice per day. At 17th level, he can use this ability three times per day.
8fbd7b61-2d29-4635-aca5-5c143410080e: At 5th level, a stalwart defender gains {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} 1/—. At 7th level, this DR increases to 3/—, and at 10th level it increases to 5/—.
26536175-606f-4c1f-b889-f278e772ed19: At 5th level, a steelblood learns to be more maneuverable while wearing armor. Whenever he is wearing armor, he reduces the {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Check_Penalty}armor check penalty{/g} by 1 (to a maximum of 0) and increases the {g|Encyclopedia:Max_Dex_Bonus}maximum Dexterity bonus{/g} allowed by his armor by 1. Every 4 levels thereafter (9th, 13th, and 17th), these {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonuses{/g} increase by 1, to a maximum 4-point reduction of the armor check {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} and a +4 increase of the maximum {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} bonus. This ability stacks with the fighter class feature of the same name.
3fcd9ec7-0457-4b9e-b2f1-bac1abe966df: At 5th level, a zen archer always deals his {g|Encyclopedia:UnarmedAttack}unarmed{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} with the arrows from his bows. For example, a Medium zen archer's short bow normally deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} damage; using this ability, his arrows deal 1d8 damage.
eb4f1d17-0336-4301-a6ad-55e9ca885dd0: At 5th level, a {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spelleater{/g} can consume spell slots for an extra dose of {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}healing{/g}. As a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}, the spelleater can consume one unused bloodrager spell slot to heal {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d8{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} for each level of the spell slot consumed.
0305171d-e781-45d8-8fe6-abb2089e9c8b: At 5th level, an Aldori swordlord attempts a {g|Encyclopedia:Persuasion}Persuasion{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill check{/g} to intimidate and demoralize his target as a {g|Encyclopedia:Free_Action}free action{/g} after he confirms a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g} or succeeds at a disarm, or sunder {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}combat maneuver{/g} with a dueling sword. If his target is already shaken, the Aldori swordlord can once per {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} attempt a Persuasion {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} to Intimidate and demoralize the target further after any successful {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g} or combat maneuver. If he succeeds at this check, the target suffers an additional -1 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g}, and loses all morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonuses{/g} to these checks.
0dbeff09-ad8a-4231-9655-6bc6169bfdc6: At 5th level, an armored hulk moves faster in medium and heavy armor. When wearing medium or heavy armor, an armored hulk can move 10 feet faster than normal, to a maximum of her {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g}.
4b215a8e-90ed-44c0-be35-a70998629061:
At 5th level, an inquisitor can imbue one of her weapons with the bane weapon special ability as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}.
A bane weapon excels against certain foes. Against a designated foe, the weapon's enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} is +2 better than its actual bonus. It also deals an extra {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} against such foes.
This ability only functions while the inquisitor wields the weapon. If dropped or taken, the weapon resumes granting this ability if it is returned to the inquisitor before the duration expires.
This ability lasts for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} per day equal to the inquisitor's level. These rounds do not need to be consecutive.
23df572a-0fc3-40ab-8aec-e70f3aaf1955: At 5th level, an urban hunter and her animal companion learn to combine their insights to defeat deception and manipulation. As long as they are within 30 feet of each other, both hunter and animal companion gain an insight {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Perception}Perception checks{/g} equal to half the urban hunter's hunter level. They also gain a +2 insight bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against mind-affecting effects.
d9cbb3d2-3ea3-465d-a6cd-41e97f407f67: At 5th level, and every six levels thereafter, a magus gains a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} in addition to those gained from normal advancement. These bonus feats must be selected from those listed as combat or magic feats. He must meet the prerequisites for these feats as normal.
cdef8b7e-9885-4ab5-885c-6b04399f825f: At 5th level, every time a monster tactician casts a summoning {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, all creatures summoned by the spell are treated as if they knew all of the monster tactician's teamwork {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g}.
792d3425-ae89-49fe-8988-12e9e81d7257: At 5th level, once per {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}, you gain a +20 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} against the first {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attack of opportunity{/g}.
366eed25-77ac-4165-a479-af75a65d0152:
At 5th level, the angelfire apostle can spend two uses of his channel energy ability to cast remove blindness or lesser {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}restoration{/g} as a {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}spell-like ability{/g}.
At 7th level, he can choose remove disease or remove paralysis.
At 9th level, he can choose neutralize poison.
At 11th level, he can choose breath of life.
At 13th level, he can choose heal.
At 17th level, he can choose restoration.
At 19th level, he can choose resurrection.
36bf358f-1a85-4b7d-9d44-330cdbd683fe: At 5th level, the bard becomes a master of lore and can take 10 on any Knowledge or Lore {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill check{/g} that he has ranks in. A bard can choose not to take 10 and can instead {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}roll{/g} normally.
5c3e1140-3822-44df-9bb6-047b7f9c2d10: At 5th level, the bloodrider gains the service of a feral mount.
