Subtract 1 from the {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} the skald takes each time he is dealt damage from a weapon or a {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural attack{/g}. At 14th and 19th levels, this damage reduction increases by 1. Damage Reduction can reduce damage to 0, but not below 0. Additionally, the skald grants this DR to all allies affected by his inspired rage.
27bc01c5-260b-4a3b-949f-91882501144e: At 9th level, a student of stone gains the benefits of the light fortification armor property.
0712d022-0b00-4f7a-9f6d-cc9c5deaee82:
At 9th level, a sword saint adds his {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} bonus (minimum 0) on {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g} confirmation {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}rolls{/g} with his chosen weapon.
In addition, the sword saint may use his magus levels in place of his {g|Encyclopedia:BAB}base attack bonuses{/g} to qualify for any {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} for which it is a prerequisite.
33aa8312-94b9-47f1-bc5b-dd1b4c7ceb7f:
At 9th level, a zen archer gains the Snap Shot {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}. If the zen archer already has it, he gains Improved Snap Shot instead.
The zen archer doesn't need to meet the prerequisites to gain Snap Shot or Improved Snap Shot.
d3f15419-2c7b-431b-9f52-e439ab270865: At 9th level, an Aldori swordlord's saving slash has a 50% chance of reducing a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g} to a normal hit.
cff8619b-9cf2-4b2f-a970-d607e088f56e: At 9th level, an arcane trickster can become invisible, as if under the effects of greater invisibility, as a {g|Encyclopedia:Free_Action}free action{/g}. She can remain invisible for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} per day equal to her arcane trickster level. Her {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} for this effect is equal to her caster level. These rounds need not be consecutive.
e3b840cd-4161-4eb1-8336-01db6e2169f9: At 9th level, an elemental master increases the {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} done by her elemental {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d8{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}energy damage{/g} plus 1d8 points of damage per two arcanist levels she possesses. The type of damage is determined by the elemental attack.
cb0aff62-898c-4c01-9c4b-1f2dbb156fc4: At 9th level, creatures summoned by the greenrager's summon nature's ally {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} gain a +4 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} and gain the druid's woodland stride ability. At 11th level, this bonus increases to +6. At 20th level, it increases to +8.
d950b815-e9db-4980-94d9-48c664d1b679: At 9th level, once per day as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}, a student of war can focus on a weapon she holds and render it anathema to her studied foe. The weapon gains the bane special ability for 1 minute.
e4db867a-6651-44e4-b4b1-b660e83f31d0: At 9th level, the angelfire apostle becomes a direct conduit for the righteous power of his deity. Whenever the angelfire apostle casts a {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} he can unleash a blast of flames as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g} by expending one use of his channel energy ability. The flames deal {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} per spell level of the highest level spell he can cast to all enemies in a 20-foot radius. Half of the damage is {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g}, and half is raw divine power not subject to fire {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resistance{/g} or {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Immunity}immunity{/g}. Any creature in the area can halve the damage with a successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex saving throw{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} 10 + half angelfire apostle level + {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier).
27f7bd14-2153-4349-902e-bc4716a4b3fa: At 9th level, the brown-fur transmuter can target others with her transmutation {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}. A brown-fur transmuter can expend 1 point from her arcane reservoir to change any transmutation spell with a range of personal to a range of {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch{/g}.
e16d576b-743d-4866-808c-e7055dead3d0: At 9th level, the cavalier receives an additional teamwork {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} as a bonus feat. He must meet the prerequisites for this feat. Using the tactician ability is a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}.
edc673c8-66b5-43dc-9921-4f96d3e36830: At 9th level, the number of successes needed to remove the poison increases to 3.
32989d03-2811-4bf7-ad4e-ca9415695185:
At 9th level, when a fiendflesh shifter uses her fiendish aspect ability, she can gain an additional ability from the list below. The fiendflesh shifter can change which ability she gains each time she uses fiendish aspect.
Daemon: Acid {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resistance{/g} equal to the resistance provided by her fiendish resilience ability and a +4 profane {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g} against disease.
Demon: Cold resistance equal to the resistance provided by her fiendish resilience ability and a +4 bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} with {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural attacks{/g}.
Devil: A +4 dodge bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} and a +4 profane bonus on Reflex saving throws.
This replaces chimeric aspect.
53e97500-fdb5-42fa-b507-75e35a67fc1b: At 9th level, when a shifter uses her shifter aspect ability to take on a minor form, she can choose two aspects and assume the minor form of each aspect.
dbec045f-f7e7-418a-bd53-49abb295a519: At 9th level, when carrying a shield, a knight of the wall adds a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} equal to his shield bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} on Will {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g}. He does not include any enhancement bonus from a magic shield in this calculation.
8a88e9b5-ca10-4166-a6e6-bc3705d5527b: At 9th level, whenever a bully succeeds at a bull rush, overrun, or trip {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}combat maneuver{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g}, after fully resolving the combat maneuver, it gains a +2 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} until the end of its next turn.
29f7fcb8-ab3b-4a2c-8510-30015d157e8f: At 9th level, while using a tower shield, a tower shield specialist gains his shield {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} against {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attacks{/g}.
a3bd750a-7783-4e87-92e8-f717fa18d04c: At 9th level, you can add any one {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} from the sorcerer/wizard spell list to your list of spells known. This spell must be of a level that you are capable of casting. You can also add one additional spell at 13th level and 17th level.
704d9d6c-1af9-4c8c-b027-37c1c7e57e41: At 9th level, you can apply an aura of heaven on yourself for a minute. This aura provides a +4 deflection {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} and a +4 resistance bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} made or effects created by evil creatures to all allies within 20 feet. You can use this ability a number of times per day equal to your sorcerer level.
e55b459f-1ad0-4a8c-b4c5-59ccdc3f81b6: At 9th level, you can call down a column of hellfire. This 10-foot-radius burst does {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g} per sorcerer level. Those caught in the area of your blast receive a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} for half {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}. Good creatures that fail their saves are shaken for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to your sorcerer level. The {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of this save is equal to 10 + 1/2 your sorcerer level + your {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier. At 9th level, you can use this ability once per day. At 17th level, you can use this ability twice per day. At 20th level, you can use this ability three times per day. This power has a range of 60 feet.
bf0f4791-5e52-4b8f-9352-15557cf4bf7a:
At 9th level, you can cause a swarm of skeletal arms to burst from the ground to rip and tear at your foes. The skeletal arms erupt from the ground in a 20-foot-radius burst.
Anyone in this area takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}slashing damage{/g} per sorcerer level. Those caught in the area receive a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} for half {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}. Those who fail the save are unable to move for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. The {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of this save is equal to 10 + 1/2 your sorcerer level + your {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier.
At 9th level, you can use this ability once per day. At 17th level, you can use this ability twice per day. At 20th level, you can use this ability three times per day.
8b2b1025-4612-4339-a577-7665e10e2cd8:
At 9th level, you can turn invisible for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} per day equal to your sorcerer level. This ability functions as greater invisibility. These rounds need not be consecutive.
Greater Invisibility: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} functions like invisibility, except that it doesn't end if the subject {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g}.
Invisibility: The creature becomes invisible. If a {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} is required, an invisible creature has a +20 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on its {g|Encyclopedia:Stealth}Stealth checks{/g}. The spell ends if the subject attacks any creature. For purposes of this spell, an attack includes any spell targeting a foe or whose area or effect includes a foe. Exactly who is a foe depends on the invisible character's perceptions. {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}Actions{/g} directed at unattended objects do not break the spell. Causing harm indirectly is not an attack. Thus, an invisible being can open doors, talk, eat, climb stairs, summon monsters and have them attack, cut the ropes holding a rope bridge while enemies are on the bridge, remotely trigger traps, open a portcullis to release attack dogs, and so forth. If the subject attacks directly, however, it immediately becomes visible along with all its gear. Spells such as bless that specifically affect allies but not foes are not attacks for this purpose, even when they include foes in their area.
3327a0d9-3251-4f59-9624-e529bd00a04e: At 9th level, you can unleash a blast of elemental power once per day. This 20-foot-radius burst does {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}acid damage{/g} per sorcerer level. Those caught in the area of your blast receive a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} for half {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}. Creatures that fail their saves gain {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Vulnerability}vulnerability{/g} to acid until the end of your next turn. The {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of this save is equal to 10 + 1/2 your sorcerer level + your {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier. At 9th level, you can use this ability once per day. At 17th level, you can use this ability twice per day. At 20th level, you can use this ability three times per day. This power has a range of 60 feet.

7f8b4ef8-f04a-4eaa-bf7c-6e09278af008: At 9th level, you get a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Concentration}concentration checks{/g} made to cast a {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} or use a {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}spell-like ability{/g}. At 15th level, your concentration {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} bonus increases to +3. At 20th level, this ability is replaced by Arcane Apotheosis.
a5815f0b-29ae-4785-8a4f-7c206e2e6a69:
At 9th level, your bloodline makes you a natural receptacle of divine energy. You can channel energy once per day. This energy can be used to cause or {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g} damage, depending on the creatures targeted.
A sorcerer channels positive energy and can choose to deal {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} to undead creatures or to heal living creatures.
Channeling positive energy causes a burst that affects all creatures of one type (either undead or living) in a 30-foot radius centered on the sorcerer. The amount of damage dealt or healed is equal to {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}3d6{/g} points of damage at 9th level plus 1d6 points of damage for every two sorcerer levels beyond 9th (4d6 at 11th, 5d6 at 13th, and so on). Creatures that take damage from channeled energy receive a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g} to halve the damage. The {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of this save is equal to 10 + 1/2 the sorcerer's level + the sorcerer's {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier. Creatures healed by channel energy cannot exceed their maximum {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit point{/g} total—all excess healing is lost.
This is a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} that does not provoke an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attack of opportunity{/g}.
4e32ace1-a56d-4053-ac17-7b6d4f97ffd1:
At some point in your family's history, a dragon interbred with your bloodline, and now its ancient power flows through your veins.
Although most consider it to be the weakest and most feral of the chromatic dragons, the white dragon makes up for its lack of cunning with sheer ferocity.
Bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}Feats{/g} of the Draconic Bloodline: Blind Fight, Great Fortitude, Improved {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}Initiative{/g}, Power Attack, Quicken Spell, Skill Focus ({g|Encyclopedia:Mobility}Mobility{/g}), Skill Focus ({g|Encyclopedia:Knowledge_Arcana}Knowledge (arcana){/g}), Toughness.
d09eef46-ac61-4191-9247-6ba6c327bc63:
At some point in your family's history, a dragon interbred with your bloodline, and now its ancient power flows through your veins.
Blue dragons are consummate schemers and obsessively orderly. In combat, blue dragons prefer to {g|Encyclopedia:Surprise}surprise{/g} foes if possible, and are not above retreating if the odds turn against them.
Bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}Feats{/g} of the Draconic Bloodline: Blind Fight, Great Fortitude, Improved {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}Initiative{/g}, Power Attack, Quicken Spell, Skill Focus ({g|Encyclopedia:Mobility}Mobility{/g}), Skill Focus ({g|Encyclopedia:Knowledge_Arcana}Knowledge (arcana){/g}), Toughness.
5d89098e-8f1e-4bc8-a823-e8b98bb8a7b6:
At some point in your family's history, a dragon interbred with your bloodline, and now its ancient power flows through your veins.
Bronze dragons have been known to ally with travelers and adventurers if the cause and reward is right and just.
Bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}Feats{/g} of the Draconic Bloodline: Blind Fight, Great Fortitude, Improved {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}Initiative{/g}, Power Attack, Quicken Spell, Skill Focus ({g|Encyclopedia:Mobility}Mobility{/g}), Skill Focus ({g|Encyclopedia:Knowledge_Arcana}Knowledge (arcana){/g}), Toughness.
6daa3ef6-3511-4912-a703-ac12932ea6e5:
At some point in your family's history, a dragon interbred with your bloodline, and now its ancient power flows through your veins.
Consummate conversationalists, brass dragons prefer to talk instead of fight.
Bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}Feats{/g} of the Draconic Bloodline: Blind Fight, Great Fortitude, Improved {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}Initiative{/g}, Power Attack, Quicken Spell, Skill Focus ({g|Encyclopedia:Mobility}Mobility{/g}), Skill Focus ({g|Encyclopedia:Knowledge_Arcana}Knowledge (arcana){/g}), Toughness.
334898d2-c071-431c-b440-de0576f84029:
At some point in your family's history, a dragon interbred with your bloodline, and now its ancient power flows through your veins.
Copper dragons are whimsical and spend most of their time in combat trying to annoy and frustrate their enemies.
Bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}Feats{/g} of the Draconic Bloodline: Blind Fight, Great Fortitude, Improved {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}Initiative{/g}, Power Attack, Quicken Spell, Skill Focus ({g|Encyclopedia:Mobility}Mobility{/g}), Skill Focus ({g|Encyclopedia:Knowledge_Arcana}Knowledge (arcana){/g}), Toughness.
f22937e3-d9d1-4186-8c01-ac008418cc65:
At some point in your family's history, a dragon interbred with your bloodline, and now its ancient power flows through your veins.
Few creatures are more cruel and fearsome than the mighty red dragon. King of the chromatics, this terrible beast brings ruin and death to the lands that fall under its shadow.
Bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}Feats{/g} of the Draconic Bloodline: Blind Fight, Great Fortitude, Improved {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}Initiative{/g}, Power Attack, Quicken Spell, Skill Focus ({g|Encyclopedia:Mobility}Mobility{/g}), Skill Focus ({g|Encyclopedia:Knowledge_Arcana}Knowledge (arcana){/g}), Toughness.
4ce02246-3978-4e9b-bb41-dbaabdf27ccb:
At some point in your family's history, a dragon interbred with your bloodline, and now its ancient power flows through your veins.
Gold dragons are the epitome of virtue. Other metallic dragons revere their gold cousins as the agents of divine forces and the paragons of dragonkind, and often seek them for advice or aid.
Bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}Feats{/g} of the Draconic Bloodline: Blind Fight, Great Fortitude, Improved {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}Initiative{/g}, Power Attack, Quicken Spell, Skill Focus ({g|Encyclopedia:Mobility}Mobility{/g}), Skill Focus ({g|Encyclopedia:Knowledge_Arcana}Knowledge (arcana){/g}), Toughness.
cd91b235-3be2-4064-8d43-7f340a35a1b8:
At some point in your family's history, a dragon interbred with your bloodline, and now its ancient power flows through your veins.
Green dragons dwell in the ancient forests of the world, prowling under towering canopies in search of prey. Of all the chromatic dragons, green dragons are perhaps the easiest to deal with diplomatically.
Bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}Feats{/g} of the Draconic Bloodline: Blind Fight, Great Fortitude, Improved {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}Initiative{/g}, Power Attack, Quicken Spell, Skill Focus ({g|Encyclopedia:Mobility}Mobility{/g}), Skill Focus ({g|Encyclopedia:Knowledge_Arcana}Knowledge (arcana){/g}), Toughness.
4d2ea02e-3ce5-49a9-8e11-7c0240027805:
At some point in your family's history, a dragon interbred with your bloodline, and now its ancient power flows through your veins.
Lording over the darkest swamps and marshes, black dragons are the undisputed masters of their domain, ruling through cruelty and intimidation. Those who dwell within a black dragon's reach live in fear.
Bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}Feats{/g} of the Draconic Bloodline: Blind Fight, Great Fortitude, Improved {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}Initiative{/g}, Power Attack, Quicken Spell, Skill Focus ({g|Encyclopedia:Mobility}Mobility{/g}), Skill Focus ({g|Encyclopedia:Knowledge_Arcana}Knowledge (arcana){/g}), Toughness.
00e94ea2-6de6-4f7c-b2a8-6511d4708eb1:
At some point in your family's history, a dragon interbred with your bloodline, and now its ancient power flows through your veins.
Of all the dragons, silvers are the most courageous, holding themselves to a chivalrous code to help the weak, defeat evil, and behave in an honorable manner.
Bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}Feats{/g} of the Draconic Bloodline: Blind Fight, Great Fortitude, Improved {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}Initiative{/g}, Power Attack, Quicken Spell, Skill Focus ({g|Encyclopedia:Mobility}Mobility{/g}), Skill Focus ({g|Encyclopedia:Knowledge_Arcana}Knowledge (arcana){/g}), Toughness.
a372ae2b-a5ef-4850-98e6-8ffbf478cc81:
At some point in your family's history, a dragon interbred with your bloodline. Now, the sublime monster's ancient power fuels your bloodrage. The power of dragons flows through you and manifests in a number of ways.
Bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}Feats{/g}: Blind Fight, Cleave, Great Fortitude, Improved {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}Initiative{/g}, Power Attack, Intimidating Prowess, Toughness.
Bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}Spells{/g}: Shield (7th), resist energy (10th), heroism (13th), fear (16th).
a342a3f6-e0e1-4aeb-85c3-da195f908511:
At will, a shifter in her natural form can extend her claws as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g} to use as a weapon. The claws on each hand can be used as a primary {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural attack{/g}, dealing {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}piercing{/g} and slashing {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} (1d3 if she is {g|Encyclopedia:Size}Small{/g}). As the shifter gains levels, the power of her claws increases. At 3rd level, her claws bypass {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} N/cold iron, N/magic, and N/silver. At 7th level, her claw damage increases to 1d6 (1d4 if Small). At 11th level, her claw damage increases to 1d8 (1d6 if Small). At 13th level, her claw damage increases to 1d10 (1d8 if Small). At 17th level, the damage die does not increase, but the {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical{/g} multiplier becomes ×3. Finally, at 19th level, the claws bypass DR N/adamantine and N/-.
While a shifter uses wild shape to assume her aspect's major form, her primary natural {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} gain the same benefits granted by her shifter claws ability. She can use either the base damage of her shifter claws or the damage of the form's primary attacks, whichever is greater. A list of primary attacks is provided in the description of each major form.
1273fc55-8d8f-4ee9-9398-f443cad54622:
At will, a shifter in her natural form can extend her claws as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g} to use as a weapon. The claws on each hand can be used as a primary {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural attack{/g}.
As the shifter gains levels, the power of her claws increases.
84f1b025-db56-482c-9145-7626d6b6eb06:
Baphomet, demon lord of beasts, mazes and minotaurs, rules over the Abyssal realm known as the Ivory Labyrinth. A favored consort of Lamashtu, he was created by her as the first minotaur to lead her creations in the mortal world.
Baphomet raided Hell to steal Asmodeus's ruby rod. Unfortunately for him, he was caught, and Lamashtu denied relation to him. As punishment, the Prince of Darkness inscribed his own symbol on the minotaur lord's brow with the nail of his index finger and imprisoned him in a maze so cunningly crafted that Asmodeus declared it unsolvable.
However, the cunning Baphomet not only solved the maze, but also stole the labyrinth itself from Hell, taking it with him when he returned to the Abyss. Returning far thinner but much wiser, Baphomet claimed this new realm for himself, and with this act established himself as a demon lord.
Domains: Animal, Chaos, Evil, Strength.
Favored Weapon: Glaive
e6fc2375-661c-47d5-8d8c-de15f1c7ffc2: Barbarian rages can be a thing of savage beauty, exhibiting a lethal grace. While such uncontrolled displays of carnage often disregard group tactics, there are those barbarians whose rages inspire and spur on their allies during the ferocious dance of death.
19ad4a6a-7659-4385-822a-a635f57bad4c: Barbarians are melee warriors who plunge into rage to deal the enemies a lot of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}. They move fast and have a lot of {g|Encyclopedia:HP}health{/g}, but are poorly armored. As they advance, the barbarians gain immunity to some of the enemies' tactical advantages.
4552773a-63ca-411e-ae96-4d888a9045f8: Barbarians can choose passive or activated powers that make some of their abilities stronger while weakening the others, and only work while the barbarian is raging. Only one activated power can work at the same time.
5b0bc6e0-f5cd-4e60-97e2-7236092e2531: Barbarians excel in combat, possessing the martial prowess and fortitude to take on foes seemingly far superior to themselves. With rage granting them boldness and daring beyond that of most other warriors, barbarians charge furiously into battle and ruin all who would stand in their way.
e8e4b36c-baf8-483b-b8b9-61f6f37b8a80: Bard is one of the best support classes in the game, wielding a lot of arcane {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}. In addition to empowering the allies, they can {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g} them, as well as control and weaken the enemies. Bards are well-versed in many {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g}, like disarming traps, and are especially good at passing Lore and Knowledge {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g}.
19a69b00-5eec-4a18-a22f-22e7525e4d2a: Bards can cast a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Cantrips_Orisons}cantrips{/g}, or 0-level {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}. These spells are cast like any other spell, but they are not expended when cast and may be used again.
b9ed6ad7-9326-4299-871b-deef985c7fee: Bards capably confuse and confound their foes while inspiring their allies to ever-greater daring. While accomplished with both weapons and magic, the true strength of bards lies outside melee, where they can support their companions and undermine their foes without fear of interruptions to their performances.
f19aee59-8578-48b1-8b0b-7a857094b200: Bards originate from a variety of backgrounds, including former shepherds, street charmers, and such. Those who find animals a more appreciative audience than humans are usually become known as beast tamers. Such bards can greatly enhance the abilities of their beastly allies through inspiring performances.
cf9c74c5-9fb9-4e4d-8faf-3717fb2efb15: Beastkin berserker adds half her level (minimum 1) on {g|Encyclopedia:Lore_Nature}Lore (nature){/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Persuasion}Persuasion{/g} (when used to intimidate) {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g}.
61256976-2341-46d3-8e0f-d3323ba71cd8:
Beginning at 2nd level, a paladin can {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g} wounds (her own or those of others) by touch. Each day she can use this ability a number of times equal to 1/2 her paladin level plus her {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier. With one use of this ability, a paladin can heal {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} of damage for every two paladin levels she possesses. Using this ability is a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, unless the paladin targets herself or her divine troth, in which case it is a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}. Despite the name of this ability, a paladin only needs one free hand to use this ability.
Alternatively, a paladin can use this healing power to deal {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} to undead creatures, dealing 1d6 points of damage for every two levels the paladin possesses. Using lay on hands in this way requires a successful melee {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g} and doesn't provoke an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attack of opportunity{/g}. Undead do not receive a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g} against this damage.
0a783318-a0f5-49a6-9e97-20170b1fe22c:
Beginning at 2nd level, a paladin can {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g} wounds (her own or those of others) by touch. Each day she can use this ability a number of times equal to 1/2 her paladin level plus her {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier. With one use of this ability, a paladin can heal {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} of damage for every two paladin levels she possesses. Using this ability is a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, unless the paladin targets herself, in which case it is a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}.
Alternatively, a paladin can use this healing power to deal {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} to undead creatures, dealing 1d6 points of damage for every two levels the paladin possesses. Using lay on hands in this way requires a successful melee {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g} and doesn't provoke an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attack of opportunity{/g}. Undead do not receive a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g} against this damage.
14894d66-d51c-4499-af0c-6db037a5b2a6: Beginning at 3rd level, an arcane trickster can enter a special stance that allows him to improvise a way to sneak {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} targets regardless of their awareness. An arcane trickster can maintain this stance for one {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} per day. For every two levels beyond 3rd, an arcane trickster can maintain this stance for one additional round, up to a maximum of 4 rounds at 9th level. The target of impromptu sneak attacks loses any {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}, but only against those attacks. The power can be used against any target, but creatures that are not subject to sneak attacks take no extra {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} (though they still lose any Dexterity bonus to AC against the attack).
fe501c24-e394-4315-98ed-e1b523c7c23e: Beginning at 3rd level, an arcane trickster can enter a special stance that allows him to improvise a way to sneak {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} targets regardless of their awareness. An arcane trickster can maintain this stance for one {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} per day. For every two levels beyond 3rd, an arcane trickster can maintain this stance for one additional round, up to a maximum of 4 rounds at 9th level. The target of impromptu sneak attacks loses any {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}, but only against those attacks. This power can be used against any target, but creatures that are not subject to {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hits{/g} take no extra {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} (though they still lose any Dexterity bonus to AC against the attack).
32f03e60-192b-44be-99db-9d272f70f966: Benefit: When you use Elemental Fist, pick one of the following energy types: acid, cold, electricity, or fire. On a successful hit, the {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} deals {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} normally plus {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of damage of the chosen type. You must declare that you are using this {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} before you make your attack roll (thus a failed attack roll ruins the attempt). You may attempt an Elemental Fist attack once per day plus one additional use for every four monk levels you have attained, and no more than once per {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}.
4a6cd8ad-76a1-4ad9-a010-8a95796ea163: Benefit: While using the Shaitan Style, as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, you can spend two Elemental Fist attempts to unleash a column of acid that has a 10-foot radius and erupts from a point of origin within 30 feet of you. Creatures caught in the column take your {g|Encyclopedia:UnarmedAttack}unarmed{/g} strike {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} plus the {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}acid damage{/g} from your Elemental Fist and are staggered for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. A successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} = 10 + half your {g|Encyclopedia:Character_Level}character level{/g} + your {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier) reduces the damage by half and prevents the target from being staggered.
626b84d6-a9e8-4b63-8b18-07a59dc39a3c: Benefit: You gain one additional Elemental Fist attempt per day. While using the Shaitan Style and Elemental Fist {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g} to deal {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}acid damage{/g}, you gain a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on acid {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} equal to your {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} bonus. Further, if your Elemental Fist {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g} misses while you are using it to deal acid damage, you still deal {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of acid damage to your target.
0767c6fb-f82c-4481-9ebf-ff14b10115ec: Benefit: You gain one additional Elemental Fist attempt per day. While using the Shaitan Style, you gain acid {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resistance{/g} equal to your {g|Encyclopedia:BAB}base attack bonus{/g}. Creatures that take {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}acid damage{/g} from your Elemental Fist {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} must succeed at a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} = 10 + half your {g|Encyclopedia:Character_Level}character level{/g} + your {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier) or be staggered for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}.
3cc9661e-78fe-4376-b9c6-6234ec32e9a4:
Benefits: A Thassilonian specialist wizard receives two additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} slots of each spell level he can cast. These bonus spell slots must both be used to prepare the same spell from the wizard's school of specialization, allowing the wizard to cast that spell twice. The wizard cannot use these slots to prepare two different spells, even if they are of the school he is specialized in.
Restrictions: A Thassilonian specialist does not get to customize his choice for opposition schools — that choice is selected for him when he chooses his specialization. These restrictions are more significant than those most wizards follow, and are known as prohibited schools. A Thassilonian wizard can never prepare a spell that is in one of his prohibited schools — he treats these spells as if they were not on the wizard spell list. If using a spell trigger or spell completion item to cast a spell from one of his prohibited schools, he must use the {g|Encyclopedia:Use_Magic_Device}Use Magic Device{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill{/g} to do so.
7491f4ae-68fa-4cdf-b13e-39b8d40f1954: Bewildered: The target becomes bewildered, taking a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}. The target takes an additional –2 penalty to AC against all {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} made by the rogue. At 10th level and 16th level, the penalty to AC against attacks made by the rogue increases by –2 (to a total maximum of –8).
e2427457-56b5-4b3c-a8b4-77917754297c: Bigger than others of its kind, a bully is used to winning fights and displays of dominance for its choice of mates, territory, or other privileges.
6a47b27c-cf57-4799-8fa4-25e01d782e87:
Bite; {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Save{/g}: Fortitude
Frequency: 1/{g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} for 4 rounds
Effect: 1 {g|Encyclopedia:AbilityDamage}Constitution damage{/g}
Cure: 1 consecutive save
The save {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} is {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g}-based.
3b77a674-fc35-41f7-b2c5-6781b4bb7434:

Frequency: 1/{g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} for 5 rounds
Effect: 1d2 {g|Encyclopedia:AbilityDamage}Constitution damage{/g}
Cure: 1 consecutive save
The save {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} is {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g}-based.
233c9c7d-9e2d-47d1-a722-e754698a12f2:
Bite; {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Save{/g}: Fortitude
Frequency: 1/{g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} for 6 rounds
Effect: {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d3{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:AbilityDamage}Constitution damage{/g}
Cure: 2 consecutive saves
The save {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} is {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g}-based.
73defb9d-4691-42f8-b4ac-a16c753d7318:
Bite; {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Save{/g}: Fortitude ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} 12)
Frequency: 1/{g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} for 6 rounds
Effect: {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d3{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}
{g|Encyclopedia:Healing}Cure{/g}: 2 consecutive saves
The save DC is {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g}-based.
745a6cf0-c956-4f2c-8de9-ea2e544adea8: Bloodragers are berserkers who succumb to rage to increase their power in melee fight. They can use a basic set of arcane {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}, mostly to empower themselves. As a bloodrager advances, they gain immunity to certain enemies' tactical advantages.
10759fb2-a325-4194-b812-73d009f0dd66: Bloodragers are proficient with all simple and {g|Encyclopedia:Weapon_Proficiency}martial weapons{/g}, light armor, medium armor, and shields (except tower shields). A bloodrager can cast bloodrager {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} while wearing light armor or medium armor without incurring the normal {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Fail_Chance}arcane spell failure chance{/g}. This does not affect the arcane spell failure chance for arcane spells received from other classes. Like other arcane spellcasters, a bloodrager wearing heavy armor or wielding a shield incurs a chance of arcane spell failure if the spell in question has somatic components.
16f1cf38-9c24-44c3-8099-cb9c5a703236: Blue dragons are consummate schemers and obsessively orderly. In combat, blue dragons prefer to surprise foes if possible, and they are not above retreating if the odds turn against them.
000a497f-c0c4-48d4-833a-15ea1328545e: Bombs are a special kind of {g|Encyclopedia:RangedAttack}ranged attacks{/g} that most commonly hit an area. Bombs ignore some {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonuses{/g} to the target's {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}armor class{/g}, so they have a better chance to hit then regular weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g}. Bombs can inflict a large variety of effects, from {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}, to blindness, to dispelling magical effects.
d3869158-c0cd-48d3-9f98-254297db093d: Bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}Feats{/g}: Blind Fight, Cleave, Great Fortitude, Improved {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}Initiative{/g}, Power Attack, Intimidating Prowess, Toughness.
e45a8672-d5d0-422f-a536-1a45b99f6ed7: Bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}Feats{/g}: Blind Fight, Combat Reflexes, Deceitful, Improved Disarm, Improved Sunder, Intimidating Prowess, Iron Will.
7072b6c7-883e-406b-b1db-733f37e17fae: Bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}Feats{/g}: Cleave, Dodge, Great Fortitude, Improved {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}Initiative{/g}, Lightning Reflexes, Power Attack, Weapon Focus.
f652c513-4cdd-40f1-9827-ef158a4dd3a7: Bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}Feats{/g}: Cleave, Great Fortitude, Bull Rush, Sunder, Intimidating Prowess, Power Attack, Toughness.
10821f04-2d35-4944-ae30-b39629b76cab: Bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}Feats{/g}: Combat Casting, Combat Reflexes, Deceitful, Lightning Reflexes, Improved Trip, Combat Expertise, Toughness.
5292882e-ac98-4157-9da9-33c019d6ae82: Bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}Feats{/g}: Combat Reflexes, Disruptive, Improved {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}Initiative{/g}, Iron Will, Power Attack, Combat Casting, Arcane Strike.
b0b7e1bb-e12f-4ed9-977d-b9e968daa836: Bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}Feats{/g}: Combat Reflexes, Dodge, Improved {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}Initiative{/g}, Lightning Reflexes, Mobility, Improved Lightning Reflexes, Intimidating Prowess.
ffcd48a9-dcfa-4080-937c-a2886eac9b0a: Bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}Feats{/g}: Diehard, Dodge, Endurance, Intimidating Prowess, Iron Will, Mobility, Toughness.

6d981973-991f-4fd7-814a-8000516c9cc5: Bronze dragons have been known to ally with travelers and adventurers if the cause and reward is right and just.
c4d2f5c6-7c32-4328-b4b3-24b79fbea054: By bending and sometimes even breaking the rules of magic, the arcanist learns to exploit gaps and exceptions in the laws of magic. Some of these exploits allow her to break down various forms of magic, adding their essence to her arcane reservoir. At 1st level and every 2 levels thereafter, the arcanist learns a new arcane exploit. An arcanist exploit cannot be selected more than once. Once an arcanist exploit has been selected, it cannot be changed. Most arcanist exploits require the arcanist to expend points from her arcane reservoir to function. Unless otherwise noted, the {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} for an arcanist exploit is equal to 10 + half the arcanist's level + the arcanist's {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier.
04699ff3-1e94-4530-b2fa-0d132b0e419c:
By expending 1 point from her arcane reservoir as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, the arcanist grants herself an effective illusion of armor.
She gains the benefits of mage armor {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} with a {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} that's equal to her arcanist level. If the arcanist already has mage armor active, she instead gains the benefits of shield of faith spell with a caster level equal to her arcanist level.
30f17223-8d9f-4a1c-8dae-0f22a5b9686c: By expending 1 point from her arcane reservoir, an arcanist can pull a veil of shadows around her, making her more difficult to spot and strike. The arcanist gains {g|Encyclopedia:Concealment}concealment{/g} (20% miss chance) and a +5 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Stealth}Stealth checks{/g}. This effect lasts a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to 1 + the arcanist's {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} bonus.
deea6f5e-02c6-4219-973d-fb8c37cd29f1: By following the path of the stone, students of stone give up much of monk's mobility in favor of sheer resilience.
ecbdbf27-c9cc-4d6a-ae05-3994805008a3: By spending 1 point from his ki pool as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}, a monk can make one additional {g|Encyclopedia:UnarmedAttack}unarmed{/g} strike at his highest {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} bonus when making a flurry of blows attack. This bonus attack stacks with all bonus attacks gained from flurry of blows, as well as those from haste and similar effects.
fa1ef72e-f702-4628-b661-9ca573a14821: By spending 2 points from his ki pool as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, the monk can {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g} a number of {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} of damage equal to his monk level.
960648cd-82f0-4b73-88c6-885b15bd9450:
By way of a celestial ancestor or divine intervention, the blood of angels fills your body with a holy potency, granting you a majestic visage and angelic powers when you enter your bloodrage.
Your bloodline grants a number of resistances and changes your form to something angelic and terrible to behold when you bloodrage.
Bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}Feats{/g}: Dodge, Improved {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}Initiative{/g}, Iron Will, Mobility, Toughness, Weapon Focus.
Bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}Spells{/g}: Bless (7th), resist energy (10th), heroism (13th), crusader's edge (16th).
5b92f281-d4bd-4eb9-b465-9b4085fd342a: By way of the druidic discipline of wild shape, shifters become living aspects of the wild. At first, they are able to assume only a minor aspect, but with time and practice they can fully transform into ever more powerful forms.
eb986391-7614-4d01-b6d5-90673a2036e5:
Calistria, also known as "The Savored Sting" and "The Unquenchable Fire," is the goddess of lust and revenge who takes on many faces and guises. She is held in especially high regard by elves, who often identify with her mercurial moods and changeable nature. A fondness for wasps has earned this vengeful deity the title of "the Savored Sting"; such creatures live on after harming their enemies, a trait Calistria's followers hope to emulate when pursuing their goals.
Domains: Chaos, Charm, Knowledge, Luck, Trickery.
Favored Weapon: Rapier
ac53dd6c-c0f0-4dee-8fb6-34dfda1d49ea: Call of the Wild — Accept Effect
2772e203-519e-484a-afdc-26ba15458b15: Call of the Wild — Beast Shape I
ae83f2a9-bb25-43e6-a5a7-a93ccd2eb068: Call of the Wild — Beast Shape II
2d89ba28-bc2a-4ab2-9447-4b3153824a59: Call of the Wild — Beast Shape III
bae545f9-e2a0-4229-af60-cdffbd25744d: Capable of calling upon the power of the gods in the form of blessings and {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}, warpriests blend divine magic with martial skill. They are unflinching bastions of their faith, shouting gospel as they pummel foes into submission, and never shy away from a challenge to their beliefs. While clerics might be subtle and use diplomacy to accomplish their aims, warpriests aren't above using violence whenever the situation warrants it. In many faiths, warpriests form the core of the church's martial forces — reclaiming lost relics, rescuing captured clergy, and defending the church's tenets from all challenges.
2958a3c8-40ec-42eb-93bc-d99f437e14a2:
Capricious fey constantly bedevil you, playing pranks on you such as tying your shoelaces together, hiding your gear, making inappropriate noises or smells at formal events, and mimicking your voice to tell embarrassing lies.
In addition to any social consequences of such mischief, you take a –4 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g}. Add faerie fire to your list of {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} known.
At 5th level, add glitterdust and mirror image to your list of spells known.
At 10th level, add confusion to your list of spells known as a 5th-level spell.
At 15th level, add insanity to your list of spells known.
9dbb83de-e544-48d3-8b61-e0c93d67b748: Cavalier is a warrior who has an animal companion — a faithful steed they can ride into battle. They are strong melee fighters who can also empower their allies.
5a7cdc85-b560-46e1-98a6-ab1bf5275885: Cavaliers are proficient with all simple and {g|Encyclopedia:Weapon_Proficiency}martial weapons{/g}, with all types of armor (heavy, light, and medium) and with shields (except tower shields).
1d5248a7-46bb-4929-8cb6-5da810e5941c: Cavaliers of the Order of the Paw pledge to defend halflings, halfling settlements, and other innocent folks by patrolling the wilderness and seeking out possible threats to both individuals and whole communities. These cavaliers hunt down potential danger with a ruthless efficiency and determination that non-halflings find surprising and even somewhat alarming.
5cc04d45-9e08-4e8d-9ed0-b37e213bd6b2: Cavaliers of this order seek out and destroy undead and those who harbor or create them. They scour old crypts, graveyards, and battlefields to bring eternal rest.
6c9cdcc8-ff12-4220-a197-cbfd537db9c0: Cavaliers who join the order of the star dedicate themselves to the protection and service of a faith and its members. Cavaliers belonging to this order tend to follow many of the tenets and guides of the religion that they serve.
52e6a877-efca-489c-8cd0-e86924c639db: Cavaliers who join the order of the sword dedicate their lives to the code of chivalry, living a life of honor, valor, and fairness. Cavaliers of this order tend to swear service to a lord or a lady. Of all the orders, the order of the sword is perhaps the broadest in terms of its focus and ideals.
14c6dd91-b9f0-4442-bdfa-90c30ab4b414:
Cayden Cailean, the god of alcohol, bravery, and freedom, is one of the Ascended: those mortals who achieved godhood by passing the Test of the Starstone. Because legend tells that he passed the test while intoxicated, he is also known as "The Lucky Drunk," "The Drunken Hero," or "The Accidental God."
Domains: Chaos, Charm, Good, Strength, Travel.
Favored Weapon: Rapier
99a04e4c-8553-422a-9b2f-f953db1eb640: Certain relentless inquisitors burn with special hatred for an enemy of specific convictions, and they stop at nothing when obsessively hunting these foes down.
f223f3b8-1603-4bef-ba9b-2040b3f37015: Champions of the faith are crusaders who use the power of their divine patron to annihilate the faith's enemies.
0cd6f34d-4ecc-467a-a444-fd248d65db4c: Change bloodline power for two rage powers
5b465163-5c4f-4a45-a816-8bb823cb70b7: Channel energy, cure wounds and inflict wounds {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} affected by Energy Equilibrium become Quickened when cast.
9fcdbb07-1332-4955-8a61-1838f924eabc: Channeling negative energy causes a burst that heals all undead creatures in a 30-foot radius centered on the cleric. The amount of damage healed is equal to {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of damage plus 1d6 points of damage for every two cleric levels beyond 1st (2d6 at 3rd, 3d6 at 5th, and so on).
add1ee92-45c1-43b0-a9ed-3bd9fd852ec0: Channeling negative energy causes a burst that {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damages{/g} all living creatures in a 30-foot cone centered on the warpriest. The amount of damage inflicted is equal to {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of damage plus 1d6 points of damage for every 3 warpriest levels he possesses above 2nd (to a maximum of 7d6 at 20th level). Creatures that take damage from channeled energy receive a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g} to halve the damage. The {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of this save is equal to 10 + half the warpriest's level + the warpriest's {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier.
f803af19-657b-475c-89c1-a8b60102435d: Channeling negative energy causes a burst that {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damages{/g} all living creatures in a 30-foot radius centered on the cleric. The amount of damage inflicted is equal to {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of damage plus 1d6 points of damage for every two cleric levels beyond 1st (2d6 at 3rd, 3d6 at 5th, and so on). Creatures that take damage from channeled energy receive a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g} to halve the damage. The {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of this save is equal to 10 + 1/2 the cleric's level + the cleric's {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier.
8aca38c4-0a9d-45eb-8ab0-bf1547c3f3b6: Channeling negative energy causes a burst that {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damages{/g} all living creatures in a 30-foot radius centered on the warpriest. The {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of this save is equal to 10 + half the warpriest's level + the warpriest's {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier.
2c368123-7a76-41bf-9d19-d3701de8493e: Channeling negative energy causes a burst that {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heals{/g} all undead creatures in a 30-foot cone centered on the warpriest. The amount of damage healed is equal to {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of damage plus 1d6 points of damage for every 3 warpriest levels he possesses above 2nd (to a maximum of 7d6 at 20th level).
274eb39d-bfc5-4610-a485-070853081ccd: Channeling negative energy causes a burst that {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heals{/g} all undead creatures in a 30-foot radius centered on the warpriest. The amount of damage healed is equal to {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of damage plus 1d6 points of damage for every 3 warpriest levels he possesses above 2nd (to a maximum of 7d6 at 20th level).
dc8287c4-ba63-4f78-9cb9-e23089518b60: Channeling positive energy causes a burst that heals all living creatures in a 30-foot radius centered on the cleric. The amount of damage healed is equal to {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of damage plus 1d6 points of damage for every two cleric levels beyond 1st (2d6 at 3rd, 3d6 at 5th, and so on).
a4e3762f-d4a4-4818-a266-63156c95f86c: Channeling positive energy causes a burst that {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damages{/g} all undead creatures in a 30-foot cone centered on the warpriest. The amount of damage inflicted is equal to {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of damage plus 1d6 points of damage for every 3 warpriest levels he possesses above 2nd (to a maximum of 7d6 at 20th level). Creatures that take damage from channeled energy receive a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g} to halve the damage. The {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of this save is equal to 10 + half the warpriest's level + the warpriest's {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier.
a0ce3d79-69b7-40a3-9b3c-2667ed4ab252: Channeling positive energy causes a burst that {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damages{/g} all undead creatures in a 30-foot radius centered on the cleric. The amount of damage inflicted is equal to {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of damage plus 1d6 points of damage for every two cleric levels beyond 1st (2d6 at 3rd, 3d6 at 5th, and so on). Creatures that take damage from channeled energy receive a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g} to halve the damage. The {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of this save is equal to 10 + 1/2 the cleric's level + the cleric's {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier.
0586967c-7c23-4598-8f60-f441cb8edecc: Channeling positive energy causes a burst that {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damages{/g} all undead creatures in a 30-foot radius centered on the shaman. The amount of damage inflicted is equal to {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of damage plus 1d6 points of damage for every two shaman levels beyond 1st (2d6 at 3rd, 3d6 at 5th, and so on). Creatures that take damage from channeled energy receive a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g} to halve the damage. The {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of this save is equal to 10 + 1/2 the shaman's level + the shaman's {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier.
14e89253-b3a1-4ce0-bea3-d57df81fe881: Channeling positive energy causes a burst that {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damages{/g} all undead creatures in a 30-foot radius centered on the sorcerer. The amount of damage inflicted is equal to {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}3d6{/g} points of damage at 9th level plus 1d6 points of damage for every two sorcerer levels beyond 9th (4d6 at 11th, 5d6 at 13th, and so on). Creatures that take damage from channeled energy receive a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g} to halve the damage. The {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of this save is equal to 10 + 1/2 the sorcerer's level + the sorcerer's {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier.
168a2f76-0b93-4f9d-b407-ea0b87181d8d: Channeling positive energy causes a burst that {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damages{/g} all undead creatures in a 30-foot radius centered on the warpriest. The amount of damage inflicted is equal to {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of damage plus 1d6 points of damage for every 3 warpriest levels he possesses above 2nd (to a maximum of 7d6 at 20th level). Creatures that take damage from channeled energy receive a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g} to halve the damage. The {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of this save is equal to 10 + half the warpriest's level + the warpriest's {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier.
b1d349ee-7de2-45ca-91be-ba10542f0cac: Channeling positive energy causes a burst that {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heals{/g} all living creatures in a 30-foot cone centered on the warpriest. The amount of damage healed is equal to {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of damage plus 1d6 points of damage for every 3 warpriest levels he possesses above 2nd (to a maximum of 7d6 at 20th level).
6c05db6f-4609-4fd7-b540-62ea8882f6c5: Channeling positive energy causes a burst that {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heals{/g} all living creatures in a 30-foot radius centered on the shaman. The amount of damage healed is equal to {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of damage plus 1d6 points of damage for every two shaman levels beyond 1st (2d6 at 3rd, 3d6 at 5th, and so on).
78d8d364-07ba-4686-a2d0-bd1121fb4298: Channeling positive energy causes a burst that {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heals{/g} all living creatures in a 30-foot radius centered on the sorcerer. The amount of damage healed is equal to {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}3d6{/g} points of damage at 9th level plus 1d6 points of damage for every two sorcerer levels beyond 9th (4d6 at 11th, 5d6 at 13th, and so on).
f4e794ef-6c59-46c7-b5cf-e2aec79f323c: Channeling positive energy causes a burst that {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heals{/g} all living creatures in a 30-foot radius centered on the warpriest. The amount of damage healed is equal to {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of damage plus 1d6 points of damage for every 3 warpriest levels he possesses above 2nd (to a maximum of 7d6 at 20th level).
60031286-1885-48af-8a25-d04acacd589f: Cleansing Fire — Flaming and Undead Bane
42727939-7a49-4278-b8f6-27224a2dfedc: Clerics are proficient with all {g|Encyclopedia:Weapon_Proficiency}simple weapons{/g}, light armor, medium armor, and shields (except tower shields). Clerics are also proficient with the favored weapon of their deities.
cfbe3dbb-8995-48d0-a36c-8e09f8f588b4: Clerics can cast a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Cantrips_Orisons}orisons{/g}, or 0-level {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}. These spells are cast like any other spell, but they are not expended when cast and may be used again.
d3f66bb9-336c-40d7-8071-efea9465210e: Clerics devote their lives to serving gods. They have access to the most powerful divine {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}. A cleric's main role is to {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g} and empower their allies. Depending on their specialization, some clerics are also good at weakening enemies, or smiting them in the name of their faith.
16d1597b-f4f5-4cd8-b467-101b81a232d6: Companions with the most vicious nature are often called aggressors.
6da059c7-de89-43f0-8222-f97ba8051454: Companions with the sturdiest skin, who can endure incredible amounts of suffering, are called bulwarks.
fd6a6892-8aad-45bb-bc02-4e5b90b1dbc7: Conjurations transport creatures from another plane of existence to your plane (calling); create objects or effects on the spot (creation); {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g} (healing); bring manifestations of objects, creatures, or forms of energy to you (summoning); or transport creatures or objects over great distances (teleportation). Creatures you conjure usually — but not always — obey your commands.
b23f7cbb-04b2-49dc-a1bf-00dc37660d5b: Consummate conversationalists, brass dragons prefer to talk instead of fight.
4320dfca-c3fe-4307-984e-702b665ecdef: Contrary to traditional wizardly study, an exploiter wizard forgoes the tried and true methods of arcane focus and arcane schools for the exploits favored by an arcanist. Some wizards regard this blatant exploitation of arcane magic as somehow "cheating," but most exploiters believe this prejudice is close-minded and overly traditional.
04115c80-7d18-4411-ba72-e9a4307d16a5: Control Madness — Deal damage to self
8bcb9f63-b720-4504-9b16-5c29284b59e9: Copper dragons are whimsical and spend most of their time in combat trying to annoy and frustrate their enemies.
e266501d-9dd7-41ab-b47c-cc4f5b0b7277: Creatures that take a direct hit from a dispelling bomb are subject to a targeted dispel magic {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, using the alchemist's level as the {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}. This cannot be used to target a specific spell effect.
8541f63c-5750-45e4-90a2-0b326ca9241a: Crusade-minded clerics train intensively to learn proper battlefield tactics to take advantage of the weaknesses of demons.
d252a03f-93bb-4e63-9127-825df8b34b0c: Crusaders serve the militant arm of a church, ready to stand guard over the religion's holy places and to be its swift, avenging arm against those who resist its truth.
730fb0e4-b98e-4e25-a1c6-f7a080312798: Cult leaders are proficient with all {g|Encyclopedia:Weapon_Proficiency}simple weapons{/g}, plus the hand crossbow, rapier, shortbow, and shortsword, as well as the favored weapon of their deity. They are proficient with light armor and light shields. The cult leader does not gain Weapon Focus as a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} as a warpriest normally would.
5051b7f2-f5e3-4c0e-ac74-6f3778c7bfa9:
Cure and inflict wounds affected by Energy Equilibrium become Empowered when cast.
Channel energy abilities affected by Energy Equilibrium deal or {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d6{/g} more {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}.
54644f1f-eff3-43ab-af28-0b7cd6e249d3: Cursed Bomb — Curse of Feeble Body
7a098782-8355-4af6-b8fa-88ce829051f2: Daredevil companions join the fray with graceful leaps or swooping dives, heedless of the danger.
eadd8a5c-463c-4b72-8395-8b1a55db6076: Defensive Stance: The bonus from Know Your Enemy ability applies to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}Armor Class{/g} and on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against the target's {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g}.
40e84eab-66b0-4b87-81d1-25ffa836f425: Demonslayers are known for their expertise in the destruction of demons.
f3af6321-634c-4294-abac-63112adf4c88:
Deskari, demon lord of infestation and locusts, is said to be the Usher of the Apocalypse. Being a child of two demons — Pazuzu and an unnamed giant insect demon — Deskari disdains the other demon lords who originated as mortals, and respects those that predated mortal sin, or those that were once qlippoth lords. Deskari's cult is most powerful in the lands that once made up the realm of Sarkoris. Outside of the Worldwound, his cults have spread into other northern nations infecting the nearby lands of Mendev, Numeria and Brevoy. Many of Deskari's cultists worship him in the hope of being rewarded when he takes over the world, but Deskari sees them as no more than pawns. The smart cultists that realize this graft demonic flesh onto themselves or sell their souls so they would become demons after death.
Domains: Chaos, Destruction, Evil, War.
Favored Weapon: Scythe
98703458-5a7b-4fa1-ad1e-1f48bf473a47:
Desna, also known as "The Great Dreamer," "Lady Luck," and "Mother Moon," the goddess of dreams, luck, stars, and travelers, is among the most ancient of deities. While her peers burdened themselves with the task of creating Golarion, she spent her time building the heavens. She knew that there would be plenty of time for her and her followers to explore the many wonders of the world later. She's changed little since those earlier days, and she and her followers delight in exploring the world.
Domains: Chaos, Good, Liberation, Luck, Travel.
Favored Weapon: Starknife
428b784e-a055-4b4e-8804-2314ee521145: Despite wearing no armor, monks can be strong defenders. They are very hard to hit, as their {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}armor class{/g} gain a bonus from their {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} ability.
4d4861f1-31d6-40bb-b2f4-ae7e21a4a851: Detects magical auras of active {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} or artifacts (or of those that were active recently). Can identify the {g|Encyclopedia:Magic_School}school of magic{/g} to which the spell belongs. Used in dialogues.
67f5a910-46cb-49af-b378-6cd515789177: Dire Conditions ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} 35): Blinded, paralyzed, and stunned.
7037c983-088d-4857-b6f0-2b76361d9919: Dire Conditions ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} 35): Blinded, paralyzed, and stunned.
82e00104-c879-4091-84e5-f0dc9ecbd409: Diseases, inhaled poisons, and noxious gaseous effects (such as stinking cloud) are negated in a 10-foot aura around the shaman for a number of minutes equal to her level. This duration does not need to be consecutive, but it must be spent in 1-minute increments. Effects caused by {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} whose level is more than half the shaman's {g|Encyclopedia:Class_Level}class level{/g} are unaffected.
3a790a0c-3f17-45a7-954a-32b7414668df: Diseases, inhaled poisons, and noxious gaseous effects (such as stinking cloud) are negated in a 10-foot aura around the witch for a number of minutes equal to her level. This duration does not need to be consecutive, but it must be spent in 1-minute increments. Effects caused by {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} whose level is more than half the witch's {g|Encyclopedia:Class_Level}class level{/g} are unaffected.
fdf2bb63-b47b-4271-b6cb-e8d8fac980cd: Disoriented: The target takes a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g}. In addition, the target takes an additional –2 penalty on all attack rolls it makes against the rogue. At 10th level and 16th level, the penalty on attack rolls made against the rogue increases by –2 (to a total maximum of –8).
061f7b99-fa81-49be-a4c5-825394ed2954:
Distraction: A creature with this ability can nauseate the creatures that it {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damages{/g}. Any living creature that takes damage from a creature with the distraction ability is nauseated for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}; a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} 10 + 1/2 creature's {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}HD{/g} + creature's {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Con{/g} modifier) negates the effect.
Poison: Swarm — injury; Fortitude save (DC 13); frequency: 1/round for 6 rounds; effect: {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} Con; cure: 1 save.
625f81c6-457d-4198-9047-e053072263f5: Divination {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} enable you to learn secrets long forgotten, predict the future, find hidden things, and foil deceptive spells.
70e3eb0e-5db6-49fe-86fb-f83d5ca21387: Divine bond allows the paladin to forge a connection to either an animal companion, or a deity. Bond with an animal allows them to choose one of the available creatures who becomes their faithful companion, can wear barding, and advances along with the paladin. Bond with a deity lets the paladin empower their weapon.
2ceb90cd-c2e7-4925-bcb6-823f8f983ce4: Divine herbalists practice an obscure alchemical art which involves medicinal and restorative techniques that transcend ordinary alchemy, allowing them to blur the line between alchemical medicine and divine miracles.
30e8bc16-c50c-427d-86f5-970c2c5adbb3: Divine hunters are proficient with all simple and {g|Encyclopedia:Weapon_Proficiency}martial weapons{/g}, with light and medium armor, and with shields (except tower shields).
30ae98a3-63bf-4f4c-8881-6a2c4b9d8065: Divine scions are paladins who improve their battle prowess not only through faith, but also through knowledge. They study their enemies to find the most efficient methods of dealing with them.
1f551882-ea00-43d0-939f-21919f22acc2:
Diviners are masters of remote viewing, prophecies, and using magic to explore the world.
Forewarned: You receive a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g} equal to 1/2 your wizard level (minimum +1). At 20th level, anytime you {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}roll{/g} initiative, assume the roll resulted in a natural 20.
Diviner's Fortune: When you activate this school power, you can touch any creature as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} to give it an insight bonus on all of its {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability checks{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} equal to 1/2 your wizard level (minimum +1) for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. You can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + your {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier.
Foretell: At 8th level, you can utter a prediction of the immediate future. While your foretelling is in effect, you emit a 30-foot aura of fortune that aids your allies or hinders your enemies, as chosen by you at the time of prediction. If you choose to aid, you and your allies gain a +2 luck bonus on ability checks, attack rolls, {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} checks, saving throws, and skill checks. If you choose to hinder, your enemies take a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on those rolls instead. You can use this ability for a number of rounds per day equal to your wizard level. These rounds do not need to be consecutive.
6845ad05-0399-47bc-b9e9-51cd38e4f9f4:
Doesn't have the following features: Bloodline (Sorcerer or Eldritch Scion or Bloodrager)
					or
Has one of the following features:
Draconic Bloodline — Black
Draconic Bloodline — Blue
Draconic Bloodline — Brass
Draconic Bloodline — Bronze
Draconic Bloodline — Copper
Draconic Bloodline — Gold
Draconic Bloodline — Green
Draconic Bloodline — Red
Draconic Bloodline — Silver
Draconic Bloodline — White
f328a46b-b610-40e3-8fc1-31122d3072f3: Dragonblood shifters draw upon the inherent strength and majesty of the true dragons, gaining a measure of their powers from their association.
da849ece-0f68-425c-b028-bb601f7d14b6: Dragonheir scions are the martially inclined humanoid descendants of those influenced by draconic power. Unlike their sorcerous brethren, dragonheir scions manifest their heritage in ways more suited to strength of arms and {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill{/g} with steel than arcane energies. Those who follow this path are often the children of mighty dragon-blooded sorcerers and others who drew energy from their dragon blood, though they themselves might not exhibit {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spellcasting{/g} ability.
9c4a3cb3-a0ca-4d27-a61b-68ebf4b2690e: Droviers view their allies and adventuring companions as a herd or pack to be protected and directed, with variations on that theme ranging from culture to culture.
cec8ec77-9614-4351-a06d-7f18087ff35e: Druids are guardians of balance, nature, and elements. They have access to the most powerful divine magic, coming from their connection with the natural world. In a battle, druids can empower their allies and animal companions, summon creatures to aid them, or control and weaken enemies.
6af24ab1-409f-4842-945b-cba0a4510d8e:
Druids are proficient with the following weapons: club, dagger, dart, quarterstaff, scimitar, scythe, sickle, shortspear, sling, and spear. They are also proficient with all {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural attacks{/g} (claw, bite, and so forth) of any form they assume with wild shape.
Druids are proficient with light and medium armor but are prohibited from wearing metal armor; thus, they may wear only padded, leather, or hide armor. A druid may also wear wooden armor that has been altered by the ironwood {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} so that it functions as though it were steel. Druids are proficient with shields (except tower shields) but must use only wooden ones.
0234e51e-6d9f-4b16-913b-647795bc9616: Druids can cast a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Cantrips_Orisons}orisons{/g}, or 0-level {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}. These spells are cast like any other spell, but they are not expended when cast and may be used again.
56dfd807-0fb3-4b35-a726-aae2f217ef05: During elemental rampage, your {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural attacks{/g} deal {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} of the chosen element, increasing to 2d6 at 11th level, and 3d6 at 20th level.
77f78ae3-0ad0-4693-ac9a-1e3cc737516c: Each bloodrager descends from someone who possessed innate magic — dragons, fey, devils, etc. Bloodline gives them a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g} and unique abilities to choose from, and allows them to specialize in a particular style of combat.
98fb104b-d089-48f5-9247-e0a9393c7134:
Each bloodrager has a source of magic somewhere in his heritage that empowers his bloodrages, bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g}, and bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}. Sometimes this source reflects a distant blood relationship to a powerful being, or is due to an extreme event involving such a creature somewhere in his family's past. Regardless of the source, this influence manifests in a number of ways. A bloodrager must pick one bloodline upon taking his first level of bloodrager. Once made, this choice cannot be changed.
The bloodrager gains bloodline powers at 1st level, 4th level, and every 4 levels thereafter. The bloodline powers a bloodrager gains are described in his chosen bloodline. For all spell-like bloodline powers, treat the character's bloodrager level as the {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}.
At 6th level and every 3 levels thereafter, a bloodrager receives one bonus feat chosen from a list specific to each bloodline. The bloodrager must meet the prerequisites for these bonus feats. At 7th, 10th, 13th, and 16th levels, a bloodrager learns an additional spell derived from his bloodline.
If the bloodrager takes levels in another class that grants a bloodline, the bloodlines must be the same type.
71cfd93a-b85b-4c2c-8b3a-c645b2b661d8: Each cavalier chooses an order to join. Their order gives them ability to challenge an enemy, gaining advantages against them. Each order gives the challenge its own unique advantages. It also gives the cavalier additional abilities as they advance.
c029974a-1269-424a-a155-1fe6b30e422e: Each deity provides access to several domains of power. A cleric chooses two of them. The domains grant the cleric additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} and abilities, and can seriously affect their specialization.
348e4950-7820-4bdb-a176-6a6be7c36a37: Each dragonheir scion can draw her lineage back to the influence of a great draconic progenitor. At 1st level, a dragonheir scion must select one of the chromatic or metallic dragon types. Once chosen, this cannot be changed. A number of dragonheir scion's abilities deal {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} and grant resistances based on her dragon type, as noted below. If a dragonheir scion takes a level in another class that grants a bloodline, the bloodlines must be of the same type, even if that means that the bloodline of one of the classes must change.
f7842c42-3c49-4c44-aa17-79f6a4d35096:
Each eldrich scion has a source of magic somewhere in her heritage that grants her {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}, bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g}, an additional class {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill{/g}, and other {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}special abilities{/g}. This source can represent a blood relation or an extreme event involving a creature somewhere in the family's past. For example, an eldrich scion might have a dragon as a distant relative or her grandfather might have signed a terrible contract with a devil. Regardless of the source, this influence manifests in a number of ways as the eldrich scion gains levels. An eldrich scion must pick one bloodline upon taking her first level of eldrich scion. Once made, this choice cannot be changed.
Filled with magical power that screams for release, sorcery is not so much a calling as a blessing — or a curse. For some eldrich scions, this arcane birthright manifests in subtle and carefully controlled ways, assisting in their manipulation of others or the pursuit of lofty goals. For others, it is wild and unpredictable, the primal and explosive lashing out of a power greater than themselves.
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, an eldrich scion learns an additional spell, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels. These spells cannot be exchanged for different spells at higher levels.
At 7th level, and every six levels thereafter, an eldrich scion receives one bonus feat, chosen from a list specific to each bloodline. The eldrich scion must meet the prerequisites for these bonus feats.
7020ddfb-394a-49a8-aaa8-efad44385870:
Each oracle draws upon a divine mystery to grant her {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} and powers. This mystery also grants additional class {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g} and other {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}special abilities{/g}. This mystery can represent a devotion to one ideal, prayers to deities that support the concept, or a natural calling to champion a cause. Regardless of its source, the mystery manifests in a number of ways as the oracle gains levels. An oracle must pick one mystery upon taking her first level of oracle. Once made, this choice cannot be changed.
At 2nd level, and every two levels thereafter, an oracle learns an additional spell derived from her mystery.
49136ca4-aa59-4a16-b57a-6be8676eb4ac: Each oracle is cursed, but this curse comes with a benefit as well as a hindrance. This choice is made at 1st level, and once made, it cannot be changed. The oracle's curse cannot be removed or dispelled without the aid of a deity. An oracle's curse is based on her oracle level plus one for every two levels or {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}Hit Dice{/g} other than oracle.
aa51c8bf-a49c-4a67-ae56-05985d98cc04:
Each sorcerer has a source of magic somewhere in her heritage that grants her {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}, bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g}, an additional class {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill{/g}, and other {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}special abilities{/g}. This source can represent a blood relation or an extreme event involving a creature somewhere in the family's past. For example, a sorcerer might have a dragon as a distant relative or her grandfather might have signed a terrible contract with a devil. Regardless of the source, this influence manifests in a number of ways as the sorcerer gains levels. A sorcerer must pick one bloodline upon taking her first level of sorcerer. Once made, this choice cannot be changed.
Filled with magical power that screams for release, sorcery is not so much a calling as a blessing — or a curse. For some sorcerers, this arcane birthright manifests in subtle and carefully controlled ways, assisting in their manipulation of others or the pursuit of lofty goals. For others, it is wild and unpredictable, the primal and explosive lashing out of a power greater than themselves.
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional spell, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels. These spells cannot be exchanged for different spells at higher levels.
At 7th level, and every six levels thereafter, a sorcerer receives one bonus feat, chosen from a list specific to each bloodline. The sorcerer must meet the prerequisites for these bonus feats.
02af8cde-d80d-46e6-9627-41290325b986: Each witch chooses a patron among the arcane entities, such as elements, death, or fate. Patron determines a witch's specialization and gives them access to new {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}.
327290ae-d41f-4af9-be32-adf440d9b993: Eldritch knights blend the abilities of fighting classes and {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spellcasters{/g}, hurling magic at the enemy one moment and hewing down their opponents with steel the next. They are just as comfortable fighting in the thick of combat as they are casting spells at foes while remaining safely behind their compatriots. Their versatility makes them valuable allies when the nature of an upcoming battle is unclear.
f7ea7892-32a1-4bdc-8607-6b906bff476f: Eldritch scoundrels can cast a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Cantrips_Orisons}cantrips{/g}, or 0-level {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}. These spells are cast like any other spell, but they are not expended when cast and may be used again.

Element: universal
Type: form infusion
Level: 1
Burn: 1
Associated Blasts: any
{g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Saving Throw{/g}: none
You form a weapon using your kinetic abilities. You create a nonreach, light or {g|Encyclopedia:Light_Weapon}one-handed{/g} weapon in your hand formed of pure energy or elemental matter. The kinetic blade's shape is purely cosmetic and doesn't affect the {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} dice, {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical{/g} threat range, or critical multiplier of the kinetic blade, nor does it grant the kinetic blade any weapon special features.
You can use this form infusion once as part of an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}action{/g}, a charge action, or a full-attack action in order to make {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attacks{/g} with your kinetic blade. Since it's part of another action (and isn't an action itself), using this wild talent doesn't provoke any additional {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attacks of opportunity{/g}. The kinetic blade deals your kinetic blast damage on each hit (applying any modifiers to your kinetic blast's damage as normal, but not your {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} modifier). The blade disappears at the end of your turn. The weapon deals the same {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}damage type{/g} that your kinetic blast deals, and it interacts with {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}Armor Class{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g} as normal for a blast of its type. The kinetic blade doesn't add the damage bonus from elemental overflow.

It grants either a +4 armor {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} or a +2 shield bonus to AC, and you can change the type of bonus as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}.
