ddd48ffc-189d-45fa-b7fe-5bcd5a7c287f: Emulating the blazing phoenix, flamewardens sweep through the world like a selective forest fire, burning away corruption, evil, and those who cling to decay.
10843b11-0239-4d26-908b-97e0fbf9eba8:
Enchanting Smile: You gain a +2 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Persuasion}Persuasion checks{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against Enchantment {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}. This bonus increases by +1 for every five wizard levels you possess, up to a maximum of +6 at 20th level.
Dazing Touch: You can cause a living creature to become dazed for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} as a melee {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g}. Creatures with more {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}Hit Dice{/g} than your wizard level are unaffected. You can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + your {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier.
941813b3-647d-4667-9ba8-21a373555e0e: Enchantment {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} affect the minds of others, influencing or controlling their behavior.
51ebcdec-273b-4d7a-9223-56c2e33b9032:
Erastil, also known as "Old Deadeye" and "The Stag God," is one of the oldest human gods still worshiped in the Inner Sea region, and is concerned with family, farming, hunting, and trade. During the Age of Creation, Erastil was among the gods who battled Rovagug when he sought to destroy Golarion. They were eventually able to contain him in the Dead Vault at the planet's core. His religion dates back to before the Age of Darkness, when small farming communities and hunter-gatherers prayed to him for bountiful harvests and successful hunts. Legends claim that it was Old Deadeye himself who crafted the first bow and gifted it to humans to overcome the challenges of the world. Even as the accomplishments of civilization mount, Erastil continues to embrace and represent the simpler pleasures life has to offer.
Domains: Animal, Community, Good, Law, Plant.
Favored Weapon: Longbow
eccf95f0-35f4-4ae1-99bf-998694d6e7f5: Eschewing physical armor for protection via the strength of his faith, an ecclesitheurge focuses on the miracles his deity bestows and the breadth of that deity's dominion.
b3bf4629-9021-405f-a151-6b51c63e7481: Even the loudest voice can often times be drowned out by the din of battle. Whether with the polished metal trumpet of a standing army or the crude curved animal horn of savage raiders, a herald of the horn sounds his raging song with thunderous blasts, which can bolster allies or shatter castle walls.
731022c5-3193-44a7-b523-6e5f008a6442: Every cleric chooses a deity and, based on that deity's {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}alignment{/g}, gain the ability to channel either positive or negative energy. The channeled energy either heals or {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damages{/g} all creatures around the cleric. Its effect depends on whether the targets are alive or undead.
aac42d6c-5de8-486e-b445-f68a32cd83e6: Every oracle devotes their life to studying some mystery. The mystery determines the oracle's specialization, giving them certain {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} and revelations — abilities that empower their oracle in their chosen role.
93b1d9a3-ee2f-4f80-bd15-35e6e034db02: Every oracle has a curse that gives them certain penalties and bonuses. As the oracle advances, their curse becomes less detrimental and more beneficial. For example, the Blackened curse impedes the oracle's abilities to hit an enemy with a weapon, but grants them a number of fire {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}.
1eb04b33-9d1f-4859-afd0-64821af2e4a1: Every paladin's code instructs him to put the welfare of others before his own, but some paladins take this farther than most, shouldering the direst suffering of the world onto themselves in order to help others and inspiring their allies to achieve heights of valor rather than seeking the glory for themselves.
d3019347-0f8f-4198-88ca-76e3bd2d243b: Every sorcerer descends from a creature that possesses innate magic, such as dragons, fey, devils, etc. The bloodline grants the sorcerer a number of available {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}, unique {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g} and abilities, and helps to empower their chosen specialization.
1d6df1a5-e78a-45db-a8e2-18c46c385d39: Every time a cleric rests, they prepare a limited number of {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}. A cleric can spend a prepared spell to cast either a cure wounds, or inflict wounds spell, depending on the kind of energy they can channel.
32c9f07f-175a-4616-a1b4-3391cd4c6916: Every time a druid rests, they prepare a limited number of {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}. A druid can spend a prepared spell to cast a summoning spell instead.
242da851-2a77-438a-8461-c5a0a6482947: Evocation {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} manipulate magical energy or tap an unseen source of power to produce a desired end. In effect, an evocation draws upon magic to create something out of nothing. Many of these spells produce spectacular effects, and evocation spells can deal large amounts of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}.
2500c3ed-4733-4d01-b43a-0dedaa54f257:
Evokers revel in the raw power of magic, and can use it to create and destroy with shocking ease.
Intense Spells: Whenever you cast an evocation {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} that deals hit point {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}, add 1/2 your wizard level to the damage (minimum +1). This {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} only applies once to a spell, not once per missile or ray, and cannot be split between multiple missiles or rays. This damage is of the same type as the spell. At 20th level, whenever you cast an Evocation spell, you can {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}roll{/g} twice to penetrate a creature's {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g} and take the better result.
Force Missile: As a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, you can unleash a force missile that automatically strikes a foe, as magic missile. The force missile deals 1d4 points of damage plus the damage from your intense spells evocation power. This is a force effect. You can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + your {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier.
Elemental Wall: At 8th level, one per day you can create a wall of energy. You can choose fire, cold, acid or {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}electricity damage{/g}. The elemental wall otherwise functions like wall of fire. At 12th level and every 4 levels thereafter, you can use this ability one additional time per day, to a maximum of 4 times at level 20.
87afbffc-6bc3-42e3-8ecf-eaf7f4343912: Far to the north, some tribes have adapted to life in the bitter cold of arctic regions. The frost spirit is seen by some as a protector of their way of life, and shamans who commune with the spirit are shown great respect in their communities. A shaman who selects the frost spirit has coarse white hair and always feels cold to the touch.
4af67f59-8bde-4277-a9eb-53352f85cfbd: Fear is a good motivator — and some commanders use this fact to inspire their troops, preferring it to the usual approach.
9ae1cf41-b122-4768-9c9a-94c188460955: Few creatures are more cruel and fearsome than the mighty red dragon. King of the chromatics, this terrible beast brings ruin and {g|Encyclopedia:Injury_Death}death{/g} to the lands that fall under its shadow.
0de9e1b0-d9fa-4313-8b9e-a7d70f8669ef: Feyform shifters are intimately linked to the First World and can draw from it to gain otherworldly powers.
5a971d65-248c-48b3-b612-9b909f6c8899: Fighter gains twice as many {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g} as the other classes. Some of these feats are directly connected to combat abilities. They also have access to unique feats that increase their {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} and chance to hit.
2a842e14-f061-49f9-a3cc-469781cc1ad1: Fighters are adept at physically damaging their enemies. They have access to a vast array of abilities which allow to turn them into either masters of melee fighting, or deadly sharpshooters. Fighters are also great at employing armor and shields, which allows them to become reliable protectors for their allies. However, they are unable to use magic, and their weak willpower make them vulnerable to hostile magic.
755767c2-7bcb-4a2d-aa32-b3622429c287: Fighters excel at combat—defeating their enemies, controlling the flow of battle, and surviving such sorties themselves. While their specific weapons and methods grant them a wide variety of tactics, few can match fighters for sheer battle prowess.
38102b04-d4d7-4d40-96ee-ea3327719bdc: Fighters make the most use of their armor. As they advance, they reduce the {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} for wearing it.
3f408002-cbe3-4059-8a1f-d3a9fd6fc873: Flaming weapon is sheathed in fire that deals an extra {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g} on a successful hit.
e96a26b4-46f0-4cc9-af2a-2c30a522e448: For a possessed shaman, merely communing with the spirit world is insufficient. Instead, she invites the spirits to share her body, granting them the chance to experience corporeal existence. In return, they grant her their skills and protect her from otherworldly influence.
82073329-07db-481c-9fd0-f75a7ec85796: For some arcanists, the power bubbling up from within is nearly too much to contain. They become adept at shaping this magical energy without needing to bind it up in {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}.
d4f8b695-89fd-464c-b328-0ad1d8799613: For some rangers living in vast plains, their horses are an irreplaceable part of their lives, and their bows are a natural extension of their arms.
45c166f1-da63-4ee4-807b-b8ec8a9ee1dd: For the next {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}, anytime this creature {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}rolls{/g} a d20, they must roll twice and take the less favorable result.
3a1d7977-38aa-4ca6-aa3d-6f1ae62efb95:
Forewarned: You receive a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g} equal to 1/2 your wizard level (minimum +1). At 20th level, anytime you {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}roll{/g} initiative, assume the roll resulted in a natural 20.
Diviner's Fortune: When you activate this school power, you can touch any creature as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} to give it an insight bonus on all of its {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability checks{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} equal to 1/2 your wizard level (minimum +1) for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. You can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + your {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier.
85cb501a-d616-47f3-b83c-a86f81872469: Fortune favors the archaeologist. As a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}, an archaeologist can call on fortune's favor, giving him a +1 luck {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g}, and weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}. He can use this ability for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} per day equal to 4 + his {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier. At each level after 1st, an archaeologist can use archaeologist's luck for 2 additional rounds per day. Maintaining this bonus is a {g|Encyclopedia:Free_Action}free action{/g}, but it ends immediately if the archaeologist is killed, paralyzed, stunned, knocked {g|Encyclopedia:Injury_Death}unconscious{/g}, or otherwise prevented from taking a free {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}action{/g} to maintain it each round. Archaeologist's luck is treated as bardic performance for the purposes of {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g}, abilities, effects, and the like that affect bardic performance. Like bardic performance, it cannot be maintained at the same time as other performance abilities. This bonus increases to +2 at 5th level, +3 at 11th level, and +4 at 17th level.
dfa71d0a-3644-47c1-b913-7da6195d11c4: Frequently called "brown-furs," these transmutation-focused arcanists are known for transforming themselves into animals. What few realize is that these specialized arcanists excel at turning themselves and others into all kinds of creatures.
8535f5d3-2a54-475c-b69b-a8110bc10a3f: From level 1 on, while a racer is wearing no armor and carrying a light load, its {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} is increased by 10 feet. From level 6 on, it's increased by 20 feet instead.
bfe05e7e-3175-4750-9d2d-6b0cd64a4d8f: Frost weapon is sheathed in a terrible, icy cold that deals an extra {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}cold damage{/g} on a successful hit.
449a0268-1c05-4de2-910f-e4fdf8f04adc: Gain +4 {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} and +2 size bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g}.
9e08a6bb-891f-4404-aa55-46911fa379da: Gain +4 {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} and +2 size bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g}.
e27bc9dc-3e6c-4836-836b-75a38bd2151f: Gain +4 {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} and +2 size bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g}.
3330095e-a0c9-4779-aee3-f2f2dafe3124: Gain +6 {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g}, +4 size bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} and +2 size bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g}.
2ff5d16d-cd18-4189-beb5-ac47aaa2add3: Gain +6 {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g}, +4 size bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} and +2 size bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g}.
5e3d1658-7e81-4d42-9c5b-0657411f9359: Gain +6 {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g}, +4 size bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} and +2 size bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g}.
9c291453-cd50-47b2-9a7e-ee0aaa7a54af: Gain +6 {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g}, +4 size bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} and +2 size bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g}.
ab163f42-4c17-4045-97d5-a8bd1eec1be2: Gain +6 {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g}, +4 size bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} and +2 size bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g}.
666e276b-c3b0-421d-84ae-44f2629bd638: Gain +6 {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g}, +4 size bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} and +2 size bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g}.
2a49bfc0-d47a-48dc-8879-ef3ea0cdacc7: Gain a +4 alchemical {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} and a +2 alchemical bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g}.
378123c2-c68d-4264-85dd-64ae5c095729: Gain a +4 alchemical {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} and a +2 alchemical bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g}.
680d0785-2eb6-417f-a48b-59b165ed805e: Gain a +4 alchemical {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} and a +2 alchemical bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g}.
f65fe63d-84fc-448a-9226-26ef6abb5472: Gain a +6 alchemical {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g}, a +4 alchemical bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g}, and a +2 alchemical bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g}.
a088e0a2-a349-426b-bce0-b9c2f8092b7e: Gain a +6 alchemical {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g}, a +4 alchemical bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g}, and a +2 alchemical bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g}.
67e4fe58-5a6e-4461-884f-39257673a180: Gain a +6 alchemical {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g}, a +4 alchemical bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g}, and a +2 alchemical bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g}.
a23f1268-7842-427f-a5bf-7495f504ca1a: Gain a +6 alchemical {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g}, a +4 alchemical bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g}, and a +2 alchemical bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g}.
7c77338e-9718-4a1e-956c-67ecd988abb9: Gain a +6 alchemical {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g}, a +4 alchemical bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g}, and a +2 alchemical bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g}.
3b84edad-f110-4eea-8708-d7222f3bfd3c: Gain a +6 alchemical {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g}, a +4 alchemical bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g}, and a +2 alchemical bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g}.
f6638d61-7997-4dd1-aa5b-bbc425584f80:
Generations ago, a demon spread its filth into the essence of your bloodline. While it doesn't manifest in all of your kin, in those moments when you're bloodraging, you embody its terrifying presence.
The power of the Abyss courses through your veins, causing horrific transformations during your bloodrage.
Bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}Feats{/g}: Cleave, Great Fortitude, Improved Bull Rush, Improved Sunder, Intimidating Prowess, Power Attack, Toughness.
Bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}Spells{/g}: Ray of enfeeblement (7th), bull's strength (10th), rage (13th), stoneskin (16th).
575ede28-6044-4ba4-a271-40a26a67b1dd:
Generations ago, a demon spread its filth into your heritage. While it does not manifest in all of your kin, for you it is particularly strong. You might sometimes have urges to chaos or evil, but your destiny (and {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}alignment{/g}) is up to you. While some would say that you are possessed, you know better. The demonic influence in your blood grows as you gain power.
Bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}Feats{/g} of the Abyssal Bloodline: Augment Summoning, Bull Rush, Cleave, Empower Spell, Great Fortitude, Power Attack, Skill Focus ({g|Encyclopedia:Lore_Religion}Lore (religion){/g}), Sunder Armor.
9f99af26-2507-4b44-bd41-d82b3577e1b2: Generations of warriors hold the line against impossible odds. Some of their ancient techniques persist to this day.
a1abbf69-7c2f-41aa-99ca-091dad9676b9: Gold dragons are the epitome of virtue. Other metallic dragons revere their gold cousins as the agents of divine forces and the paragons of dragonkind, and often seek them for advice or aid.
a9d0d809-dcae-4f18-bef3-74e9af327977:
Gorum, also known as "Our Lord in Iron," is a god of battle above all other pursuits; it is said that he would rust away into nothingness if there was ever a time with no more conflicts to be fought. His faithful believe he is present in every iron weapon of war that is forged.
Domains: Chaos, Destruction, Glory, Strength, War.
Favored Weapon: Greatsword
2408a6b7-9e1c-4489-b7a4-9f1121e15e7a:
Gozreh is a dualistic deity of nature, a god of the storm and sky and also a goddess of the wave and surf. Born of the ocean's fury and the wind's wrath, Gozreh is a fickle deity.
Domains: Air, Animal, Plant, Water, Weather.
Favored Weapon: Trident
7e287592-ba5d-4be6-8af4-df1c76cc99cc: Greater Mutagen that gives the alchemist a +6 alchemical {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g}, a +4 alchemical bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g}, and a +4 natural armor bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}. The alchemist takes a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} as long as the mutagen persists.
867829d9-4c0c-4cbd-9659-53e1e7231c27: Green dragons dwell in the ancient forests of the world, prowling under towering canopies in search of prey. Of all the chromatic dragons, green dragons are perhaps the easiest to deal with diplomatically.
87febf53-5044-465a-9abc-148844f80e5f: Grenadiers train to exercise their talents in the thick of battle, even when not under the influence of their mutagens. They learn methods of combining weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} with their alchemical magic, and sacrifice skill with poisons in order to become more adept at using alchemical bombs or using alchemical items in conjunction with their martial skills. As an unusual side effect of their skill at handling bombs and alchemical items with increased speed, grenadiers master the ability to drink potions, elixirs, and mutagens quickly and safely, without exposing themselves to peril while doing so.
8db06898-17c2-4ac7-8110-7e1d854732e0:
Groetus is the god of the End Times, a sentient and cruel moonlet that looks down upon the Boneyard and waits for the last living soul to die. When Pharasma judges the last soul after the last living body dies on the Material Plane, Groetus will descend to the Boneyard and move on to the Material Plane to "clean up" and pack the dust away for another reality. No one really knows what Groetus is going to do once the last soul is judged, but it is generally accepted that it will not be pleasant.
Domains: Chaos, Darkness, Destruction, Madness.
Favored Weapon: Heavy flail
6df737dc-c0da-4fea-8e6d-c8b17f2c7113: Hampered: All of the target's speeds are reduced by half (to a minimum of 5 feet).
f1672a86-ab95-40fd-999a-68d0ffb390f0: Hellknight signifers form the spellcasting arm of the Hellknight orders. They serve as faceless enforcers of order and use their magical powers to relentlessly root out and punish criminals to the letter of the law. They wear masks — often featureless — to mark themselves as impersonal agents of order, unswayed by empathy, detached from emotion, and dedicated to passing impartial judgment upon all lawbreakers. A signifer's distinctive mask is a symbol of his devotion to the precepts of law and exacting justice, and it serves as the focus for several of his signifer powers. Traditionally, signifers are arcane or divine spellcasters.
3b573975-7ed8-4ad8-b4b8-ac6b1ffe5d9d:
Hellknights of the Chain value social order and responsibility, seeking to root out anarchists and fugitives. They have reputations as relentless hunters who drag lawbreakers away in chains. These Hellknights keep meticulous count of the number of criminals they've brought to justice; they never abandon the pursuit of a fugitive, and they believe everyone has a specific, crucial role to play in society.
At 1st level you gain a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:CMB}CMB{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:CMD}CMD{/g}. This bonus increases by +1 at 5th and 9th level.
9a387902-f498-4f1a-8d1f-be32c8927dca:
Hellknights of the Order of the Pyre seek to combat outlandish faiths and beliefs, preventing them from gaining purchase in the Inner Sea region. They are cult hunters first and foremost, but also fight to repress other philosophies they deem dangerous. These Hellknights hate and vocally condemn cultists, priests of rare religions, and followers of mystical orders.
At 1st level, whenever you receive {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g}, you gain {g|Encyclopedia:Fast_Healing}fast healing{/g} 5 for the number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to your level in this prestige class. At 5th level you gain fast healing 10 and at 9th level you gain fast healing 15 instead.
4021fdd1-9f0f-473e-970e-bc3a1ceb0a7e:
Hellknights of the Scourge seek out corruption within order and laws not fit for the lawful. They question and seek to determine the difference between what is legal and what is for the greater good — owing allegiance to no one nation or ruler. Their quests for order often take them places that other Hellknights cannot tread, both physically and philosophically. As a result, their commitment to the Measure and the Chain must be beyond reproach.
Whenever you land a killing blow, all enemies in a 15-foot radius suffer a -2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on Will {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} for 3 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g}. This penalty increases to -3 at 5th and -4 at 9th level.
d726d1d1-ff7a-4f5a-82f4-9e3b1424f74b: Hexes are {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}special abilities{/g} available to witches and shamans. They are very versatile and can help you finely tune the character for their chosen role in the party. Some of the hexes duplicate the most powerful abilities of other classes.
e8a49a10-0ecf-4199-9c52-cfc46333b432: Hunt callers are skalds whose songs draw their allies into the animal world. They can invoke the inner beasts of those who observe their supernatural performances—a talent that causes many to mistake the hunt caller and her allies for lycanthropes or other shapechanging creatures.
2f6a8e03-452c-45c2-b994-aba9d4b9c8f9: Hunters are warriors of the wilds that have forged close bonds with trusted animal companions. They focus their tactics on fighting alongside their companion animals as a formidable team of two. Able to cast a wide variety of nature {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} and take on the abilities and attributes of beasts, hunters magically improve both themselves and their animal companions.
426a2ea2-66dd-4ca1-82a8-96a2c1f6641f: Hunters can cast a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Cantrips_Orisons}orisons{/g}, or 0-level {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}. These spells are cast like any other spell, but they are not expended when cast and may be used again.
50fbeffd-8f2c-41ac-87a9-e5d30b62013c: Hunters can empower themselves and their animal companions with {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g} and abilities of various beasts. For example, a leopard companion can be empowered with a mouse aspect to make the enemies unlikely to hit it.
a5a5938f-871d-4503-9c85-79b9bc78528f: Hunters fight side by side with their animal companions. They can use both melee and ranged weapons, and employ some divine {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} that let them empower themselves and their companions.
33c54797-3241-4c7d-aea8-11a35d0ec64c:
If a character can catch an opponent when he is unable to defend himself effectively from her {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}, she can strike a vital spot for extra {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}.
The character's attack deals extra damage anytime her target would be denied a {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} (whether the target actually has a Dexterity bonus or not), or when the character {g|Encyclopedia:Flanking}flanks{/g} her target. This extra damage is {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} and increases by 1d6 at later levels. This additional damage is precision damage and is not multiplied on a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g}.
The character must be able to see the target well enough to pick out a vital spot and must be able to reach such a spot.
6e856910-5c8b-4df0-803b-dd0cbd1532b8: If an animal companion is subjected to an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} that normally allows a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex saving throw{/g} for half {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}, it takes no damage if it makes a successful saving throw.
c84cb98e-7154-4bc7-8762-b30c3245f8c3: If she has both hands free, a kineticist can gather energy or elemental matter as a {g|Encyclopedia:Move_Action}move action{/g}. Gathering power in this way allows the kineticist to reduce the total burn cost of a blast wild talent she uses in the same {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} by 1 point. The kineticist can instead gather power for 1 full round in order to reduce the total burn cost of a blast wild talent used on her next turn by 2 points (to a minimum of 0 points). If she does so, she can also gather power as a move {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}action{/g} during her next turn to reduce the burn cost by a total of 3 points. This ability can never reduce the burn cost of a wild talent below 0 points.
21f2e9f5-aa42-43b2-a338-4e8ab17cb008: If the barbarian scores a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical{/g} threat while in the lethal stance, she applies double the lethal stance's {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} when {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}rolling{/g} to confirm the critical. A barbarian must have the lethal stance rage power and be at least 4th level to select this rage power.
ce51af3b-2b16-48d1-88fd-f4239c663dcd: Illusion {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} deceive the senses or minds of others. They cause people to see things that are not there, not see things that are there, hear phantom noises, or remember things that never happened.
b5f3ba0a-7cc8-4322-ab0c-583c0b490931:
Illusionists use magic to weave confounding images, figments, and phantoms to baffle and vex their foes.
Blinding Ray : As a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, you can fire a shimmering ray at any foe within 30 feet as a ranged {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g}. The ray causes creatures to be blinded for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. Creatures with more {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}Hit Dice{/g} than your wizard level are dazzled for 1 round instead. You can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + your {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier.
Invisibility Field : At 8th level, you can make yourself Invisible as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g} for a number of rounds per day equal to your wizard level. These rounds do not need to be consecutive. This otherwise functions as greater invisibility.
7660c78a-1ac4-4281-8dd6-70a20256f351:
Imprisoned since the Age of Creation, the god Rovagug, also known as "The Rough Beast", "The Great Destroyer" and "The Worldbreaker", seeks only to destroy creation and the other gods. Believed to be imprisoned in a state of torpor somewhere deep within Golarion, his increasingly restless stirrings are taken by many to be the cause of volcanic activity and earthquakes. His worshipers are known for embodying the god's dominion over destruction, disaster, and wrath.
Domains: Chaos, Destruction, Evil, War, Weather.
Favored Weapon: Greataxe
b057d230-ac08-4c76-9101-d3d3a5a7fd06:
In addition to magical extracts, alchemists are adept at swiftly mixing various volatile chemicals and infusing them with their magical reserves to create powerful bombs that they can hurl at their enemies. An alchemist can use a number of bombs each day equal to his {g|Encyclopedia:Class_Level}class level{/g} + his {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier.
Thrown bombs have a range of 30 feet and use the Throw Splash Weapon special {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}. Bombs are considered weapons and can be selected using {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g} such as Point-Blank Shot and Weapon Focus. On a direct hit, an alchemist's bomb inflicts {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g} + additional {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} equal to the alchemist's Intelligence modifier. The damage of an alchemist's bomb increases by 1d6 points at every odd-numbered alchemist level. Splash damage from an alchemist bomb is always equal to the bomb's minimum damage (so if the bomb would deal 2d6+4 points of fire damage on a direct hit, its splash damage would be 6 points of fire damage). Those caught in the splash damage can attempt a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} for half damage. The {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of this save is equal to 10 + 1/2 the alchemist's level + the alchemist's Intelligence modifier.
f846a4c1-de22-432a-b429-dfcaf89ff89a: In addition to the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} gained by oracles as they gain levels, each oracle also adds all of either the {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}cure{/g} spells or the inflict spells to her list of spells known (cure spells include all spells with "cure" in the name, inflict spells include all spells with "inflict" in the name). These spells are added as soon as the oracle is capable of casting them. This choice is made when the oracle gains her first level and cannot be changed.
5fb5f7b0-9775-4d76-bef1-608bd08f7d59: In addition to the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} gained by oracles as they gain levels, oracle adds all the inflict spells to her list of spells known (inflict spells include all spells with "inflict" in the name). These spells are added as soon as the oracle is capable of casting them.
30c2619b-4d2f-46ad-b51f-9b61c2b23878: In addition to the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} gained by oracles as they gain levels, oracle adds all the {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}cure{/g} spells to her list of spells known (cure spells include all spells with "cure" in the name). These spells are added as soon as the oracle is capable of casting them.
335a67ab-7d4a-4c89-aa6f-adb4eed4a590:
In strange and eldritch runes you find potent magic.
Blast Rune: As a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, you can create a blast rune in a desired location. Any creature entering a 5-foot area around the rune takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} + 1 point for every two levels you possess in the class that gave you access to this domain. This rune deals either acid, cold, electricity, or {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g}, decided when you create the rune. The rune lasts a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to your level in the class that gave you access to this domain. You can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + your {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier.
Warding Rune: At 8th level, you can create a warding rune in a desired location. Any creature entering a 5-foot area around the rune must make a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g} or they will not be able to {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} for a number of rounds equal to 1/2 your level in the class that gave you access to this domain. The rune lasts a number of rounds equal to your level in the class that gave you access to this domain. You can use this ability once per day at 8th level and one additional time per day for every four levels in the class that gave you access to this domain beyond 8th.
Domain {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}Spells{/g}: protection from {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}alignment{/g}, protection from arrows, communal protection from arrows, communal protection from energy, {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g}, greater dispel magic, power word blind, power word stun, power word kill.
9221df25-d5ed-45d5-9208-23a52b7bd989:
In strength and brawn there is truth — your faith gives you incredible might and power.
Strength Surge: As a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, you can touch a creature to give it great strength. For 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}, the target gains an enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} equal to 1/2 your level in the class that gave you access to this domain (minimum +1) to {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attacks{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Athletics}Athletics checks{/g}. You can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + your {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier.
Might of the Gods: At 8th level, you add 1/2 of your level in the class that gave you access to this domain as an enhancement bonus to your Athletics {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g}.
abfb000f-9992-4d8d-a95f-589ed29c183f:
In strength and brawn there is truth — your faith gives you incredible might and power.
Strength Surge: As a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, you can touch a creature to give it great strength. For 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}, the target gains an enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} equal to 1/2 your level in the class that gave you access to this domain (minimum +1) to {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attacks{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Athletics}Athletics checks{/g}. You can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + your {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier.
Might of the Gods: At 8th level, you add 1/2 of your level in the class that gave you access to this domain as an enhancement bonus to your Athletics {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g}.
Domain {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}Spells{/g}: enlarge person, bull's strength, magical vestment, mass enlarge person, righteous might, stoneskin, legendary proportions, frightful aspect, transformation.
4defac02-bcf2-4083-9e12-677f4b432702: In the world's wild lands, a mount is an advantage in both everyday life and the dealing of death. In many barbarian tribes, the true stature of a warrior is determined by his skill and ferocity on horseback. Other tribes measure it in skill atop whatever terrible mounts their people employ. A number of bloodragers are not only skilled in the art of mounted combat, but have learned to channel their arcane energies directly into their mount.
58fd36b9-6735-41bf-8bed-9d0f5cb60811: Incense fog area increases to 30 feet around incense synthesizer.
5d92b322-57d8-4932-8868-a30570765f91: Increases movement {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} by 30 ft and makes the target immune to {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attacks of opportunity{/g}.
c800c7df-21ba-4521-95bb-9360ea6ba783:
Infernal influence grants you profane insight and weighs on your soul.
Creatures instinctively distrust you, and you take a –3 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Persuasion}Persuasion{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g} when used for diplomacy.
You gain a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on Persuasion skill {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g} when used to intimidate or bluff. Persuasion becomes a class skill for you.
At 5th level, you gain a +4 bonus to all {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against charm effects.
At 10th level, you gain {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Immunity}immunity{/g} to fire.
At 15th level, any weapon you wield is treated as lawful and evil for the purposes of overcoming {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g}.
e2ff8471-dd05-4811-93aa-ee5c52cc0c4a:
Injury; {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Save{/g}: Fortitude
Frequency: 1/{g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} for 6 rounds
Effect: 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:AbilityDamage}damage{/g}
Cure: 1 save

df957f39-ab61-4a1c-86e8-17aa07f1f3b5:

Frequency: 1/{g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} for 6 rounds

e4d6c792-b88e-44b8-8a8c-76c55b1f28fa:

Frequency: 1/{g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} for 6 rounds

Cure: 1 save
97a2b29b-d39e-4881-825e-cac827063c2b: Innate magical powers are always a tempting phenomenon, and many people are content with the extent of their powers, but overwhelming mages strive to improve the sheer capacity of their powers.
bf8a98f9-5553-4dfb-9d2b-5bb338345abf: Inquisitors are skilled at sensing deception and intimidating their foes. An inquisitor receives a morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on all {g|Encyclopedia:Persuasion}Persuasion{/g} skill {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g} made for intimidation and {g|Encyclopedia:Perception}Perception checks{/g} equal to 1/2 her inquisitor level (minimum +1).
c09feea9-0599-46fe-9918-8b4b0c443e0b: Inquisitors are their deities' weapons of retribution. They possess many divine {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}, mostly using them to empower themselves, and fight with a weapon favored by their deity. Depending on their specialization, an inquisitor can be deadly in melee or ranged combat.
b2d66c6e-3112-497c-8612-14b7d8047814: Inquisitors can cast a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Cantrips_Orisons}orisons{/g}, or 0-level {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}. These spells are cast like any other spell, but they are not expended when cast and may be used again.
94189a48-5d25-4f05-a2d3-1e5537315eb9: Inquisitors tend to move from place to place, chasing down enemies and researching emerging threats. As a result, they often travel with others, if for no other reason than to mask their presence. Inquisitors work with members of their faith whenever possible, but even such allies are not above suspicion.
4806db3e-7fe9-49ab-a95d-a74e301ce0c2: Instead of a melee weapon, an eldritch archer must use a ranged weapon for {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} combat. She doesn't need a free hand for ranged spell combat. The eldritch archer cannot accept an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to gain a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Concentration}concentration checks{/g} to cast a spell defensively.
292bfdc3-1066-492d-ab98-350c219010db: Instead of dealing {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}, this bomb exposes creatures around it to choking gas. Creatures that take a direct hit or are in the splash area must succeed at a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g} or become nauseated for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} damage the alchemist bomb would usually inflict. Creatures nauseated by this bomb can attempt another save each round.
fc517f26-ea40-4a83-9580-8534a9daea43: Instead of dealing {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}, this bomb exposes creatures around it to choking gas. Creatures that take a direct hit or are in the splash area must succeed at a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g} or become nauseated[LONGSTART] for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} damage the alchemist bomb would usually inflict. Creatures nauseated by this bomb can attempt another save each round[LONGEND].
4df0cbe9-5e9b-4fd2-ae25-680b3d2c148b: Instead of drawing the components of, creating, and throwing a bomb, the alchemist can draw the components, drink them, mix them within his body, and then expel them as a breath weapon as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}. This breath weapon is a 15-foot cone and has the same {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} as the bomb. Each creature within the cone takes {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} as if it had suffered a direct hit from the alchemist's bomb, but succeeding at a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} (DC = 10 + 1/2 the alchemist's level + the alchemist's {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier) halves the damage. Unlike throwing normal bombs, drawing, drinking, and expelling breath weapon bombs does not provoke {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attacks of opportunity{/g}.
48caa1c5-8ae5-4dcc-ae27-2e7788d44721: Instead of getting a new hex, you can increase the amount of energy channeled by your hex channeler's channel energy ability by {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g}.
438c7b4d-65e2-4ab2-b8b5-1a23927cca4e: Instead of preparing her {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}, a ley line guardian draws the power casting spells directly from ley lines. A ley line guardian is a spontaneous spellcaster. She knows the same number of spells and receives the same number of spell slots per day as a sorcerer of her witch level. Bonus spells granted by a ley line guardian's patron are added to the ley line guardian's total spells known at the appropriate levels.
d20b5eb0-8d69-43e1-b3fe-d69b90f833f4:
Iomedae, also known as "The Inheritor," "Light of the Sword," and "Lady of Valor," is the goddess of righteous valor, justice, and honor. Having served as Aroden's herald, she inherited many of the Last Azlanti's followers upon his death, and continues to espouse the ideas of honor and righteousness in the defense of good and the battle against evil.
Domains: Glory, Good, Law, Sun, War.
Favored Weapon: Longsword
db063a04-3ec2-4b2d-92dd-95559f1e5431:
Irori, also known as "Master of Masters", "The Enlightened One" and "The Perfect Human," is the god of enlightenment, self-perfection, knowledge, healing, and inner strength. His followers claim that he was once a mortal who achieved absolute physical and mental perfection and thus attained divinity of his own volition. He is one of the core gods, if not the most powerful deity, of the Vudrani pantheon, but has an increasing following in the Inner Sea region as well.
Domains: Healing, Knowledge, Law, Rune, Strength.
Favored Weapon: Unarmed strike
5de7d656-6d76-4ed1-9fa4-9bc1a678c747: Ki Strike — Cold Iron and Silver
7ee23bbe-83aa-45f0-aa1f-428f699d9564: Kineticist is one of the most difficult classes to master. They are the masters of elements, capable of creating elemental blasts with almost no boundaries. These blasts can be devastating to the enemies.
79ac6538-4fdb-4166-82ea-a675e05c2526: Kineticist spends a {g|Encyclopedia:Full_Round_Action}full-round action{/g} and a {g|Encyclopedia:Move_Action}move action{/g} to gather energy or elemental matter and reduce the total burn cost of a chosen blast by 3. After that, they use the chosen blast. If the burn cost drops to 0 before the whole time is spent, they stop gathering power and use the chosen blast immediately. To use this ability, the kineticist needs to have their both hands free. This ability can never reduce the burn cost of a blast below 0 points.
b86420bd-74f2-486c-9fb0-21d9750e53cc: Kineticist spends a {g|Encyclopedia:Full_Round_Action}full-round action{/g} to gather energy or elemental matter and reduce the total burn cost of a chosen blast by 2. After that, they use the chosen blast. If the burn cost drops to 0 before the whole {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} is spent, they stop gathering power and use the chosen blast immediately. To use this ability, the kineticist needs to have their both hands free. This ability can never reduce the burn cost of a blast below 0 points.
17e487fc-2a6f-43ee-a65d-daddbcb789d1: Kineticist spends a {g|Encyclopedia:Move_Action}move action{/g} to gather energy or elemental matter and reduce the total burn cost of a chosen blast by 1. After that, they use the chosen blast. To use this ability, the kineticist needs to have their both hands free. This ability can never reduce the burn cost of a blast below 0 points.
f3a5ecd3-c13d-422d-a4d0-8883ea458bca:
Kineticists are living channels for elemental matter and energy, manipulating the world around them by drawing upon inner reserves from their own bodies. Kineticists often awaken to their kinetic abilities during a violent or traumatic experience, releasing their power involuntarily. As kinetic power is seldom inherited, kineticists are rarely able to find mentors to guide them, so they must delve into these mysteries on their own to learn to control their gifts.
Kineticists generally use their powers to assail their foes from range, but based on the way their talents develop, they can channel their kinetic abilities for a variety of situations. Kineticists are usually quite different from their families and friends, so they often strike out on their own or alongside others with extraordinary talents.
4c872a4f-ad2e-4fb3-b385-e52f89e6bf9c: Kineticists are proficient with all {g|Encyclopedia:Weapon_Proficiency}simple weapons{/g} and light armor, but not shields.
51adddc9-921a-49b6-8ac0-39ace46975f7: Kineticists who focus on the element of air are called aerokineticists. Aerokineticists often control air flow or electricity, specializing in mobility and ranged combat.
6966dc8e-1133-42cd-8c7a-936c9060bf8f: Kineticists who focus on the element of earth are called geokineticists. Geokineticists manipulate the earth itself, and they are masters of defensive techniques.
181765b5-6a80-49e1-99b1-270c24c14e5d: Kineticists who focus on the element of fire are called pyrokineticists. Pyrokineticists wield elemental fire as a potent weapon, and they possess a powerful offense.
9ba7f6a4-547f-44ea-993d-f81565a9f547: Kineticists who focus on the element of water are called hydrokineticists. Hydrokineticists master the flow of water or the numbing chill of cold, and they are known for their versatility and flowing forms, like the ever-changing currents.
b26bdd09-18dc-4265-8d0a-38647b4f5427:
Known to her faithful as the "Dawnflower", "The Healing Light", and "The Everlight", Sarenrae is a goddess who teaches temperance and patience in all things. Compassion and peace are her greatest virtues, and if enemies of the faith can be redeemed, they should be. Worship of this goddess of healing, honesty, redemption, and the sun began far to the east of the Inner Sea, in the vast Padishah Empire of Kelesh, but her worshipers can now be found throughout the world.
Domains: Fire, Glory, Good, Healing, Sun.
Favored Weapon: Scimitar
dc781cac-e454-482b-b950-8fa94a894107:
Lamashtu is the mother and patroness of many misshapen and malformed creatures that crawl, slither, or flap on, above, or below the surface of Golarion. Her unholy symbol is a three-eyed jackal head, which may be represented in many ways, and her sacred animal is the jackal.
Domains: Chaos, Evil, Madness, Strength, Trickery.
Favored Weapons: Falchion, kukri
ddd3a362-a9ec-4fd3-930f-b5a91f76f6b4: Lay on Hands is a unique ability that allows the paladins to {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g} themselves and their allies. As a paladin advances, they improve this ability, learning to remove various negative conditions with it.
9a659505-d31a-4d75-bca0-fe5a6ed96a03:
Leader of a small cult of undead, created by h{mf|is|er} own hands, {name} became famous as the indomitable commander of the Fifth Mendevian Crusade against the Worldwound. Determined to destroy the forces of the Abyss at any cost, {mf||s}he ventured on the path of the L{mf|ord|ady} of Death. For millennia, powerful necromancers have dreamed of a power that could rival the divine. They have created cults in their own names, and attracted many followers. Thanks to h{mf|is|er} legendary powers, {name} has managed to achieve much greater success than the others: {mf||s}he has acquired a talent to bestow divine spells upon h{mf|is|er} followers. From that moment, the undead created by h{mf|im|er} needed no other deities to cast spells.
Domains: Death, Evil, Strength, Undead Subdomain, War.
4276c1d9-2ff6-4b35-92b7-8d383ef1780a: Life and death are two sides of the coin called the universe. Those clerics who do not give preference to either side and can compensate both types of energy in themselves become priests of balance. They are equally good at both giving and taking life — depending on how much their goals match with yours.
1c70323a-90ef-4061-b5c3-6639e1f65339: Like unruly pets, some companions have a tendency to destroy nearby objects while unsupervised, and their masters can channel these destructive impulses into an advantage in battle.
3a3b7c29-4b5f-430d-9f3f-6bcf9d08cbc4: Lording over the darkest swamps and marshes, black dragons are the undisputed masters of their domain, ruling through cruelty and intimidation. Those who dwell within a black dragon's reach live in fear.
3f59c142-b923-4e2b-aede-d94516eb2d21: Magi can cast a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Cantrips_Orisons}cantrips{/g}, or 0-level {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}. These spells are cast like any other spell, but they are not expended when cast and may be used again.
9c7dd2ab-80a7-4fe9-ae32-20a38354cc3f: Magi spend much of their time traveling the world, learning whatever martial or arcane secrets they can find. They might spend months learning a new sword-fighting style from a master warrior, while simultaneously moonlighting in the local library, poring through tomes of ancient lore. Most who take this path dabble in all sorts of lore, picking up anything that might aid them in their search for perfection.
25809b6b-4970-463f-a20e-83f362a7df02: Magical beasts are similar to animals but can have {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} scores higher than 2 (in which case the creature knows at least one language, but can't necessarily speak). Magical Beasts usually have supernatural or {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}extraordinary abilities{/g}, but are sometimes merely bizarre in appearance or habits.
9816cf65-126e-4dca-a9bd-5d6033c2b208: Magus is an arcane {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spellcaster{/g} who fights with a weapon in one hand and a spell in the other. They are very effective attackers thanks to a vast array of both offensive and defensive spells. However, playing this class takes a lot of attention and micromanagement.
6f3b125a-b4d2-46f1-8803-52d1681e2f51: Magus possesses a pool of arcane energy that allows them to empower their weapons, restore spent {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}, and use other {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}special abilities{/g}.
f0de7bbc-1651-463d-b299-f15f534f1874: Manticores are known to breed with many lion-like creatures, and shifters in lion forms are no exception. Perhaps you are the result of someone's vile experiment, or some other circumstances have dictated that your shifting abilities have become twisted by manticore blood.
e890a67e-ac8d-4a4a-87aa-9402952fda8f: Many battlemages focus purely on destructive evocations, but some extend their tactical studies to include use of the tried-and-true protection of steel. These armored battlemages learn to move and cast {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} in even the most restrictive armors, and have developed new methods to magically enhance their armor.
7c6a1c06-a4d1-4280-8e47-64179ae0e529: Many courts are places of artistic refinement, attracting those performers who wish to revel in an aristocratic art scene. Such artists may aim to become a darling of the court, focusing on the aesthetic requirements of a particular tradition as well as learning details about that court's history and culture. Court poets elevate the skald's love of history and poetry to an aristocratic ideal, captivating courts with complicated poetic traditions and inspiring others with their craft. Some court poets go on to create their own works, weaving their magic and force of personality into their unique performances.
3ba64f88-2a2c-4951-a998-31e9130a23a6: Many fighters believe the tower shield is a tool suitable only for troops on the battlefield, claiming it is too large and bulky to use in skirmishes or within dungeon corridors. Tower shield specialists defy those notions, using their massive shields with startling skill and incredible effect. They use these seemingly clumsy shields to perform deft maneuvers that confound their enemies.
963c6ee8-7435-40b6-8f89-382a51b80405: Martial Stance: The bonus from Know Your Enemy ability applies on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} against the target.
bf31ee1c-db64-4b7f-b4f8-f883719da650: Metamagic Mastery — Extend and Reach Spell
0fb2d4a7-7d48-4650-9889-8e4491c9af7d: Metamorphs eschew traditional alchemy, focusing on internal chemistry and the transfiguration of living forms.
9e916c06-668c-4a81-aa39-b89ef27f616a: Minor Conditions ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} 20): Fatigued, shaken, and sickened.
5710c28c-d696-4e7f-b116-1f36dd5890bb: Minor Conditions ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} 20): Fatigued, shaken, and sickened.
45a375ba-8781-4756-8aa9-1d7338b4c08f: Monks are masters of martial arts, deadly in melee combat. They fight with their bare hands, or with special monk weapons. A monk must have a lawful {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}alignment{/g}, or they won't be able to advance.
adc1f8e9-fcfe-4407-8530-1fa9cb8d1c3d:
Monks are proficient with the club, crossbow (light or heavy), dagger, handaxe, javelin, kama, nunchaku, quarterstaff, sai, shortsword, shortspear, shuriken, siangham, sling, spear, and any weapon with the monk special weapon quality.
Monks are not proficient with any armor or shields.
When wearing armor, using a shield, or carrying a medium or heavy load, a monk loses his {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} bonus, as well as his fast movement and flurry of blows abilities.
c50ad4b6-7ee5-498e-a5c4-b85780e659b0: Monks can make additional {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} when they fight with bare hands or monk weapons. The higher their level is, the more {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} they deal. A monk can also choose a style that would grant them additional attacks and powers, such as improvements to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}armor class{/g}, weakening the enemies, etc.
a897b0d6-2836-451a-b420-81a6d527d632: Monks excel at overcoming even the most daunting perils, striking where it's least expected, and taking advantage of enemy vulnerabilities. Fleet of foot and skilled in combat, monks can navigate any battlefield with ease, aiding allies wherever they are needed most.
1ac10a45-0480-4edc-acb6-59a97e1b7d23: Monstrous humanoids are similar to humanoids, but with monstrous or animalistic features. They often have magical abilities as well.
6bc7e1a8-0a09-448d-b78e-9c1f81227991: More than capable of upholding the honor of their deities in battle, clerics often prove stalwart and capable combatants. Their true strength lies in their capability to draw upon the power of their deities, whether to increase their own and their allies' prowess in battle, to vex their foes with divine magic, or to lend {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}healing{/g} to companions in need. As their powers are influenced by their faith, all clerics must focus their worship upon a divine source.
2a9dd7bd-bd2e-43ca-8867-97890addab88: Most bloodragers prefer light armor, but some learn the secret of using heavy armors. These steelbloods plod around the battlefield inspiring fear and delivering carnage from within a steel shell.
c825ae6f-ecbe-4ce7-9990-5e3ca58157ff: Most characters gain advantages when they {g|Encyclopedia:Flanking}flank{/g} an enemy, {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} an enemy who can't see them or enjoy a similar fortunate position. But only rogues and slayers deal a tremendous amount of additional {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} in such a situation.
ebc3ab9e-f051-4ccd-9768-8863fd12e6c3: Most paladins rush into battle, meeting evil toe to toe. The divine hunter prefers to engage evil from afar, striking down her foes before they can threaten her allies.
08dd80ad-aa37-4a45-a086-cabd15bc722c: Most shamans seek spirits to learn from them. Spirit hunters pursue them to eliminate. Some of these loners are on a quest to rid the world of evil spirits and restless ghosts, others fight spirits to gain more power, and some join the wars spirits wage among themselves, no matter how mysterious and inscrutable for a mortal's mind these could be. Spirit hunters learn to enchant their weapons, so it could harm the incorporeal enemies as easily as mortal flesh.
63e0c456-0a3d-42c9-b206-99c9b7629080: Mystic theurges place no boundaries on their magical abilities and find no irreconcilable paradox in devotion to the arcane as well as the divine. They seek magic in all of its forms, finding no reason or logic in denying themselves instruction by limiting their knowledge to one stifling paradigm, though many are simply hungry for limitless power. The mystic theurge is a powerful component for any party, supplying magic for {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}, defense, and {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}healing{/g}. Mystic theurges travel the world in search of arcane and holy artifacts, magical lore, or divine revelations, and most have no qualms about teaming up with groups of adventurers so long as that group's goals do not directly conflict with their own.
1492fef9-0893-4ccd-a186-d6a9b50022ab: Necromancy {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} manipulate the power of death, unlife, and the life force. Spells involving undead creatures make up a large part of this school.
48a695f6-94ee-421c-a792-c634cae474c0:
Nethys, also known as "The All-Seeing Eye", is a Garundi god who holds knowledge and magic above all things. He gained enough power to witness all things, and this both fueled his divinity and shattered his mind. He is a god of magic, torn between destroying the world with one hand and saving it with the other.
Domains: Destruction, Knowledge, Magic, Protection, Rune.
Favored Weapon: Quarterstaff
e79c8ac3-6db8-47cf-9e86-12d40ed8a4a3: No stodgy researcher, this archaeologist meets his research head-on in the field. Archaeologists sacrifice the bard's inspirational performance for a smattering of rogue talents.
5d260669-47d3-4848-a6e7-68095eb33e23:
Norgorber is known as the once-mortal god of thievery and assassination, as well as a keeper of secrets. He is called the "Reaper of the Reputation" by some, but he has more insidious titles among worshipers who venerate his other three aspects: "Blackfingers", "Father Skinsaw", and the "Gray Master". He remains an enigma to most, and his true motives are unknown. Many of his own followers remain ignorant of his plans and designs. Norgorber is the only evil god amongst the Ascended.
Domains: Charm, Death, Evil, Knowledge, Trickery.
Favored Weapon: Shortsword
928bea64-fdf4-481a-9611-3bc16bfd048b: Not all cavaliers are content to ride at the head of a charge, leading from the front and facing down their enemies directly. Some prefer to stand away from the fray, their banners a beacon shining brightly over the battlefield, rallying their troops to victory. The standard bearer employs the banner of his order, his lord, or his own house to raise the spirits of his allies and warns enemies of impending doom.
7afaece6-b4c0-4514-a9b4-2583abd8b670: Not all shifters represent the balance of nature. The rageshaper is a destructive force of nature brought to bear — a wild and uncontrollable engine of annihilation fueled by wrath. Rageshapers fly into bloodletting frenzies and rain down devastation like unstoppable natural disasters.
84744d4c-9cf4-4c4e-9178-96ab7c5a9196: Not all spirits deserve reverence and respect. Some are twisted and despicable. It's a spirit warden's duty to end these spirits' existence.
45d106f3-42ce-4885-8e0d-486f46e9dc5d: Not all who start as novice armigers have what it takes to become a full-fledged Hellknight, but those who do receive a wide array of abilities as they grow more powerful. While the individual powers and focus of a particular Hellknight vary according to his order, all Hellknights are universally feared and respected in regions where they maintain a presence. Most Hellknights are lawful neutral and proudly avoid being "tainted" by distractions such as good or evil, but some who rise in power shift toward tyrannical and cruel natures.
96aded6a-0b13-475a-b33d-daab053053c9: Of all the dragons, silvers are the most courageous, holding themselves to a chivalrous code to help the weak, defeat evil, and behave in an honorable manner.
67c06bbe-2ef6-45b3-9eee-a279ddbbe3e6:
On Golarion, "atheism" usually denotes the belief that those beings commonly called "gods" are not worthy of the authority and reverence bestowed upon them by others. Atheists rarely doubt the existence of deities, and generally acknowledge that deities are very powerful beings, but deem them no more than that. Instead of gods, they tend to revere ideals such as goodness or freedom, philosophies such as the Prophecies of Kalistrade or diabolism, or nothing in particular. Some scholars argue that the term "atheist" is incorrectly applied to these people, preferring terms such as "dystheists" or "misotheists." Others call themselves "agnostics," insisting that no mortal can say what is divine and what isn't, as the workings of the divine are fundamentally unknowable by mortals. However, such distinctions are lost on a generally religious society, and most accept the more common term.
Atheism is looked down upon in many parts of Golarion, but is enforced on a state level in the nations of Rahadoum in Garund, Touvette in the River Kingdoms, and Bachuan in Tian Xia.
Despite their lack of faith, atheists' souls are still judged by Pharasma. Their posthumous fate varies: some are sent to planes best matching their individual alignments and philosophies, while others become bodiless spirits in the Astral Plane, are reincarnated, or find their fate in the Graveyard of Souls.
68c5f956-20ab-44c0-bc50-0372ec71a564:
On a direct hit, an alchemist's acid bomb inflicts {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}3d6{/g}+5 points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}acid damage{/g}. Splash {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} from an alchemist bomb is always 8 damage. The {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of this {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}save{/g} is 17.
Creatures that take a direct hit from an acid bomb take an additional 1d6 points of acid damage 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} later.
1c303a0a-9b9a-4a05-8b4d-f659fce378e6:
On a direct hit, an alchemist's blinding bomb inflicts {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g} + additional {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} equal to the alchemist's {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier. The damage of an alchemist's bomb increases by 1d6 points at every odd-numbered alchemist level[LONGSTART] (this bonus damage is not multiplied on a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g} or by using {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g} such as Vital Strike)[LONGEND]. Splash damage from an alchemist bomb is always equal to the bomb's minimum damage[LONGSTART] (so if the bomb would deal 2d6+4 points of fire damage on a direct hit, its splash damage would be 6 points of fire damage). Those caught in the splash damage can attempt a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} for half damage. The {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of this save is equal to 10 + 1/2 the alchemist's level + the alchemist's Intelligence modifier[LONGEND].
Creatures that take a direct hit from a blinding bomb are blinded for 1 minute unless they succeed at a Fortitude save. Creatures in the splash area that fail their saves against the bomb are dazzled for 1 minute.

Splash damage from an arcane bomber's bomb is always equal to the bomb's minimum damage (so if the bomb would deal 2d6+4 points of damage of the chosen energy type on a direct hit, its splash damage would be 6 points of the same energy type). Those caught in the splash damage can attempt a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} for half damage. The {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of this save is equal to 10 + 1/2 the arcane bomber's level + the arcane bomber's Intelligence modifier.

edb9e016-38ad-4f34-ba2b-5efd8943c5b4: Once per day per paladin level, a stonelord can draw upon the power of the living rock. As a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}, she treats her {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attacks{/g} until the beginning of her next turn (whether armed or {g|Encyclopedia:UnarmedAttack}unarmed{/g}) as magical and adamantine with a +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}. This bonus increases by +1 at 5th level and every 5 levels thereafter.
73508dd0-a9bf-449d-a334-78a6cdd24638: Once per day the divine guardian pledges her protection to a willing creature for the day.
1ceaa7bc-5365-4112-b4cb-0b7d49c2e4b1: Once per day the witch can, as a {g|Encyclopedia:Full_Round_Action}full-round action{/g}, touch a dead creature and bring it back to life. This functions as resurrection, but it does not require a material component.
4ade6643-59c0-4880-a396-8b318a161bec:
Once per day, a Hellknight can call out to the powers of law to aid him in his struggle against chaos. As a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}, the Hellknight chooses one target within sight to smite. If this target is chaotic, the Hellknight adds his {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} bonus (if any) to his {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} and adds twice his Hellknight level to all {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} made against the target of his smite. Smite chaos attacks automatically bypass any {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} the creature might possess. In addition, while smite chaos is in effect, the Hellknight gains a deflection {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} equal to his Charisma modifier (if any) to his {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} against attacks made by the target of the smite.
If the Hellknight targets a creature that is not chaotic, the smite is wasted with no effect.
The smite chaos lasts until the target dies or the Hellknight selects a new target. At 4th level, and at every three levels thereafter, the Hellknight may smite chaos one additional time per day.
0313eac3-3aeb-4ba6-a517-6e36f8791b68:
Once per day, a cavalier can challenge a foe to combat. As a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}, the cavalier chooses one target within sight to challenge. The cavalier's {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attacks{/g} deal extra {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} whenever the {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} are made against the target of his challenge. This extra damage is equal to the cavalier's level. The cavalier can use this ability once per day at 1st level, plus one additional time per day for every three levels beyond 1st, to a maximum of seven times per day at 19th level.
Challenging a foe requires much of the cavalier's {g|Encyclopedia:Concentration}concentration{/g}. The cavalier takes a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to his {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}Armor Class{/g}, except against attacks made by the target of his challenge.
The challenge remains in effect until the target is dead or {g|Encyclopedia:Injury_Death}unconscious{/g} or until the combat ends. Each cavalier's challenge also includes another effect which is listed in the section describing the cavalier's order.
0b2cb4d4-48e0-4dd2-8a72-bf82dd224682:
Once per day, a paladin can call out to the powers of good to aid her in her struggle against evil. As a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}, the paladin chooses one target within sight to smite. If this target is evil, the paladin adds her {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Cha{/g} bonus (if any) to her {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} and adds her paladin level to all {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} made against the target of her smite, smite evil attacks automatically bypass any {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} the creature might possess.
In addition, while smite evil is in effect, the paladin gains a deflection {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} equal to her Charisma modifier (if any) to her {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} against attacks made by the target of the smite. If the paladin targets a creature that is not evil, the smite is wasted with no effect.
The smite evil lasts until the target dies or the paladin selects a new target. At 4th level, and at every three levels thereafter, the paladin may smite evil one additional time per day.
cfc0499c-a414-4673-9829-77ce361dd41d: Once per day, a rogue with this talent can designate a single enemy she is adjacent to as her prey. Until the end of her next turn, she can add her sneak attack {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} to all {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} made against her prey, even if she is not {g|Encyclopedia:Flanking}flanking{/g} it or it is not {g|Encyclopedia:Flat_Footed}flat-footed{/g}.
19a613f4-bde1-482a-b2a3-d66569909649: Once per day, as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}, you can use this ability to gain a re-{g|Encyclopedia:Dice}roll{/g} on the next failed {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g} that causes you to become blinded, deafened, frightened, panicked, paralyzed, shaken, or stunned, with a +4 insight {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on the roll. At 7th and 15th level, you can use this ability one additional time per day.
cbeeb190-3295-4a0a-b958-ea7afad82069: Once per day, your skin hardens and takes on the appearance of iron, granting you {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} 10/adamantine. This functions as stoneskin {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, using your oracle level as the {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}. At 15th level, you can use this ability twice per day. You must be at least 11th level to select this revelation.

e13027cb-142b-4105-a9bf-a58697be7a82:
One of your ancestors was fey, or the fey realm somehow intermixed with your bloodline. It affects your bloodrage in tricky and surprising ways.
The power of the natural world saturates your being, and manifests itself when you bloodrage.
Bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}Feats{/g}: Combat Reflexes, Dodge, Improved {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}Initiative{/g}, Lightning Reflexes, Mobility, Improved Lightning Reflexes, Intimidating Prowess.
Bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}Spells{/g}: Entangle (7th), hideous laughter (10th), haste (13th), confusion (16th).
8c835d49-f849-448d-838c-ddd117e89264:
One of your legs is permanently wounded, reducing your base land {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} by 10 feet. Your speed is never reduced due to encumbrance.
At 5th level, you are immune to the fatigued condition (but not exhaustion).
At 10th level, your speed is never reduced by armor.
At 15th level, you are immune to the exhausted condition.
02ec4693-06b1-422c-b3d7-ee95db0add74: Opponents {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damaged{/g} by the character's sneak attack can't make {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attacks of opportunity{/g} for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}.
87c4e575-9a78-42de-ada6-3b876c299960: Oracles are powerful divine {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spellcasters{/g} who have access to the most powerful divine magic. They can effectively {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g} and empower their allies, or devastate their enemies. Oracles have access to a limited number of spells and only gain new ones as they advance in level. This makes them less flexible, but they can cast more spells before needing a {g|Encyclopedia:Rest}rest{/g}.
9000ae85-5c56-45ae-bf5f-513aeeec5130: Oracles are proficient with all {g|Encyclopedia:Weapon_Proficiency}simple weapons{/g}, light armor, medium armor, and shields (except tower shields).
04aa3e3a-be02-48ae-b200-a40e369f8897: Oracles gain their magical powers through strange and mysterious ways, be they chosen by fate or blood. While most might be content with their strange powers, some oracles join the Pathfinders specifically to find out more about their mysteries and determine the genesis and history of their eldritch talents. These {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spellcasters{/g} are known as seekers, after their obsession with researching ancient texts and obscure ruins for any clues they can find about their heritage and histories.
4ad83f8f-027d-427b-8bfd-90de9bb257f2: Oracles know a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Cantrips_Orisons}orisons{/g}, or 0-level {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}. These spells are cast like any other spell, but they do not consume any slots and may be used again.
03325733-396a-43cf-976c-47483c7abbdb:
Order of the Gate Hellknights seek to curb and prevent lawlessness through magic and manipulation. They have reputations as mysterious, emotionless, and sometimes cruel magic-users. Many are convinced that the Order of the Gate's Hellknights are spying on them or already know their secrets. Sometimes this fear is true, as the order's members prefer preventing crime to punishing it and often use manipulation, information-gathering, and spying to further their agenda.
While a Hellknight of the Gate wears armor, he reduces the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Fail_Chance}arcane spell failure chance{/g} by 5% at 1st level, 10% at 5th and 20% at 9th level.
7bf87c24-696e-4e72-aa1a-1f18724ac0e9:
Order of the Godclaw Hellknights enforce law with a crusader's zeal, going where they're needed most in the fight against the forces of chaos. They know no bounds or borders in the quest for absolute order. To Hellknights of the Godclaw, the cause of order is a holy mandate for which they will travel far to battle chaos in lands that know little of civilization. To others, these Hellknights' faith is likely inexplicable — some believe the members of the order are experts in all five individual faiths or even that they are heretics.
At 1st level you gain an aura which you can use 3 times per day. It lasts 1 minute and grants all allies in a 30-foot radius a +1 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} against chaotic enemies. This bonus increases by +1 at 5th and 9th level.
fba9bfe9-dc32-4477-bca2-2d1cda4bb072:
Order of the Nail Hellknights idealize civilized societies and seek to unite all people in advancing that cultural baseline. In fact, the Order of the Nail's members preach that anyone who doesn't embrace their own culture is a criminal and heathen who must be destroyed. The order's members idealize the lifestyles and challenges of frontier settlers, no matter the displacement, indignation, or cruelty they might visit on those who were there before.
At 1st level, a hellknight selects a creature type from the ranger favored enemies list. He gets a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} against them.
At 5th level and 9th level this bonus increases by additional +2.
6973c803-a05b-4b03-bf3f-a8aaa9ff3845:
Order of the Rack Hellknights hate wastefulness of both thought and deed. They crush pointless dreams, end rebellions, and trample frivolous or dangerous inventions. They also closely observe individuals, seeking hints of destructive ambitions and wasteful vices, and are skilled at destroying seditious writing and strange inventions.
Three times per day as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} you can target a single creature. That creature must pass a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will saving throw{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} 10 + level in this prestige class + your {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} bonus) or become unable to cast {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} in this prestige class. At 5th and 9th levels you gain one additional use of this ability. The same effect occurs whenever you confirm a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g}.
b9d25680-e6b7-4b6f-b35c-376ac8498251: Paladin can choose an {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}evil-aligned{/g} enemy creature and gain significant advantages against it, bolstering their chance to hit, {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} output, and protection. This ability can be used a limited number of times per day.
a7cb58ca-1c28-4e7c-9baa-4de8d5ba6bd3: Paladins are fighting evil on the front lines. They are good at destroying especially powerful evil creatures. As they advance, they gain access to a small number of basic divine {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}, focusing mostly on {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}healing{/g} and empowering themselves and their allies. A paladin must have a Lawful Good {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}alignment{/g}, or they will lose most of their powers.
2e70f84c-d000-4ed9-b6b4-9f82433b08ce: Paladins are known for their charity and for tending to the sick. The hospitaler takes to this calling above all others, spending much of her time {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}healing{/g} the poor, and giving aid and succor to those in need.
93c003f9-9f4e-4732-adf0-80150e24df1b: Paladins are proficient with all simple and {g|Encyclopedia:Weapon_Proficiency}martial weapons{/g}, with all types of armor (heavy, medium, and light), and with shields (except tower shields).
3e2e5b73-73f8-4ec6-846f-1014fe08da84: Paladins serve as beacons for their allies within the chaos of battle. While deadly opponents of evil, they can also empower goodly souls to aid in their crusades.
