Their magic and martial {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g} also make them well suited to defending others and blessing the fallen with the strength to continue fighting.
5d918e8a-ce78-4b19-8ecc-d7e258a782f7: People often find themselves listening to the rustle of the wind, but only a handful of them hear whispering of the mighty nature element, and can use it as a source of power.
b51cf17c-7988-4e00-b9c9-1e91b45b3543: Performances most commonly help to empower the allies, but they also can control or weaken the enemies. This ability has a wide area of effect. As a bard advances, they learn new songs with different effects.
fa05546b-f1f9-4aac-8296-1d1d6c15c4ea: Physical Enhancement: You gain a +1 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to one physical {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability score{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g}, or {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g}). This bonus increases by +1 for every five wizard levels you possess to a maximum of +5 at 20th level. At 20th level, this bonus applies to two physical ability scores of your choice.
c5c0a20b-9eb6-4593-ad85-d0b5ca41ff66: Poison Use — Increased Successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Saves{/g} to Remove
26b9289b-bbe3-4058-9a74-485429a97d0c: Preservationist is an alchemist who keeps preserved specimens in bottles, and releases them to aid him in his battles.
6b5afe40-d9b2-4a50-a8f7-abf24aad8efc: Primal druids hone their spiritual and magical connections to nature's largest creatures, especially dinosaurs and megafauna, revering these massive creatures as living relics of a primeval time when all creatures were more in harmony with nature.
06fe8351-809a-4d24-86e4-2ace7256336c:
Pulura, the mistress of the stars and the aurora, is an angel empyreal lord, the patron of those travelers that become homesick, lost, or injured in the snowy wastes of the far north. She often appears dancing amid the aurora borealis in the skies of far northern lands, and legend has it that her extraordinary beauty will burn any mortals who dare approach her too closely. Pulura is worshiped by denizens of the far north who believe that the aurora is an omen of her good deeds. Sailors worship her as the keeper of the constellations which mortals navigate their world, lighting the way so that those who travel or explore can always find their way home. She was also worshiped as a major deity in the lost Kellid realm of Sarkoris before it fell to the demons of the Worldwound.
Domains: Air, Good, Chaos, Weather
Favored Weapon: Sling Staff
11be51d6-7cb1-400f-8776-06e90d6cffc1: Ranger can form a special bond either with an animal companion, or with their party. In the former case, the character chooses one of the available animals as a companion who can wear barding and advances along with the owner. In the latter case, they can give a part of their favored enemy {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to their teammates.
e196169e-6c8d-4968-aad5-886f70014dc7: Ranger chooses a type of enemies to gain a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} and chance to hit against. As they advance, they can choose new favored enemies and gain new advantages against the ones chosen before.
c8c3fd37-eae5-4702-9ea0-2ca5a67c7fe9: Rangers are adept at exterminating certain types of enemies. Rangers can become masters of any kind of weapons, depending on the combat style they choose. Thanks to their unique abilities, rangers are some of the best dual-wielding warriors.
b9379ca5-05d5-4430-aa65-19c44f78cd6c: Rangers are deft skirmishers, either in melee or at range, capable of skillfully dancing in and out of battle. Their abilities allow them to deal significant harm to specific types of foes, but their skills are valuable against all manner of enemies.
8cc5380b-10c0-44af-bd79-fdc11085613f: Rangers who walk in the tempest unafraid draw the power of the storm into themselves and become stormwalkers.
db21e829-d3d9-496c-abf8-58c41ab2ee10: Rather than empowering a physical weapon, a feral champion grows claws as primary {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural weapons{/g} on each hand. These claws deal {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} as a warpriest's sacred weapon.
c0ad2788-478a-4f89-a0d8-dd38194eacc1: Rather than pursuing their holy missions alone, some inquisitors see the inherent value of working with like-minded allies to accomplish mutual goals.
24e0ff67-4656-47f7-b78d-88b5d913a3ce: Referred to as fanatics, lunatics, or obsessives, cultists see themselves as genuine devotees of their deity. And the hierarchs of those devotees, the cult leaders, are the most fanatical of them all. Cult leaders are known for turning reasonable hearts toward corrupted teachings and striking at those that get in the way of their agenda.
589175d5-5301-41fc-a59e-59ae30fed661:
Regardless of {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}alignment{/g}, any cleric can release a wave of energy by channeling the power of her faith through her holy (or unholy) symbol. This energy can be used to cause or {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}, depending on the type of energy channeled and the creatures targeted.
A good cleric (or a neutral cleric who worships a good deity) channels positive energy and can choose to deal damage to undead creatures or to heal living creatures. An evil cleric (or a neutral cleric who worships an evil deity) channels negative energy and can choose to deal damage to living creatures or to heal undead creatures. A neutral cleric of a neutral deity must choose whether she channels positive or negative energy. Once this choice is made, it cannot be reversed. This decision also determines whether the cleric can cast spontaneous cure or inflict {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}.
Channeling energy causes a burst that affects all creatures of one type (either undead or living) in a 30-foot radius centered on the cleric. The amount of damage dealt or healed is equal to {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of damage plus 1d6 points of damage for every two cleric levels beyond 1st (2d6 at 3rd, 3d6 at 5th, and so on). Creatures that take damage from channeled energy receive a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g} to halve the damage. The {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of this save is equal to 10 + 1/2 the cleric's level + the cleric's {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier. Creatures healed by channel energy cannot exceed their maximum {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit point{/g} total—all excess healing is lost. A cleric may channel energy a number of times per day equal to 3 + her Charisma modifier. This is a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} that does not provoke an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attack of opportunity{/g}. A cleric can choose whether or not to include herself in this effect.
426eb838-1c61-4b3e-97f3-9d249f0746b4: Remove Call of the Wild — Beast Shape I
ccdf72c3-c008-432e-9405-d6af1bc6c2ad: Remove Call of the Wild — Beast Shape II
fb2e6492-3b60-4e0a-b3e8-cecf3d682e27: Remove Call of the Wild — Beast Shape III
6450e5c2-e3bb-4553-8cb0-746d6cddfe04:
Remove curse can remove all curses on an object or a creature. If the target is a creature, you must make a {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d20{/g} + caster level) against the {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of each curse affecting the target. Success means that the curse is removed.
At 8th level, the witch doctor can choose to lose any prepared magic {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} that is 3rd level or higher in order to spontaneously cast dispel magic or remove curse. This ability can only target a spell effect that is on an ally (including herself ). If she forfeits a magic spell higher than 3rd level, she gains a +2 sacred {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on her caster level check to dispel the spell or to remove the curse for every spell level higher than 3rd that she sacrifices.
1ac6414c-c69c-4b9a-a924-38afb0ddb88f: Rogue's main role in the party is dealing a horrendous amount of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} to enemies in melee combat. They don't have much {g|Encyclopedia:HP}health{/g}, but can be hard to hit thanks to their high Agility. Rogue also possesses a number of useful {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g}, from lying to picking locks and defusing traps.
b336fb7b-21d0-49b1-abcc-c12ff8de12bf: Rogues are proficient with all {g|Encyclopedia:Weapon_Proficiency}simple weapons{/g}, plus the hand crossbow, rapier, sap, shortsword, and shortbow. They are proficient with light armor, but not with shields.
f18a037e-1b76-4287-bc6c-3054b4f28990:
Rogues are proficient with all {g|Encyclopedia:Weapon_Proficiency}simple weapons{/g}, plus the hand crossbow, rapier, shortsword, and shortbow.
An eldritch scoundrel is not proficient with any armor or shields. Armor sometimes interferes with an eldritch scoundrel's gestures, which can cause her {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} with somatic components to fail.
bd908172-bfe9-45a2-8156-38e698096a95: Rogues excel at moving about unseen and catching foes unaware, and tend to avoid head-to-head combat. Their varied {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g} and abilities allow them to be highly versatile, with great variations in expertise existing between different rogues. Most, however, excel in overcoming hindrances of all types, from unlocking doors and disarming traps to outwitting magical hazards and conning dull-witted opponents.
6201ea99-656e-45ff-acac-3b7db2abe6cb: Rowdy adds {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d6{/g} additional {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} per sneak attack dice to the damage of his vital strike. This is precision damage.
f176d929-1e1a-4ebc-a04f-abebb881901e: Secrets, mysteries, and shrouds are the ever-changing backbone of the witch of the veil. She always strives to discover new arcane knowledge in this universe while guarding the secrecy of this knowledge.
ba914739-765e-45f5-bab0-645cf5d2f408: See No Evil, Hear No Evil
1469cbec-7151-4adb-9b9d-2cee9267320e: Seekers often look to ancient devices, old tomes, and strange magical items in order to learn more about their oracle mysteries. As a result of this curiosity and thanks to an innate knack at deciphering the strange and weird, a seeker gains {g|Encyclopedia:Trickery}Trickery{/g} as a class {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill{/g}. In addition, at 1st level, a seeker adds half his oracle level on Trickery skill {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g} (minimum +1).
20172559-dc39-4337-958c-91ac95a4506a: Seekers often look to ancient devices, old tomes, and strange magical items in order to learn more about their sorcerous bloodlines. As a result of this curiosity and thanks to an innate knack at deciphering the strange and weird, a seeker gains {g|Encyclopedia:Trickery}Trickery{/g} as a class {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill{/g}. In addition, at 1st level, a seeker adds half his sorcerer level on Trickery skill {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g} (minimum +1).
caa1202f-8a0c-46d0-bd6c-10def1362ddd: Select one type of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}combat maneuver{/g}. When performing the selected maneuver, you treat your oracle level as your {g|Encyclopedia:BAB}base attack bonus{/g} when determining your {g|Encyclopedia:CMB}CMB{/g}. At 7th level, you gain the Improved {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} (such as Improved Trip) that grants you a bonus when performing that maneuver. At 11th level, you gain the Greater feat (such as Greater Trip) that grants you a bonus when performing that maneuver. You do not need to meet the prerequisites to receive these feats.
da9bd483-a4f4-4c4d-8ef1-28dc6ec4e27a: Sensei Advice: Mass Purity of Body
264692e4-89ab-4ce0-8a5e-77167864504b: Sensei Advice: Mass Wholeness of Body
d950b62a-565c-4b57-b542-d1926235e126: Severe Conditions ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} 30): Confused, exhausted, frightened, and nauseated.
05bbe2ee-f506-44e1-8afc-4c8dad8e889e: Severe Conditions ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} 30): Confused, exhausted, frightened, and nauseated.
38ea1d09-1ce4-413e-bd10-4808f2afadbb: Shamans are divine {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spellcasters{/g} who have access to the strongest spells of this type. Shaman has a great versatility in terms of customizing their build for the player's preferred style. Depending on their chosen specialization, a shaman can massacre enemies, support and {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g} allies, or control and weaken the foes. However, playing as a shaman is pretty difficult and is not recommended for the new players.
9d7f7a7f-4852-4581-85c5-f2dcc29ce670:
Shelyn, also known as "The Eternal Rose", "The Eternal Maiden" and "The Incorruptible", is the goddess of art, beauty, love, and music, and the half-sister of Zon-Kuthon. Shelyn focuses just as much attention on internal beauty as external. As aspects of her role as goddess of beauty, Shelyn also promotes the creation of art and the composing and performance of music. Clerics of Shelyn frequently are artists themselves. As the goddess of love, Shelyn encourages the proliferation of that feeling in all its forms. She is not the goddess of sexuality, lust, or fertility, and makes a very clear distinction between love and sexuality, although she does not in any way discourage erotic love. The few paladins who worship her practice courtly love.
Domains: Air, Charm, Good, Luck, Protection.
Favored Weapon: Glaive
6eba4ef8-8f78-4a8b-a268-8235f073a718: Shieldbearers are divine warriors who stand on the front lines of battle, shoulder to shoulder with the soldiers of their people.
2e8c7363-6a84-4740-a451-d3600a711c78: Shock weapon is sheathed in crackling electricity that deals an extra {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}electricity damage{/g} on a successful hit.
06262e4e-022a-4cb8-bf57-a82997fc4aba: Shroud of Water — Increase Armor Bonus
3fc98805-9d36-45ee-add4-2ba5c54e8b5a: Shroud of Water — Increase Shield Bonus
464c1fcc-fc9a-4371-bd52-8d459e59bbab: Skald can choose a number of passive and activated powers that empower some of their abilities while weakening the others. They only work while the skald is raging. Only one activated power can be used at the same time.
601270a5-93f9-459c-ac09-647afda928f0: Skald is a combination of a furious fighter and an empowering ally. They usually fight in melee, can employ a limited number of {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}, can {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g} and empower their party members. Their songs inspire battle rage in their teammates, making those who fight with weapons stronger.
7d045124-7c5a-4537-914c-19a22b53666a: Skalds are poets, historians, and keepers of lore who use their gifts for oration and song to inspire allies into a frenzied rage. They balance a violent spirit with the veneer of civilization, recording events such as heroic battles and the deeds of great leaders, enhancing these stories in the retelling to earn bloodier victories in combat. A skald's poetry is nuanced and often has multiple overlapping meanings, and he applies similar talents to emulate magic from other {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spellcasters{/g}.
11f211e0-a625-4391-944c-057480ae62b0: Skilled at tracking down targets, slayers are consummate hunters, living for the chase and the deadly stroke that brings it to a close. Slayers spend most of their time honing their weapon skills, studying the habits and anatomy of foes, and practicing combat maneuvers.
5406664c-0c26-45dc-9463-b4926ef0abca:
Slam; {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Save{/g}: Fortitude
Frequency: 1/{g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} for 2 rounds
Effect: 1d2 {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} and 1d2 {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}
{g|Encyclopedia:Healing}Cure{/g}: 1 consecutive saves
The save {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} is {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g}-based.
dcb84d30-3838-4ff4-ab54-0ee16ada4847: Slayers can fight both in melee and ranged combat. Their main role is dealing large amounts of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} to enemies. However, their defense is rather weak.
3a729151-584f-4553-86a5-86cf618a25d8: Some alchemists focus their efforts on researching different kinds of incenses to aid them and their allies in battle against the forces of evil.
01ddbfad-34af-4837-b97a-a84566a391ad: Some arcanists have innate abilities closely linked to nature. They use their {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} to dive deeper into the secrets of the world.
2a61eea5-f3be-42e3-9c12-5b4f2af7f36c: Some arcanists store their {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} as whispered secrets within familiars instead of on paper.
d001a9ff-d09d-4d52-a7db-b9a1a7edd4c1: Some barbarians disdain the hides and leather used as armor by most of their kin. Instead they master the heaviest of armors, even those created by more civilized people, to gain greater protection and stability in battle.
ca982e97-1476-4b79-b420-770b961edd47: Some barbarians learn to take whatever comes their way, shrugging off mortal wounds with ease. These barbarians invite their enemies to attack them, and use pain to fuel their rage.
e2cd34ab-d75d-42f4-9e49-c0ee22937fee: Some bards use their upbeat music to fire up their allies, but tranquil whisperers do the opposite: they play their soothing compositions to alleviate any emotional pressure on their comrades and improve their concentration.
8f07f07a-12e5-43b0-8353-8f6d028f6149: Some companions have uncanny {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g}, providing their masters with swift transport.
5cb177a1-f286-43da-9306-70743a26b4b3: Some companions live lives of faithful devotion and steady vigilance, standing watch through long hours and always ready to leap into action to protect their masters.
cc964698-2c75-4685-8184-5a473937c8a1: Some creatures can transform themselves into whirlwinds and remain in that form for up to 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} for every 2 {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}HD{/g} they have. A creature in whirlwind form cannot make its normal {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} and does not {g|Encyclopedia:Threatened_Area}threaten{/g} the area around it. Creatures caught in the whirlwind take a –4 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} and a –2 penalty on attack rolls and must succeed on a {g|Encyclopedia:Concentration}concentration check{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} 15 + {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} level) to cast a spell. An affected creature must succeed on a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} (DC 10 + half monster's HD + the monster's {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} modifier) each round or take {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} as if it were hit by the whirlwind creature's slam attack.
aba34247-1908-43f6-9194-0000d56a39e8: Some criminals steal with finesse, their victims only discovering the crime when the rogue is long gone and the coin already spent. A thug, on the other hand, cares nothing for finesse. Through both threat and violence, the thug gets what she wants by the promise of force, and has no problem making good on that promise as needed.
b3f7ebb2-9afc-4c99-941e-9fedc3b5521a: Some druids embrace the destructive aspect of nature and its elements, using this power to fuel their prowess in melee combat.
97a36f16-1402-48cc-b5ed-a48e9849c167: Some druids hear the whispers of the natural world like fey creatures do, and learn to mimic those tantalizing murmurs in order to influence the minds of both wild beasts and civilized people. These feyspeakers are often touched by the fey in some way, such as mortals who dared to eat the food and drink the wine while in the hidden halls of the fey.
10f1d5da-e831-44a0-930d-5704fe0efc2d: Some druids specialize in tracking down, diverting, and slaying fey threats.
ea885880-3dc4-4e74-ab29-dab90aa5c443: Some fighters focus their efforts on finding the biggest, heaviest, most imposing weapon they can find and training to manage and harness the weight of their massive weapons for maximum impact. These fighting school benefits only apply when using {g|Encyclopedia:Light_Weapon}two-handed{/g} weapons.
7ba43156-5992-4f1f-9761-8c85572c1f6f:
Some gain power through study, some through devotion, others through blood, but the witch gains power from her communion with the unknown. Generally feared and misunderstood, the witch draws her magic from a pact made with an otherworldly power. Communing with that source, using her familiar as a conduit, the witch gains not only a host of {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}, but a number of strange abilities known as hexes. As a witch grows in power, she might learn about the source of her magic, but some remain blissfully unaware. Some are even afraid of that source, fearful of what it might be or where its true purposes lie.
While many witches are recluses, living on the edge of civilization, some live within society, openly or in hiding. The blend of witches' spells makes them adept at filling a number of different roles, from seer to healer, and their hexes grant them a number of abilities that are useful in a fight. Some witches travel about, seeking greater knowledge and better understanding of the mysterious powers that guide them.
a53255bf-2f87-43fb-b7e4-41a36daac40a: Some half-elves spend all their time gaining new knowledge and {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g}, becoming masters of all.
89857951-97e9-41ca-8b1e-10e38a3fc677: Some hunters specialize in hunting other people side by side with a loyal friend.
797ddcfa-4a57-4cee-b7e9-0045c3077ac5: Some inquisitors create a strong bond with an animal companion, and they hunt and punish threats to the faith as an awe-inspiring duo. When they work together as one, there are few that dare to stand in their way.
acd44680-acc7-4709-85b6-8f1fc1f61cfc: Some kineticists have such a powerful personality that they can seize control of their element with their minds alone, without endangering their bodies.
d83822dc-e344-4f80-86e1-4b0158ffee8d: Some kineticists use the overflowing elemental power seeping through their bodies to manifest additional powers.
af630ad3-d2e6-4722-97bb-44e11f7f3f08: Some kineticists who are loathe to suffer the consequences of channeling their power study the darkest esoteric energies of the planes and use souls to fuel their occult might. The spiritual tortures these dark elementalists inflict upon their victims' souls are horrifically selfish acts on par with the actions of daemons.
1c11c193-1e50-40cf-8738-6846ac3f710b: Some monks focus their efforts on perfecting the way of one of the simplest weapons — a quarterstaff. They train until the quarterstaff becomes a natural extension of their own body.
ea510e73-6c87-4c19-816b-aa8ab786783b: Some monks seek to become one with another weapon entirely — the bow. The zen archer takes a weapon most other monks eschew and seeks perfection in the pull of a taut bowstring, the flex of a bow's limbs, and the flight of an arrow fired true.
5ee7ef9f-0dd4-4e74-b402-92c3a36fdb29: Some oracles are possessed by spirits, demons, or similar beings. Instead of drawing her powers from deities, a possessed oracle has these otherworldly forces work their magic through her.
583bfed7-ab6a-49f4-baa0-d46df1c18467: Some paladins use their gifts to focus on the holy light that shines within their souls. With the gifts of purity and redemption, these paladins spend much of their lives helping others find the true path. Unleashing this power takes patience and comes at a steep price.
bf152c61-b196-437b-a08d-d7a533fb8358: Some people consider barbarians savages driven by rage and animal instincts. Instinctual warriors represent the opposite picture. They are concentrated fighters who are so adept at controlling their rage that they can fight blind, relying on only a sixth sense.
a026900f-55fc-455c-b232-b985267b3367: Some slayers study the arcane knowledge to learn new efficient ways of hunting their targets. They are known as arcane enforcers.
2e998228-321b-4234-b236-b21914e77b8f: Some undead are susceptible to your mind-affecting {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}. Undead creatures are treated as humanoids for the purposes of determining which spells affect them.
b1e6e09b-f5a2-43f4-8f23-c5d6d8db7d88: Some witches specialize in potions, using their magical abilities to enhance the properties of potions, and even making their allies stronger through use of arcane mixtures.
7b225c2b-cc6e-4dfd-85b6-57f8b60f4866: Some witches tap into the power of their patrons not through a special connection with a familiar, but rather directly through the vast network of ley lines that crosses the planes. These witches can harness the latent powers of ley lines without even needing to be near one of the points where ley lines' powers are accessible to mortal {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spellcasters{/g}.
b6d293be-c94f-474c-b3be-422fcce7de9e: Some witches think of their magic not as a gift, but as a curse. Her body is tarnished with a mark of her ill fate. Maybe the patron of such a witch was cruel and decided that power mustn't come cheap, or, maybe, they mercifully helped the witch to turn the adversities that befell her into a source of new strength. A stigmatized witch relies on intuition, her magic is based not on the sharpness of her wit, but on the strength of her character. Instead of the regular powers granted by a patron, such a witch gets a curse like an oracle, and she casts her {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} spontaneously — like a sorcerer, rather than a wizard.
85aa23e2-3a63-424c-a114-d2345c357926: Some wizards consider scrolls a natural extension of their magical abilities.
d941db03-8a0e-47ca-9817-eb34834d9865: Some {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spellcasters{/g} seek the secrets of magic, pursuing the power to make the impossible possible. Others are born with magic in their blood, commanding unbelievable forces as effortlessly as they breathe. Yet still others seek to meld the science of arcane scholars with the natural might of innate casters. These arcanists seek to discover the mysterious laws of magic and through will and expertise bend those forces to their whims. Arcanists are the shapers and tinkers of the arcane world, and no magic can resist their control.
b6e715db-bc7e-4130-9b70-132558f44ed3: Sometimes brute force is as effective as {g|Encyclopedia:Trickery}trickery{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Stealth}stealth{/g}, and sometimes even more. Rowdies prefer this approach, and are true masters of inflicting lots of pain in a straightforward manner.
a090f7dc-9e5d-4817-87bc-393ec4bb5ef3: Sometimes, mixed blood makes a bloodrager into an unstoppable martial machine, forcing conflicting impulses on his mind.
490ade6c-f221-4c72-ae0a-ab12c96498ed:
Somewhere in your family's history, a relative made a deal with a devil, and that pact has influenced your family line ever since. In you, it manifests in direct and obvious ways, granting you powers and abilities. While your fate is still your own, you can't help but wonder if your ultimate reward is bound to the Pit. You can draw upon the power of Hell, although you must be wary of its corrupting influence. Such power does not come without a price.
Bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}Feats{/g} of the Infernal Bloodline: Blind Fight, Combat Expertise, Deceitful, Disarm, Extend Spell, Iron Will, Skill Focus ({g|Encyclopedia:Knowledge_Arcana}Knowledge (arcana){/g}), {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}Spell{/g} Penetration.
f95ef84b-0f3a-4d2d-81da-f7c52c3b3aef: Sorcerers are powerful arcane spellcasters, very effective in combat. Unlike the other arcane spellcasters, they can use a limited array of spells which makes them less flexible in various situations. However, they can cast more spells before they need a rest.
3e7af657-28c9-4cec-bb56-bd3ac19ed192: Sorcerers are proficient with all {g|Encyclopedia:Weapon_Proficiency}simple weapons{/g}. They are not proficient with any type of armor or shield. Armor interferes with a sorcerer's gestures, which can cause her {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} with somatic components to fail.
01d09808-e8e1-4224-8b63-a9baaaafc8de: Sorcerers can cast a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Cantrips_Orisons}cantrips{/g}, or 0-level {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}. These spells are cast like any other spell, but they are not expended when cast and may be used again.
8e623319-82f7-474f-b7bc-8070c41175a8: Sorcerers excel at casting a selection of favored {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} frequently, making them powerful battle mages. As they become familiar with a specific and ever-widening set of spells, sorcerers often discover new and versatile ways of making use of magics other spellcasters might overlook. Their bloodlines also grant them additional abilities, assuring that no two sorcerers are ever quite alike.
e3287e02-3b7f-4bfe-8820-09708639815b: Sorcerers gain their magical powers through strange and mysterious ways. While most might be content with their strange powers, some adventure far and wide in search of a greater understanding of the genesis and history of their eldritch talents. These {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spellcasters{/g} are known as seekers, after their obsession with researching ancient texts and obscure ruins for any clues they can find about their heritage and histories.
8f53dd0e-4372-4fbc-ba6f-00a426e32837: Special {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}Attacks{/g}: The creature may smite evil once a day as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g} (it adds its {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} bonus to attack rolls, and a {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} equal to its {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}HD{/g} against evil foes; smite persists until the target is dead or the creature rests).
6711fc82-9e3d-4c62-be81-82467f04b36d: Spirit determines the shaman's specialization and their role in the party. Choosing a spirit and developing their bond, a shaman gains new {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} abilities and hexes that improve their arsenal.
31378019-2368-4a27-9f76-228553e72db6: Stalwart defenders are masters of melee combat, striving to prove that the best offense is a good defense. Stalwart defenders are normally found on the front lines of battle, holding a position to cover their allies, leaping into breaches of opposing formations and holding them open for others, and guarding more vulnerable allies by acting as mobile fortifications, stable points in the ever-changing chaos of battle.
91a4a397-b50e-496e-83af-46cedee864dd: Starting at 10th level, a magus counts 1/2 his total magus level as his fighter level for the purpose of qualifying for {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g}. If he has levels in fighter, these levels stack.
c0578936-1299-408a-a3dc-91ed3bb311de: Starting at 10th level, and every two levels thereafter, a witch can choose a major hex whenever she could select a new hex.
440dca9b-7f83-412d-a2da-666f1e8a7edb: Starting at 11th level, every time you {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} an enemy with your {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural attacks{/g} during elemental rampage, the enemy must make a Fortitude ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} 10 + half the druid level + {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} modifier), or become entangled, until a new successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g} is made.
d7ae215b-c8ab-47e6-b3a9-4cdfc897e0dd: Starting at 11th level, every time you {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} an enemy with your {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural attacks{/g} during elemental rampage, the enemy must make a Reflex ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} 10 + half the druid level + {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} modifier), or start burning, receiving {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d6{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g} each {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}.
8201d877-59d0-4a33-9d58-9f1fdfb844db: Starting at 11th level, every time you {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} an enemy with your {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural attacks{/g} during elemental rampage, the enemy must make a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} 10 + half the druid level + {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} modifier), or become sickened, until a new successful saving throw is made.
70c9119b-caa2-4438-a7dd-9dfdff9fe61c: Starting at 11th level, every time you {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} an enemy with your {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural attacks{/g} during elemental rampage, you deal your additional elemental {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} to two more enemies within 15 feet.
00d1c919-cad4-40cc-ab5d-05b56d252cb6:
Starting at 13th level, an elemental engine gains more benefits while at maximum burn, depending on the element she chose at 1st level.
If the chosen element was air, you gain an additional +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} with electricity descriptor. Additionally, you are under the effect of the freedom of movement spell.
If the chosen element was earth, you gain an additional +2 bonus on saving throws against spells with acid descriptor. Additionally, you gain immunity to trip, bull rush, and pull {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}combat maneuvers{/g}.
If the chosen element was fire, you gain an additional +2 bonus on saving throws against spells with fire descriptor. Additionally, you are under the effect of the haste spell.
If the chosen element was water, you gain an additional +2 bonus on saving throws against spells with cold descriptor. Additionally, any enemy in a 10-foot radius must make a Fortitude saving throw ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} 10 + half the kineticist level + {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} modifier) every {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} or become slowed, as per the slow spell, for 1 round.
2464fde5-7ee6-4842-a09e-d4e7a9e59ad7: Starting at 13th level, any creature that strikes a blight druid with a {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:UnarmedAttack}unarmed{/g} strike, or {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural weapon{/g} must succeed at a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g} with a {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of 10 + 1/2 the druid's level + the druid's {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier or become nauseated for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} and contract bubonic plague, as the contagion {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}. If the creature makes its save, it is immune to this effect for 24 hours.
42b7481a-f508-40d1-a6f7-c1afa9ee6387: Starting at 15th level, as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}, a wind whisperer can affect all allies in a 30-foot radius with the freedom of movement {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} effect for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to his {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier. This ability can be used once per day plus one more time for every 6 oracle levels.
8cce2ac0-01a6-4e7a-bd89-4aa21dbbcfd6: Starting at 17th level, a barbarian no longer becomes fatigued at the end of her rage.
8fb66ac5-95af-4745-bf10-96a4400f3b7f: Starting at 17th level, an instinctual warrior no longer becomes fatigued at the end of her rage.
e9d860d7-d1a2-4156-908a-f8741e1bce02: Starting at 18th level, and every two levels thereafter, a witch can choose a grand hex whenever she could select a new hex.
bebad9cd-3fc5-4af7-aa19-b78ea2f7fc76: Starting at 1st level, a beast tamer can cast summon nature's ally I as a {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}spell-like ability{/g} a number of times per day equal to 3 + her {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier. She can cast this {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, and the creatures remain for 1 minute per level (instead of 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} per level). At 3rd level and every 2 bard levels thereafter, the power of this ability increases by 1 spell level, allowing her to summon more powerful creatures (to a maximum of summon nature's ally IX at 17th level). A beast tamer cannot have more than one summon spell active in this way at a time; if she uses another, any existing summon immediately ends.
46a595bf-1f37-431e-b191-2259436b6985: Starting at 1st level, a monster tactician can cast summon monster I as a {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}spell-like ability{/g} a number of times per day equal to 3 + her {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier. She can cast this {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, and the creatures remain for 1 minute per level (instead of 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} per level). At 3rd level and every 2 inquisitor levels thereafter, the power of this ability increases by 1 spell level, allowing her to summon more powerful creatures (to a maximum of summon monster IX at 17th level). A monster tactician cannot have more than one summon monster spell active in this way at a time; if she uses another, any existing summon monster immediately ends.
4e45c045-b2ce-4be4-b2bf-75c37a762bcd:
Starting at 1st level, a zen archer can make a flurry of blows as a full-{g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}action{/g}, but only when using a bow (even though it is a ranged weapon). He may not make a flurry of blows with his {g|Encyclopedia:UnarmedAttack}unarmed attacks{/g} or any other weapons. A zen archer does not apply his {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} made with flurry of blows unless he is using a composite bow with a Strength rating.
A zen archer's flurry of blows otherwise functions as normal for a monk of his level.
A zen archer cannot use Rapid Shot or Manyshot when making a flurry of blows with his bow.
acb38624-bbcd-40cc-befa-ad360559c2cb:
Starting at 1st level, an inquisitor can pronounce judgment upon her foes as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}. Starting when the judgment is made, the inquisitor receives a bonus or {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}special ability{/g} based on the type of judgment made.
At 1st level, an inquisitor can use this ability once per day. At 4th level and every three levels thereafter, the inquisitor can use this ability one additional time per day. Once activated, this ability lasts until the combat ends, at which point all of the bonuses immediately end.
When the inquisitor uses this ability, she must select one type of judgment to make. As a swift {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}action{/g}, she can change this judgment to another type.
484494c2-158d-4239-8ed4-bced5411fb87: Starting at 1st level, you can grow claws as a {g|Encyclopedia:Free_Action}free action{/g}. These claws are treated as {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural weapons{/g}, allowing you to make two claw {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} as a full attack using your full {g|Encyclopedia:BAB}base attack bonus{/g}. Each of these attacks deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} plus your {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} modifier (1d3 if you are Small). At 5th level, these claws are considered magic weapons for the purpose of overcoming {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g}. At 7th level, the damage increases by one step to 1d6 points of damage (1d4 if you are Small). At 11th level, these claws deal an additional 1d6 points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}acid damage{/g} on a successful hit. You can use your claws for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} per day equal to 3 + your {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier. These rounds do not need to be consecutive.
26dffd98-e64f-490a-84df-555721b2f699: Starting at 1st level, you can grow claws as a {g|Encyclopedia:Free_Action}free action{/g}. These claws are treated as {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural weapons{/g}, allowing you to make two claw {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} as a full attack using your full {g|Encyclopedia:BAB}base attack bonus{/g}. Each of these attacks deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} plus your {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} modifier (1d3 if you are Small). At 5th level, these claws are considered magic weapons for the purpose of overcoming {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g}. At 7th level, the damage increases by one step to 1d6 points of damage (1d4 if you are Small). At 11th level, these claws deal an additional 1d6 points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}cold damage{/g} on a successful hit. You can use your claws for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} per day equal to 3 + your {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier. These rounds do not need to be consecutive.
83f56726-9396-4248-90d2-7df2959f10ad: Starting at 1st level, you can grow claws as a {g|Encyclopedia:Free_Action}free action{/g}. These claws are treated as {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural weapons{/g}, allowing you to make two claw {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} as a full attack using your full {g|Encyclopedia:BAB}base attack bonus{/g}. Each of these attacks deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} plus your {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} modifier (1d3 if you are Small). At 5th level, these claws are considered magic weapons for the purpose of overcoming {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g}. At 7th level, the damage increases by one step to 1d6 points of damage (1d4 if you are Small). At 11th level, these claws deal an additional 1d6 points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}electricity damage{/g} on a successful hit. You can use your claws for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} per day equal to 3 + your {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier. These rounds do not need to be consecutive.
2f50c905-74bb-4256-a14e-90df40a2ad17: Starting at 1st level, you can grow claws as a {g|Encyclopedia:Free_Action}free action{/g}. These claws are treated as {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural weapons{/g}, allowing you to make two claw {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} as a full attack using your full {g|Encyclopedia:BAB}base attack bonus{/g}. Each of these attacks deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} plus your {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} modifier (1d3 if you are Small). At 5th level, these claws are considered magic weapons for the purpose of overcoming {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g}. At 7th level, the damage increases by one step to 1d6 points of damage (1d4 if you are Small). At 11th level, these claws deal an additional 1d6 points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g} on a successful hit. You can use your claws for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} per day equal to 3 + your {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier. These rounds do not need to be consecutive.
048b434c-af36-4a3b-9f91-89cc38878d12: Starting at 1st level, you can make a melee {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g} as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} that causes a living creature to become shaken for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to 1/2 your sorcerer level (minimum 1). If you touch a shaken creature with this ability, it becomes frightened for 1 round if it has fewer {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}Hit Dice{/g} than your sorcerer level. You can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + your {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier.
c54884f7-54ae-415b-9ada-c0ba48913012: Starting at 1st level, you can unleash a bolt of magic force as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, targeting any foe within 30 feet as a ranged {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g}. This bolt deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} + 1 for every two sorcerer levels you possess. You can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + your {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier.
56a39c54-ad75-4e87-b985-b67d3f7e2e32: Starting at 1st level, you can unleash a ray of heavenly fire as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, targeting any foe within 30 feet as a ranged {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g}. Against evil creatures, this ray deals ({g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} + 1 for every two sorcerer levels you possess) points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}. This damage is divine and not subject to energy {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resistance{/g} or {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Immunity}immunity{/g}. This ray {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heals{/g} good creatures of (1d4 + 1 for every two sorcerer levels you possess) points of damage. A good creature cannot benefit from your heavenly fire more than once per day. Neutral creatures are neither harmed nor healed by this effect. You can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + your {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier (or {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier for an empyreal sorcerer).
98ba9b37-c215-40c5-8325-79e2280ec4e1: Starting at 1st level, you can unleash an elemental ray as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, targeting any foe within 30 feet as a ranged {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g}. This ray deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}acid damage{/g} + 1 for every two sorcerer levels you possess. You can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + your {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier.
eea6e422-edec-460b-b559-261220215f56: Starting at 1st level, you can unleash an elemental ray as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, targeting any foe within 30 feet as a ranged {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g}. This ray deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}cold damage{/g} + 1 for every two sorcerer levels you possess. You can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + your {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier.
485b4b08-dd0a-411d-9676-5e8002673d31: Starting at 1st level, you can unleash an elemental ray as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, targeting any foe within 30 feet as a ranged {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g}. This ray deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}electricity damage{/g} + 1 for every two sorcerer levels you possess. You can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + your {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier.
9aff4db4-f8c8-42fb-9a7a-5cb553595f80: Starting at 1st level, you can unleash an elemental ray as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, targeting any foe within 30 feet as a ranged {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g}. This ray deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g} + 1 for every two sorcerer levels you possess. You can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + your {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier.
280524f7-7f41-4901-8c3f-b3cc70e28bc3: Starting at 20th level, enemies under effect of entangling cold make all enemies in a 5-foot radius make the same {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g} each {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}, or become entangled.
e0d2c3b8-75b0-4b4b-8af1-504585add7d9: Starting at 20th level, enemies under effect of sickening acid make all enemies in a 5-foot radius make the same {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g} each {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}, or become sickened.
b6ef00fe-4daf-4546-99e3-0c3889f7fcdd: Starting at 20th level, enemies who are burning because of your elemental rampage deal the burn {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} to all enemies in a 5-foot radius around them.
f6182f4f-3991-405c-9614-1ea3414f63b4: Starting at 20th level, every time you {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} an enemy with your {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural attacks{/g} during elemental rampage, you deal your additional elemental {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} to four more enemies within 15 feet.
146f17ab-0b0f-43d5-b62d-eecdcb193049: Starting at 2nd level, a fighter gains a +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on Will {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g} against fear. This bonus increases by +1 for every four levels beyond 2nd.
64c11766-4b6b-4f36-ba57-85c8ec608d2f:
Starting at 3rd level, a fighter learns to be more maneuverable while wearing armor. Whenever he is wearing armor, he reduces the {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Check_Penalty}armor check penalty{/g} by 1 (to a minimum of 0) and increases the {g|Encyclopedia:Max_Dex_Bonus}maximum Dexterity bonus{/g} allowed by his armor by 1. Every four levels thereafter (7th, 11th, and 15th), these {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonuses{/g} increase by +1 each time, to a maximum –4 reduction of the armor check {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} and a +4 increase of the maximum {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} bonus allowed.
In addition, a fighter can also move at his normal {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} while wearing medium armor. At 7th level, a fighter can move at his normal speed while wearing heavy armor.
26284a4a-7353-4511-a3f0-e007e52d73ce:
Starting at 3rd level, the kinetic knight gains resolve that he can call upon to endure even the most devastating wounds and afflictions. He can use this ability once per day at 3rd level, plus one additional time per day for every two kinetic knight levels beyond 3rd.
Determined: As a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, the kinetic knight can spend one use of his resolve to remove the fatigued, shaken, or sickened condition. If the kinetic knight is at least 11th level, he can alternatively remove the exhausted, frightened, nauseated, or staggered condition.
Resolute: Whenever the kinetic knight is required to make a Fortitude or {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g}, he can spend one use of his resolve as an immediate {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}action{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}roll{/g} twice and take the better result.
This ability replaces the kineticist infusion gained at 3rd level and supercharge.
430b596f-5ea6-4d07-b67c-e94ff4074c0f: Starting at 3rd level, when wearing light or no armor and not using a shield, a duelist gains an additional +4 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} against {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attacks of opportunity{/g} caused when she moves out of a {g|Encyclopedia:Threatened_Area}threatened square{/g}.
e476fa70-60a6-4898-a4db-807142678c7e: Starting at 4th level, a defender of the true world gains a +4 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against the spell-like and {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}supernatural abilities{/g} of fey. She treats her {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural attacks{/g} as cold iron for the purpose of overcoming {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g}, and she gains a +2 bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g} to overcome the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g} of fey creatures.
2498836e-daca-41fc-8fcb-4244daf951db: Starting at 4th level, a druid gains a +4 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against the spell-like and {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}supernatural abilities{/g} of fey and plants.
1e7dfde2-aa75-48af-b2e8-478b24126f38: Starting at 4th level, a mixed-blood rager can choose a second bloodline to invoke at the same time.
e54fc611-254e-4e43-af3a-d660993f6556:
Starting at 4th level, a warpriest can release a wave of energy by channeling the power of his faith through his holy (or unholy) symbol. This energy can be used to deal or {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g} damage, depending on the type of energy channeled and the creatures targeted. Using this ability is a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} that expends two uses of his fervor ability and doesn't provoke an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attack of opportunity{/g}. The warpriest must present a holy (or unholy) symbol to use this ability. A good warpriest (or one who worships a good deity) channels positive energy and can choose to heal living creatures or to deal {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} to undead creatures. An evil warpriest (or one who worships an evil deity) channels negative energy and can choose to deal damage to living creatures or heal undead creatures. A neutral warpriest who worships a neutral deity (or one who is not devoted to a particular deity) channels positive energy if he chose to spontaneously cast cure {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} or negative energy if he chose to spontaneously cast inflict spells.
Channeling energy causes a burst that affects all creatures of one type (either undead or living) in a 30-foot radius centered on the warpriest. The amount of damage dealt or healed is equal to the amount listed in the fervor ability. Creatures that take damage from channeled energy must succeed at a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will saving throw{/g} to halve the damage. The save {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} is 10 + 1/2 the warpriest's level + the warpriest's {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier. Creatures healed by channeled energy cannot exceed their maximum {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit point{/g} total—all excess healing is lost. A warpriest can choose whether or not to include himself in this effect.
50bfe419-e16b-40ae-a65a-8b7b2e12c0be: Starting at 5th level, a duelist can make an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attack of opportunity{/g} against any creature whose {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} she successfully parries, so long as the creature she is attacking is within {g|Encyclopedia:Reach}reach{/g}.
1ce617d5-9569-4770-a002-c6e5f454ce67:
Starting at 5th level, a fighter can select one group of weapons. Whenever he {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} with a weapon from this group, he gains a +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on attack and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}.
Every four levels thereafter (9th, 13th, and 17th), a fighter becomes further trained in another group of weapons. He gains a +1 bonus on attack and damage rolls when using a weapon from this group. In addition, the bonuses granted by previous weapon groups increase by +1 each. For example, when a fighter reaches 9th level, he receives a +1 bonus on attack and damage rolls with one weapon group and a +2 bonus on attack and damage rolls with the weapon group selected at 5th level. Bonuses granted from overlapping groups do not stack. Take the highest bonus granted for a weapon if it resides in two or more groups.
A fighter also adds this bonus to any {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}combat maneuver{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g} made with weapons from his group. This bonus also applies to the fighter's {g|Encyclopedia:CMD}Combat Maneuver Defense{/g} when defending against disarm attempts made against weapons from this group.
be59161d-6110-4abe-8a39-3c3c06d158c3: Starting at 5th level, an arcane trickster can cast her {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} without their somatic or verbal components, as if using the Still Spell and Silent Spell {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g}. Spells cast using this ability do not increase in spell level or {g|Encyclopedia:Casting_Time}casting time{/g}. She can use this ability 3 times per day at 5th level and one additional time per every two levels thereafter, to a maximum of 5 times per day at 9th level. The arcane trickster decides to use this ability at the time of casting.
2c3c1aaf-aa75-4467-9875-896efd074a1f: Starting at 5th level, if a blight druid is adjacent to a creature at the beginning of its turn, the creature must succeed at a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g} with a {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of 10 + 1/2 the druid's level + the druid's {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier or become sickened for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. A creature of the animal, fey, or plant type that fails its save is nauseated for 1 round and sickened for 1 minute thereafter. If the creature makes its save, it is immune to this effect for 24 hours, as are creatures immune to disease.
58b9694d-9c9c-4890-98d2-dc9d713bd915: Starting at 7th level, a sword saint counts his sword saint level –3 as his fighter level for the purpose of qualifying for {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g}. If he has levels in fighter, these levels stack.
3411f631-e49b-4ae6-a0dd-c019392f0193:
Starting at 7th level, an elemental engine gains additional benefits while at maximum burn, depending on the element she chose at 1st level.
If the chosen element was air, you gain a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} with electricity descriptor. Additionally, you gain immunity to ground-based spells and abilities.
If the chosen element was earth, you gain a +2 bonus on saving throws against spells with acid descriptor. Additionally, you gain a +4 bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:CMD}CMD{/g} against trip, bull rush, and pull {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}combat maneuvers{/g}.
If the chosen element was fire, you gain a +2 bonus on saving throws against spells with fire descriptor. Additionally, you gain a +20 enhancement bonus to your {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g}.
If the chosen element was water, you gain a +2 bonus on saving throws against spells with cold descriptor. Additionally, any enemy striking you in melee combat with a non-{g|Encyclopedia:Reach}reach{/g} melee weapon must make a Fortitude saving throw ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} 10 + half the kineticist level + {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} modifier) or become slowed, as per the slow spell, for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}.
0189e24a-090f-4926-a162-df73f974119c: Starting at 7th level, as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}, a wind whisperer can affect all allies in a 30-foot radius with the haste {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} effect for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to his {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier. This ability can be used once per day plus one more time for every 6 oracle levels.
327d2517-869d-4691-9840-2692fdbe05ce: Steeped in traditions that trace their origins to the warrior-monks who trained under the tutelage of draconic masters, scaled fists eschew passive introspection in favor of unshakable confidence. Scaled fists learn to combine brutal intimidation with the brazen ferocity of an ancient wyrm to devastate their foes.
12a8cb3b-adb8-4152-adc0-09c4b793d1b1: Stories often tell of kitsune with multiple tails, but not many realize that fewer than one kitsune in every thousand has this potential, and those that do usually have a magical quirk in their blood or have been blessed by their race's deific matron. As a result, most that harness the mystic powers of their newfound tails often gain sorcerous powers, becoming nine-tailed heirs.
bd775ceb-99ce-405e-b8dd-dcae08f29d1c: Students of arcane magic, legerdemain, and stealth, eldritch scoundrels are a rare breed of adventurer most commonly found seeking lost and valuable arcane writings in the ruins of fallen empires.
fe34d832-9f7b-4bc0-87f2-3efdb0f41c22: Sylvan tricksters are rogues who model themselves after the mischievous fey of legend. Though not {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spellcasters{/g}, sylvan tricksters learn minor magical abilities reminiscent of those favored by fey creatures. The journey for many sylvan tricksters began in childhood, learning at an elder's knee the stories of the fey and the secrets of how to resist their tricks. Sylvan tricksters often live in areas where the boundary with the Fey World is thin, and a few have even been there — voluntarily or not.
1199a9b1-7177-4279-b3cd-fb6d8367a856: Tactical Stance: The bonus from Know Your Enemy ability applies on {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}combat maneuver{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g} and to {g|Encyclopedia:CMD}CMD{/g} when initiating or defending against combat maneuvers.
cf4e2bf6-aca9-4a4e-980d-3742587307e3: Tactical leaders are skilled at speaking soothing words that keep the peace and bolster allies' resolve. A tactical leader receives a morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on all {g|Encyclopedia:Persuasion}Persuasion{/g} skill {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g} (when used for diplomacy) equal to half his inquisitor level (minimum +1).
f40ee916-7b58-442f-b0b8-67326ee6b055:
Thassilonian specialists who follow the path of Envy focus on suppressing magic other than their own.
Prohibited Schools: Evocation, Necromancy.
62e949ba-a77e-4049-abc1-c5035ed74ead:
Thassilonian specialists who follow the path of Gluttony seek to manipulate their bodies in their unending hunger for life.
Prohibited Schools: Abjuration, Enchantment.
56fd6c8b-0b6b-4bea-a7df-21bc373e5f00:
Thassilonian specialists who follow the path of Greed delight in transforming things into other things, as well as enhancing themselves.
Prohibited Schools: Enchantment, Illusion.
44865b4e-1d3f-40d0-8ea5-e07a077ab73e:
Thassilonian specialists who follow the path of Lust gain great personal satisfaction at manipulating others' minds, emotions, and wills.
Prohibited Schools: Necromancy, Transmutation.
5d59026e-2d22-4c91-9da3-fb910646b9c2:
Thassilonian specialists who follow the path of Pride seek to perfect their own appearance and power through trickery and illusions.
Prohibited Schools: Conjuration, Transmutation.
afa3d2f7-f6b2-45f5-872f-5c3ed829cef4:
Thassilonian specialists who follow the path of Sloth enlist agents and minions to perform their tasks, or create what is needed as it is needed.
Prohibited Schools: Evocation, Illusion.
146576ef-606b-4efa-8505-44ef43dd4ac1:
Thassilonian specialists who follow the path of Wrath focus on complete mastery of the raw destructive power of magic, and delight in channeling those destructive forces in awesome displays.
Prohibited Schools: Abjuration, Conjuration.
e6df7926-fd05-4135-8fe3-81302718d603: The Aldori Swordlords of Brevoy are among the deadliest and most feared fighters of the Inner Sea. They have spent long years mastering the Aldori dueling sword, pitting themselves against other dueling swords and all manner of weaponry besides. Their speed and reflexes weave a net of impenetrable steel around them, from which they strike and harry their unfortunate opponents. The most common form of Aldori dueling (and arguably the easiest of the techniques to master) focuses on avoiding damage and disarming foes; these swordlords prefer to wear light or no armor, trusting their skill for protection.
75f841a6-32be-47be-8b4b-3b5b98d9c8c3:
The Green Faith is a naturalistic philosophy based on the belief that natural forces are worthy of attention and respect. Followers of the Green Faith meditate daily, commune with natural forms of power, and show respect to nature in all things.
Domains: Animal, Earth, Fire, Plant, Water.
Favored Weapon: Sickle
506cf227-ca97-4534-8cfe-0fe7d8ebec19:
The Hellknight Order of the Godclaw reveres a pantheon of five deities: Iomedae and Torag are seen as model Hellknights (concerned with offensive and defensive combat, respectively), Irori as the epitome of emotionless discipline, Abadar as a keeper of laws, and Asmodeus as a strategist king. Depictions of these deities as part of the Godclaw differ from traditional images, with the deities portrayed as stern, armored paragons of law. Though some members of the Order of the Godclaw dedicate themselves to individual gods, many take the whole pantheon as their patron, receiving spells despite their unorthodox (perhaps even heretical) beliefs.
Domains: Law, Protection, Strength, War.
Favored Weapon: Flail
4e693d65-100b-4932-b15b-8ffee3c33f44: The Hellknight can make a {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g} as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} to cause a creature to suffer incredible pain. The creature touched takes {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} equal to {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} + the Hellknight's {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier, and must succeed at a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g} or become staggered for 1d4 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g}.
fa9a40ab-988c-4d40-8c85-b7d65f06af53: The Hellknight can summon a creature to aid him in battle, as if using a summon monster {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, save that the summoned creature lingers for 1 hour before vanishing. A Hellknight can summon a wolf. A 9th-level Hellknight can summon a hell hound.
01db47e0-19c3-48e8-89d1-c29361b63540: The Hellknight can use greater command as a {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}spell-like ability{/g}, using her {g|Encyclopedia:Character_Level}character level{/g} as her {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}.
e5cf99fd-e3c5-4059-8420-608930ecceb0: The Order of the Pike are renowned monster hunters, taking on large game using ancient weapon arts combined with modern equipment.
eb2c62b8-c5d3-4852-9b58-690e9552a1e9:
The Pit lives in your blood. Maybe one of your ancestors was seduced by the powers of Hell or made a deal with a devil. Either way, its corruption seethes within your lineage.
When you bloodrage, hellfire infuses your blood with terrifying effects.
Bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}Feats{/g}: Blind Fight, Combat Reflexes, Deceitful, Improved Disarm, Improved Sunder, Intimidating Prowess, Iron Will.
Bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}Spells{/g}: Protection from good (7th), scorching ray (10th), fireball (13th), shout (16th).
575cf44e-d0e2-4cc9-9b09-2bd660419859: The abilities of duelists complement those rogues or bards who wish to accentuate their fighting prowess but, because of their lack of heavy armor, are afraid to leap into combat. Duelists fight in the forefront alongside fighters, barbarians, and other melee combatants, deftly avoiding the blades of their opponents while expertly targeting their vulnerabilities.
06b8c240-2ae5-4343-b200-b39a5acd6404:
The abjurer uses magic against itself, and masters the art of defensive and warding magics.
Resistance: You gain resistance 5 to an energy type of your choice, chosen when you prepare {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}. This resistance can be changed each day. At 11th level, this resistance increases to 10. At 20th level, this resistance changes to immunity to the chosen energy type.
Protective Ward: As a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, you can create a 10-foot-radius field of protective magic centered on you that lasts for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to your {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier. All allies in this area (including you) receive a +1 deflection {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to their {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}Armor Class{/g}. This bonus increases by +1 for every five wizard levels you possess. You can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + your Intelligence modifier.
Energy Absorption: At 6th level, you gain an amount of energy absorption equal to 3 times your wizard level per day. Whenever you take {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}energy damage{/g}, apply immunity, vulnerability (if any), and resistance first and apply the rest to this absorption, reducing your daily total by that amount. Any {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} in excess of your absorption is applied to you normally.
605708c7-3bda-4af7-9b8d-a72c74735bd8: The alchemist gains the ability to create a cognatogen, a mutagen-like mixture that heightens one mental {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability score{/g} at the expense of a physical ability score. If the cognatogen enhances his {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g}, it applies a {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to his {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g}. If it enhances his {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g}, it applies a penalty to his {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g}. If it enhances his {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g}, it applies a penalty to his {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g}. Otherwise, this ability works just like the mutagen ability (including the natural armor {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}). Anytime the alchemist would prepare a mutagen, he may instead prepare a cognatogen. All limitations of mutagens apply to cognatogens as if they were the same substance — an alchemist can only maintain one mutagen or cognatogen at a time, a cognatogen that is not in an alchemist's possession becomes inert, drinking a cognatogen makes a non-alchemist sick, and so on. When the effect of the cognatogen ends, the alchemist takes 2 points of {g|Encyclopedia:AbilityDamage}ability damage{/g} to the ability score penalized by the cognatogen. The infuse mutagen discovery and the persistent mutagen class ability apply to cognatogens.
00d20a7f-2893-4459-9e66-a6ee0765ab6c: The alchemist gains the ability to {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g} from wounds rapidly. As a {g|Encyclopedia:Free_Action}free action{/g} once per {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}, he can heal 5 {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} as if he had the {g|Encyclopedia:Fast_Healing}fast healing{/g} ability. He can heal 5 hit points per day in this manner for every 2 alchemist levels he possesses.
b187fe2d-d8fe-47fa-addf-218042740629: The alchemist has mastered preserving flesh and applied this knowledge to his own body, turning himself into an undead-like creature. The alchemist's type does not change, but he becomes immune to cold, paralysis, and sleep.
a2a23ced-1fdd-4be2-8364-7972ee2ebdb7:
The alchemist learns how to preserve and protect his vital organs, reducing the chance of a mortal wound. When a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g} or sneak {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} is scored on the alchemist, there is a 25% chance that the critical hit or sneak attack is negated and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} is instead {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}rolled{/g} normally.
This does not stack with similar abilities that negate critical hits and sneak attacks (such as fortification armor). An alchemist can take this discovery up to three times; the effects stack, increasing this chance to 50% and then 75%.
18581bfe-a75c-4f3f-8e78-eaadf6bbf3df: The alchemist's body is suffused with poison. Any creature that bites the alchemist must make a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude saving throw{/g} or be nauseated for {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g}.
5a80f6aa-fa8e-44cf-bb62-f4871ccd40a6: The alchemist's bombs now have a splash radius of 10 feet rather than 5 feet. Creatures that take a direct hit from an explosive bomb catch fire, taking {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g} each {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} until the fire is extinguished.
15eecb6f-73b7-46e7-a423-c6a4ba8b7cab: The alchemist's cognatogen now grants a +4 natural armor {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}, a +6 alchemical bonus to one mental {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability score{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g}, or {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g}), and a +4 alchemical bonus to a second mental ability score. The alchemist takes a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on both associated physical ability scores as long as the cognatogen persists, and takes 2 points of {g|Encyclopedia:AbilityDamage}ability damage{/g} to both associated physical ability scores when the cognatogen ends.
c0abc639-974b-45ca-971b-a466e86dd1fd: The alchemist's cognatogen now grants a +6 natural armor {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}, a +8 alchemical bonus to one mental {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability score{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g}, or {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g}), a +6 alchemical bonus to a second mental ability score, and a +4 alchemical bonus to a third mental ability score. The alchemist takes a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to his {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} as long as the cognatogen persists, and takes 2 points of {g|Encyclopedia:AbilityDamage}ability damage{/g} to each physical ability score when the cognatogen ends.
697c90b1-cdc5-4b7e-88e4-0d4085c0773a: The alchemist's constant exposure to strange chemicals has expanded his mind. His {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} score permanently increases by 2 points.
fdd74b50-595f-4a9b-ab89-542d4b71e957: The alchemist's flesh responds to damage with shocking speed — he gains {g|Encyclopedia:Fast_Healing}fast healing{/g} 5.
7765f26a-a41e-40a6-be74-d156eb466570: The alchemist's mutagen now grants a +4 natural armor {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}, a +6 alchemical bonus to one physical {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability score{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g}, or {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g}), and a +4 alchemical bonus to a second physical ability score. The alchemist takes a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on both associated mental ability scores as long as the mutagen persists.
68e3b8a2-13cf-4075-8569-992fc610a698: The alchemist's mutagen now grants a +6 natural armor {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}, a +8 alchemical bonus to one {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability score{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g}, or {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g}), a +6 alchemical bonus to a second physical ability score, and a +4 alchemical bonus to a third physical ability score. The alchemist takes a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} as long as the mutagen persists.
9e4b9014-572b-46a2-94bf-299a8b0aa187: The alchemist's mutagen now grants a +8 natural armor {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} and a +8 alchemical bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g}. The alchemist takes a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to his {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} as long as the mutagen persists.
33e45c4d-8deb-45b9-a649-ae4ee66cd2e0: The alchemist's reputation is not softened by his exuberance (some would say dangerous recklessness) in perfecting his magical extracts and potion-like creations, infusing these substances with magic siphoned from his aura and using his own body as experimental stock. Nor is it mollified by the alchemist's almost gleeful passion for building explosive bombs and discovering strange new poisons and methods for their use. These traits, while making him a liability and risk for most civilized organizations and institutions of higher learning, seem to fit quite well with most adventuring groups.
d96c0da8-5894-417a-91f2-112bda4ab8d2:
The animal companion gains {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g} equal to its level +5. It also gains:
1 — 4 {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}HD{/g}: {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resistance{/g} 5 to cold and fire.
5 — 10 HD: resistance 10 to cold and fire, {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} 5/good
11+ HD: resistance 15 to cold and fire, DR 10/good
Smite Good (Su): Once per day, the fiendish creature may smite a {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}good-aligned{/g} creature. As a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}, the creature chooses one target within sight to smite. If this target is good, the creature adds its {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} bonus (if any) to {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} and gains a {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} equal to its HD against that foe. This effect persists until the target is dead or the creature rests.
ecabdf65-3709-4c95-87ea-f4f357ca9b8a:
The animal companion gains {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g} equal to its level +5. It also gains:
1 — 4 {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}HD{/g}: {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resistance{/g} 5 to cold, electricity and acid.
5 — 10 HD: resistance 10 to cold, electricity and acid, {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} 5/evil
11+ HD: resistance 15 to cold, electricity and acid, DR 10/evil
Smite Evil (Su): Once per day, the celestial creature may smite an {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}evil-aligned{/g} creature. As a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}, the creature chooses one target within sight to smite. If this target is evil, the creature adds its {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} bonus (if any) to {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} and gains a {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} equal to its HD against that foe. This effect persists until the target is dead or the creature rests.
8c3fec93-c1bc-4ef5-ba6f-64dc6de8fb72: The arcanist can expend 1 point from her arcane reservoir as a {g|Encyclopedia:Free_Action}free action{/g}. If she does, the next arcanist {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} she casts in 2 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} will have increased {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} by 1 or increased {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} by 1. She can expend no more than 1 point from her reservoir on a given spell in this way.
de0dc757-7dd9-40c0-b39a-6f94b76aabdf: The arcanist can expend 1 point from her arcane reservoir to create a dimensional crack that she can step through to reach another location. This ability is used as a {g|Encyclopedia:Move_Action}move action{/g}, allowing her to move to any location in close range she can see.
93c96232-23c0-4a1a-8169-37f5a655062b: The arcanist can grant herself {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g} for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to her {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier (minimum 1) as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} by expending 1 point from her arcane reservoir. This spell resistance is equal to 6 + her arcanist level.
fb254456-53c3-4d2c-8104-09d7b6bd4729: The arcanist can loose a deafening blast of sonic energy by expending 1 point from her arcane reservoir and succeeding at a ranged {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g} against any one target within 30 feet. The blast deals an amount of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}sonic damage{/g} equal to {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} + the arcanist's {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier, plus an additional 1d6 points of sonic damage for every 2 levels beyond 1st (to a maximum of 10d6 at 19th level). The target can attempt a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g} to halve the {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}.
4b338f35-aa44-4bfc-9cde-66e31d3439aa: The arcanist can protect herself from {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}energy damage{/g} as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} by expending 1 point from her arcane reservoir. She must pick one energy type and gains resistance 10 against that energy type for 1 minute per arcanist level. This protection increases by 5 for every 5 levels the arcanist possesses (up to a maximum of 30 at 20th level).
cbaf023d-ea48-4487-b6d5-7f3e02149833: The arcanist can unleash a blast of force by expending 1 point from her arcane reservoir. This {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} automatically strikes one target within 30 feet (as magic missile) and deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}force damage{/g}, plus 1 point of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} per arcanist level. {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}Spells{/g} and effects that negate magic missile also negate this effect.
