When a creature takes {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}cold damage{/g} while under this effect, it is entangled for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. If the creature takes cold {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} while already entangled by beckoning chill, the duration of the entangled condition increases by 1 round. Once affected, the creature cannot be the target of this hex again for 24 hours.
be538125-d8ca-42a4-b986-521f5fb4c98c: The shaman creates an invisible shell of air that grants her a +4 armor {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}. At 7th level and every 4 levels thereafter, this bonus increases by 2. At 13th level, this barrier causes incoming arrows, rays, and other {g|Encyclopedia:RangedAttack}ranged attacks{/g} requiring an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack roll{/g} against her to suffer a 50% miss chance. The shaman can use this barrier for 1 hour per day per shaman level.
dfefc93f-bedc-4bf2-a25b-755ab10ec19d: The shaman entangles a creature within 30 feet for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to the shaman's {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier (minimum 1). A successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex saving throw{/g} negates this effect. Whether or not the save is successful, the creature cannot be the target of this hex again for 24 hours.
06cfbe45-d9c9-4857-adc5-3ffddc0f187e: The shaman gains a +4 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on all {g|Encyclopedia:Lore_Religion}Lore (religion){/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g}. As a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, the shaman can {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g} all allies with negative {g|Encyclopedia:HP}HP{/g} in a 30-foot radius for {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g}.
1dd0453f-960f-4300-bc07-5a4f3645055b: The shaman gains cold {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resistance{/g} 10. In addition, as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, she can summon an icy blast in a 20-foot-radius burst originating from a point she can see within 30 feet. This blast deals {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}cold damage{/g} equal to {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} per shaman level she has to each creature caught in the burst. Each target can attempt a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex saving throw{/g} to halve this {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}. The shaman can use this ability three times per day.
0a72079c-c0df-484e-bc54-f55d4b355a0b: The shaman gains electricity {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resistance{/g} 10. In addition, as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} she can unleash a 20-foot line of sparks from her fingertips, dealing {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}electricity damage{/g} per shaman level she possesses. A successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex saving throw{/g} halves this {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}. The shaman can use this ability three times per day.
49c61ac5-186b-4399-81dd-a1efb5ccd454: The shaman gains fire {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resistance{/g} 10. In addition, as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} she can unleash a 15-foot cone of flame from her mouth, dealing {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g} per shaman level she possesses. A successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex saving throw{/g} halves this {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}. The shaman can use this ability three times per day.
7123fa73-fdf1-4db3-a881-b8ae479ba2ea: The shaman gains {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} 2/adamantine. This DR increases by 1 for every 4 levels beyond 8th the shaman possesses. In addition, as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, she can cause jagged pieces of stone to explode from her body in a 10-foot-radius burst. This deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}piercing damage{/g} per 2 shaman levels she possesses. A successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex saving throw{/g} halves this {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}. The shaman can use this ability three times per day.
dad2c717-9c34-4160-b8a9-f73b8a72c79f: The shaman gains {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} 3/magic. This DR increases by 1 for every 4 shaman levels she possesses beyond 8th. In addition, as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} she can cause jagged pieces of bone to explode from her body in a 10-foot-radius burst. This deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}piercing damage{/g} for every 2 shaman levels she possesses. A successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex saving throw{/g} halves this {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}. The shaman can use this ability three times per day.
e4c143ea-9e77-430c-b809-69ca8b82ab0e: The shaman grants a creature she touches some of the magically resilient nature of dragons, causing the creature to be immune to magical sleep effects for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to the shaman's level. At 7th level, the creature is also immune to paralysis for this duration. Once a creature has benefited from the draconic resilience hex, it cannot benefit from this hex again for 24 hours.
ac583556-5263-4548-9b0a-43cd9045f6ed: The shaman makes an extra {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attack of opportunity{/g} each {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. This ability stacks with the {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} of opportunity granted by the Combat Reflexes {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}. At 8th level, the shaman gains the Weapon Specialization feat in a weapon of her choice as a bonus feat. At 16th level, the shaman gains the Greater Weapon Focus feat as a bonus feat, for the same weapon chosen for Weapon Specialization. The shaman doesn't need to meet the prerequisites of these feats.
e8aa4949-1bf7-4211-b342-bd213a178179: The shaman receives a +4 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to her {g|Encyclopedia:CMD}CMD{/g} when resisting bull rush or trip attempts as long as she is standing on the ground. At 5th level, the shaman receives Improved Trip as a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}. At 10th level, the shaman receives Greater Trip as a bonus feat. The shaman does not need to meet the prerequisites of these feats.
540e0f7a-ba86-4025-b9e8-2b494c3dfd60: The shaman receives one metamagic {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} as a bonus feat. The shaman must meet the prerequisites for the feat.
873cf2c1-f8e3-4f80-a6d8-cdd24616910a: The shaman touches a willing creature (including herself) and grants a battle ward. The next time a foe makes an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack roll{/g} against the target, the ward activates and grants a +3 deflection {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to the warded creature's {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}. Each subsequent time she's attacked, the deflection bonus reduces by 1 (to +2 for the second time she's attacked and +1 for the third). The ward fades when the bonus is reduced to +0 or after 24 hours, whichever comes first. At 8th level, the ward's starting bonus increases to +4. At 16th level, it increases to +5. A creature affected by this hex cannot be affected by it again for 24 hours.
b3f120cc-9f4d-4fb2-ad78-fba61fa7487c: The shaman touches a willing creature (including herself) and grants a ward of flames. The next time the warded creature is struck with a {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g}, the creature making the {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g} + 1 point of fire {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} for every 2 shaman levels she possesses. This ward lasts for 1 minute, after which it fades away if not already expended. At 8th and 16th levels, the ward lasts for one additional attack. A creature affected by this hex cannot be affected by it again for 24 hours.
4d95ebc0-449b-41ff-9e6a-99e19066e8f5: The shaman's nails are long and sharp, and count as {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural weapons{/g} that deal {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d3{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} (1d2 for a Small shaman).
0d03c914-f41f-46d2-b444-fcafeae5353e: The shaman's spirit animal takes the form of an animal companion of her choice, using her shaman level as her effective druid level.
ee8655c1-b47b-4298-a3e5-f33e66b73caa: The shieldbearer can channel energy only when carrying a shield, and the ability manifests as a 30-foot-cone burst, rather than as a radius.
3efc403f-8689-48a6-926b-26dff48c6322: The shifter class offers players a way to experience a shapeshifting character that is more martially inclined than a {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spellcasting{/g} druid. With each new level, the shifter's powers grow in new and surprising ways, creating a character that thrives in battle, exploration, and stealth.
e2892a67-fe32-474e-bff6-75fb747ec111: The skin of a shaman who selects the stone spirit takes on a rough, stony appearance. When the shaman calls upon one of this spirit's abilities, tiny gemstones underneath her flesh pulse with a bright glow, like phosphorescent geodes glittering in a dark cave.
1850fad5-ce4d-4613-8a89-988bd551554b: The slayer gains {g|Encyclopedia:Trickery}Trickery{/g} as a class {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill{/g}. The slayer also gains the trapfinding rogue ability, using his slayer level as his effective rogue level.
d2fb48b3-c644-4457-b205-b5dc05a8c09f: The sohei are masters of the horse and the hunt. A monastic soldier, the sohei is equally adept at combat afoot or on horseback. While skilled in {g|Encyclopedia:UnarmedAttack}unarmed{/g} techniques, many sohei favor weapons they can use while mounted on horseback or against others' horses.
5a81c94d-913e-476d-b6ae-f032de6459a8:
The spider is a patient hunter, sensing foes that struggle in its webs.
Minor Form: You gain a +2 dodge {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}. At 8th level, the bonus increases to +4, and at 15th level, it increases to +6.
Major Form: Your shape changes to that of a medium spider. While in this form, you gain the tremorsense ability (10 feet), the web special {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}, and a bite attack ({g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}).
Web: As a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, you can attempt to wrap a foe in sticky webs as a ranged {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g}. If you hit the foe, they are immobilized and entangled. Each {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}, the victim can attempt to break free by making a successful {g|Encyclopedia:Athletics}Athletics{/g} or {g|Encyclopedia:Mobility}Mobility check{/g} (the {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill{/g} with the greater bonus is selected automatically). Both skill {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g} have a {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} equal to 10 + half your shifter level + your {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} modifier.
At 8th level, you gain a +4 racial bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Perception}Perception checks{/g}, and the range of your tremorsense ability increases to 20 feet. At 15th level, you gain the {g|Encyclopedia:Improved_NaturalAttack}improved natural attack{/g} ability with your bite attack, and the range of your tremorsense ability increases to 30 feet.
Primary {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural attacks{/g}: bite
63c1d1b4-0b8f-4a75-9715-7dbdac09b556:
The spider is a patient hunter, sensing foes that struggle in its webs. The shifter can shift into her aspect's minor form for a number of minutes per day equal to 3 + her shifter level. The duration does not need to be consecutive, but it must be spent in 1-minute increments. Shifting into a minor form is a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}, while ending the effect is a {g|Encyclopedia:Free_Action}free action{/g}.
Minor Form: You gain a +2 dodge {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}. At 8th level, the bonus increases to +4, and at 15th level, it increases to +6.
77ea3305-1f26-4056-a249-106a93e2c8f9:
The spirit hunter can add the cold property to a weapon, but this consumes 1 point of enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} granted to this weapon.
A frost weapon is sheathed in a terrible, icy cold that deals an extra {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}cold damage{/g} on a successful hit. The cold does not harm the wielder.
ce2271c0-3beb-4a3c-8ec5-4ca3959ace7f:
The spirit hunter can add the flaming property to a weapon, but this consumes 1 point of enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} granted to this weapon.
A flaming weapon is sheathed in fire that deals an extra {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g} on a successful hit. The fire does not harm the wielder.
8f819003-f841-4d4d-976d-a306100ece75:
The spirit hunter can add the ghost touch property to a weapon, but this consumes 1 point of enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} granted to this weapon.
A ghost touch weapon deals {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} normally against incorporeal creatures, regardless of its bonus. An incorporeal creature's 50% reduction in damage from corporeal sources does not apply to {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} made against it with ghost touch weapons.
4f848376-b39c-40d6-af39-79951c00a14f:
The spirit hunter can add the keen property to a weapon, but this consumes 1 point of enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} granted to this weapon.
The keen property doubles the threat range of a weapon. This benefit doesn't stack with any other effects that expand the threat range of a weapon (such as the keen edge {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} or the Improved {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}Critical{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}).
cfafff67-2f2f-4831-ab4d-818e40905337:
The spirit hunter can add the shocking property to a weapon, but this consumes 1 point of enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} granted to this weapon.
A shock weapon is sheathed in crackling electricity that deals an extra {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}electricity damage{/g} on a successful hit. The electricity does not harm the wielder.
ae6b4596-fdd8-467a-bfa1-3bba94180a86:
The spirit hunter can add the speed property to a weapon, but this consumes 3 points of enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} granted to this weapon.
When making a full {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}, the wielder of a speed weapon may make one extra attack with it. The attack uses the wielder's full {g|Encyclopedia:BAB}base attack bonus{/g}, plus any modifiers appropriate to the situation. (This benefit is not cumulative with similar effects, such as a haste {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}.)
50801f55-5ece-4e89-9a07-c19a629448d9: The spirit warden adds the following {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} to the list of spells she can cast using spirit magic: doom (1st), command undead (2nd), life blast (3rd), death ward (4th), pillar of life (5th), undeath to death (6th), finger of death (7th), sunburst (8th), foresight (9th).
a53b254e-e8ba-4910-8c40-a2fdb3499bae: The stalwart defender is immune to the sickened and nauseated conditions.
df1e0280-695f-4671-a7cc-348e37182c84: The stalwart defender may enter a defensive stance even if fatigued. While maintaining a defensive stance after using this ability, he is immune to the fatigued condition.
ae59a8df-1b28-444b-a351-7693bccdc3b0: The stalwart defender's {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g} from this class increases by 1/—. This increase is always active while the stalwart defender is in a defensive stance. He can select this power up to two times. Its effects stack. The stalwart defender must be at least 6th level before selecting this defensive power.
09584022-f88f-481c-add4-43c1d90476b0: The strength of conviction of some inquisitors is so great that they can, with a single word, sentence an enemy to {g|Encyclopedia:Injury_Death}death{/g} while increasing their allies' power.
a40127b6-a493-4d54-a269-b609a4b309c1: The strong bond with fairies determines a natural predisposition of gnomes to the magic of the First World. By sacrificing time to learn the modern arcanist techniques, phantasmal mages become true masters of metamagic when it comes to the school of illusion.
1e66858f-b9bf-4118-af26-12326ec1026a: The strong emphasis on wizards within elven culture influences how even non-wizard elves see themselves. Many elven magi do not consider themselves masters of a blend of martial and magical talents, but rather a sub-category of wizards who study the effect of physical movement and techniques upon {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spellcasting{/g} ability. They believe their ability to cast spells while fighting is an outgrowth of the concept of the "spell dance", which itself is just another kind of wizardry.
cea5b7ea-1bf8-4d6f-9350-e99f3ab2bb65: The swordlords follow no singular path to dueling mastery — some of those who take up the blade only dabble in its use, while others explore swordplay with the dueling weapon in unconventional ways.
9b3ca45a-7ff3-48fb-8ffb-083413417aca:
The taint of the grave runs through your family. Perhaps one of your ancestors became a powerful lich or vampire, or maybe you were born dead before suddenly returning to life. Either way, the forces of death move through you and touch your every action. You can call upon the foul powers of the afterlife. Unfortunately, the more you draw upon them, the closer you come to joining them.
Bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}Feats{/g} of the Undead Bloodline: Combat Casting, Great Fortitude, Iron Will, Skill Focus ({g|Encyclopedia:Lore_Religion}Lore (religion){/g}), Spell Focus, Greater Spell Focus, Toughness, Diehard.
ac7619b7-d237-4fbd-badb-8a6e6d07c002:
The target gains {g|Encyclopedia:Fast_Healing}fast healing{/g} 5 for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to half the witch's {g|Encyclopedia:Class_Level}class level{/g}.
Once a creature has benefited from this hex, it cannot benefit from it again for 24 hours.
9c5e72b5-4dd5-4181-9e00-00da6fb41d57: The target is rimed with a shell of frost needles that slowly work their way into its flesh (Fortitude negates). The target turns pale and blue, and takes 1 point of {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:AbilityDamage}damage{/g} per minute until it dies, {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g} (once per minute), or is {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}cured{/g}. Break enchantment, dispel magic, remove curse, and similar {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} end the effect. If the target saves, it is immune to this hex for 1 day. This is a cold effect.
27bcfaf1-f33e-4106-aa4d-14184ad16e4c: The target of this hex becomes shaken for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to 3 + the witch's {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier. As long as the witch remains within 30 feet of her target, she gains a +1 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} and a +1 morale bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} as long as this effect persists. A successful Will save reduces the duration of this hex to 1 round. This is a mind-affecting fear effect.
763e2ab4-9384-4b98-a6fc-4240fc1a7b54:
The target takes a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on all {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g}. This hex lasts for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to 3 + the witch's {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier (or 3 + {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier for Stigmatized Witch). A Will save reduces this to just 1 round.
This is a mind-affecting effect. At 8th level the penalty increases to –4.
278c39d3-954d-459a-8094-b0d54663fdc4:
The target takes a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on one of the following (shaman's choice): {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability checks{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g}, or {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g}. This hex lasts for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to 3 + the shaman's {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier. A Will save reduces this to just 1 round.
This is a mind-affecting effect. At 8th level the penalty increases to –4.
e756688f-a268-49ce-9407-a53f2ce9326e:
The target takes a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on one of the following (witch's choice): {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability checks{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g}, or {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g}. This hex lasts for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to 3 + the witch's {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier (or 3 + {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier for Stigmatized Witch). A Will save reduces this to just 1 round.
This is a mind-affecting effect. At 8th level the penalty increases to –4.
5ddb7235-aea8-4145-a38f-e7b084a137ac:
The target takes a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g}. This hex lasts for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to 3 + the witch's {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier (or 3 + {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier for Stigmatized Witch). A {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g} reduces this to just 1 round.
This is a mind-affecting effect. At 8th level the penalty increases to –4.
b4158cfa-c941-417b-ad85-173b7acd55da:
The target takes a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}. This hex lasts for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to 3 + the witch's {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier (or 3 + {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier for Stigmatized Witch). A {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g} reduces this to just 1 round.
This is a mind-affecting effect. At 8th level the penalty increases to –4.
771b284a-8d49-445d-a2f0-50cb77caf153:
The target {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heals{/g} up to 4 points of {g|Encyclopedia:AbilityDamage}ability score damage{/g} from two {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability scores{/g}.
Once a creature has benefited from this hex, it cannot benefit from it again for 24 hours.
313e462e-bfbd-46a2-83e2-c4cc596ee3f6: The target's vision is impaired, causing the target to treat all creatures as if they had {g|Encyclopedia:Concealment}concealment{/g} (20%) for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}.
07cff54e-21d5-4cef-998a-86559759a197: The teachings of light gods say that everyone deserves the right to redemption. Everyone – except the demons. Reformed fiends are demons who have entered on the path of good, although they still look like monsters in the eyes of the most living. But no one will dare to doubt that the rage with which they fight the creatures of evil is the force that the world needs most in these difficult times.
4671e297-d637-496a-96b2-fe72b3c833ba:
The tiger is a powerful but graceful hunter of the wild, quietly stalking its prey and then taking it down with ruthless efficiency.
Minor Form: You gain a +2 inherent {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to your {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} score. At 8th level, the bonus increases to +4, and at 15th level, it increases to +6.
Major Form: Your shape changes to that of a large tiger. While in this form, you gain a {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} bonus of +10 feet, the {g|Encyclopedia:Scent}scent{/g} ability (30 feet), a bite {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d6{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}), two claw attacks (2d4 damage), the grabber ability with both your bite and claw attacks, and the pounce ability. At 8th level, you gain a +4 racial bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Stealth}Stealth checks{/g}. At 15th level, you gain the {g|Encyclopedia:Rake}rake{/g} ability, which uses the damage of your regular claw attacks for the extra claw attacks.
Primary {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural attacks{/g}: bite, claw
f8364758-950b-4af3-9850-41a7de2eb1b4:
The tiger is a powerful but graceful hunter of the wild, quietly stalking its prey and then taking it down with ruthless efficiency. The shifter can shift into her aspect's minor form for a number of minutes per day equal to 3 + her shifter level. The duration does not need to be consecutive, but it must be spent in 1-minute increments. Shifting into a minor form is a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}, while ending the effect is a {g|Encyclopedia:Free_Action}free action{/g}.
Minor Form: You gain a +2 inherent {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to your {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} score. At 8th level, the bonus increases to +4, and at 15th level, it increases to +6.
4298fe8e-cf13-4fc0-afd2-f3b985685982: The wandering marksman is used to diverting enemy attention from him to his animal companion and then striking from a distance.
127b77c0-df19-4211-b24c-af8981be6d59: The warded creature receives a +2 deflection {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} and a +2 resistance bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g}. This ward lasts until the warded creature is hit or fails a saving throw. A shaman knows when a warded creature is no longer protected. A shaman can have only one ward active at a time. If the shaman uses this ability again, the previous ward immediately ends. A shaman cannot use this ability on herself. At 8th level and 16th level, the bonuses provided by this ward increase by +1.
77a0740a-d365-47c7-bafb-52b4518da2cd: The warded creature receives a +2 deflection {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} and a +2 resistance bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g}. This ward lasts until the warded creature is hit or fails a saving throw. A witch knows when a warded creature is no longer protected. A witch can have only one ward active at a time. If the witch uses this ability again, the previous ward immediately ends. A witch cannot use this ability on herself. At 8th level and 16th level, the bonuses provided by this ward increase by +1.
e9d0f948-30b5-4be7-9ab7-b6ba28d26272: The warpriest enhances his armor with acid {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resistance{/g} 10.
719948aa-0796-4b5c-886c-546e1b7b0c91: The warpriest enhances his armor with acid {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resistance{/g} 20.
6bed68bc-8477-4847-b550-2f1adc5de1bd: The warpriest enhances his armor with acid {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resistance{/g} 30.
6b4850b6-fab1-43cf-bf2b-6825e80b9685: The warpriest enhances his armor with cold {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resistance{/g} 10.
b41b1f43-6525-485b-9181-84384b817ef1: The warpriest enhances his armor with cold {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resistance{/g} 20.
bbb97bb7-e5c2-41c4-b0b2-98eae44b1a3d: The warpriest enhances his armor with cold {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resistance{/g} 30.
5b8e0461-dc26-4d66-980d-f6d7aedb03d9: The warpriest enhances his armor with electricity {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resistance{/g} 10.
0513a8e7-aeef-4a98-95b5-70349f073251: The warpriest enhances his armor with electricity {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resistance{/g} 20.
5c599aec-29ff-4e9b-a3fd-e38130fe2048: The warpriest enhances his armor with electricity {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resistance{/g} 30.
8af15acf-b3cc-40e4-806b-152a959a4625: The warpriest enhances his armor with fire {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resistance{/g} 10.
2802d6a7-997d-49f8-9894-35892e5a0b31: The warpriest enhances his armor with fire {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resistance{/g} 20.
5592f49b-9663-4a3f-8888-56526a7a0a25: The warpriest enhances his armor with fire {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resistance{/g} 30.
9353cba3-ad31-4260-89f4-2fa009c765ce: The warpriest enhances his armor with {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g} 13.
70c0c25d-19d1-4cc4-9024-03c6f7916030: The warpriest enhances his armor with {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g} 15.
99c7e072-18fa-4223-bb92-88878432df8a: The warpriest enhances his armor with {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g} 17.
7b342889-aa7e-4be5-a6df-e64e0dd737b2: The warpriest enhances his armor with {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g} 19.
acc50343-5ccd-4a93-b693-ab1ead25bc4a: The witch can become an animal. This ability is similar to beast shape II, polymorphing the witch into a leopard.
a79a78ff-53aa-4314-b774-8eb75c7c51fc: The witch can cause a creature within 30 feet to suffer grave misfortune for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. Anytime the creature makes an {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability check{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack roll{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g}, or {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill check{/g}, it must {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}roll{/g} twice and take the worse result. A Will save negates this hex. At 8th level and 16th level, the duration of this hex is extended by 1 round. This hex affects all rolls the target must make while it lasts. Whether or not the save is successful, a creature cannot be the target of this hex again for 1 day.
9667ebb5-d443-41be-9240-71fc113ec64c:
The witch can cause fate to twist so that it benefits a creature within 30 feet for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. Whenever that creature is targeted by an effect that requires an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack roll{/g}, including weapon attacks, the attacker must {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}roll{/g} twice and take the worse result.
At 8th level and 16th level, the duration of this hex is extended by 1 round. A witch cannot use this ability on herself. Hexes that affect the fortune hex, such as cackle, also affect protective luck.
90a0d900-d2a3-4942-be6c-fda5c76feac9:
The witch can cause the debilitating wounds of a creature she touches to quickly close, helping it heal rapidly.
The target gains {g|Encyclopedia:Fast_Healing}fast healing{/g} 5 for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to 1/2 the witch's {g|Encyclopedia:Class_Level}class level{/g} or it {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heals{/g} up to 4 points of {g|Encyclopedia:AbilityDamage}ability score damage{/g} from two {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability scores{/g}.
Once a creature has benefited from this hex, it cannot benefit from it again for 24 hours.
8314c84c-c61a-40f8-b1bc-8314e7fc74ee: The witch can grant a creature within 30 feet a bit of good luck for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. The target can call upon this good luck, allowing him to {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}reroll{/g} any {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability check{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack roll{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g}, or {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill check{/g}, taking the better result. At 8th level and 16th level, the duration of this hex is extended by 1 round. Once a creature has benefited from the fortune hex, it cannot benefit from it again for 24 hours.
899968e3-d997-449b-8eef-0105b5f41375: The witch can make her enemies {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Vulnerability}vulnerable{/g} to energy. This hex lasts for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to the witch's level, during which any energy {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resistance{/g} or energy {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Immunity}immunities{/g} on the target are suppressed. A successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g} reduces this to just 1 round. Whether or not the save is successful, that creature cannot be the target of this hex again for 1 day.
b6f45eb1-ab0b-454d-91f3-a0b3f5a1a810: The witch can touch a creature to suppress and protect it from negative conditions. The witch chooses one of the following conditions each time she uses this hex: blinded, cursed, diseased, or poisoned. If the target is afflicted with the chosen condition, that condition is suppressed for a number of minutes equal to the witch's level. Additionally, the witch grants her target a +4 circumstance {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against effects that cause the chosen conditions for 24 hours. A creature can benefit from the hex twice in 24 hours, once for each of two different conditions.
92b3a087-3547-4617-85cd-b25f8c3596e0: The witch can touch a creature to suppress and protect it from negative conditions. The witch chooses one of the following conditions each time she uses this hex: dazzled, fatigued, shaken, or sickened. If the target is afflicted with the chosen condition, that condition is suppressed for a number of minutes equal to the witch's level. Additionally, the witch grants her target a +4 circumstance {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against effects that cause the chosen conditions for 24 hours. A creature can benefit from the hex twice in 24 hours, once for each of two different conditions.
43331a53-8184-4c17-9f58-3b393deb10d0: The witch can use her magic to grant her allies ferocious animal abilities. The witch can partially transform a willing ally, granting him {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural attacks{/g} for a number of minutes equal to the witch's level. Choose one: the creature gains one bite {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} that deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d8{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}, or the creature gains two claw attacks that deal 1d4 points of damage each. These attacks follow the standard rules for natural attacks.
abba47b2-e349-4dd6-8b05-e4d736f4f050:
The witch can use this hex to turn a humanoid enemy into an animal and rob it of its free will.
The transformation works as beast shape II and is negated by a successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g}. The transformed creature retains its {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} score and known languages, if any, but the witch controls its mind. This effect functions as dominate monster, except the creature does not receive further saving throws to resist the hex. Whether or not the save is successful, a creature cannot be the target of this hex again for 1 day.
2edc8195-69ab-470e-a1a5-391d6c637cb8:
The witch causes a creature within 30 feet to fall into a sleep riddled with nightmares. This functions as the slumber hex. Additionally, the restless nature of the sleep causes the creature to violently toss and turn, dealing {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d10{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} to itself each turn.
This damage does not wake the creature. When it wakes, the creature's addled state causes it to be confused for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to half the witch's level. The witch must have the slumber hex to select this hex.
72c729fc-f117-49d5-92c0-67154bc9bd43: The witch doctor is a healer who specializes in afflictions of the soul. Often misunderstood, she protects her tribe with healing powers, powerful defensive magic, and her own divine "witchcraft."
0204ebfa-df04-410f-95bc-51f04743cab7: The witch may target a single undead creature with this hex as if with an undeath to death {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}. A {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g} negates this effect. Whether or not the save is successful, a creature cannot be the target of this hex again for 1 day.
1cc21fb5-a068-486e-9a15-6b92bd5b4610: The witch's nails are long and sharp, and count as {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural weapons{/g} that deal {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d3{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} (1d2 for a Small witch).
5d12faa6-2aa6-4777-9807-662207984f5b: Their close tie to the natural world grants the druid one of the following cleric domains: Air, Animal, Earth, Fire, Ice Subdomain, Plant, Water, or Weather. When determining the powers and bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} granted by this domain, the druid's effective cleric level is equal to her druid level. A druid that selects this option also receives additional domain spell slots, just like a cleric. She must prepare the spell from her domain in this slot and this spell cannot be used to cast a spell spontaneously.
e27e0d04-5508-44aa-80a5-a7183f1050e7: These abilities modify the blasts. There are two types of infusions: substances and forms. Substances supplement the blasts with various effects, such as the ability to ignite the target. Forms change the blast itself, for example, modifying its range or area of effect.
1a75ee8f-679e-483c-8bee-fa7d4323bb44: These activated abilities give the inquisitor powers of their choice. Unlike many other effects, they keep working until the end of combat. For example, the inquisitor can choose to {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g} a small amount of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} each turn.
8e6f2250-508c-4c1e-8a77-f8607c03c98f: These are the {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g} and abilities that the oracle can choose at certain points of their development. They include both passive and active effects. For example the revelations of Life give the oracle the ability to channel energy, {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}healing{/g} or {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damaging{/g} a group of targets.
1d82600b-43c1-4812-8e84-fe679d533141:
These professional killers are trained and used almost exclusively by crime families.
Streetwise and ruthless, they operate independently, often making their talents available to the highest bidder. Though a few unscrupulous executioners exploit this arrangement and force families to pay higher rates for their services, most of these assassins follow a strict personal code and maintain absolute transparency with their employers.
7e8be7c3-7147-4d16-b9a0-fb39e86ea6c7: These rangers' favorite hunting grounds aren't woods or mountains, but city streets and enemy headquarters. These masterful spies hunt for secrets, rather than meat, using lies and {g|Encyclopedia:Stealth}stealthiness{/g} as effectively as blades and arrows.
1df46371-2d94-4e2d-ad1a-84c3c0843733: This ability allows a character to move at full {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} using the {g|Encyclopedia:Stealth}Stealth{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill{/g} without {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g}.
d2d5eb48-32f1-425a-a3c0-35e11eb482c5: This ability allows the Hellknight to select one of the following domains: Artifice, Glory, Knowledge, Law, Magic, Nobility, Protection, Rune, Strength, Travel, or War. The Hellknight gains the granted powers of that domain, treating his Hellknight levels as cleric levels to determine what domain abilities he has access to.
a75c1244-dce7-463d-a7e9-673dde88ff1f: This ability allows the character to accept effects of Call of the Wild. If it is disabled, the character won't accept the effects of Call of the Wild from skald.
0fe3ccbe-30a8-4f6f-aac8-b26a235277e5: This ability allows the character to accept effects of Inspire Rage. If it is disabled, the character won't accept the effects of Inspire Rage from any skald.
a273f5b5-f4c1-442a-8aed-f9fce70233f1: This ability allows the character to react to a danger faster than others. Thanks to it, they can evade a {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to their {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}armor class{/g} in some situations, and become immune to some of the enemies' tactical advantages.
294b811e-a6a4-4585-b22a-16895cd38c49: This ability allows the magus to cast a {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} within the same {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} as a weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}. It can't be used if the magus has their both hands full.
b9408995-6fd5-416d-ab3f-f087030c7b4a: This ability can charge a weapon with a {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} that requires a {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g}, and then deliver it by attacking the enemy with that weapon.
e9dd1316-d97d-4b12-97d6-efd60c3cbcb2: This ability empowers the inquisitor's weapon. It can be used several times a day. It can help deal a lot of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}, but, unlike the judgments, its time of use is very limited.
3a8aa808-ca08-43e5-bdfb-85b9590aa4ca: This ability has a large area of effect. It empowers {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} and chance to hit of those of the skald's allies who fight with weapons, but take away their ability to cast {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}. This song can also grant them rage powers. As the skald advances, they learn new songs with various effects.
40f84176-ce40-402e-8626-1ca233ba09d4: This ability temporarily increases the {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} power, {g|Encyclopedia:HP}health{/g} and the ability to resist hostile control, but also decreases defense. After the rage ends, the character gets fatigued and becomes weaker for a short time.
7b736cff-4beb-4813-a16d-6f1c168e600c: This ability temporarily increases the {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} power, {g|Encyclopedia:HP}health{/g} and the ability to resist hostile control, but also decreases defense. After the rage ends, the character gets fatigued and becomes weaker for a short time.
7920352f-cfc6-458d-ac01-85d3a831a195:
This ability unlocks the aspect of the proud and fearless griffon — a creature dedicated to protecting its territory. These regal beasts are revered as symbols of freedom and strength in many cultures. A griffonheart shifter can take on the aspect of the griffon and assume griffon traits as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}. While in this form, she gains an aura that grants her and her allies within 30 feet a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against fear effects; she also gains a +2 inherent bonus to her {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} score. She can maintain this form for a number of minutes per day equal to 3 + her shifter level. The duration does not need to be consecutive, but it must be spent in 1-minute increments.
At 5th level, the griffonheart shifter grows a pair of bird-like wings that grant her immunity to ground-based effects.
At 10th level, the griffonheart shifter's bonus to Strength increases to +4, and her aura now grants her and her allies immunity to fear.
At 15th level, the griffonheart shifter's bonus to Strength increases to +6, and she gains a +4 inherent bonus on her Will saving throws.
At 20th level, the griffonheart shifter's bonus to Strength increases to +8, her inherent bonus on Will saving throws increases to +6, and she becomes resistant to movement-impairing effects (as per the freedom of movement {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}).
This alters and replaces all improvements to shifter aspect.
575edbff-84ff-450a-a998-bb92d6189e4e: This ability works as Stunning Fist, but it makes the target fatigued for 1 minute on a failed {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}save{/g} instead of stunning for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}.
f7231b41-93dd-46a9-af0c-696f8bf98ca1: This ability works as Stunning Fist, but it makes the target sickened for 1 minute on a failed {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}save{/g} instead of stunning for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}.
f3be1c77-591f-4af3-a787-714b9ff5ca00: This ability works like evasion, except that while the character still takes no {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} on a successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex saving throw{/g} against attacks, he henceforth takes only half damage on a failed save. A {g|Encyclopedia:Helpless}helpless{/g} character does not gain the benefit of improved evasion.
75a4858b-5f93-46e5-bb15-b2228a91b00f: This active ability gives the slayer {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonuses{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} and chance to hit against a studied enemy.
097e51b0-3ae7-49ad-b219-bee57714299e: This acts as a cure light wounds {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, using the shaman's {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}. Once a creature has benefited from the {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}healing{/g} hex, it cannot benefit from it again for 24 hours. At 5th level, this hex acts like cure moderate wounds.
3ca787de-5560-4c26-8dbc-0e87dd5d565e: This acts as a cure light wounds {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, using the witch's {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}. Once a creature has benefited from the healing hex, it cannot benefit from it again for 24 hours. At 5th level, this hex acts like cure moderate wounds.
32c68782-781e-4e97-b87a-7b7cef023bdc: This armor blurs the wearer whenever she tries to hide, while also dampening the sound around her, granting a +5 competence {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Stealth}Stealth{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g}. The armor's {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Check_Penalty}armor check penalty{/g} still applies normally.
a7afcb83-2851-4f22-87bc-17c354a7655b: This armor pushes back against anything that threatens to knock its wearer to the ground. The wearer gains a +4 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:CMD}CMD{/g} against grapple, trip and overrun {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}combat maneuvers{/g}.
af963b8a-d3f2-4016-ba76-2e5b30112b2a: This armor pushes back against anything that threatens to knock its wearer to the ground. The wearer gains a +4 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:CMD}CMD{/g} against grapple, trip and overrun {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}combat maneuvers{/g}.
b983e12f-93f8-4149-8d3a-46b2b2cd009a:
This aspect unlocks the brutal ferocity and tenacious fury of the wolverine. The wolverine's lust for battle invigorates its will to live, and it can press on in battle longer than its enemies expect.
Minor Form: You gain 2 additional {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} per shifter level you have and a +2 racial {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to your {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} score. At 8th level, you gain Diehard as a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}, and the additional hit points increase to 4 per shifter level you have. At 15th level, the racial bonus to your Constitution score increases to +4, and the additional hit points increase to 6 per shifter level you have.
Major Form: Your shape changes to that of a large dire wolverine. While in this form, you gain a {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} bonus of +10 feet, the {g|Encyclopedia:Scent}scent{/g} ability (30 feet), a bite {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}), and two claw attacks (1d8 damage). Additionally, whenever you are dealt damage in combat, you enter a state identical to a barbarian's rage. You can remain in this state for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} per day equal to 4 + twice your shifter level + your Constitution modifier. This ability otherwise functions like a barbarian's rage and benefits from rage powers gained from other sources. At 8th level, you can choose two barbarian rage powers, using your shifter level as your effective barbarian level for the purpose of meeting the prerequisites. At 15th level, you are no longer fatigued at the end of your rage.
Primary {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural attacks{/g}: bite, claw
fb135d99-fb94-4703-9646-78ce85e73d08:
This aspect unlocks the brutal ferocity and tenacious fury of the wolverine. The wolverine's lust for battle invigorates its will to live, and it can press on in battle longer than its enemies expect. The shifter can shift into her aspect's minor form for a number of minutes per day equal to 3 + her shifter level. The duration does not need to be consecutive, but it must be spent in 1-minute increments. Shifting into a minor form is a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}, while ending the effect is a {g|Encyclopedia:Free_Action}free action{/g}.
Minor Form: You gain 2 additional {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} per shifter level you have and a +2 racial {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to your {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} score. At 8th level, you gain Diehard as a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}, and the additional hit points increase to 4 per shifter level you have. At 15th level, the racial bonus to your Constitution score increases to +4, and the additional hit points increase to 6 per shifter level you have.
cc021037-404b-41fc-b38c-45ca6ac3e5d6: This character now has demon claws.
188be43b-d014-4a6a-aed5-3d801ceffbeb: This character now has dragon claws.
df288d63-b279-484b-b2a2-5f9841621e32: This character now has serpent's fang.
c5fcd5c7-dbe0-4336-b467-8b61a71c98f1: This charming gaze makes a humanoid creature regard you as its trusted friend and ally (treat the target's attitude as friendly). If the creature is currently being threatened or {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacked{/g} by you or your allies, however, it receives a +5 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on its {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g}. Range 30 feet. Will {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} 20 negates. The save DC is {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g}-based.
961fbb8a-6fe2-4775-ab35-891b97859733: This class usually includes soldiers, bandits, and city guards — NPCs who have chosen war as their trade.
d16c7b16-9cdc-464c-9369-6d449d4cda6e: This creature has Aura of Heaven.
d9fea9d9-a09c-4673-b2cd-49ab7764b30a: This creature is freezing and takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}cold damage{/g} each turn.
d2f0bfa7-9120-4561-8b9e-727eb254f168: This creature is freezing and takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}cold damage{/g} each turn.
41c6686f-4616-4c34-80ca-3b846a663331: This creature is freezing and takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d8{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}cold damage{/g} each turn.
3f639e74-d1d4-428a-9ef7-af865837e687: This creature is freezing and takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d6{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}cold damage{/g} each turn.
e48195e6-6407-4cab-a677-f649dea7cb6f: This creature is freezing and takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d6{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}cold damage{/g} each turn.
e9f9a79d-cb93-4611-b203-09531273b93e: This creature is laughing hysterically and can take no {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}actions{/g} except a single {g|Encyclopedia:Move_Action}move action{/g} per turn.
1ed0c617-6d32-40ab-93d8-d096f56d2c2c: This creature is on fire and takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g} each turn.
9a7b28ac-b966-4fff-8557-5558fd15a91f: This creature is on fire and takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g} each turn.
32e5ada2-6259-40c5-b658-f0a626c2e613: This creature is on fire and takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d8{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g} each turn.
1125dee9-2e56-4c64-846f-47b3c4889dae: This creature is on fire and takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d6{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g} each turn.
37a9d3b1-5be3-4cce-972b-b2adb25e9410: This creature is shaken. It takes a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability checks{/g}. Shaken is a less severe state of fear than frightened or panicked.
9c5fc75c-3e4a-43d4-9b13-e6e1b7a1a66a: This creature is under protection of Aura of Heaven.
ff6c2806-e4a8-481a-b057-613805b52082: This disease seems to be magical. It can't be treated by mundane means.
ce03b307-fa81-47cd-b5d3-4ea2ab988762: This exploit works as the acid jet exploit, but the arcanist needs to expend 2 points from her arcane reservoir instead of one. If she does, the target takes additional {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} on the following {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} if it fails its {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g}. The target takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}acid damage{/g} on the following round for every 2d6 points of acid damage dealt by the initial {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}. On subsequent rounds, the target continues to take 1d6 points of acid damage for every 2d6 points of acid damage dealt on the previous round. The damage continues until the amount of acid damage dealt on the previous round by this effect is 1d6. For example, a 9th level arcanist would deal (5d6 + {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier) points of acid damage, 2d6 points of acid damage on the following round, and 1d6 points of acid damage on the third and final round. The arcanist must have the acid jet exploit to select this exploit.
fc8f3ace-da88-4f5b-9f37-c76f59b038b9: This exploit works as the flame arc exploit, but the arcanist needs to expend 2 points from her arcane reservoir instead of one. If she does so, half of the {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} she deals is fire, and the other half results directly from unholy power that is not subject to fire resistance. Good creatures that take damage from a hellfire ray must succeed at a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will saving throw{/g} or be sickened for {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g}.
a905dc0a-c804-46b7-bec9-2e385f50533b: This exploit works as the flame arc exploit, but the arcanist needs to expend 2 points from her arcane reservoir instead of one. If she does, each target catches on fire if it fails its {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g}. Until the fire is extinguished, the target takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}3d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g} at the start of each of its turns. The target can attempt a Reflex every {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} to extinguish the flames.
1efe8497-26c4-46cb-99e4-7885d3e38ccf: This exploit works as the ice missile exploit, but the arcanist needs to expend 2 points from her arcane reservoir instead of one. If she does, the target is coated in rime if it fails its {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g}. As long as the ice remains (1 minute per level), the target is entangled and takes 1 point of {g|Encyclopedia:AbilityDamage}Dexterity damage{/g} at the start of each of its turns. The target tries to break free from the ice every {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} by making a {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} with a {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} equal to 10 + the arcanist's {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier. If the target takes {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g}, the ice melts and the effect ends. The arcanist must have the ice missile arcanist exploit to select this exploit.
80605248-4b43-4f27-b9c0-52838f17e636: This exploit works as the lightning lance exploit, but the arcanist needs to expend 2 points from her arcane reservoir instead of one. If she does, all creatures adjacent to the target take an amount of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} equal to half the amount of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}electricity damage{/g} rolled. Adjacent creatures can attempt a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex saving throw{/g} to halve this damage. Whether or not the target makes its saving throw has no effect on adjacent targets. The arcanist must have the lightning lance exploit to select this exploit.
ac359f30-44b5-4fd9-8253-1cb1280c6066: This hex acts as cure serious wounds, using the witch's {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}. Once a creature has benefited from the major healing hex, it cannot benefit from it again for 24 hours. At 15th level, this hex acts like cure critical wounds.
96f02ec6-1630-4f1a-b2b3-87c5997071b2:
This hex grants the shaman a +2 natural armor {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}.
The effect leaves the shaman's skin thick and stiff to the touch.
cc40a4e0-7770-4bab-85a4-9ebc505757a8:
This hex grants the witch a +2 natural armor {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}.
The effect leaves the witch's skin thick and stiff to the touch.
fc2d28ad-244a-4cb0-bd18-18151a3f8c3a: This hex has a range of 30 feet. The hexed creature receives a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g} to negate the effect. If this save is failed, the creature becomes fatigued the first {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} of the hex. On the second round of the hex, the creature becomes exhausted. On the third round, the creature dies unless it succeeds at a Fort save. Creatures that fail the first save but succeed at the second remain exhausted and take {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}4d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} + 1 point of damage per level of the witch. Slaying the witch that hexed the creature ends the effect, but any fatigue or exhaustion remains. Whether or not the saves are successful, a creature cannot be the target of this hex again for 1 day.
67822dad-7ec3-46fa-97ff-c17c48012d9d: This horn functions as a horn of blasting, except that it deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}10d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}sonic damage{/g}, stuns creatures for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} (a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g} reduces the {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} by half).
74812134-e71d-4fb6-bfa8-b80f53846200: This is a ranger's unique ability that determines their specialization — for example, fighting with two {g|Encyclopedia:Light_Weapon}one-handed{/g} weapons. It grants the ranger abilities that improve the chosen fighting style, even if they are usually available only to other classes.
8d53e0bb-6b80-4b4f-bbd5-2dddce028c72: This is a special kind of potion that allows the alchemist to empower some of their abilities for the price of weakening the others. Mutagens serve to specialize the alchemist for a certain combat style, such as assault, defense, or ranged combat.
c6b872ba-3de0-42dd-91d2-12ff74c5a39e: This is a special {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} whose type depends on the selected element. They can deal both physical and {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}energy damage{/g}, and frequently can hit from afar. They can be modified or empowered, and if a kineticist possesses more than one element, their powers can be combined. Kineticist create their blasts with bare hands, any weapons would hinder them.
9da91bc4-3355-42cc-8838-dd4520fd5532: This judgment bathes the inquisitor's weapons in a divine light. The inquisitor's weapons count as magic for the purposes of bypassing {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g}. At 6th level, the inquisitor's weapons also count as one {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}alignment{/g} type (chaotic, evil, good, or lawful) for the purpose of bypassing {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} reduction. The type selected must match one of the inquisitor's alignments. If the inquisitor is neutral, she does not receive this {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g}. At 10th level, the inquisitor's weapons also count as adamantine for the purpose of overcoming damage reduction (but not for reducing hardness).
0777109a-d907-44d1-b3f0-c09a1576eb22: This judgment gives the inquisitor great focus and makes her {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} more potent. This benefit grants a +1 sacred {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Concentration}concentration checks{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g} made to overcome a target's {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g}. This bonus increases by +1 for every three inquisitor levels she possesses.
9b6cb3c0-bb52-4686-836b-7dc825c908f6: This judgment makes the inquisitor resistant to harm, granting {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} 1/chaotic. This DR increases by 1 for every five levels she possesses.
5b52c9b5-d0b1-4d2c-89f9-4ae1e4f3df6e: This judgment makes the inquisitor resistant to harm, granting {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} 1/evil. This DR increases by 1 for every five levels she possesses.
1c95f751-94a2-4d59-b5f6-3d34c912f845: This judgment makes the inquisitor resistant to harm, granting {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} 1/good. This DR increases by 1 for every five levels she possesses.
7e93eee1-64e4-4b8c-837a-ae660d4f1ca0: This judgment makes the inquisitor resistant to harm, granting {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} 1/lawful. This DR increases by 1 for every five levels she possesses.
7ae2b199-899d-4924-845c-2045c46552b3: This judgment makes the inquisitor resistant to harm, granting {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} 1/magic. This DR increases by 1 for every five levels she possesses. At 10th level, this DR changes from magic to an {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}alignment{/g} (chaotic, evil, good, or lawful) that is opposite the inquisitor's.
3b89387b-db1e-4d3f-bb76-efc649d0a658: This judgment spurs the inquisitor to seek justice, granting a +1 sacred {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on all {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g}. This bonus increases by +1 for every five inquisitor levels she possesses. At 10th level, this bonus is doubled on all attack rolls made to confirm {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hits{/g}.
dc69037a-15ec-4872-bf7d-2c5c2a33d324: This patron grants the witch a list of known {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}:
b0388551-f3f6-4555-9f6c-b785c19a8c73: This protective aura provides a +4 deflection {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} and a +4 resistance bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} made or effects created by evil creatures to anyone within 20 feet. Otherwise, it functions as a magic circle against evil and a lesser globe of invulnerability, both with a radius of 20 feet.
2f33aa53-f9e6-491e-b97d-bcd83bad6c98: This spiraling animal horn can be sounded as a normal horn, but if the command word is spoken and the instrument is then played, it deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}5d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}sonic damage{/g} to creatures within a 40-foot cone (a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g} reduces the {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} by half).
dc793be4-81c4-4722-9f05-f5917fdf3d45: This suit of armor grants the wearer {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} 5/magic.
665b717e-ae76-4e5f-b22a-ef18b73498aa: This suit of armor or shield produces a magical force that protects vital areas of the wearer more effectively. When an enemy confirms a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g} or lands a sneak {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} against the wearer, there is a chance that the critical hit or sneak attack is negated and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} is instead {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}rolled{/g} normally. The chance is 25% for light fortification, 50% for moderate fortification, and 75% for heavy fortification.
b7a0776a-764f-4417-98a4-9d2d7fbe91c5: This type comprises vegetable creatures. Note that regular plants, such as one finds growing in gardens and fields, lack {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} scores; even though plants are alive, they are objects, not creatures.
8bff6cef-02e4-4d2c-b284-bebaaf8eb094: This type includes insects, arachnids, other arthropods, worms, and similar invertebrates.
f7bbf01c-4a7e-4f8c-8f09-c21fbe9925ce: This unique ability allows the warpriest to cast any {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} very quickly, but only on themselves. For example, they can use a spell to make themselves stronger, then {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} an enemy on the same {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. This ability also allows the warpriest to {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g} themselves or their allies with a touch, or to {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} the undead.
d368e005-3033-4dd3-a933-862404f7cb4b: This unit is a full caster.
8e3fa18c-1f58-422b-883d-5b35d92b7df5: This weapon emits a magic circle against evil effect. All creatures within the area gain the effects of a protection from evil {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}.
4a7da5ca-7012-41af-a0bf-edf599c3e994: This works like evasion, except while the character still takes no {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} on a successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex saving throw{/g} against an attack, they also take only half damage on a failed save. A {g|Encyclopedia:Helpless}helpless{/g} character does not gain the benefit of improved evasion.
5b839006-dea0-430f-9c62-97ad7d870fac:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill{/g} depends on {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability score{/g}.
{g|Encyclopedia:Persuasion}Persuasion{/g} represents character's talent to manipulate other people through negotiation, deceit, or intimidation.
Here are examples where you apply your character's Persuasion skill to:
• Change others' attitudes or opinions.
3fe980d4-f1be-4164-9aa7-27a67dc0c554:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill{/g} depends on {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability score{/g}. This skill cannot be used if your character is not trained in it.
{g|Encyclopedia:Use_Magic_Device}Use Magic Device{/g} skill represents character's talent at activating magic items, even if you are not otherwise trained in their use.
Here are examples where you apply your character's Use Magic Device skill to:
• Activate wands and scrolls that you would normally be unable to use.
2153c7be-f4d3-4cf7-9a21-74c6c4f33d0f:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill{/g} depends on {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability score{/g}. Armor {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalties{/g} apply to this skill {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g}.
{g|Encyclopedia:Mobility}Mobility{/g} represents character's talent for balance and coordination, including aerial {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}maneuvers{/g}, gymnastics, and tumbling.
Here are examples where you apply your character's Mobility skill to:
• Move past opponents without provoking {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attacks of opportunity{/g}.
• Squeeze through tight spots.
• Climb and jump.
014280ce-9c84-4c69-96bd-6fb6d5b69c4a:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill{/g} depends on {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability score{/g}. Armor {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalties{/g} apply to this skill {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g}.
{g|Encyclopedia:Stealth}Stealth{/g} represents character's talent at avoiding detection, allowing the character to slip past foes or strike from an unseen position.
Here are examples where you apply your character's Stealth skill to:
• Avoiding random encounters on global map or during {g|Encyclopedia:Rest}rest{/g}.
• Moving past enemies without them noticing.
97173efb-7405-4d4d-8346-5ffa60bdefc6:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill{/g} depends on {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability score{/g}. This skill cannot be used if your character is not trained in it. Armor {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalties{/g} apply to this skill {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g}.
Here are examples where you apply your character's Trickery skill to:
• Disarm traps or devices.
• Open locks on doors and chests.
ad41048c-c5bc-4849-8c2f-527081ba1a07:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill{/g} depends on {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability score{/g}. This skill cannot be used if your character is not trained in it.
{g|Encyclopedia:Knowledge_Arcana}Knowledge (arcana){/g} represents character's knowledge about {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}, magic items and numerous bits of magical lore.
Here are examples where you apply your character's Knowledge (arcana) skill to:
• Arcane spell scroll scribing during {g|Encyclopedia:Rest}camping{/g}.
• Identification of found magical items.
• Learn spells from spellbooks and scrolls.
f9029dc3-d606-4e2d-91dc-510782a1cd73:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill{/g} depends on {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability score{/g}. This skill cannot be used if your character is not trained in it.
{g|Encyclopedia:Knowledge_World}Knowledge (world){/g} represents character's knowledge about people, systems that make civilization run, historical events that made societies what they are today.
Here are examples where you apply your character's Knowledge (world) skill to:
• Brew potions during {g|Encyclopedia:Rest}camping{/g}.
• Decipher writing in foreign languages.
• Recall knowledge (about geography, history, locales, or nobility).
05a57c62-dae1-40e6-991a-069b74e81df3:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill{/g} depends on {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability score{/g}. Armor {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalties{/g} apply to this skill {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g}.
{g|Encyclopedia:Athletics}Athletics{/g} represents the character's talent at deeds of physical prowess such as leaping or scaling walls.
Here are examples where you apply your character's Athletics skill to:
• Move a heavy object.
• Climb an obstacle.
• Jump.
683122d6-b5bd-45cc-9515-448447940356:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill{/g} depends on {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability score{/g}.
{g|Encyclopedia:Perception}Perception{/g} represents character's acuity of your senses allows you to notice fine details, see danger coming, and tell if people are behaving suspiciously.
Here are examples where you apply your character's Perception skill to:
• Notice traps and hidden objects.
• Determine your chances to be not {g|Encyclopedia:Surprise}surprised{/g} in case of a sudden {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} on your {g|Encyclopedia:Rest}camp{/g}.
43e8c9a7-5e58-4aad-8e2b-417141621350:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill{/g} depends on {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability score{/g}. This skill cannot be used if your character has not trained it at least once.
{g|Encyclopedia:Lore_Religion}Lore (religion){/g} represents character's knowledge about the secrets of deities, holy lore, and extraplanar realms.
Here are examples where you apply your character's Lore (religion) skill to:
• Divine {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} scroll scribing during {g|Encyclopedia:Rest}camping{/g}.
• Gives an ability to {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}cure{/g} a disease.
• Recall knowledge about the planes or religions.
99372625-b0de-400e-8284-baf00c9dea34:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill{/g} depends on {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability score{/g}. This skill cannot be used if your character is not trained in it.
{g|Encyclopedia:Lore_Nature}Lore (nature){/g} represents character's knowledge about the natural world, and ability to command and train wild creatures.
Here are examples where you apply your character's Lore (nature) skill to:
• Allows to recall knowledge about dungeons or nature.
• Delays fatigue while traveling on the world map.
5e08914b-dadb-480f-aeed-a36321e2d060:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} always deals a type of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} determined by your element (air). In addition, the subtype of this spell changes to match the energy type of your element.
Any creature in the area takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}electricity damage{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum 5d4).
d7464378-2757-4c25-bba8-af96008e775f:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} always deals a type of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} determined by your element (air). In addition, the subtype of this spell changes to match the energy type of your element.
You blast your enemies with a beam of electricity. You may fire one ray, plus one additional ray for every four levels beyond 3rd (to a maximum of three rays at 11th level). Each ray requires a ranged {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g} to hit and deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}4d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}electricity damage{/g}.
f1eaa61d-b303-4066-86b6-a6075006f02e:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} always deals a type of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} determined by your element (earth). In addition, the subtype of this spell changes to match the energy type of your element.
Any creature in the area takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}acid damage{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum 5d4).
69ac827b-0411-4ec9-8f59-3ee3794317a0:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} always deals a type of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} determined by your element (earth). In addition, the subtype of this spell changes to match the energy type of your element.
You blast your enemies with a beam of acid. You may fire one ray, plus one additional ray for every four levels beyond 3rd (to a maximum of three rays at 11th level). Each ray requires a ranged {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g} to hit and deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}4d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}acid damage{/g}.
3c3e101e-0be8-4a1f-91d1-e70bd99317d2:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} always deals a type of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} determined by your element (water). In addition, the subtype of this spell changes to match the energy type of your element.
Any creature in the area takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}cold damage{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum 5d4).
9bf8ef6c-82f1-48d5-af91-cdf52ee1acb8:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} always deals a type of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} determined by your element (water). In addition, the subtype of this spell changes to match the energy type of your element.
You blast your enemies with a beam of cold. You may fire one ray, plus one additional ray for every four levels beyond 3rd (to a maximum of three rays at 11th level). Each ray requires a ranged {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g} to hit and deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}4d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}cold damage{/g}.
bdbd02e0-e93e-41b5-b97a-20ea737b34fe:
Those with the aspect of the boar are famously stubborn.
Minor Form: You gain a +2 inherent {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on Fortitude {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g}. At 8th level, the bonus increases to +4, and at 15th level, it increases to +6.
Major Form: Your shape changes to that of a large dire boar. While in this form, you gain the {g|Encyclopedia:Scent}scent{/g} ability (30 feet), a gore {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d8{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}), and a {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} bonus of +10 feet. At 8th level, you gain the {g|Encyclopedia:Improved_NaturalAttack}improved natural attack{/g} ability with your gore attack, and you gain powerful charge (+1d8 on your gore attack when charging). At 15th level, you gain 1 additional {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit point{/g} per shifter level you have, and you gain Awesome Blow as a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}.
Primary {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural attacks{/g}: gore
2be2b876-9964-4f8c-a4c0-775262bde350:
Those with the aspect of the boar are famously stubborn. The shifter can shift into her aspect's minor form for a number of minutes per day equal to 3 + her shifter level. The duration does not need to be consecutive, but it must be spent in 1-minute increments. Shifting into a minor form is a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}, while ending the effect is a {g|Encyclopedia:Free_Action}free action{/g}.
Minor Form: You gain a +2 inherent {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on Fortitude {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g}. At 8th level, the bonus increases to +4, and at 15th level, it increases to +6.
b5542133-c5cf-4114-94d4-4f2d20ce5021: Though a living creature, a deathtouched companion reacts to positive and negative energy as if it were undead: positive energy harms it, while negative energy {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heals{/g} it.
956bf521-3bf0-4758-b937-b15e1627e17e: Though named for the wild savages who fight alongside rabid dogs, mad dogs employ all manner of beasts as their battle brethren.
078dadfd-dd4a-4dcd-9af3-ecd61e31c9a4: Three times per day as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} you can target a single creature. That creature must pass a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will saving throw{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} 10 + level in this prestige class + your {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} bonus) or become unable to cast {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} in this prestige class. At 5th and 9th levels you gain one additional use of this ability. The same effect occurs whenever you score a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g}.
b3e7c2b0-c10b-4faf-8087-6778fcbd6890: To a blood kineticist, the water in a creature's blood is just like any other sort, and she uses that knowledge to brutal ends.
5af9251c-d32e-47a0-849a-10e4c1adf304: To many wizards, the experimentation of the alchemist seems quaint, if not dangerous or frightening. A few wizards take up the secrets of the bomb, however, fusing alchemy with their already considerable magical power.
b5da6e3a-cbe3-4adc-abc4-0e48692a4e92: To those who know how to manipulate it, the blood of a dhampir can be a powerful component to magic. A cruoromancer infuses his necromantic magic with the power of his unique mixture of living blood and undead ichor. As his power increases in this strange arcane art, a cruoromancer finds potent ways to infuse his unique blood with Necromancy {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}.
eb3ea8cd-8723-43fe-9d9d-1a436cc4eb8d: To treat an affliction means to tend to a single diseased or poisoned character. Make a {g|Encyclopedia:Lore_Religion}Lore (religion) check{/g}. If your {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} exceeds the {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of the affliction, the affliction is removed. You can treat each character only once per day. You need a first aid kit to use this ability.
64567492-67c0-49c2-8ca3-92b1265f4c23:
Torag, also known as the "Father of Creation," is a stoic and serious dwarven god of the forge, protection, and strategy who values honor, planning, and well-made steel. He is an often distant deity, lending magical power to his clerics, but leaving his followers to make their own way through life, knowing that this will make them strong and determined.
Domains: Artifice, Earth, Good, Law, Protection.
Favored Weapon: Warhammer
8081feff-3706-49ab-ac6b-b7dc121b4bea: Traditional monks walk the strict path of discipline which thousands of predecessors trod before them. They sacrifice the freedom to choose their power in exchange for steeled willpower and the trusted set of traditional abilities.
4d7ef41f-98de-4996-ac22-a542de43fdf8: Transmutation {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} change the properties of some creature, thing, or condition.
7dd9d3fb-3717-4325-b5ff-566c6cbbd73d:
Transmuters use magic to change the world around them.
Physical Enhancement: You gain a +1 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to one physical {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability score{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g}, or {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g}). This bonus increases by +1 for every five wizard levels you possess to a maximum of +5 at 20th level. At 20th level, this bonus applies to two physical ability scores of your choice.
Telekinetic Fist: As a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, you can strike with a telekinetic fist, targeting any foe within 30 feet as a ranged {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g}. The telekinetic fist deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}bludgeoning damage{/g} + 1 for every two wizard levels you possess. You can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + your {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier.
