Change Shape: At 8th level, you can change your shape for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} per day equal to your wizard level. These rounds do not need to be consecutive. This ability otherwise functions like beast shape II or elemental body I. At 12th level, this ability functions like beast shape III or elemental body II.
c37c3b6f-eb95-49b5-94d7-8491dd89d863: Typically, nature finds its greatest harmony with divine magic, but sometimes a connection with the natural world manifest itself through the arcane current in the veins of the bloodragers called greenragers. These bloodragers funnel their eldritch heritage into abilities that allow them to call powerful allies from nature and empower them with their bloodrage.
9f3b1a74-d401-4c89-9e63-ffbb7eee4811: Undead are once-living creatures animated by spiritual or supernatural forces.
47febb4d-6f99-4f91-b5ad-690a8f3cef63: Under the effects of feral mutagen the alchemist gains bat-like wings that give him a +3 dodge {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} against {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attacks{/g} and immunity to the effects of difficult terrain.
25969394-3fd8-4e7b-9ade-93280bd88d83: Underground chemists are part of the rotting, fetid underbelly of the alchemical world. While underground chemists can't hold a candle to dedicated alchemists, they're tricky and dangerous with alchemical substances and potions.
6ed4e857-0740-4b0f-81b2-775262805ada: Unlike crusaders or paladins, who charge headlong into battle in the name of their patron deities, herald callers are adept at calling powerful outsiders to aid their brethren in battle.
902a931c-b086-4ed6-b1e4-39f292f52468: Unlike most sorcerers, whose innate magic is powered by force of personality, you use pure willpower to master and fuel your magic. You use your {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g}, rather than your {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g}, to determine all class features and effects relating to your sorcerer class, such as bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} per day, the maximum spell level you can cast, the {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}save{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DCs{/g} of your spells, and the number of daily uses of your bloodline powers. You gain a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Lore_Religion}Lore (religion) checks{/g}.
d4c0de42-4bf2-45dd-819c-0e7ac89e39f0: Unlike most sorcerers, whose innate magic is powered by force of personality, you use your intellect to understand and master your mystic powers. You use your {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g}, rather than your {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g}, to determine all class features and effects relating to your sorcerer class, such as bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} per day, the maximum spell level you can cast, the {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}save{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DCs{/g} of your spells, and the number of daily uses of your bloodline powers. You gain a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Knowledge_Arcana}Knowledge (arcana){/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g}.
81325da4-97c0-4998-bf41-f24a16560a27: Unlike normal animals of its kind, an animal companion's {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}Hit Dice{/g}, abilities, {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g} advance as the druid advances in level. If a character receives an animal companion from more than one source, her effective druid levels stack for the purposes of determining the statistics and abilities of the companion. Most animal companions increase in {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} when their druid reaches 4th or 7th level, depending on the companion.
42a50fc2-7aae-4894-9455-68131ca4470c: Unlike typical magi, eldritch scions do not study tomes of magic or spend time learning to combine martial and magical skills. Rather, eldritch scions find that their {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} and abilities come to them instinctively.
481a0106-ed56-4e87-a19b-2f2c2538bc63: Until the target of the smite is dead
cd623bdb-7aa6-43d2-afdc-865357596efb: Until the target of the smite is dead
1d008e9c-67d5-4bfa-ae17-c9c33f46156b:
Until would-be Hellknights take the trial referred to simply as the Test — in which they enter single combat with a conjured devil and either emerge victorious or die — they are known as armigers. While this is a blanket term for all Hellknights-in-training (including those training to become signifers), it also applies specifically to fighters who focus their training to become Hellknights. Despite their lack of recognized rank, armigers are skilled and deadly warriors.
Most armigers live and train at their order's citadel, working toward the day when they become full-fledged Hellknights. These armigers follow a brutally strict routine; they spend hours honing their combat skills against other trainees, obsessively studying in the citadel's libraries, or memorizing passages of the Hellknight philosophy known as the Measure and the Chain. At regular intervals, squads of armigers emerge from their citadels to patrol nearby cities or frontier lands, working to enforce Hellknight law and their order's edicts.
827cffd8-0746-453f-9f97-7d14e4d3a8f6: Upon achieving 20th level, you achieve true enlightenment and become one with the universe. You receive a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on all {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} equal to your {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier. You become immune to confusion, exhaustion, fatigue, nausea, and sickened effects. You can take 20 on all Knowledge {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g}. Once per day, should you die, 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} after dying you are reborn as a living example of the summoning of your chosen philosophy. Your body re-forms with all your equipment, and you return to life with maximum {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g}.
6d2a7291-fb77-44eb-829d-a77e7f5ce86d: Upon initiation, a Hellknight signifer receives a signifer mask, often devoid of eyeholes or other personal features. This mask doesn't obscure the signifer's vision, and while wearing it he gains a +2 competence {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Perception}Perception checks{/g} and on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} and abilities that rely on visual effects.
d95f59dc-1460-418b-8837-edc59327e88c: Upon reaching 20th level, a rogue becomes incredibly deadly when dealing sneak attack {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}. Each time the rogue deals sneak attack damage, she can slay the target. The target receives a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g} to negate the death effect. The {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of this save is equal to 10 + 1/2 the rogue's level + the rogue's {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} modifier. Once a creature has been the target of a master strike, regardless of whether or not the save is made, that creature is immune to that rogue's master strike for 24 hours.
33833a79-7592-436e-9872-883ae729a505: Upon reaching 20th level, you become a master of {g|Encyclopedia:Injury_Death}death{/g}. You can cast animate dead at will without paying a material component cost. Additionally, once per day, you can cast power word kill, but the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} can only target a creature with 150 {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} or less.
ec9fa361-5848-4481-a037-d42d5e44a315: Upon reaching 20th level, you become a perfect channel for life energy. You become immune to bleed, death {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g}, exhaustion, fatigue, nausea effects, negative levels, and sickened effects.
2bfa7ae5-a614-4116-9066-edcd6a35cc5d: Upon reaching 20th level, you become an avatar of battle. You gain the Pounce ability. Whenever you confirm a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g}, you can ignore any {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} the target might possess. Whenever an enemy tries to confirm a critical hit against you, you gain a +4 insight {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to your {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} for this {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g}.
bf39544d-fd8e-44be-ad78-a8fd8dea04fd: Upon reaching 20th level, you become one with the spirits of your ancestors. You gain a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on Will {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} equal to your {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier, {g|Encyclopedia:Blindsense}blindsense{/g} up to a range of 60 feet, and a +4 bonus on your {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} for all Divination {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}. You can cast foresight as a {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}spell-like ability{/g} once per day.
e78bc09a-2d5b-450a-9080-9dce0f804efd:
Upon reaching 5th level, a divine hunter forms a divine bond with her ranged weapon. As a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, she can call upon the aid of a celestial spirit for 1 minute per paladin level.
At 5th level, this spirit grants the weapon a +1 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g}. For every three levels beyond 5th, the weapon gains another +1 enhancement bonus, to a maximum of +6 at 20th level. These bonuses can be added to the weapon, stacking with existing weapon bonuses to a maximum of +5.
Alternatively, they can be used to add any of the following weapon properties: axiomatic, brilliant energy, flaming, flaming burst, holy, keen, merciful, and speed. Adding these properties consumes an amount of bonus equal to the property's cost. These bonuses are added to any properties the weapon already has, but duplicate abilities do not stack.
A paladin can use this ability once per day at 5th level, and one additional time per day for every four levels beyond 5th, to a total of four times per day at 17th level.
104411ed-beca-405b-a064-5ce611907122:
Upon reaching 5th level, a paladin forms a divine bond with her god. This bond can take one of two forms. Once the form is chosen, it cannot be changed.
The first type of bond allows a paladin to form a divine bond with her weapon. As a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, she can call upon the aid of a celestial spirit for 1 minute per paladin level.
At 5th level, this spirit grants the weapon a +1 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g}. For every three levels beyond 5th, the weapon gains another +1 enhancement bonus, to a maximum of +6 at 20th level. These bonuses can be added to the weapon, stacking with existing weapon bonuses to a maximum of +5.
Alternatively, they can be used to add any of the following weapon properties: axiomatic, brilliant energy, disruption, flaming, flaming burst, holy, keen, and speed. Adding these properties consumes an amount of bonus equal to the property's cost. These bonuses are added to any properties the weapon already has, but duplicate abilities do not stack.
A paladin can use this ability once per day at 5th level, and one additional time per day for every four levels beyond 5th, to a total of four times per day at 17th level.
The second type of bond allows a paladin to gain the service of an unusually intelligent, strong, and loyal steed to serve her in her crusade against evil. This mount is a heavy horse. This mount functions as a druid's animal companion, using the paladin's level as her effective druid level.
At 11th level, the mount gains the celestial creature simple template.
At 15th level, a paladin's mount gains {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g} equal to the paladin's level + 11.
774ed9a0-6ef5-4aaa-94f9-0b26f6b4a4e9:
Upon reaching 5th level, a paladin forms a divine bond with her weapon. As a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, she can call upon the aid of a celestial spirit for 1 minute per paladin level.
At 5th level, this spirit grants the weapon a +1 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g}. For every three levels beyond 5th, the weapon gains another +1 enhancement bonus, to a maximum of +6 at 20th level. These bonuses can be added to the weapon, stacking with existing weapon bonuses to a maximum of +5.
Alternatively, they can be used to add any of the following weapon properties: axiomatic, brilliant energy, defending, disruption, flaming, flaming burst, holy, keen, and speed. Adding these properties consumes an amount of bonus equal to the property's cost (see Table: Melee Weapon Special Abilities). These bonuses are added to any properties the weapon already has, but duplicate abilities do not stack.
A paladin can use this ability once per day at 5th level, and one additional time per day for every four levels beyond 5th, to a total of four times per day at 17th level.
354ca0a9-a0e5-44bc-bba6-0be1992ca58e:
Upon reaching 5th level, a paladin forms a divine bond with her weapon. As a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, she can call upon the aid of a celestial spirit for 1 minute per paladin level.
At 5th level, this spirit grants the weapon a +1 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g}. For every three levels beyond 5th, the weapon gains another +1 enhancement bonus, to a maximum of +6 at 20th level. These bonuses can be added to the weapon, stacking with existing weapon bonuses to a maximum of +5.
Alternatively, they can be used to add any of the following weapon properties: axiomatic, brilliant energy, defending, disruption, flaming, flaming burst, holy, keen, merciful, and speed. Adding these properties consumes an amount of bonus equal to the property's cost. These bonuses are added to any properties the weapon already has, but duplicate abilities do not stack.
A paladin can use this ability once per day at 5th level, and one additional time per day for every four levels beyond 5th, to a total of four times per day at 17th level.
e3a08d38-6f3d-49e7-b993-b8bf283563b4:
Upon reaching 5th level, a paladin forms a divine bond with her weapon. As a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, she can call upon the aid of a celestial spirit for 1 minute per paladin level.
At 5th level, this spirit grants the weapon a +1 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g}. For every three levels beyond 5th, the weapon gains another +1 enhancement bonus, to a maximum of +6 at 20th level. These bonuses can be added to the weapon, stacking with existing weapon bonuses to a maximum of +5.
Alternatively, they can be used to add any of the following weapon properties: axiomatic, brilliant energy, disruption, flaming, flaming burst, holy, keen, and speed. Adding these properties consumes an amount of bonus equal to the property's cost. These bonuses are added to any properties the weapon already has, but duplicate abilities do not stack.
A paladin can use this ability once per day at 5th level, and one additional time per day for every four levels beyond 5th, to a total of four times per day at 17th level.
8141b304-a3eb-4150-b938-5bae6d5d90fb: Upon reaching 6th level, a dragon disciple gains a +2 increase to the character's {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} score.
155111f5-1323-4aa8-a3fc-0bdb65be3ebc: Upon reaching 8th level, a dragon disciple gains a +2 increase to the character's {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} score.
4aafb568-7f0f-4b00-9037-ec198e7e27d6: Urban hunters help guards track down and apprehend criminals or spies, find lost children and disaster victims, and protect animals from abuse in the city. They still draw their inspiration and strength from the natural world, marveling at how nature flourishes wherever the city allows.
e1988865-e0ff-4f77-b215-0b68c1aad8d5:
Urgathoa, also known as "The Pallid Princess" and "Lady Despair," is the goddess of physical excess, disease, and the undead. She is mostly worshiped by dark necromancers, the undead, and those wishing to become undead. Sometimes those who live gluttonous lifestyles make supplication to her, as do those suffering from a serious illness. Her faithful believe she was the first creature to defy Pharasma and return, unnaturally, from the Boneyard and break free from the cycle of souls.
Domains: Death, Evil, Magic, Strength, Undead, War.
Favored Weapon: Scythe
526f8528-b5b2-4a09-b349-763e872063c0: Usually wizards specialize in a {g|Encyclopedia:Magic_School}magic school{/g}, delivering greater impact in a focused manner, but {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} masters try to make their expertise as broad as possible.
99262c59-9e06-48b6-afb5-e6d96881ed00: Vanguard gets an additional use per day of the Vanguard Tactician ability.
359a0740-6868-4704-a141-67afdfd6e978: Vanguards are battlefield commanders who focus on the brutality of combat and lead their allies to bloody victory. Quick to react to danger, a vanguard is a valuable scout, capable officer, and skilled tactician.
2fb2a161-7976-463e-9724-3c7688138b44: Versatile Healing Channel — Breath of Life
7c33dc21-da12-44b1-b7b9-95607efcebbd: Versatile {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}Healing{/g} Channel — Remove Disease, Remove Paralysis
034626af-e3d0-4719-8327-6a632e6ab14e: Warpriest chooses a deity to worship. Each deity grants a number of blessings that give unique abilities. Warpriest can choose two of them.
9da21b69-780e-4f02-9e3b-6f9029064401: Warpriest chooses one weapon type from the many available, and perfects the art of using it. As they progress, it deals more {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}, and can be empowered with various {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} and abilities. Warpriest also gains bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g} that give them {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} and damage rolls, available only to them.
82301a9d-7ba3-4f0b-b884-bb9c88b17ac5: Warpriests apply both cold weapons and a vast array of sacred {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}. They are effective in both offense and defense, can {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g} and empower allies, and have an ability to channel energy to heal or {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} multiple targets.
d972f906-c035-4703-b265-b7c392c0e4f9: When a character with this talent hits a creature with a melee weapon that deals sneak attack {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}, the target cannot make {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attacks of opportunity{/g} for {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g}+1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g}.
ad715176-940b-43d5-a807-dc61f70d71d1: When a character with this talent makes a {g|Encyclopedia:Perception}Perception check{/g}, they gain a +4 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g}.
77518b73-2be1-47af-8560-f915d4d4c022:
When a cruoromancer casts a {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} of the necromancy school, he can opt to infuse that spell with his undead-tainted blood as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}. As he increases in level, the power and effects of such infusions become more potent. Each time a cruoromancer uses blood infusion, he drains a portion of his own blood either by cutting himself with a blade or by opening a scab from a previous wound. When he does this, he takes an amount of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} equal to {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} + half his wizard level. A cruoromancer can only affect a spell with a single type of blood infusion.
At 1st level, he can infuse his Necromancy spells in either of the following ways:
Focused Infusion: When the cruoromancer uses this infusion, he adds +1 to the {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of the infused Necromancy spell.
Sickening Infusion: When the cruoromancer uses this infusion, any creature damaged by the infused Necromancy spell becomes sickened for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}.
1190e4c0-669d-4e73-9a92-150c63aaa78d:
When a fiendflesh shifter uses her fiendish aspect ability, she can gain an additional ability. The fiendflesh shifter can change which ability she gains each time she uses fiendish aspect.
Daemon: Acid {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resistance{/g} equal to the resistance provided by her fiendish resilience ability and a +4 profane {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g} against disease.
cdb7a9d4-5af7-4953-b192-37053f8db06b:
When a fiendflesh shifter uses her fiendish aspect ability, she can gain an additional ability. The fiendflesh shifter can change which ability she gains each time she uses fiendish aspect.
Daemon: Acid {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resistance{/g} equal to the resistance provided by her fiendish resilience ability, a +4 inherent {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to her {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} score, and immunity to disease.
4afe3719-d92e-41ec-af40-6a75fdfc12ab:
When a fiendflesh shifter uses her fiendish aspect ability, she can gain an additional ability. The fiendflesh shifter can change which ability she gains each time she uses fiendish aspect.
Demon: Cold {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resistance{/g} equal to the resistance provided by her fiendish resilience ability and a +4 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} with {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural attacks{/g}.
051fb5fc-f179-4816-81dc-675a4853f780:
When a fiendflesh shifter uses her fiendish aspect ability, she can gain an additional ability. The fiendflesh shifter can change which ability she gains each time she uses fiendish aspect.
Demon: Cold {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resistance{/g} equal to the resistance provided by her fiendish resilience ability and a +4 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} with {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural attacks{/g}. The fiendflesh shifter also gains a +4 inherent bonus to her {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} score and increases the damage die of all natural {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} by one category.
ebc14f60-eb2a-40ec-9794-3a263397552a:
When a fiendflesh shifter uses her fiendish aspect ability, she can gain an additional ability. The fiendflesh shifter can change which ability she gains each time she uses fiendish aspect.
Devil: A +4 dodge {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} and a +4 profane bonus on Reflex {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g}.
bc8d131a-2033-487a-a974-8a9ccbdb8825:
When a fiendflesh shifter uses her fiendish aspect ability, she can gain an additional ability. The fiendflesh shifter can change which ability she gains each time she uses fiendish aspect.
Devil: A +4 dodge {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} and a +4 profane bonus on Reflex {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g}. The fiendflesh shifter also gains a +4 inherent bonus to her {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} score and immunity to blindness.
71b4971b-1889-4846-992b-ee20f3bd040d:
When a hospitaler reaches 4th level, she gains the {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}supernatural ability{/g} to channel positive energy like a cleric. She can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + her {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier. Using this ability does not expend uses of lay on hands, as it does with other paladins. This energy can be used to cause or {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}, depending on the creatures targeted.
A hospitaler channels positive energy and can choose to deal damage to undead creatures or to heal living creatures.
Channeling positive energy causes a burst that affects all creatures of one type (either undead or living) in a 30-foot radius centered on the hospitaler. The amount of damage dealt or healed is equal to {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of damage at 4th level plus 1d6 points of damage for every two hospitaler levels beyond 4th (2d6 at 6th, 3d6 at 8th, and so on). Creatures that take damage from channeled energy receive a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g} to halve the damage. The {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of this save is equal to 10 + 1/2 the hospitaler's level + the hospitaler's Charisma modifier. Creatures healed by channel energy cannot exceed their maximum {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit point{/g} total—all excess healing is lost.
This is a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} that does not provoke an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attack of opportunity{/g}.
247aa028-29fa-4003-a391-9594d9d807aa: When a magus gains a special bond with his mount, he becomes an arcane rider. The magus and his faithful companion not only begin to think as one, but literally become a single arcane entity — they share one arcane pool and can move through dimensions together, plunging enemies into confusion with sudden attacks from nowhere.
c213f6d4-9760-4939-a9fe-9d34f9747240: When a new loremaster level is gained, the character gains new {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} per day as if he had also gained a level in a spellcasting class he belonged to before adding the prestige class. He does not, however, gain other benefits a character of that class would have gained, except for additional spells per day, spells known (if he is a spontaneous spellcaster), and an increased effective level of spellcasting. If a character had more than one spellcasting class before becoming a loremaster, he must decide to which class he adds the new level for purposes of determining the number of spells per day.
591fbec8-dac1-4198-9a1b-ae7921635af0: When a new winter witch level is gained, the character gains new {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} per day as if she had also gained a level in witch or shaman spellcasting class she belonged to before she added the prestige class. Additionally, at 2nd level, and every two level after, a winter witch gets a new hex depending on the chosen spellcasting class.
12b466ab-13f7-418a-b5b7-df7887499e9d:
When a paladin reaches 4th level, she gains the {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}supernatural ability{/g} to channel positive energy like a cleric. Using this ability consumes two uses of her lay on hands ability. This energy can be used to cause or {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}, depending on the creatures targeted.
A paladin channels positive energy and can choose to deal damage to undead creatures or to heal living creatures.
Channeling positive energy causes a burst that affects all creatures of one type (either undead or living) in a 30-foot radius centered on the paladin. The amount of damage dealt or healed is equal to {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of damage plus 1d6 points of damage for every two paladin levels beyond 1st (2d6 at 4th, 3d6 at 5th, and so on). Creatures that take damage from channeled energy receive a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g} to halve the damage. The {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of this save is equal to 10 + 1/2 the paladin's level + the paladin's {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier. Creatures healed by channel energy cannot exceed their maximum {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit point{/g} total—all excess healing is lost.
This is a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} that does not provoke an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attack of opportunity{/g}.
e39ef6ad-981e-4fc5-acce-0c016c7c37d8:
When a priest of balance casts the positive channel energy or cure wounds {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, he strengthens the next negative channel energy or inflict wounds spell. Similarly, if he casts the negative channel energy or inflict wounds spell, he strengthens his next positive channel energy or cure wounds spell.
Cure and inflict wounds spells strengthened this way have their {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} increased by 2.
Channel energy abilities strengthened this way deal or {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} more {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}.
dc96bd39-d980-47e2-8d8c-34bd87c0845b: When a target of the divine guardian's divine troth ability is {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacked{/g}, she may use an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attack of opportunity{/g} to provide her ally with a +4 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}.
fe3b23c9-bf99-47dd-a978-fdc1bc9d0bcd: When a warpriest devotes himself to a god of the natural world, he is sometimes blessed with supernatural powers that allow him to evoke animalistic power and fury.
dfd7af6e-cc0d-4393-8e80-364832e563c7:
When an alchemist creates a bomb, he can choose to have it deliver one of the four powerful curses. A creature that takes a direct hit from a cursed bomb must succeed at a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g} or be affected by one of the following curses:
Curse of Feeble Body — the subject suffers a -6 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} score.
Curse of Weakness — the subject suffers a -6 penalty to {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} scores.
Curse of Idiocy — the subject suffers a -6 penalty to {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} scores.
Curse of Deterioration — the subject suffers a -4 penalty on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g}, saves, {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability checks{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g}.
abd1ad22-5fc5-4cc7-91e8-8d806e47f355: When carrying a shield, the shieldbearer adds his shield {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Concentration}concentration checks{/g} to cast defensively.
96e81e97-c90f-4f91-996f-84f45060e40f: When making a sneak attack against a creature that has {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g}, the character's {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} reduces that {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} reduction for two {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} by an amount equal to the character's level. This {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to damage reduction does not stack.
b5c26223-c153-4831-9e4b-a9b9b64e112a: When making {g|Encyclopedia:Knowledge_Arcana}Knowledge (arcana){/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g}, a demonbane priest gains a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on the check equal to half his {g|Encyclopedia:Class_Level}class level{/g} (minimum +1).
c291545a-14ca-499e-90ea-34054ab5eaa7: When subjected to an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} that normally allows a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex saving throw{/g} for half {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}, an animal companion takes no damage if it makes a successful saving throw and only half damage if the saving throw fails.
15fd3967-ce55-4091-8950-865173722dfc: When the Hellknight uses smite chaos on a creature, he can impede its mobility. The creature can negate this effect with a successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g}; otherwise, it is affected as if by slow for {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g}.
f0d95349-dbf9-429b-8f25-1cfc4147d6ee: When the Hellknight uses smite chaos on a creature, he can strike the creature mute for {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} unless it succeeds at a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g}. A mute creature cannot speak or cast {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} with verbal components.
e14025eb-4a18-47ee-8ec8-2ff9c6635859: When the alchemist creates a bomb, he can choose for it to detonate very brightly. Creatures that take a direct hit from a blinding bomb are blinded for 1 minute unless they succeed at a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g}. Creatures in the splash area that fail their saves against the bomb are dazzled for 1 minute.
9b0420fa-8be8-4f64-a118-a3ad0ef6ec85: When the alchemist creates a bomb, he can choose to have it deal good {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}divine damage{/g}. Evil creatures that take a direct hit from a holy bomb must succeed at a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g} or be staggered on their next turn. Against neutral creatures, holy bombs deal half {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}, and such targets are not affected by their staggering effect. Holy bombs have no effect on {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}good-aligned{/g} creatures.
ff55afca-d7a0-4035-9ee6-8ca569dcdc27: When the alchemist creates a bomb, he can choose to have it dispel magic effects instead of deal {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}. Creatures that take a direct hit from a dispelling bomb are subject to a targeted dispel magic {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, using the alchemist's level as the {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}. This cannot be used to target a specific spell effect.
84851a5d-86ec-4ed8-8ee1-64e7c6ad75fa: When the alchemist creates a bomb, he can choose to have it inflict {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}acid damage{/g}. Creatures that take a direct hit from an acid bomb take an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of acid {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} later.
d19a9a25-2689-4b19-b66c-f9ddcab3af11: When the alchemist creates a bomb, he can choose to have it inflict {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}cold damage{/g}. Creatures that take a direct hit from a frost bomb are staggered for one {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} unless they succeed on a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g}.
f72a7765-611b-4df2-8f50-9efd6f672a88: When the alchemist creates a bomb, he can choose to have it inflict {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}electricity damage{/g}. Creatures that take a direct hit from a shock bomb are dazzled for {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g}.
7c64b176-dcdd-4f6f-b96c-396f5393a32d: When the alchemist creates a bomb, he can choose to have it inflict {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}force damage{/g}. Force bombs deal {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} points of force damage, plus 1d4 points of force damage for every odd-numbered level, instead of 1d6. Creatures that take a direct hit from a force bomb are knocked prone unless they succeed at a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g}.
a198b480-16a9-4a51-9ba9-415ac370871a: When the alchemist throws a bomb, it doesn't affect allies.
7812ab27-ff2c-4473-b3bf-f44090384ff7: When the alchemist throws a bomb, it doesn't affect their allies.
60fe9a27-5821-45be-bb5b-6a663afb3e1d: When the character is confused and hits a creature with a {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g} that deals sneak attack {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}, the character is no longer confused.
8c26333e-c737-426e-aab6-1111e4652c40: When the character is shaken and hits a creature with a {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g} that deals sneak attack {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}, the character is no longer shaken.
c5bd5b77-1b79-4f79-98e6-2389975235c8: When the character is sickened and hits a creature with a {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g} that deals sneak attack {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}, the character is no longer sickened.
195c698f-b4f3-4b55-a487-8ee87d38c5e1: When the cruoromancer uses this infusion, any creature {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damaged{/g} by the infused Necromancy {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} becomes sickened for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}.
4686d0e2-6a31-486f-97df-05c9ff9a962b: When the cruoromancer uses this infusion, he adds +1 to the {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of the infused Necromancy {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}.
5d4f5627-fdbf-42bc-b210-09bfcfad4d96: When the fighter is wielding weapons from the trained weapon group, his weapon training bonus applies to his {g|Encyclopedia:CMD}CMD{/g} against all {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}combat maneuvers{/g} attempted against him.
610a829d-b56c-4c47-8aee-5f3c71e8d24d: When unarmored and not wielding a shield, the instinctual warrior adds his {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} bonus (if any) to his {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:CMD}CMD{/g}. In addition, an instinctual warrior gains a +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to AC and CMD at 4th level. This bonus increases by 1 for every four barbarian levels thereafter, up to a maximum of +5 at 20th level.
ca280a0d-1fd9-4665-9189-9c72c8b9df6e:
When unarmored and unencumbered, the monk adds his {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} bonus (if any) to his {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:CMD}CMD{/g}. In addition, at level 4 a monk gains a +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to AC and CMD. This bonus increases by 1 for every four monk levels thereafter, up to a maximum of +5 at 20th level.
These bonuses to AC apply even against {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attacks{/g} or when the monk is {g|Encyclopedia:Flat_Footed}flat-footed{/g}. He loses these bonuses when he is immobilized or {g|Encyclopedia:Helpless}helpless{/g}, when he wears any armor, when he carries a shield, or when he carries a medium or heavy load. If a different class ability, like shifter's Defensive Instinct or barbarian's Cunning Elusion, also allows the character to add his {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} bonus to AC and CMD, these two bonuses cannot be applied simultaneously: the monk's class ability suppresses the others.
a75e2518-3e3b-48c2-b6e1-f3441cee93f9:
When unarmored and unencumbered, the monk adds his {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} bonus (if any) to his {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:CMD}CMD{/g}. In addition, a monk gains a +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to AC and CMD at 4th level. This bonus increases by 1 for every four monk levels thereafter, up to a maximum of +5 at 20th level.
These bonuses to AC apply even against {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attacks{/g} or when the monk is {g|Encyclopedia:Flat_Footed}flat-footed{/g}. He loses these bonuses when he is immobilized or {g|Encyclopedia:Helpless}helpless{/g}, when he wears any armor, when he carries a shield, or when he carries a medium or heavy load.
ecdb53ec-186c-483f-b7e9-e9a90386fb33: When unarmored, the monk adds his {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} bonus (if any) to his {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:CMD}CMD{/g}. In addition, a monk gains a +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to AC and CMD at 4th level. This bonus increases by 1 for every four monk levels thereafter, up to a maximum of +5 at 20th level.
f4ad4623-0762-4d1e-9d02-5f8f87ff4e50: When unarmored, the scaled fist adds his {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} bonus (if any) to his {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:CMD}CMD{/g}. In addition, a scaled fist gains a +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to AC and CMD at 4th level. This bonus increases by 1 for every four scaled fist levels thereafter, up to a maximum of +5 at 20th level.
52d8be0d-62bb-4d39-80b9-7f23138845f7: When using this infusion with animate dead, the summoned skeletons gain a +4 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} for the duration of the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} that summoned it.
4e679063-c821-4c04-a888-929bc11340e4: When wearing light or no armor and not using a shield, a duelist adds 1 point of {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} bonus (if any) per duelist {g|Encyclopedia:Class_Level}class level{/g} as a dodge {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to her {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}Armor Class{/g} while wielding a melee weapon. If a duelist is caught {g|Encyclopedia:Flat_Footed}flat-footed{/g} or otherwise denied her {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} bonus, she also loses this bonus.
cbb1a1ed-16a0-4853-a351-3fbf920ece3c: When wearing light or no armor, wielding his chosen weapon, and not using a shield, a sword saint adds 1 point of {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} bonus (if any) per magus {g|Encyclopedia:Class_Level}class level{/g} as a dodge {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to her {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}Armor Class{/g}. If a sword saint is caught {g|Encyclopedia:Flat_Footed}flat-footed{/g} or otherwise denied her {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} bonus, she also loses this bonus.
f4c7b4e4-4bc6-494d-8b40-65989c16762b: When you activate this school power, you can touch any creature as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} to give it an insight {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on all of its {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability checks{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} equal to 1/2 your wizard level (minimum +1) for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. You can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + your {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier.
1a42f4cd-aa13-4a62-bea4-5842bdfc5066:
When you bloodrage, serpentine nature infuses you with vicious grace.
Bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}Feats{/g}: Combat Casting, Combat Reflexes, Deceitful, Lightning Reflexes, Improved Trip, Combat Expertise, Toughness.
Bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}Spells{/g}: Expeditious retreat (7th), cat's grace (10th), hold person (13th), touch of slime (16th).
853faed0-d942-4c1b-bb2e-c58ec8dea043: When you confirm a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g} using a light or {g|Encyclopedia:Light_Weapon}one-handed{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}piercing{/g} weapon, you can apply a –4 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to target's {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}Armor Class{/g} for 1 minute.
d28bb332-6ea6-4a26-933f-f7d5b71c4321: When you confirm a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g} using a light or {g|Encyclopedia:Light_Weapon}one-handed{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}piercing{/g} weapon, you can apply a –4 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to target's {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} for 1 minute.
6e916902-daf3-43c3-b360-3251220dc4b9: When you confirm a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g} using a light or {g|Encyclopedia:Light_Weapon}one-handed{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}piercing{/g} weapon, you can apply one of the following {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalties{/g} in addition to the {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} dealt: reduce the target's movement {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} by a half, {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} or {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:AbilityDamage}damage{/g}, –4 penalty on all {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g}, –4 penalty to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}Armor Class{/g}, or 2d6 points of bleed damage. These penalties last for 1 minute, except for ability damage, which must be healed normally, and bleed damage, which continues until the target receives magic {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}healing{/g} or leaves combat.
98563796-24c5-4526-9d41-5a9abb77ff45: When you confirm a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g} using a light or {g|Encyclopedia:Light_Weapon}one-handed{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}piercing{/g} weapon, you can apply {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d6{/g} points of bleed {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} to the target. Bleed will continue until the target receives magic {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}healing{/g} or leaves combat.
1a3d46dd-1de8-46f8-9f1b-18ea34d92e6d: When you confirm a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g} using a light or {g|Encyclopedia:Light_Weapon}one-handed{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}piercing{/g} weapon, you can inflict {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:AbilityDamage}Dexterity damage{/g} to the target.
a9d9219b-9056-4073-ab45-2577c2191a33: When you confirm a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g} using a light or {g|Encyclopedia:Light_Weapon}one-handed{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}piercing{/g} weapon, you can inflict {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:AbilityDamage}Strength damage{/g} to the target.
72d852cb-9bb5-4a11-b399-f40a107ec8c9: When you confirm a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g} using a light or {g|Encyclopedia:Light_Weapon}one-handed{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}piercing{/g} weapon, you can reduce the target's movement {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} by a half for 1 minute.
bff66d76-b840-4cb5-9a44-c627c2f06599:
Whenever a battle scion would gain a rage power from the skald's rage power ability (at 3rd level and every 3 skald levels thereafter), she can instead choose to gain a teamwork {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} for which she meets the prerequisites.
The battle scion can grant this feat to allies under the effect of inspired rage, as long as those allies also meet the prerequisites, but she must expend 3 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} of raging song for each round in which she grants a teamwork feat.
92b1a668-e52d-4c78-9b1f-950bebe264ef: Whenever a creature takes {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}cold damage{/g} from one of your {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} and fails at a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g}, it is slowed (as per the slow spell) for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. At 11th level, the duration increases to {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} rounds.
c1116303-4848-4de4-a0cf-95d5a576358d: Whenever a creature takes {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g} from one of your {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}, it catches on fire. This fire deals 1 point of fire {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} at the beginning of the burning creature's turn. The fire lasts for {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g}, but it can be extinguished if the creature succeeds at a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} (using {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} = 10 + half Oracle level + {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier).
2fa8243e-bcd3-4eed-b838-2bae640918c7: Whenever a disenchanter gains a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}, he must choose from the following list: Great Fortitude, Improved Counterspell, Iron Will, Lightning Reflexes, Skill Focus ({g|Encyclopedia:Knowledge_Arcana}Knowledge (arcana){/g}), or Spell Focus (Abjuration). At 9th level, he adds the following feats to this list: Dispel Synergy, Improved Great Fortitude, Improved Iron Will, and Improved Lightning Reflexes. At 12th level, he adds the following feats to this list: Destructive Dispel and Ray Shield. He need not meet the prerequisites for these feats.

9308448e-d341-4885-89c8-65327bbd0d5b: Whenever a rogue lands a sneak attack, they can also inflict a special wound that would impose a negative effect on the enemy. There are many kinds of negative effects available, and the rogue can choose which of them to inflict.
bebaf7bc-0eba-44e5-9055-822e90f6f933:
Whenever a thug successfully uses {g|Encyclopedia:Persuasion}Persuasion{/g} to demoralize a creature, the duration of the shaken condition is increased by 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}.
In addition, if the target is shaken for 4 or more rounds, the thug makes the target frightened for 1 round.
7027b9a7-1c67-4a2a-a734-d7ffc7470137: Whenever an Order of the Paw cavalier issues a challenge, his mount gains a +1 dodge {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} as long it is threatening the target of the cavalier's challenge and the cavalier is riding the mount. This bonus increases by +1 for every four levels the cavalier possesses.
3d2c5d82-a177-4d55-8c3e-4a7b5006f3ee: Whenever an order of the cockatrice cavalier issues a challenge, he receives a +1 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on all melee {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} made against the target of his challenge as long as he is the only creature threatening the target. This bonus increases by +1 for every four levels the cavalier possesses.
a995ab84-ac8c-44f0-9197-73e5d05ab23d: Whenever an order of the lion cavalier issues a challenge, he receives a +1 dodge {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to his {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} against {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} made by the target of his challenge. This bonus increases by +1 for every four levels the cavalier possesses.
c03ef3f2-796b-43ef-8a51-d03892805812: Whenever an order of the shroud cavalier issues a challenge to an undead creature, he receives a +1 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} against the target of his challenge. The bonus increases by 1 for every 4 class levels the cavalier possesses.
edb4c627-fc19-41a5-9aa2-f2866696459e: Whenever an order of the star cavalier issues a challenge, he receives a +1 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on all his {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} as long as he is threatening the target of his challenge. This bonus increases by +1 for every four levels the cavalier possesses.
a4d430b2-6b8b-4c26-a0a4-9a61ae4f1af2: Whenever an order of the sword cavalier issues a challenge, he receives a +1 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} against the target of his challenge so long as he is astride his mount. The bonus increases by +1 for every four levels the cavalier possesses.
5a37bbdd-720f-4874-ba24-144e1cea4b5a: Whenever the alchemist imbibes a mutagen, he gains two claw {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} and a bite attack. These are primary attacks and are made using the alchemist's full {g|Encyclopedia:BAB}base attack bonus{/g}. The claw attacks deal {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} (1d4 if the alchemist is Small) and the bite attack deals 1d8 points of damage (1d6 if the alchemist is Small). While the mutagen is in effect, the alchemist gains a +2 competence {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Persuasion}Persuasion{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g} when used to intimidate.

89b88f25-9e0f-47cd-8e3f-5d20cb80b5d7: Whenever the two-handed fighter {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} with a weapon from this group, he gains a +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on attack and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}.
561bca2d-7894-4155-93ca-54099cb335b1:
Whenever this creature hits an enemy with a melee attack, it also attempts a grapple maneuver check against its target. If the check is successful, both the target and the creature are grappled.
Grappled characters cannot move, take a -2 penalty on all attack rolls and a -4 penalty to Dexterity-based checks, cannot make attacks of opportunity, and whenever they cast a spell or use a spell-like ability, they must make a concentration check against a DC of 10 + the spell's level + the grappler's CMB or lose the spell.
The target of the grapple attempts to escape every round by making a successful Athletics or Mobility skill check, or Strength check. The DC of this check is the grappler's CMD.
While grappling the target, the grappler cannot take standard actions. Each round, the grappler makes a grapple maneuver check with a +5 circumstance bonus. On success, the target is pinned and takes damage equal to that of the grappler's attack with the highest damage dice. As a free action, the grappler can end the grapple for both themselves and the target. If the check fails, this ends the grapple for both the grappler and the target.
Pinned characters suffer the following penalties:
Character suffers all of the penalties from being grappled
Character loses their Dexterity and dodge bonuses to AC
Character cannot take standard actions
Character suffers a -4 penalty to AC
This ability also gives the creature a +4 bonus on grapple maneuver checks.
41c125de-910c-42a3-b74c-9b000ba6c044: Whenever you apply a metamagic {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} to a {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} that increases the slot used by at least one level, increase the spell's {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} by +1. This bonus does not stack with itself and does not apply to spells modified by the Heighten Spell feat.
