1c984a42-f00a-45d9-a226-16a465d15e7c: Whenever you cast a {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} with {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}acid damage{/g}, that spell deals +1 point of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}dice{/g} rolled.
cfb09dd4-81a9-40f5-bf6e-0687aa13c685: Whenever you cast a {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} with {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}cold damage{/g}, that spell deals +1 point of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}dice{/g} rolled.
2d785535-6ec6-4fbb-b57d-52f20494b5b2: Whenever you cast a {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} with {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}electricity damage{/g}, that spell deals +1 point of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}dice{/g} rolled.
c37b3ec4-e816-4932-9241-822a7b41e97a: Whenever you cast a {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} with {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g}, that spell deals +1 point of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}dice{/g} rolled.
2ec00beb-d93b-4548-a8b6-d3900735b92b: Whenever you land a killing blow, all enemies in a 15-foot radius suffer a -2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on Will {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} for 3 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g}. This penalty increases to -3 at 5th and -4 at 9th level.
602ffd77-0bc7-435e-a6d9-bb68f3beea56: Whenever you score a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g} against an opponent with a {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} that requires an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack roll{/g}, you may immediately attempt to trip your opponent as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}. You do not provoke an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attack of opportunity{/g} as normal for this trip attempt. You cannot be tripped in return when using this ability.
04e5fec8-a53b-4300-b76e-62c4754ab323: Whenever you score a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g} against an opponent with an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, the target is staggered for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. At 11th level, the duration increases to {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} rounds.
908a0229-5e43-4e76-bee1-d5a31fc5c40b: Whenever you {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}roll{/g} for {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g}, you can roll twice and take either result. At 7th level, you gain Uncanny Dodge. At 11th level, you can roll for initiative three times and take any one of the results.
2d214699-e9f0-4bd1-a23e-b5fa77aaa103: Whenever your {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}healing{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} heal a target up to its maximum {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g}, any excess points persist for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} per level as temporary hit points (up to a maximum number of temporary hit points equal to your oracle level).
abad6dbd-d78f-4738-8880-bb8c710f3387: Where other bloodragers learn to avoid or shrug off minor {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} of all sorts, {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spelleaters{/g} tap into the power of their bloodline in order to {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g} damage as it comes, and can even cannibalize their own magical energy to heal more damage and continue taking the fight to the enemy.
4500568e-bd57-47cf-9247-d2e342de8827: Whether a changeling in the process of succumbing to her mother's call, a witch cursed by a hag to become her instrument of torment, a vain and petty witch overeager for power, or some other unfortunate soul, a hagbound witch finds its soul has been infected by a hag's spite and powerful, corrupt arcane magic. Her mind and body begin to transform to reflect her new being. Hagbound witches suffer a slow transformative taint that is similar to the accursed corruption and make ideal candidates for this additional power — and tragedy.
be1103b7-8f14-4b07-b058-1a8608a6fa4f: Whether riding on the wind as a falcon or hiding in some fetid bog waiting to strike, the shifter is a true master of the wild. Both a devoted defender of druidic circles and a fierce predator, the shifter can take on the forms of nature and even fuse them together with devastating effect and unbridled savagery. Shifters are protectors of druidic circles and avengers of nature, yet a shifter's magic is different from that of her druidic kin. Rather than invoking {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} from the natural world or forging alliances with animals, shifters focus their supernatural powers inward to gain control over their own forms. Their ability to change their forms is as varied as the wonders of the wilds themselves but always remains at least partially rooted in the natural world. There are many paths to becoming a shifter; most are trained in that role by druidic circles and have their powers unlocked via rituals of initiation. Yet some stumble upon the gift naturally, as if their blood bore the secrets of shifter transformation.
c9b71475-2a5d-4ba8-a7bb-760d4493a621: Whether the result of a partially successful attempt at revival, a strange blight, or repeated exposure to undead, deathtouched companions are living animals with a trace of the undead, somewhat like dhampirs.
e3dc1271-5df9-4c14-b02a-3803d5a075d1: While a Hellknight of the Gate wears armor, he reduces the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Fail_Chance}arcane spell failure chance{/g} by 5% at 1st level, 10% at 5th and 20% at 9th level.
0b28de33-8903-43d9-bbe4-4f4ef64b4a42: While all hunters have a bond with the natural world, a forester has a stronger tie to her environment than to the animals within it. While most foresters feel strong bonds with woodland regions, the archetype functions well in other terrains as well. In such cases, a forester might refer to herself by a different name that more accurately reflects her chosen terrain. For example, a forester who favors bogs and marshes might call herself a "swamper," while one who favors frozen regions might call herself a "glacier guardian." As foresters gain levels and take on new favored terrains, they often eschew such titles completely, viewing them as unnecessary, and merely refer to themselves as guardians of the wild or champions of nature's will — but regardless of the name, their devotion remains.
39f9803a-5a10-4420-a5ec-84846ac04e56: While all inquisitors root out enemies of the faith, in many orders and churches there's a select group of these religious hunters devoted to one goal, and one goal alone — to terminate the enemies of the faith wherever they can be found. Sometimes these sanctified slayers are given special dispensation to commit ruthless murders for the faith's greater good. Other times, they're simply willing to take the initiative to revel in the zeal of such grisly work.
f21dcfa9-224b-4d07-9824-ebd6ccac6f8a: While bloodrage powers come from the very essence of a bloodrager's being and are often strict and immutable, some bloodragers tap into ancient traditions and primitive wisdom to enhance their rages with something more primal. The primalist mixes his bloodline with more traditional rage powers.
285673fd-5c6b-4b2a-9598-f8f8a52eac73: While in a defensive stance, a stalwart defender gains a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g} rolls, melee {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}, thrown weapon damage rolls, and Will {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g}. In addition, she gains a +2 dodge bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}Armor Class{/g} and 2 temporary {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}Hit Die{/g}.
e5bbfa5f-b227-46b3-a03e-5fb1ddd0ad68: While in a defensive stance, the stalwart defender is immune to the shaken and frightened conditions. He must be at least 4th level before selecting this power.
bdba0ff6-8d05-41a9-b11c-2017615f2b23: While in a defensive stance, the stalwart defender may make an extra slam {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} (even if he doesn't normally have a slam attack). If used as part of a full attack, the extra attack is made at the stalwart defender's full {g|Encyclopedia:BAB}base attack bonus{/g} –5. The smash deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} (if the stalwart defender is Medium, or 1d3 if he is Small) plus half the character's {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} modifier.
d2860f31-984c-4f01-b635-771c2bb3bc7c: While in a rage, an instinctual warrior gains a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g}. In addition, she gains 2 temporary {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}Hit Die{/g}.
8f76d282-cfa3-4a03-ae7d-64e96eb791c0: While in bloodrage, a bloodrager gains a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g} rolls, melee {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}, thrown weapon damage rolls, and Will {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g}. In addition, she takes a -2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}Armor Class{/g}. She also gains 2 temporary {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}Hit Die{/g}.
6ec561bd-f295-4df3-8ce6-c1fbcb479be7: While in rage, a barbarian gains a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g} rolls, melee {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}, thrown weapon damage rolls, and Will {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g}. In addition, she takes a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}Armor Class{/g}. She also gains 2 temporary {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}Hit Die{/g}.
56d061b7-5aa0-46f7-b43a-239d899fb2d9: While in rage, a barbarian of 14th level or higher gains a +4 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on Will {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}resist Enchantment spells{/g}. This bonus stacks with all other modifiers, including the morale bonus on Will saves she also receives during her rage.
1ceb6c1e-7189-406e-8c1d-0fc4b6f216d5:
While in rage, a rageshaper gains a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g} rolls, melee {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}, thrown weapon damage rolls, and Will {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g}. In addition, he takes a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}Armor Class{/g}. He also gains 2 temporary {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}Hit Die{/g}.
Once per use of devastating form, a rageshaper can use the ground slam ability.
Ground Slam: Once per use of devastating form, a rageshaper can slam the ground, dealing {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}bludgeoning damage{/g} per shifter level + an additional 1d6 bludgeoning damage for every enemy hit by this ability to all enemies within 20 feet of him and knocking them prone. A successful Reflex save ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} 10 + half the rageshaper's shifter level + the rageshaper's {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} modifier) halves the damage and negates being knocked prone.
9163e156-d7d5-4265-a894-5fb8ec766b89: While in the guarded stance, the barbarian can apply her dodge {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} as a bonus on Reflex {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g}. A barbarian must have the guarded stance rage power and be at least 6th level to select this rage power.
31fe1e94-48da-4992-81eb-13683aeb2360: While in the guarded stance, the barbarian gains an additional +4 dodge {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} against {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} made to confirm {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hits{/g}. A barbarian must have the guarded stance rage power and be at least 8th level to select this rage power.
67d77539-f40a-4f55-8704-8c882bc55664: While in the lethal stance, the barbarian's {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical{/g} multiplier for {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} increases by 1 (a ×2 multiplier becomes ×3, a ×3 multiplier becomes ×4, and a ×4 multiplier becomes ×5). A barbarian must have the lethal stance and deadly accuracy rage powers and be at least 16th level to select this rage power.
26702921-99f1-4e39-8f8c-24fed53e62f8: While in the powerful stance, every first successful {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g} in a {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} applies a -1 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} and Fortitude {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} for one round. This penalty increases by 1 point and duration increases for 1 round for every 4 levels the barbarian has beyond 8. A barbarian must have the Powerful Stance rage power and be at least 8th level to select this rage power.
885eeafd-b263-439b-b060-e7a5010c8bdf: While in the powerful stance, the barbarian can make an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} that causes her enemies to bleed profusely. Her melee and thrown weapon attacks deal additional {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} equal to her {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} modifier. This {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} increases by 1 for every 4 levels the barbarian has beyond 12. This damage bypasses {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g} and doesn't multiply on a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g}. Barbarian must have the powerful stance rage power and be at least 12th level to select this rage power.
004a8a08-5886-4e0f-bcb4-150b32470f63: While in the reckless stance, the barbarian imparts the stance's {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to all willing allies within 30 feet of her. A barbarian must have the reckless stance rage power to select this rage power.
fdc47e13-37d4-4b9c-a8cc-f9b97f398639: While many ferocious combatants can tap into a deep reservoir of buried rage, bloodragers have an intrinsic power that seethes within. Like sorcerers, bloodragers' veins surge with arcane power. While sorcerers use this power for {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spellcasting{/g}, bloodragers enter an altered state in which their bloodline becomes manifest, where the echoes of their strange ancestry lash out with devastating power. In these states, bloodragers can cast some arcane spells instinctively. The bloodrager's magic is as fast, violent, and seemingly unstoppable as their physical prowess.
54619cab-55d5-424e-9ed7-ca3b431851d3: While many warpriests focus on threats to the body, the disenchanter focuses on dangers to the mind and the soul. Using the power of his patron, the disenchanter seeks to keep the powers of magic in check.
64bce211-a221-423f-98bd-c002d56166dc: While many warriors strive to perfect their art, spending all of their time honing their skill at martial arms, others spend as much effort dedicating themselves to a cause. These warriors, known as cavaliers, swear themselves to a purpose, serving it above all else. Cavaliers are skilled at fighting from horseback, and are often found charging across a battlefield, with the symbol of their order trailing on a long, fluttering banner. The cavalier's true power comes from the conviction of his ideals, the oaths that he swears, and the challenges he makes.
6c706aa5-2e04-4e1a-8f64-881a90d02d07: While most fighters rely on physical fitness and rigorous training to achieve martial superiority, a few prefer to create and imbibe dangerous concoctions that transform them into fearsome creatures.
9597c7bf-9739-41d8-b56d-66855356c95a: While most hunters heed the call of nature and fight to protect its bounty, some are inspired to serve a higher power. These divine hunters use faith to aid them in their struggles, and their faith infuses their animal companions, making these companions champions of their deities.
8685dd49-a916-4695-8577-2679b4d9e14b: While most inquisitors have learned to take advantage of the movements of their opponents and allies in combat, some instead summon creatures as a means of claiming strategic advantage, exploiting the mystic connection between themselves and their summoned creatures to impart a bit of their own tactical knowledge.
fe891de8-4d2a-4e61-99d4-32926811fa21: While most kineticists channel elemental power through their bodies, rare kineticists channel such power through their minds. Psychokineticists lack strong spirit, and so this energy ravages their minds but unleashes power locked in their ruptured emotions. Sometimes a psychokineticist inadvertently unleashes his power when he experiences an outburst of strong emotion, potentially making a psychokineticist an outcast or even an accidental killer.
4d98d296-039c-449b-9c28-b9b211e10d10:
While others of your kin may be powerful wizards and sorcerers, the eldritch nature of the blood coursing through your veins transforms you into a {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}-breaking terror.
When you bloodrage, arcane power transforms you into an arcane juggernaut who can cut down even the most careful caster.
Bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}Feats{/g}: Combat Reflexes, Disruptive, Improved {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}Initiative{/g}, Iron Will, Power Attack, Combat Casting, Arcane Strike.
Bonus Spells: Magic missile (7th), invisibility (10th), lightning bolt (13th), dimension door (16th).
fe491e53-7924-48fa-b05e-31865ebd908d: While raging, the barbarian gains a +1 natural armor {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}. This bonus increases by +1 for every four levels the barbarian has attained. Note: Totem rage powers grant powers related to a theme. A barbarian cannot select from more than one group of totem rage powers; for example, a barbarian who selects a beast totem rage power cannot later choose to gain any of the dragon totem rage powers (any rage power with "dragon totem" in its title).
f058543b-cf04-46eb-b3c1-dce296dcf086: While raging, the barbarian gains a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}acid damage{/g}, death effects, disease, and poison. This bonus increases by 1 for each daemon totem rage power the barbarian has, excluding this one.
a90910fc-9106-48e4-8dba-05956d6e82d7: While raging, the barbarian gains a bite {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}. If used as part of a full attack, the bite attack is made at the barbarian's full {g|Encyclopedia:BAB}base attack bonus{/g} –5. If the bite hits, it deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} (assuming the barbarian is Medium; 1d3 points of damage if {g|Encyclopedia:Size}Small{/g}) plus half the barbarian's {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} modifier.
dac75309-7bcc-473e-903a-8da350c0d200: While raging, the barbarian gains the pounce {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}special ability{/g}, allowing her to make a full {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} at the end of a charge. In addition, the {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} from her claws increases to {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d8{/g} (1d6 if {g|Encyclopedia:Size}Small{/g}) and the claws deal ×3 damage on a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g}. Note: Totem rage powers grant powers related to a theme. A barbarian cannot select from more than one group of totem rage powers; for example, a barbarian who selects a beast totem rage power cannot later choose to gain any of the dragon totem rage powers (any rage power with "dragon totem" in its title).
37ff35a5-69b6-4869-a26a-b0d68cedd08b: While raging, the barbarian gains two claw {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g}. These attacks are considered primary attacks and are made at the barbarian's full {g|Encyclopedia:BAB}base attack bonus{/g}. The claws deal {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}slashing damage{/g} (1d4 if {g|Encyclopedia:Size}Small{/g}) plus the barbarian's {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} modifier. Note: Totem rage powers grant powers related to a theme. A barbarian cannot select from more than one group of totem rage powers; for example, a barbarian who selects a beast totem rage power cannot later choose to gain any of the dragon totem rage powers (any rage power with "dragon totem" in its title).
4935fabe-5046-42ff-9f56-d23c74ae64c1: While raging, the barbarian gains {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g} equal to 11 + the barbarian's {g|Encyclopedia:Class_Level}class level{/g} against {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} with the evil descriptor. She also gains a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on all {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against spells and effects from evil creatures.
3d36c3c9-06af-4dc5-8453-46a5eb89957b: While raging, the barbarian grows a pair of large horns, gaining a gore {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}. This attack is a primary attack (unless she is also attacking with weapons, in which case it is a secondary attack) and is made at the barbarian's full {g|Encyclopedia:BAB}base attack bonus{/g} (–5 if it is a secondary attack). The gore attack deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d8{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}piercing damage{/g} (1d6 if {g|Encyclopedia:Size}Small{/g}) plus the barbarian's {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} modifier (1/2 if it is a secondary attack).
4be1f840-9442-4df6-9465-ea9f1543817b: While raging, the barbarian is surrounded by an aura of menace. Good creatures adjacent to the barbarian are shaken and take {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}slashing damage{/g} at the beginning of the barbarian's turn as dozens of small cuts open across their flesh. Neutral creatures that are adjacent to the barbarian are shaken, but do not take any {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}. Evil creatures are unaffected.
f304a30e-52aa-4e0f-9157-ab22337a2834: While raging, the barbarian sprouts dozens of wicked barbs from her body. Anyone striking the barbarian with a melee weapon, an {g|Encyclopedia:UnarmedAttack}unarmed{/g} strike, or a {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural weapon{/g} takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}piercing damage{/g}.
f6a82074-04a2-4245-9d0e-fcb4a44641c5: While raging, the spirits that surround the barbarian make it difficult for her enemies to see her. The spirits grant the barbarian a 20% miss chance against {g|Encyclopedia:RangedAttack}ranged attacks{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attacks{/g} made by creatures that are not adjacent to the barbarian (such as {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} with {g|Encyclopedia:Reach}reach{/g} weapons).
346228a3-5ff4-4ba2-a202-65b19202bbb6: While raging, this effect bestows upon the barbarian a halo of gleaming light that shines as if it were daylight and triggers an invisibility purge effect in the barbarian's square and each adjacent square. The invisibility purge only affects non-good creatures.
b3c01295-1b50-46b8-a892-656681330616: While raging, whenever barbarian is subject to a {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} or a non-spell healing effect that cures {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit point{/g} damage, she heals 1 additional point of damage per her {g|Encyclopedia:Character_Level}character level{/g}. This does not affect {g|Encyclopedia:Fast_Healing}fast healing{/g} or {g|Encyclopedia:Regeneration}regeneration{/g}.
61066e97-edd6-4d3a-a5d3-87d5a944d84a: While some barbarians take on bestial aspects in their rages, the beastkin berserker descends so deeply into primal fury that she actually transforms into an animal. Berserkers of the surface world often associate with predators such as bears or wolves, and are sometimes mistaken for lycanthropes. Some barbarians shapechange into rampaging dinosaurs or megafauna, crafting their armor out of the hide and bones of their favored animals.
7395ec71-69b7-4477-9d38-6c76fcff8df8: While some druids might keep to the fringe of battle, allowing companions and summoned creatures to fight while they confound foes with the powers of nature, others transform into deadly beasts and savagely wade into combat. Druids worship personifications of elemental forces, natural powers, or nature itself. Typically this means devotion to a nature deity, though druids are just as likely to revere vague spirits, animalistic demigods, or even specific awe-inspiring natural wonders.
ba9bdea3-246c-4c43-9a99-1738833367f0: While some heroes speak to gods or consort with otherworldly muses, shamans commune with the spirits of the world and the energies that exist in every living thing. These divine adventurers draw upon their power to shape the world and expand the influence of their spiritual patrons. Shamans have strong ties to natural spirits. They form powerful bonds with particular spirits, and as their power grows they learn to call upon other spirits in times of need.
1882dc5f-dcd8-4a84-994e-e800e0066ced: While the barbarian is raging, her {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attacks{/g} impose a temporary negative level on her opponent on a successful {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g}. After 1 hour, these temporary negative levels disappear automatically (without a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g}).
01fee1af-28eb-4148-a9d0-bf5378ee5b63:
While the concept of wizard specializations along the classically recognized {g|Encyclopedia:Magic_School}schools of magic{/g} certainly dates back to the time of Azlant, and perhaps beyond into the dim recesses of time before humanity rose to prominence, it was the runelords of Thassilon who explored school specialization to its full extreme.
Focusing their research on the discovery that each school of magic was opposed by two specific opposition schools, the runelords developed methods of further enhancing their mastery over their chosen arcane specialties. Essentially, they defined these seven schools as much by what they couldn't do as by what they could. By excising "impurities" introduced by fixed oppositional schools, they traded arcane versatility for greater strength in their chosen fields.
63913719-3f6e-4b09-a805-1bb0c4e0973f: While the twisted power of the demon-worshiping skalds is great, it comes at a terrible price.
22e7d9b7-19ce-47fc-bf0c-b214c7799e38: While this ability is active, the monk's class ability no longer allows you to add your {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:CMD}CMD{/g}. Instead, if another class ability, such as shifter's Defensive Instinct or barbarian's Cunning Elusion, would allow you to add your {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} bonus to AC and CMD, these abilities are no longer suppressed and apply as normal.
01fd67a3-6145-4d62-af78-df6fee7c7e18: While universalist wizards might study to prepare themselves for any manner of danger, specialist wizards research {g|Encyclopedia:Magic_School}schools of magic{/g} that make them exceptionally skilled within a specific focus. Yet no matter their specialty, all wizards are masters of the impossible and can aid their allies in overcoming any danger.
9ea9d7b3-0688-4a72-a9c4-d749c65da923: While usually rangers use their {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} to cast divine {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}, espionage experts use the power of their personality. The main casting ability for the espionage expert is {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g}.
6f8e8bb3-3e03-49a0-b04b-8e98320af028: Winter witch levels stack with shaman levels to determine the power of shaman hexes and frost spirit abilities, and with witch levels to determine the power of witch hexes and access to major and grand hexes, and for acquiring patron {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}.
6bd17183-fad7-43fd-9af7-a093162f6071: Witch Doctor Channel Positive Energy — Harm Undead
a8a231c6-b55b-4922-ae49-4ddb3fe10472: Witch Doctor Channel Positive Energy — Heal Living
e2b7c955-bb2c-433d-ab4d-29c27022387a: Witch chooses a familiar who gives them a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to certain abilities or {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g}.
df7e85cd-5be1-4240-a4d6-2f84219a9835: Witches are potent arcane {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spellcasters{/g} who can employ the strongest spells. They are especially good at controlling and weakening the enemies both with spells and unique magic abilities called hexes. Witches can also {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g} and empower their allies, though less effectively than some other classes. This is a difficult class to play for a newcomer.
5ff51f7b-97e4-4744-bbac-2fd6aedfe5c6:
Witches learn a number of magic tricks, called hexes, that grant them powers or weaken foes. At 1st level, a witch gains one hex of her choice. She gains an additional hex at 2nd level and for every 2 levels attained after 2nd level. A witch cannot select an individual hex more than once.
Using a hex is a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} that doesn't provoke an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attack of opportunity{/g} unless otherwise noted. The {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} to resist a hex is equal to 10 + half the witch's level + the witch's {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier. For Stigmatized Witch the saving throw use {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier instead of Intelligence modifier.
25c895fd-2604-46bb-97b3-9ac88db8c3ce: Witches sometimes dive deep into elemental energies, allowing to evoke destructive powers upon their enemies.
977690e2-6395-4e15-a680-59b19c7303dd: With a quick incantation, a witch can place this hex on one creature within 60 feet, causing them to suffer intense pain. The target is nauseated for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to the witch's level. A {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g} negates this effect. If the saving throw is failed, the target can attempt a new save each round to end the effect. Whether or not the save is successful, a creature cannot be the target of this hex again for 1 day.
8c2878c8-8a30-4512-8269-ef7065ca5119: With a quick incantation, the shaman causes a creature within 30 feet to suffer stiffness in the joints and bones, causing the target to be staggered 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. A successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude saving throw{/g} negates this effect. At 8th level, the duration is increased to a number of rounds equal to her shaman level, though the target can attempt a save each round to end the effect if its initial saving throw fails. At 16th level, the target can no longer attempt a saving throw each round to end the effect, although it still attempts the initial Fortitude saving throw to negate the effect entirely.
a09cb863-59cb-4478-9e31-5a768b02d566: With a single shout, the shaman causes one target creature within 30 feet to become shaken for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. A successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will saving throw{/g} negates this effect. At 8th level, she makes the target frightened instead. At 16th level, she makes it panicked instead. This is a mind-affecting fear effect. A creature affected by this hex cannot be affected by it again for 24 hours.
fc1b5262-1be7-4f90-8e7c-4ba2ad5d7f40:
With power over storm and sky, you can call down the wrath of the gods upon the world below.
Storm Burst: As a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, you can create a storm burst targeting any foe within 30 feet as a ranged {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g}. The storm burst deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} + 1 point for every two levels you possess in the class that gave you access to this domain. In addition, the target is buffeted by winds and rain, causing it to take a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. You can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + your {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier.
Lightning Lord: At 8th level, as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}, you can call down a bolt of lightning. You can call down a bolt of lightning a number of times per day equal to your level in the class that gave you access to this domain. This ability otherwise functions as call lightning.
09651a58-ae79-46e8-acb3-f603126ed920:
With power over storm and sky, you can call down the wrath of the gods upon the world below.
Storm Burst: As a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, you can create a storm burst targeting any foe within 30 feet as a ranged {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g}. The storm burst deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} + 1 point for every two levels you possess in the class that gave you access to this domain. In addition, the target is buffeted by winds and rain, causing it to take a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. You can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + your {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier.
Lightning Lord: At 8th level, as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}, you can call down a bolt of lightning. You can call down a bolt of lightning a number of times per day equal to your level in the class that gave you access to this domain. This ability otherwise functions as call lightning.
Domain {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}Spells{/g}: snowball, summon small elemental, call lightning, slowing mud, ice storm, sirocco, fire storm, sunburst, tsunami.
e2539776-1d85-4330-b5cf-930504dbc49f: With the magic of a {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spellcasting{/g} class at their disposal, dragon disciples can assume the typical role of a magic-user, hampering the movement of the enemy and hurling {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}-dealing spells at their opponents. Dragon disciples' draconic abilities, however, make these versatile spellcasters even more formidable, as they use their breath weapons and flight to destroy their foes directly.
51ebbb15-338d-4638-90cf-bf136523e95c: With their mastery of magic, arcane tricksters can make for even more subtle or confounding opponents than standard rogues. Ranged legerdemain enhances their skill as thieves, and their ability to make sneak {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} without {g|Encyclopedia:Flanking}flanking{/g} or as part of a {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} can make arcane tricksters formidable {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}-dealers.
b8ab0cf1-5c0d-44c4-af29-09e4e5cf7a8f: Wizard can form a bond with either a magic item, or a familiar. A familiar grants them {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonuses{/g} to certain abilities or {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g}, while an item helps them replenish a used {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} once a day.
5e70c7ce-253c-4548-93ed-d9431f9e444f: Wizard chooses a favored {g|Encyclopedia:Magic_School}school of magic{/g}, which grants them bonus abilities and {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}. However, they also choose two opposition schools, diminishing their ability of casting spells that belong to them.
476f8ebd-2a77-462e-946b-33f5d5fd63bb: Wizards are powerful arcane {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spellcasters{/g}. They have a large array of different spells, which makes them useful in different situations. They can destroy or weaken their enemies, or empower their allies. However, this versatility has its downside: the number of spells a wizard can cast per day is not very large.
6579705b-b33b-46d2-ad08-f2d7b7ec6db5: Wizards are proficient with the club, dagger, heavy crossbow, light crossbow, and quarterstaff, but not with any type of armor or shield. Armor interferes with a wizard's movements, which can cause his {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} with somatic components to fail.
3f340a61-2cbe-4d61-b6d6-59d84057518f: Wizards can cast a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Cantrips_Orisons}cantrips{/g}, or 0-level {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}. These spells are cast like any other spell, but they are not expended when cast and may be used again.
4d950a89-b63a-4934-b760-2baf236af2d4: Wizards can expand their arsenal of {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} by copying them from scrolls into their spellbook.
de589a58-bd69-469e-99a9-49f030cfcfd5: Wizards sometimes specialize in utilizing one element, converting other elements into their own.
e72b35fc-6309-44dd-bae2-de1615217df9:
Wizards who do not specialize (known as universalists) have the most diversity of all arcane {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spellcasters{/g}.
Hand of the Apprentice: You cause your melee weapon to fly from your grasp and strike a foe before instantly returning to you. As a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, you can make a single {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} using a melee weapon at a range of 30 feet. This attack is treated as a {g|Encyclopedia:RangedAttack}ranged attack{/g} with a thrown weapon, except that you add your {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier on the attack roll instead of your {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} modifier ({g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} still relies on {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g}). This ability cannot be used to perform a {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}combat maneuver{/g}. You can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + your Intelligence modifier.
Metamagic Mastery: At 8th level, you can extend or alter the range of your next spell as though using the Extend or Reach spell {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} accordingly. You can use this ability once per day at 8th level and one additional time per day for every two wizard levels you possess beyond 8th.
Extend spell: An extended spell lasts twice as long as normal. A spell with a duration of {g|Encyclopedia:Concentration}concentration{/g}, instantaneous, or permanent is not affected by this feat.
Reach spell: You can alter a spell with a range of touch, close, or medium to increase its range by one range category, using the following order: touch, close, medium, and long. Spells modified by this feat that require melee {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attacks{/g} instead require ranged touch attacks.
At 12th level, you can empower your next spell as though using the Empower Spell feat. Empowering costs 2 daily usages of metamagic mastery.
Empowered spell: All variable, numeric effects of an empowered spell are increased by half including {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonuses{/g} to those {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}dice{/g} rolls. {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Saving throws{/g} and opposed rolls are not affected, nor are spells without random variables.
At 16th level, you can maximize your next spell as though using the Maximize Spell feat. Maximizing costs 3 daily usages of metamagic mastery.
Maximized spell: All variable, numeric effects of a spell modified by this feat are maximized. Saving throws and opposed rolls are not affected, nor are spells without random variables.
At 20th level, you can quicken your next spell as though using the Quicken Spell feat. Quickening costs 4 daily usages of metamagic mastery.
Quicken Spell: Casting a quickened spell is a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}. You can perform another {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}action{/g}, even casting another spell, in the same {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} as you cast a quickened spell. A spell whose {g|Encyclopedia:Casting_Time}casting time{/g} is more than 1 round or 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Full_Round_Action}full-round action{/g} cannot be quickened.
25df484d-13c9-46ef-a594-4ca55714c037:
You are a crusader for your god, always ready and willing to fight to defend your faith.
Battle Rage: You can touch a creature as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} to give it a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on melee {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} equal to 1/2 your level in the class that gave you access to this domain for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} (minimum +1). You can do so a number of times per day equal to 3 + your {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier.
1cbb839b-6f04-4973-841f-49ccc8369741:
You are a crusader for your god, always ready and willing to fight to defend your faith.
Battle Rage: You can touch a creature as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} to give it a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on melee {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} equal to 1/2 your level in the class that gave you access to this domain for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} (minimum +1). You can do so a number of times per day equal to 3 + your {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier.
Domain {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}Spells{/g}: bless, aid, magical vestment, divine power, flame strike, blade barrier, power word blind, power word stun, power word kill.
4ac9cfab-d939-4193-b649-03628f48e9b2:
You are a great leader, an inspiration to all who follow the teachings of your faith.
Inspiring Word: As a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, you can speak an inspiring word to a creature within 30 feet. That creature receives a +2 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability checks{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to 1/2 your level in the class that gave you access to this domain (minimum 1). You can use this power a number of times per day equal to 3 + your {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier.
Inspiring Command: At 8th level, you can issue an inspiring command to your allies, who must all be within 30 feet of you. Affected allies gain a +2 insight bonus on attack rolls, {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:CMD}CMD{/g}, and skill {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g} for a number of rounds equal to 1/2 your level in the class that gave you access to this domain (minimum 1). You can use this power a number of times per day equal to 3 + your Wisdom modifier.
d7f29c10-6230-4f4c-8428-91b4455495ea:
You are a great leader, an inspiration to all who follow the teachings of your faith.
Inspiring Word: As a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, you can speak an inspiring word to a creature within 30 feet. That creature receives a +2 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability checks{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to 1/2 your level in the class that gave you access to this domain (minimum 1). You can use this power a number of times per day equal to 3 + your {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier.
Inspiring Command: At 8th level, you can issue an inspiring command to your allies, who must all be within 30 feet of you. Affected allies gain a +2 insight bonus on attack rolls, {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:CMD}Combat Maneuver Defense{/g}, and skill {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g} for a number of rounds equal to 1/2 your level in the class that gave you access to this domain (minimum 1). You can use this power a number of times per day equal to 3 + your Wisdom modifier.
Domain {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}Spells{/g}: divine favor, grace, magical vestment, heroism, dominate person, brilliant inspiration, greater heroism, frightful aspect, overwhelming presence.
57dacf1c-1d01-4f73-ace9-f92762c40818:
You are a master of illusions and deceptions. {g|Encyclopedia:Trickery}Trickery{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Stealth}Stealth{/g} are class {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g}.
Copycat: You can create an illusory double of yourself as a {g|Encyclopedia:Move_Action}move action{/g}. This double functions as a single mirror image and lasts for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to your level in the class that gave you access to this domain, or until the illusory duplicate is dispelled or destroyed. You can have no more than one copycat at a time. This ability does not stack with the mirror image {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}. You can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + your {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier.
Master's Illusion: At 8th level, you can make yourself and any number of allies within 30 feet invisible for 1 round per level in the class that gave you access to this domain. The rounds do not need to be consecutive.
db8c9d6e-15a2-4fa4-82e8-a9f09061b2ab:
You are a master of illusions and deceptions. {g|Encyclopedia:Trickery}Trickery{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Stealth}Stealth{/g} are class {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g}.
Copycat: You can create an illusory double of yourself as a {g|Encyclopedia:Move_Action}move action{/g}. This double functions as a single mirror image, and lasts for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to your level in the class that gave you access to this domain, or until the illusory duplicate is dispelled or destroyed. You can have no more than one copycat at a time. This ability does not stack with the mirror image {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}. You can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + your {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier.
Master's Illusion: At 8th level, you can make yourself and any number of allies within 30 feet invisible for 1 round per level in the class that gave you access to this domain. The rounds do not need to be consecutive.
Domain Spells: sleep, invisibility, dispel magic, confusion, mind fog, cloak of dreams, insanity, mass invisibility, weird.
60538858-7443-4ee5-ae69-230aebdeb167:
You are a scholar and a sage of legends. In addition, you treat all Knowledge and Lore skills as class {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g}.
Void Form: You can become semi-tangible as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}. While in this form, you are immune to {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hits{/g} and gain a +1 deflection {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}. This bonus increases by 1 at 8th level and every 4 levels thereafter. You can use this power a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} per day equal to your level in the class that gave you access to this domain.
Teaching Moment: At 8th level as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g} you can grant all allies within 30 feet special insights. Once during the next minute, each affected creature can choose to {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}roll{/g} twice and take the better result before attempting an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack roll{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability check{/g}, skill {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g}, or {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g}. You can use this ability once per day at 8th level, and one additional time per day for every 4 levels in the class that gave you access to this domain beyond 8th.
Domain {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}Spells{/g}: true strike, fox's cunning, communal see invisibility, {g|Encyclopedia:Injury_Death}death{/g} ward, true seeing, mass fox's cunning, power word blind, power word stun, power word kill.
8abe15e7-9e62-4496-9200-bb0109b3d5b3:
You are a scholar and a sage of legends. In addition, you treat all Knowledge skills as class {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g}.
Void Form: You can become semi-tangible as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}. While in this form, you are immune to {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hits{/g} and gain a +1 deflection {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}. This bonus increases by 1 at 8th level and every 4 levels thereafter. You can use this power a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} per day equal to your level in the class that gave you access to this domain.
Teaching Moment: At 8th level as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g} you can grant all allies within 30 feet special insights. Once during the next minute, each affected creature can choose to {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}roll{/g} twice and take the better result before attempting an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack roll{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability check{/g}, skill {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g}, or {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g}. You can use this ability once per day at 8th level, and one additional time per day for every 4 levels in the class that gave you access to this domain beyond 8th.
415e63ec-ac11-4b87-a205-893c23419ea1:
You are a spirit of freedom and a staunch foe against all who would enslave and oppress.
You have the ability to ignore impediments to your mobility. For a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} per day equal to your level in the class that gave you access to this domain, you can move normally regardless of magical effects that impede movement, as if you were affected by freedom of movement. This effect occurs automatically as soon as it applies. These rounds do not need to be consecutive.
Freedom's Call: At 8th level, you can emit a 30-foot aura of freedom for a number of rounds per day equal to your level in the class that gave you access to this domain. Allies within this aura are not affected by difficult terrain or the confused, frightened, panicked, paralyzed, slowed, shaken, or staggered conditions. This aura only suppresses these effects, and they return once a creature leaves the aura or when the aura ends, if applicable. These rounds do not need to be consecutive.
Domain {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}Spells{/g}: remove fear, remove paralysis, remove curse, freedom of movement, break enchantment, greater dispel magic, elemental body IV, mind blank, communal mind blank.
9747b841-fe45-41bc-a7eb-16878f20ee29:
You are a true student of all things mystical, and see divinity in the purity of magic.
Hand of the Acolyte: You can cause your melee weapon to fly from your grasp and strike a foe before instantly returning. As a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, you can make a single {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} using a melee weapon at a range of 30 feet. This attack is treated as a {g|Encyclopedia:RangedAttack}ranged attack{/g} with a thrown weapon, except that you add your {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier to the attack roll instead of your {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} modifier ({g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} still relies on {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g}). This ability cannot be used to perform a {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}combat maneuver{/g}. You can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + your Wisdom modifier.
Dispelling Touch: At 8th level, you can use a targeted dispel magic effect as a melee {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g}. You can use this ability once per day at 8th level and one additional time per day for every four levels in the class that gave you access to this domain beyond 8th.
Domain {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}Spells{/g}: color spray, resist energy, dispel magic, communal protection from energy, {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g}, greater dispel magic, power word blind, protection from spells, clashing rocks.
26507677-df7f-4373-ad10-83f2d41ef2f5:
You are an explorer and find enlightenment in the simple joy of travel, be it by foot or conveyance or magic. Increase your base {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} by 10 feet.
Agile Feet: As a {g|Encyclopedia:Free_Action}free action{/g}, you can gain increased mobility for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. For the next round, you ignore all difficult terrain and do not take any {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalties{/g} for moving through it. You can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + your {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier.
Dimensional Hop: At 8th level, you can teleport up to 10 feet per level in the class that gave you access to this domain per day as a {g|Encyclopedia:Move_Action}move action{/g}. This teleportation must be used in 5-foot increments and such movement does not provoke {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attacks of opportunity{/g}.
2ba5a4d4-2952-464e-93fe-fc060d2d2816:
You are an explorer and find enlightenment in the simple joy of travel, be it by foot or conveyance or magic. Increase your base {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} by 10 feet.
Agile Feet: As a {g|Encyclopedia:Free_Action}free action{/g}, you can gain increased mobility for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. For the next round, you ignore all difficult terrain and do not take any {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalties{/g} for moving through it. You can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + your {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier.
Dimensional Hop: At 8th level, you can teleport up to 10 feet per level in the class that gave you access to this domain per day as a {g|Encyclopedia:Move_Action}move action{/g}. This teleportation must be used in 5-foot increments and such movement does not provoke {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attacks of opportunity{/g}.
Domain {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}Spells{/g}: longstrider, grace, mass feather step, mass dimension door, break enchantment, elemental body III (air), summon greater air elemental, protection from spells, elemental swarm (air).
1ba346ec-e0f5-4554-92bf-13f786e8446d:
You are forewarned of danger but can't act to prevent it. You gain uncanny dodge, as the rogue class feature, but you are staggered for the entire first {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} of combat.
At 5th level, you gain a +4 insight {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g}.
At 10th level, you gain improved uncanny dodge as the rogue ability, using your oracle level as your rogue level.
At 15th level, you gain a +4 insight bonus on all your {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} and to your {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} during the first round of combat.
a265399e-b947-40a1-9cb1-6f5d4c214d08: You are in Large spirit naga form now. You also have a {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d6{/g} bite {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} with poison and the charming gaze ability.
d545a1cc-bc7c-434c-b6d1-a33bd4120d87: You are in huge earth elemental form now. You have a +8 {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to your {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g}, a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to your {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g}, a +4 size bonus to your {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g}, a +6 natural armor bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}, and a +1 bonus to your {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}combat maneuvers{/g}. You also have two {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d8{/g} slam attacks, {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resist{/g} acid 20, and {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Vulnerability}vulnerability{/g} to electricity. You are immune to {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hits{/g} and sneak attacks and have {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} 5/—.
95f48f20-d259-4501-80af-c25c7a5e1b80:
You are infused with luck, and your mere presence can spread good fortune.
Bit of Luck: You can touch a willing creature as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, giving it a bit of luck. For the next {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}, any time the target {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}rolls{/g} a d20, she may roll twice and take the more favorable result. You can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + your {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier.
Divine Fortune: At 6th level, as a standard {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}action{/g}, you can bless yourself with divine luck. For the next half your level in the class that gave you access to this domain rounds you roll two times on every d20 roll and take the best result. You can use this ability once per day at 6th level, and one additional time per day for every 6 levels in the class that gave you access to this domain beyond 6th.
Domain {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}Spells{/g}: true strike, aid, protection from energy, communal protection from energy, break enchantment, mass cat's grace, greater {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}restoration{/g}, euphoric tranquility, mass heal.
ac98ed51-1ce3-46ce-a677-422d8638a618:
You are infused with the glory of the divine, and are a true foe of the undead. In addition, when you channel positive energy to harm undead creatures, the {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}save{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} to halve the {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} is increased by 2.
Touch of Glory: You can cause your hand to shimmer with divine radiance, allowing you to touch a creature as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} and give it a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} equal to your level in the class that gave you access to this domain on a single {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g}-based {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill check{/g} or Charisma {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability check{/g}. This ability lasts for 1 hour or until the creature touched applies the bonus to a {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}roll{/g}. You can use this ability to grant the bonus a number of times per day equal to 3 + your {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier.
Aura of Heroism: At 8th level, you can emit a 30-foot aura of heroism for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} per day equal to your level in the class that gave you access to this domain. Using this ability is a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}. Allies in the area are treated as if they were under the effects of heroism {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}.

35d8d319-19ed-4731-90a3-c71820dbcc2f:
You are sinister and cruel, and have wholly pledged your soul to the cause of evil.
Touch of Evil: You can cause a creature to become sickened as a melee {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g}. Creatures sickened by your touch count as good for the purposes of {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} with the evil descriptor. This ability lasts for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to 1/2 your level in the class that gave you access to this domain (minimum 1). You can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + your {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier.
Scythe of Evil: At 8th level, you can give a weapon touched the unholy special weapon quality for a number of rounds equal to 1/2 your level in the class that gave you access to this domain. You can use this ability once per day at 8th level, and an additional time per day for every four levels beyond 8th.

0414fca4-b89f-4fd5-b1c8-48995705e965: You are surrounded by a soporific aroma that causes living creatures that begin their turn or end their movement within 5 feet of you to fall asleep for 1 minute. efee3963-dce4-42e4-8e8a-b5a18145a22d: You are treated as an undead creature when you are targeted by positive or negative energy. At 7th level, you receive channel resistance +2. This bonus increases by +2 at 11th and 15th level.

7bdf226a-ace1-4044-b5a5-6ec69ec5a139: You become a {g|Encyclopedia:Size}large{/g} dragon-like creature. You also gain one bite ({g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d6{/g}), two claws (1d6), two secondary wing {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} (1d8) (secondary attacks do not benefit from shifter claws), and one tail slap attack (1d8). All breath weapons deal 8d8 points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} and allow a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} for half damage.

Fire Bolt: As a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, you can unleash a scorching bolt of divine fire from your outstretched hand. You can target any single foe within 30 feet as a ranged {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g} with this bolt of fire. If you hit the foe, the fire bolt deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g} + 1 point for every two levels you possess in the class that gave you access to this domain. Fire Resistance: At 6th level, you gain {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resist{/g} fire 10. This resistance increases to 20 at 12th level. At 20th level, you gain {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Immunity}immunity{/g} to fire.

4b8ad173-f87d-4ee4-833e-4c9c18b8f93f:
You can cause the living to bleed at a touch, and find comfort in the presence of the dead.
Bleeding Touch: As a melee {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g}, you can cause a living creature to take {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. This effect persists for a number of rounds equal to 1/2 your level in the class that gave you access to this domain (minimum 1). You can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + your {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier.
{g|Encyclopedia:Injury_Death}Death{/g}'s Embrace: At 8th level, you {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g} damage instead of taking damage from channeled negative energy. If the channeled negative energy targets undead, you heal {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} just like undead in the area.
If you are undead, then you instead do not take {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}damage from positive energy{/g}.

35c8bff4-4ddd-499c-851c-3133634b71bf: You can create an illusory double of yourself as a {g|Encyclopedia:Move_Action}move action{/g}. 7ebcdb4f-5b6e-4f33-9911-a1553be79905: You can create an invisible shell of air that grants you a +4 armor {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g}. At 7th level, and every four levels thereafter, this bonus increases by +2. At 13th level, this barrier causes incoming arrows, rays, and other {g|Encyclopedia:RangedAttack}ranged attacks{/g} requiring an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack roll{/g} against you to have a 50% miss chance. You can use this shield for 1 hour number of times per day equal to oracle level.
c7b4c22a-4d78-4d97-b50b-596bab25f84b: You can draw life force from the bodies of enemies and channel it into yourself. As a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, you can drain the life essence from one living target within 30 feet. The target takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} per two levels you possess (maximum 10d6). You gain temporary {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} equal to the damage you deal. The temporary hit points last a number of hours equal to your {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier. The target receives a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g} to halve the damage (and the temporary hit points you gain). You may use this ability once per day at 7th level, plus one additional time per day for every 4 levels you possess beyond 7th. You must be at least 7th level before selecting this revelation.
762716bb-1d3a-45aa-8814-7d1079da44b3: You can emit a 30-foot-radius aura that grants your allies a +4 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on all {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against effects that inflict the fatigued or exhausted condition. 02165578-b08a-47bf-bfdd-7df4539b7af6:
You can manipulate lightning, mist, and wind, and are {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resistant{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}electricity damage{/g}.
Lightning Arc: As a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, you can unleash an arc of electricity targeting any foe within 30 feet as a ranged {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g}. This arc of electricity deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of electricity damage + 1 point for every two levels you possess in the class that gave you access to this domain. You can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + your {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier.
Electricity Resistance: At 6th level, you gain resist electricity 10. This resistance increases to 20 at 12th level. At 20th level, you gain {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Immunity}immunity{/g} to electricity.
Domain {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}Spells{/g}: shocking grasp, protection from arrows, lightning bolt, shout, cloudkill, chain lightning, elemental body IV (air), greater shout, elemental swarm (air).
2cf70f62-db6a-48e2-a938-046939077603:
You can manipulate water and mist and ice, conjure creatures of water, and {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resist{/g} cold.
Icicle: As a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, you can fire an icicle from your finger, targeting any foe within 30 feet as a ranged {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g}. The icicle deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}cold damage{/g} + 1 point for every two levels you possess in the class that gave you access to this domain. You can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + your {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier.
Cold Resistance: At 6th level, you gain resist cold 10. This resistance increases to 20 at 12th level. At 20th level, you gain {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Immunity}immunity{/g} to cold.
Domain {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}Spells{/g}: ray of sickening, acid arrow, stinking cloud, freedom of movement, ice storm, cone of cold, elemental body IV (water), horrid wilting, tsunami.
e5fa8bbf-5481-4908-88e1-a1969d184cd2: You can move through a {g|Encyclopedia:Threatened_Area}threatened square{/g} without provoking an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attack of opportunity{/g} from an enemy by using Acrobatics. When moving in this way, you move at half {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g}.
ce6d651c-15ca-4fd7-8b1a-23171ecd0f69: You can perceive the world by creating high-pitched noises and listening to their echoes. This gives you blindsight of equal range.
2e574902-612e-46a8-9b98-154db3bbbe75: You can perceive the world by creating high-pitched noises and listening to their echoes. This gives you blindsight to a range of 30 feet.
0e38266d-5248-4a42-94f4-dcd377f76be9:
You can repair {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} to objects, animate objects with life, and create objects from nothing.
Aura of Efficiency
You can emit a 30-foot-radius aura that grants your allies a +4 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on all {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against effects that inflict the fatigued or exhausted condition. You can use this aura for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} per day equal to your level in the class that gave you access to this domain. These rounds do not need to be consecutive.
Aura of Efficiency: Damage Resistance
At 8th level, your Aura of Efficiency grants your allies {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} 1/—. This DR increases by +1/— for every three levels you possess in the class that gave you access to this domain beyond 8th.

6c741017-8a3c-4a0d-a4a9-c53ed618ae1c:
You can speak with and befriend animals with ease. In addition, you treat {g|Encyclopedia:Lore_Nature}Lore (nature){/g} as a class {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill{/g}.
Animal Companion: At 4th level, you gain the service of an animal companion. Your effective druid level for this animal companion is equal to your level in the class that gave you access to this domain – 3. (Druids who take this ability through their nature bond class feature use their druid level – 3 to determine the abilities of their animal companions.)
Domain {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}Spells{/g}: magic fang, hold animal, dominate animal, summon nature's ally IV, beast shape III, summon nature's ally VI, summon nature's ally VII, summon nature's ally VIII, summon nature's ally IX.
302eceba-ae0d-413f-9fff-e92a2c710459: You can summon the spirit of a great warrior ancestor and allow it to possess you, becoming a mighty warrior yourself. You gain a +4 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g}, and a +4 natural armor bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}. Your {g|Encyclopedia:BAB}base attack bonus{/g} while possessed equals your oracle level (which may give you additional {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g}), and any weapon you are wielding gains Keen enchantment. You can use this ability for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} for every 2 oracle levels you possess. This duration does not need to be consecutive, but it must be spent in 1-round increments. You must be at least 11th level to select this revelation.
6b38b13e-5cd8-42bb-a46a-4e55358f9610: You can summon the spirits of your ancestors to {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} in a ghostly barrage—their fury creates physical wounds on creatures in the area. The storm has a range of 100 feet and is a 20-foot-radius burst. Objects and creatures in the area take {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d8{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} for every two oracle levels you possess. Undead creatures in the area take 1d8 points of damage for every oracle level you possess. A successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g} reduces the damage to half. You must be at least 7th level to select this revelation. You can use this ability once per day, plus one additional time per day at 11th level and every four levels thereafter.
b6c5a5f9-d5dc-477b-9321-69becc19cc46: You can touch a creature as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} to give it a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on melee {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} equal to 1/2 your level in the class that gave you access to this domain for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} (minimum +1).[LONGSTART] You can do so a number of times per day equal to 3 + your {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier.[LONGEND]
e80e5122-9f36-42af-8998-7b9541d243ff: You can touch a creature as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g} it of {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of damage + 1 point per level in the class that gave you access to this domain. This touch also removes the fatigued, shaken, and sickened conditions (but has no effect on more severe conditions).[LONGSTART] You can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + your {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier.[LONGEND]
bac72f21-017d-4baf-a09b-d358dc5795cd: You can touch a creature as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, granting a sacred {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability checks{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} equal to half your level in the class that gave you access to this domain (minimum 1) for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}.[LONGSTART] You can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + your {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier.[LONGEND]
5ec6ad1f-9ef8-4b9f-b55b-183f5645dcde: You can touch a living creature as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}healing{/g} it for {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} points of damage plus 1 for every two levels you possess in the class that gave you access to this domain. You can only use this ability on a creature that is below 0 {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g}.[LONGSTART] You can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + your {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier.[LONGEND]
17ca32f9-7810-4306-a3f2-db3071447856: You can touch a willing creature as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, giving it a bit of luck. For the next {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}, any time the target {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}rolls{/g} a d20, he may roll twice and take the more favorable result.[LONGSTART] You can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + your {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier.[LONGEND]
ac54b62c-1a4f-400a-a955-63b11d86836e: You can touch a willing creature as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, infusing it with the power of divine order and allowing it to treat all {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability checks{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} as if the natural {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}d20{/g} roll resulted in an 11.[LONGSTART] You can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + your {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier.[LONGEND]
77787255-6381-4f3d-80f9-572fc0738531: You can transform an opponent into a harmless animal as if using baleful polymorph. This transformation lasts 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} per oracle level. You may use this ability a number of times per day equal to your {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier. You must be at least 7th level before selecting this revelation.
f88c6533-0ed9-49b2-b5ff-18283e0eee97: You can transform yourself into a whirlwind and back again. The whirlwind is 30 feet wide, and every creature that spends a {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} in the whirlwind must succeed at a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} or take {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}bludgeoning damage{/g}. While in whirlwind form, you cannot {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}, but you are able to use your abilities.
13862c14-02a8-4bc5-b84e-c3ca7ae73bca: You can transform yourself into a whirlwind and back again. The whirlwind is 30 feet wide, and every creature that spends a {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} in the whirlwind must succeed at a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} or take {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}bludgeoning damage{/g}. While in whirlwind form, you cannot {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}, but you are able to use your abilities.
670f1d65-c34a-4858-a267-7bbfd2f58afd: You can transform yourself into a whirlwind and back again.
